papadam.author: Sid B.
papadam.review: Not sure why this place has 4 star rating cause everything about this place sucked. From service to food. It took 35 mins to get our meal. We ordered: chicken tikka masala (there's no flavor whatsoever), chicken biryani (um I don't think you're suppose to add food color to biryani. The color comes from the spices duh which were not in this biryani. Actually, it should be called fried rice not biryani). We also got papadam which you can't really fuck up so won't comment on that but we did ask for some chutney that is suppose to go with the papadam and the server said sure let me get it and he never came back lol We also got some naan. I will say this their naan is freshly made and it was piping hot and delicious. So if you plan on going here just get the naan LOL oh and I also asked for samosa and the dude was like we have no samosa's WHAT NO SAMOSA's ok big tip here DO NO EAT AT AN INDIAN PLACE THAT HAS NO SAMOSA's ITS A SIGN FOR BAD THINGS TO COME

excerpts: Spicy, full of cilantro, chicken vindaloo not covered in that weird red sauce other places use, creamy chicken tikka masala (a little too sweet, actually, but nothing some raita couldn't fix), DIY chai station, lovely, spicy samosas and FRESH papadam.
I rarely go to places that are worth the Yelp hype, but Lahore Kahari brings it.
papadam.author: Maria D.
papadam.review:
After getting me tipsy at Bourbon & Branch, Megan W. took things down a notch and bought me dinner at this joint. GODAMN. It is wonderful. Owner/chef is always smiling but his waiter/slave looks emaciated. I have no idea how he could be with the off the hook food that is coming out of this kitchen. Spicy, full of cilantro, chicken vindaloo not covered in that weird red sauce other places use, creamy chicken tikka masala (a little too sweet, actually, but nothing some raita couldn't fix), DIY chai station, lovely, spicy samosas and FRESH papadam. I rarely go to places that are worth the Yelp hype, but Lahore Kahari brings it. It's been brought.

And becuase I know you fools love gossip, I didn't put out. Megan is gonna have to work a little harder.

excerpts: The papadam came out fresh & hot (up until now, i have always had it cold), and they had potato naan, also fresh & hot.
Mmmm...naan.
papadam.author: N B.
papadam.review:
Like this place needs another review...but wow. What the heck kind of Indian/Pakistani food have I been eating?

My friend strongly urged me to order the Chilean Sea Bass, which came on a sizzling platter. He had the lamb kebab also on a sizzling platter, and we shared some chicken tikka masala & palak paneer. The fish was hot, spicy, and mixed with vegetables. Super tasty & not greasy. EX-cellent.

The papadam came out fresh & hot (up until now, i have always had it cold), and they had potato naan, also fresh & hot. Mmmm...naan. A rare treat for me.

The complimentary chai was hot, flavorful and rich. Not like that watery drivel at Naan n' Curry.

From what I understand, one of the servers is a little quirky at times, but although he was busy, service was still good for a little divey place--though it was much cleaner than Shalimar. Just don't go expecting to get in & out quickly. Like another reviewer says: just enjoy the bollywood film playing--or the company you're with. It's part of the charm of the place.

excerpts: We got the Papadam appetizer to start.
Everything here is made to order here mind you.
papadam.author: Timbo G.
papadam.review:
First of all I've been wanting to try this place forever and something always comes up for some reason or another. Went with some friends on a cold and crisp Sunday twilight session and let one person do the ordering since she is somewhat of a regular. We got the Papadam appetizer to start. Everything here is made to order here mind you. Paper thin and served with a buttermilk sauce and also a sweet plum sauce if my taste buds serve me right. 

Next up was the cheese Naan which was super tasty I must say. For our entrees we ordered Spicy Chicken Boti, Lamb Boti and Bengan Bhartiia   all savory and mighty proper! Also we got Lahore Karachi Rice which   was amazingly spiced and flavorful. Nom nom nom nom nom... For desert we tried the Gulab Jaman which are deep fried dough balls dipped in a honey like concoction pretty good but I think I'll try something else next time. Had a little Chi to wash it down also. The service was decent and the owner/chef bid us farewell from the kitchen as we left. This place has comfy mellow feel to it and is TOPZ in my book. I'll be taking some other friends here very soon if I have my say.

Oh yeah white rice ='s boring people fyi... Chowmerz..

excerpts: So we choose a little of everything: the papadam ($1), wafer-thin flatbreads with a texture reminiscient of potato chips, paneer pakora ($3.50), deep-fried, French fry-shaped wedges of cheese, seekh kebab ($4), a very spicy lamb sausage on skewers, chicken tikka masala ($7), mildly spicy pieces of chicken in a creamy sauce, lamb vindaloo ($7), a very spicy stewy mixture of lamb and potatoes, plain naan ($1), garlic naan ($2), a side of rice ($1.25), and gulab jamun ($3.50) for dessert.
papadam.author: Meghan P.
papadam.review:
So it's Friday night after work, and we're starving. Indian food sounds fabulous. Something spicy. And cheap. And Yelp-approved. Lahore Karahi it is.

As soon as the menu hits my hands, my eyes are frantically scanning the page looking for anything and everything that sounds delicious. Dammit. It all does. So we choose a little of everything: the papadam ($1), wafer-thin flatbreads with a texture reminiscient of potato chips, paneer pakora ($3.50), deep-fried, French fry-shaped wedges of cheese, seekh kebab ($4), a very spicy lamb sausage on skewers, chicken tikka masala ($7), mildly spicy pieces of chicken in a creamy sauce, lamb vindaloo ($7), a very spicy stewy mixture of lamb and potatoes, plain naan ($1), garlic naan ($2), a side of rice ($1.25), and gulab jamun ($3.50) for dessert. 

The sole server, who had a room's full of hungry, needy patrons to attend to and therefore whose sympathy I had from the get-go, was quirky and odd but kind of fun. The food came out all out of order and sporadically but you know what? I didn't care. It was all just so good and satisfying, and it was a ton of food, but we cleaned each plate. Oh and P.S., mango lassi is my new favorite drink. 

My favorite moment of the evening came when our server dropped the check. I'm like, okay, I know this is cheap eats and all, but that was a crapload of food we just ordered, and S. has slipped into some comatose, food-drunken stupor that he will not have recovered from until the next afternoon. But somehow, after plate upon plate of deliciously satisfying food, the grand total of the evening was.... $38.78. What?!?!?! I began to loathe and regret each night we had spent $100+ on an appetizer, two entrees and a round of drinks at other, sub-par establishments. The value of this place just blew my mind.

So go here, it's delicious, amazingly priced, and my new go-to place for Indian food in the city.

excerpts: I got the Mango Lassi, Vegetable Samosa, Vegetable Korma and I enjoyed all.
The Mango Lassi is very good.
The Vegetable Korma is a mild curry but you can ask to make it spicy.
They ask what percent spicy you want it, if you want it spicy.
The drinks you grab yourself if you want water, tea, canned soda, but the Mango Lassi is on the menu.
There are a lot of vegetarian choices as well as meat choices and seafood.
vegetable samosa.author: Apolline B.
vegetable samosa.review: Very delicious food and a warm environment. I'm a vegetarian but my family is not. We all enjoyed our food. I got the Mango Lassi, Vegetable Samosa, Vegetable Korma and I enjoyed all. The Mango Lassi is very good. The Vegetable Korma is a mild curry but you can ask to make it spicy. They ask what percent spicy you want it, if you want it spicy. The drinks you grab yourself if you want water, tea, canned soda, but the Mango Lassi is on the menu. There are a lot of vegetarian choices as well as meat choices and seafood.

excerpts: *Vegetable samosa: two crispy puffs filled with potatoes, green peas ($3.99)
The samosas were a good size and crispy.
The only disappointing thing?
They didn't give me any mint dipping sauce.
vegetable samosa.author: Elena N.
vegetable samosa.review:
I was tired, hungry and maybe just a little hung over. So what was I craving? Deliciously comforting Indian food! Decided to pick up take out from Lahore Karahi for lunch.

*Vegetable samosa: two crispy puffs filled with potatoes, green peas ($3.99)
The samosas were a good size and crispy. The only disappointing thing? They didn't give me any mint dipping sauce. So I didn't get that refreshing mint contrast.

*Chicken tikka masala: barbecued boneless chicken sauteed with herbs and spices ($9.99)
Nice flavor with a subtle spice. I usually like my curry thick, so this was a little on the runny side for me. It didn't really coat the naan when I dipped it in the curry.

*Garlic naan: naan stuffed with garlic ($2.75)
Huge! The naan was actually the favorite part of my meal. Soft with a nice chew. And some good garlic flavor.

This could have easily been a 4 star review if they didn't forget the mint dipping sauce and the curry was thicker. But alas, those two misses made this a 3 star review. But the good thing about getting Indian for lunch? I can also have it for dinner. I had enough leftovers for two more meals!

excerpts:
Our order: 
*Vegetable Samosa-It was pretty good, but maybe because we were starving.
Naan-It was hot, toasty and yummy...especially dipped in the curry
*Lahore Karahi Rice-you will definitely need to order this if you're ordering curry
*Tandoori fish-
My fiancé ordered this because he saw them make it on Iron Chef and we all must admit, it was a good choice.
Probably our favorite dish there.
Seasoned just perfectly to give you that nice flavored taste
*Chicken curry & lamb curry-Flavorable and had a bite to it
*Mango Lassi drink-Very interesting.
They ran out of it but gave us half a glass to try
and it was good.
Very thick
vegetable samosa.author: Betty D.
vegetable samosa.review:
Yes it's in a sketchy neighbor but that' okay because it's worth it. It's not completely a hole in the wall restaurant but it's definitely not fancy or anything either so don't be surprised. Gets very crowded on the weekends and they don't take reservations. 

We went there based off of a review in a magazine. My fiancé and brother in law loves, loves, loves hot food and the review they read said this place had it. Super hot that they wouldn't be able to eat. So we made a trip into the city last weekend. 

Our order: 
*Vegetable Samosa-It was pretty good, but maybe because we were starving. 
*Naan-It was hot, toasty and yummy...especially dipped in the curry 
*Lahore Karahi Rice-you will definitely need to order this if you're ordering curry 
*Tandoori fish-My fiancé ordered this because he saw them make it on Iron Chef and we all must admit, it was a good choice. Probably our favorite dish there. Seasoned just perfectly to give you that nice flavored taste 
*Chicken curry & lamb curry-Flavorable and had a bite to it 
*Mango Lassi drink-Very interesting. They ran out of it but gave us half a glass to try and it was good. Very thick and I don't think I could have finished a full glass 

What was disappointing was that we had asked for the curry to be extra, super, I can't eat it spicy and it barely even had a bite. We figured they were so busy that they forgot to add some spices to the food. 

It was really crowded and the place isn't big. There was only one waiter and he was running from table to table but he was very apologetic that it was busy so we didn't mind at all. Overall I think I'll be back to try other things on the menu.

excerpts:
Vegetable Samosa (delectable)
Lamb Korma (indescribable flavor)
Tandoori Fish (amazing burst of flavor in my mouth)
Tandoori Chicken ( a little dry but good flavor)
vegetable samosa.author: Blu n.
vegetable samosa.review:
I give it 6 stars minus 1 for efficiency.

It was my first time here.  There was chaos and confusion everywhere.  A large party of 10 was just leaving.   There seemed to be one waiter and one busboy running around like chickens with their heads cut off.... really.  I would recommend they get a large bucket to clear off tables, or one more waiter to help with the load.  From what I could see they had enough customers and revenue coming in to justify another helper.

We were getting a little cranky waiting to be seated when I could clearly see the inefficient way the place was being run.  We finally got seated and then the one waiter was running around trying to get people's place settings to them.  We waited and served ourselves water.  We finally decided to take matters into our own hands and called the waiter over to let him know we were ready to order.  It's a good thing because we got our order in before the rest of the tables that got seated at the same time we did.  

When we realized this poor waiter was the only one waiting, bussing tables, and serving we just felt bad and chilled out a little.  We sat sipping our water and watching the very entertaining Indian musical on the screen.  Our food finally showed up and one bite of our food, we were blown away!

Vegetable Samosa (delectable)
Lamb Korma (indescribable flavor)
Tandoori Fish (amazing burst of flavor in my mouth)
Tandoori Chicken ( a little dry but good flavor)
Naan (yummm)

We went a little overboard with the food for 2 but it was all worth it!
If you see the overworked waiter doing his best to serve everyone give him a break, be extra friendly and patient and give him a nice tip.  He was pleasant throughout dinner and the completely full joint!  Just be ready to wait and be patient in getting service.

excerpts: We ordered vegetable samosa, tandoori fish (caution to the oil spatters as it arrives on a sizzling iron platter), chicken tikka masala,  and two garlic/onion naans.
My girlfriend and I stuffed our faces until capacity and still had leftovers to divvy up.
We ended up walking the nearby shops in downtown to let the food digest and all I could think about was looking for a fork to finish up my leftovers!
The food was amazing and I would definitely come back and order the same thing!
vegetable samosa.author: Lisa C.
vegetable samosa.review: Visited Lahore on a Friday with a girlfriend.  We were lucky to grab a table before the crowd packed the place!  We ordered vegetable samosa, tandoori fish (caution to the oil spatters as it arrives on a sizzling iron platter), chicken tikka masala,  and two garlic/onion naans.  My girlfriend and I stuffed our faces until capacity and still had leftovers to divvy up.  We ended up walking the nearby shops in downtown to let the food digest and all I could think about was looking for a fork to finish up my leftovers!  The food was amazing and I would definitely come back and order the same thing!

excerpts: The vegetable pakora and vegetable samosas are incredible.
I wish I could eat this everyday.
A must eat and it can be delivered.
vegetable pakora.author: Nichole F.
vegetable pakora.review: This place though! I'm in San Fran for the second time in a month and couldn't NOT eat here again. The vegetable pakora and vegetable samosas are incredible. I wish I could eat this everyday. A must eat and it can be delivered.

excerpts: The staff treats us very well and I don't even have to order my meal anymore (they just know it): vegetable pakora, matar paneer, naan and rice.
Can't ever go wrong with that!
vegetable pakora.author: Angel M.
vegetable pakora.review: It's always great here. The staff treats us very well and I don't even have to order my meal anymore (they just know it): vegetable pakora, matar paneer, naan and rice. Can't ever go wrong with that!

excerpts: and then when it was my turn to pick up my pickup order was all to happy to turn around, without washing his hands, and handle my food with his bare hands (in this case vegetable pakora which he removed from a bowl on the range, where I assume it was being held to keep it warm, and then packed it up in a paper bag).
vegetable pakora.author: William C.
vegetable pakora.review:
DO NOT EAT HERE UNLESS YOU WANT HEPATITIS OR SOME OTHER COMMUNICABLE DISEASE DUE TO THEIR UNSANITARY PRACTICES. (65/100 health inspection rating currently - do you know how much you have to f-up to get a 65/100 on a health inspection?)

This used to be my favorite cheap South Asian in the neighborhood and I hadn't noticed changes since the new owners took over (although my friends had said its quality had gone down) until my last visit - never again.  As I watched, the guy at the counter handled money, the register, and the phone and then when it was my turn to pick up my pickup order was all to happy to turn around, without washing his hands, and handle my food with his bare hands (in this case vegetable pakora which he removed from a bowl on the range, where I assume it was being held to keep it warm, and then packed it up in a paper bag).  When I called him out on it because AH HELL NO NASTY he laughed and treated it like a joke, even going to the point of finally mockingly washing his hands in the sink that is oh so conveniently located next to the register though not highly used (as if it mattered at that point).

If these owners care so little about cleanliness they have no business running a restaurant.  Shut them down!  At least I hope the city will soon as you know I complained to the health department.  Just don't take your chances here...The high rating they currently have is from reviews under the previous owners.

excerpts: I got the chile naan, vegetable pakora and shasi paneer medium spice.
It was perfectly savory and decadent.
Not to mention relatively cheap too!
Totally yummy.
vegetable pakora.author: Makana S.
vegetable pakora.review: This place was honestly super delicious. I got the chile naan, vegetable pakora and shasi paneer medium spice. It was perfectly savory and decadent. Not to mention relatively cheap too! Totally yummy.

excerpts: We started with the $3 basket of Vegetable Pakora, tasty and surprisingly light veggie fritters that looked like they came from South Carolina, not South Pakistan (see photo).
vegetable pakora.author: Ed U.
vegetable pakora.review:
My kindred Yelper Liz S. so inspired me with her knowledgeable review of Lahore Karahi on "Check Please! Bay Area" that it finally motivated Jamie W. and me to try it finally after all these years. We were expecting a madhouse of chaos, but we must have come after Katrina came through since all we saw were piles of dirty dishes all around. We honestly didn't know whether we should wait for the young waiter to clean it all up or just pitch in with some Palmolive and a pair of Playtex gloves from the Walgreen's down O'Farrell. 

We decided to wait and hoped the waiter would wipe down the table. Alas, Jamie got a stain on his beloved Threadless T-shirt due to leftover curry sauce on the rim of the table, and only my Diet Coke came. Note we both ordered Diet Cokes and only mine came. Not Jamie's, mine. Things were not off to a promising start. However, once the food started coming, all was forgiven. We started with the $3 basket of Vegetable Pakora, tasty and surprisingly light veggie fritters that looked like they came from South Carolina, not South Pakistan (see photo). But the exotic spices came through with each bite. 

I ordered the $6.50 Butter Chicken, which consisted of Tandoori chicken pieces bathing in a buttery cream sauce (see photo). Very tender with carrots and spices complementing the flavor. Jamie went for the $7 Lamb Korma, which was just as tender and succulent though a bit hazardous to spoon since the bowl was filled to the brim with the spicy sauce (see photo). We skipped the naan in favor of a plate of Basmati rice to make sure we sop up all the sauces. Genuinely delicious but maybe bring a sponge just in case the waiter doesn't have time to be thorough next time. 

FOOD - 4.5 stars...homemade Pakistani dishes done up right and packed with flavor 
AMBIANCE - 2.5 stars...well... 
SERVICE - 4 stars...the attentive young server was everywhere 
TOTAL - 4 stars...definitely worthy of a return visit...thanks Liz!

excerpts: Vegetable Pakora :
Mixed vegetable fritters
Chicken tikka masala :

Chicken in mild & creamy tomato curry sauce
Buttered chicken :

Chicken cooked in creamy tomato sauce
chicken biryani :

Saffron basmatic rice w/ chicken & nuts
Plain nann, garlic nann
The vegetable pakora was good too but wayy oily...
It is fried
so yea.
Chicken biryani?
Good but spicy.
I'm becoming so slow with food terms, I didn't even know med is spicier then mild.
How lame.
vegetable pakora.author: Juliane N.
vegetable pakora.review:
A new place to grab some great Indian food! My brother wanted to try this place out so him, my sis and I came here for lunch today before I had to go work. The place was really empty and the gate was still half closed so we thought it was not open. But then the owner came out and it was open. He apparently was the only person working so the food took a little longer then expected.

Free Chai! YAY! Love it. So we ordered our usual food. 
Vegetable Pakora : Mixed vegetable fritters
Chicken tikka masala : Chicken in mild & creamy tomato curry sauce
Buttered chicken : Chicken cooked in creamy tomato sauce
chicken biryani : Saffron basmatic rice w/ chicken & nuts
Plain nann, garlic nann, potato nann

Wayy too much food for 3. I have no clue why we order chicken tikka and butter chicken when they're both the same thing. He warned us but we went for it anyways. Oh wells. The chicken tikka masal had pistachios on top! First time seeing it served like that but it went well with the dish. Tasted delish. Both the chicken tikka masala and buttered chicken tasted the same but we still enjoyed it. I like how it's not like Naan and Curry's sauce. Naan and Curry seem to have more heavy cream in their recipe and this one is more Authentic like. The vegetable pakora was good too but wayy oily... It is fried so yea. Chicken biryani? Good but spicy. I'm becoming so slow with food terms, I didn't even know med is spicier then mild. How lame. So I had to drink tons of water after each bite of food!

The owner/chef was super nice and made sure everything was good and that we enjoyed it. He even offered dessert but I was too full to actually except it..

Cheap good authenic Indian food is the best!!! Oh, and I didn't smell like spices coming out of the restaurant!

excerpts: On Sunday night 10 of us stuffed ourselves silly with tandori fish, chicken tikka masala, vegetable pakora, aloo keema, vegetable biryani, chicken kabab and naan.
I worked the menu out directly with Guddu at the counter.
My only regret?
vegetable pakora.author: Miriam W.
vegetable pakora.review:
On Sunday night 10 of us stuffed ourselves silly with tandori fish, chicken tikka masala, vegetable pakora, aloo keema, vegetable biryani, chicken kabab and naan. I worked the menu out directly with Guddu at the counter. My only regret? Forgetting to order the aloo tikki!

All told (with tax and a 25% tip) the meal cost us $127. Holy bargain!

Lahore's BYOB and yes we did! Tip: Anchor Steam beer pairs well with this food and is available at the bodega across the street.

excerpts:
Vegetable Pakora
- delicious mixed vegetable fritters.
I think I like samosas more, but this was a nice change.
vegetable pakora.author: Melissa D.
vegetable pakora.review:
This place is a good enough reason for winding up in the Tenderloin. If you can manage to deal with people walking up to you offering you crack every so often, find your way over here. Granted, you may get side-tracked by another deliciously-smelling Indian restaurant on the way (they seem to be all over the TL), but when you get here, holding off at the other places will be worth it!

I came here for lunch with 4 of my coworkers yesterday, and thankfully, it was not busy at all. We had no problem getting served quickly too.

We ordered:
Aloo Keema
- ground up lamb with potatoes... this was delicious! If you thought you didn't like lamb, don't turn your attention away from this dish. I was skeptical at first because I'm very particular about how where I order lamb, but gosh, this was WORTH it! Deliciously spicy too!

Chicken Biryani
- good and flavorful

Tandoori Fish
- we were told that we should order this dish because it's the signature dish! It comes served to you on a sizzling dish, with onions and spices on it. Definitely a good idea that we read yelp reviews saying to order this! And the fish just comes apart in your mouth!

Prawn Vindaloo
- I'm such a vindaloo fan, so this dish was my pick for the meal. The prawn was soft enough to eat. I hate when I order something with prawn or shrimp and it comes out tough. That's gotta be the worst ever. The sauce was a very good kind of spicy. Mmmm, I'm salivating just thinking about it now...

Garlic and Sesame Naan
- WHOA! The garlic really jumps out at you! I'm glad we ordered 4 of these.

Vegetable Pakora
- delicious mixed vegetable fritters. I think I like samosas more, but this was a nice change. Definitely try it if you haven't yet.

When we first saw the plates, I thought the portions were a little small. But as we ate, we soon realized that we were getting stuffed and still had lots of extra food there! Four plates is defitely a good amount for 5 people.

I can't wait to go back... Only thing that I hated was that I smelled like a curry restaurant for the rest of the afternoon at work. But we all have to make sacrifices, right?

excerpts:
We ordered:
Vegetable Pakora - Crispy, Tasty and Amazing.
vegetable pakora.author: Mack L.
vegetable pakora.review:
I'm only NOT giving them a perfect score because of some nitpicky things. Our Tandori fish came out late and cold, then the refire on it was still a bit unsatisfactory, but that is really the biggest negative of the experience at Lahore Karahi and possibly some lack of service here and there.

Me and 3 friends showed up on a Sunday evening around 7pm. We were seated in a couple minutes. 

We ordered:
Vegetable Pakora - Crispy, Tasty and Amazing.
Garlic Naan - VERY GOOD
Chicken Kabab - This was pretty spicy, but tasty, please note it's GROUND chicken, so it's a bit of a shaped kabob, but good if you can handle the heat.
Chicken Vindaloo - Amazing.
Vegetable Biryani - Perfect to mix everything with and wrap up in a piece of Naan.
Tandori Fish - Was good, but ours was cold and refired and not as fresh tasting. Would try this again to see if I missed out on the magic or not.

I saw this restaurant on Check Please Bay Area and I'm so thankful I did. I'm not one to just guess about getting indian/pakistani food. So Yelp and that show gave me the shove I needed to try it out. 

It is now one of my favorite places to eat in SF. 

My belly is smiling.

excerpts: Paneer Pakora and Vegetable Pakora are both great.
vegetable pakora.author: Mary M.
vegetable pakora.review:
I would wait in a two hour line in the rain to eat here. Luckily I only had to wait about 30 minutes and it was not raining. 

The chicken tikka masala is the best that I have ever tasted. I am sad that I only get to have it when I am in San Francisco, which is a rare occasion. Paneer Pakora and Vegetable Pakora are both great. Garlic Naan is AMAZING and the rice is AMAZING.

excerpts: About 15 minutes later, The waiter brought us Some very doughy Vegetable Pakora..
Confused, we told him we had ordered Samosa,  and he said they broke the Samosas and could not make any more
so we should just eat the Pakora
Instead because "it is very good".
It wasn't.
While the batter was hot and spiced, it was overly doughy and mostly onions.
vegetable pakora.author: Raphael P.
vegetable pakora.review:
We went out with the intent of having some great Biriyani and some Kashmiri Nan (Our favorites). 

First off we arrived to find about 10 people standing around waiting to be seated at the empty tables, and 2 people waiting for their to go order that was sitting there getting cold. The waiter was walking around looking busy, but really just straightening the tables, and picking up napkins. 10 minutes later we got seated and the people waiting for their to go order finally got to pay for it. First sign of trouble.. 

We order Samosa, Benghan Bartha, Prawn Biriyani, and Afghani (Kashmiri) Nan. The waiter tried to convince us we didn't want Kashmiri Nan, and in this case we should have taken his advice. 

About 15 minutes later, The waiter brought us Some very doughy Vegetable Pakora.. Confused, we told him we had ordered Samosa,  and he said they broke the Samosas and could not make any more so we should just eat the Pakora Instead because "it is very good". It wasn't.  While the batter was hot and spiced, it was overly doughy and mostly onions.  Soon after our Prawn Biriyani and Benghan Bartha Arrived.  

The Biriyani was bland, and dry.  The Shrimp weren't even marinated in the Biriyani Spices and tasted not entirely fresh.  The Rice Seemed undercooked and rushed.

Benghan Bartha, overly runny. The waiter said this was one of their specialties.. I found it to be not so special. For a dish that's supposed to be made from blended Eggplant and tomatoes, this was the most liquidy, non eggplant flavored version of this dish ever. A Light brown gravy like liquid with a shred or 3 of Eggplant Skin.. 

And the Kicker was the Afghani (Kashmiri) Nan.  We were expecting a Nan with Cherry Paste and Nuts (similar to the description and what we commonly know and love as Kashmiri Nan). However what arrived (Another 10 minutes after all the food) Looked like they had picked the dried fruits out of a holiday fruit cake (you know the kind no one eats around the holidays). Little Bitz of fake wax cherries and those plasticky green mystery fruit were embedded in a paper thin slice of crispy hot nan like bread. 

By this time, the cockroaches had descended on our table (no joke). After shooing off a few we decided to call it quits and pack up our leftovers (which were not gong to eat anyways) and get the $@#^& outa dodge!

While the Waiter Seemed to be a really nice and personable (if not overly pushy) guy, the food and dirty decor were severely lac luster.

I left this restaurant in a daze.. wondering "WHY GOD WHY?"  How could so many people on yelp actually like this place? Did they maybe get some crack in their food or get hypnotized by the pushy waiter? I guess ill never know, because you will never find me eating here again ever. 

Compared to any other restaurant that serves Pakistani/Indian this was by far the worst I've had in the city..

excerpts: Samosas, Vegetable Pakora, Muttar Paneer, Pappadam, and Naan.
vegetable pakora.author: Kane M.
vegetable pakora.review:
update:
I am soooooo sad they are closed for lunch now... But Gudu has paid his dues and deserves some rest.





I eat here at least once a week, so it is only fair that I make it my first review. (that is after having my account of 3 years close suddenly when yelp decided to change a policy without notification...still a little bitter, yep)

I eat mostly vegetarian, so I can't speak for the rest of the menu, but what I get, I love. Samosas, Vegetable Pakora, Muttar Paneer, Pappadam, and Naan. 

The naan bread is only a buck so get plenty...I like to take the rest home and make pizzas...

The service can be slow at times as Guddu sometimes is the cook, server, and cashier.

I love the space...growing up in So.Cal. ,I saw plenty of the sterile big box type stores and restaurants and felt they lacked heart. The kitchen here extends into the dining room and it has a real feel of authenticity.

Guddu takes great pride in his food and it shows. I spend the better part of 15 years in kitchens, so when we got to talking, I realized how much of himself Guddu puts into this place. All his food is Halaal and he drives pretty far to get the best.

Thanks for all the great food Guddu...

excerpts: Vegetable pakora was almost all breading.
Naan had a strange, almost toothpaste-like flavor to it.
It also had patches of charred, crunchy (not in a good way) remnants from the grill on it.
Makes me wonder if they ever scrape the grill.
Chicken tikka tasted bland.
vegetable pakora.author: Tom J.
vegetable pakora.review:
Did not have a good experience here.  Yelp, you let me down this time.  

Vegetable pakora was almost all breading.  Naan had a strange, almost toothpaste-like flavor to it.  It also had patches of charred, crunchy (not in a good way) remnants from the grill on it.  Makes me wonder if they ever scrape the grill.  Chicken tikka tasted bland.  Chutneys were watery.  

You can see the kitchen clearly from the counter.  It's definitely not clean.  Service was almost non-existent.  

Maybe I arrived on an off night.  On the bright side, the prices are cheap....back on the dark side, maybe it's cheap for a reason.

excerpts: We ordered the vegetable pakora which I did like because unlike other places where they consist of just dough you could see and taste all the veggies.
vegetable pakora.author: Lucia V.
vegetable pakora.review: I was really excited to go here because of the good reviews I had read and because I could walk here from my apartment instead of having to go to the Richmond, West Portal, or the Mission for some tasty Indian food. The service was attentive (that's why I gave two stars) but I thought the food wasn't very great. We ordered the vegetable pakora which I did like because unlike other places where they consist of just dough you could see and taste all the veggies. We ordered the vegetable sabzi, saag paneer, daal masala, a side of rice, and one piece of naan. Nothing really stood out and I didn't like the naan, it was too crispy. I'll have to try it again before I really decide to dislike it.

excerpts: The chicken tika masala rated about 3 stars, saag paneer was not spicy enough - garlic naan was tasty and vegetable pakora was too doughy.
Fair pricing, plenty of food but not exciting enough to go racing back.
The neighborhood is so dicey that one might not want to walk around there after dark, let alone in daylight.
It, the neighborhood speaks of the sadness of run-down San Fran.
Maybe former NY Mayor Guiliani needs to clean up the slums of SF!
vegetable pakora.author: Chloe M.
vegetable pakora.review: Went with a friend during the week for dinner - our expectations were pretty high but the results were a little disappointing. Pleasant enough service, the food came quickly. The chicken tika masala rated about 3 stars, saag paneer was not spicy enough - garlic naan was tasty and vegetable pakora was too doughy. Fair pricing, plenty of food but not exciting enough to go racing back.  The neighborhood is so dicey that one might not want to walk around there after dark, let alone in daylight. It, the neighborhood speaks of the sadness of run-down San Fran. Maybe former NY Mayor Guiliani needs to clean up the slums of SF!

excerpts: We started with the vegetable pakora, which was flavorful, but not crispy, like most restaurants.
vegetable pakora.author: Erwin C.
vegetable pakora.review:
Went to early dinner on Saturday night, and immediately sat down. We started with the vegetable pakora, which was flavorful, but not crispy, like most restaurants. The garlic naan was delicious, as well as our entrees, the lamb vindaloo and chicken karahi.  Both were spicy, but not overwhelming.  Almost as enjoyable was the rice, which, according to the owner, is their specialty.  The rice is cooked with cinnamon sticks, and contains serrano peppers, although they don't crack the peppers to keep the heat down.

Parking is a cinch, though given the neighborhood, that is not a surprise. Be alert, and enjoy the fare.

excerpts: We ordered the vegetable pakora, butter chicken, aloo mattar, a couple orders of rice and a garlic naan.
GREAT food.
the green chutney here is absolutely amazing.
When all was said and done, we still were hungry, so I asked the guy for a chicken vindaloo.
He said "right now?
" and I was like "yes, please!"
So the food comes 5 minutes later (the service is ridiculously quick, that's a plus), and it's lamb instead of chicken.
Best vindaloo ever, and it turned out that the lamb was a good contrast
--it was good quality lamb, too.
The presentation is real homey -- the food comes in bowls that look like my cereal bowls at home.
The kitchen area is right there in front of you, so the whole thing is real honest.
You can see what's cooking right there and watch your food being prepared.
Also, there's vintage, poor-quality bollywood on the TV.
major yay. go here.
vegetable pakora.author: Ethan K.
vegetable pakora.review: This place is great. We walked here from Powell before the show at Herbst and had a leisurely, great meal. We picked up drinks from the next-door market and the dude supplied us with a bottle opener when he asked. Very courteous service; a Mexican dude is the cook, and they treat him like family. We ordered the vegetable pakora, butter chicken, aloo mattar, a couple orders of rice and a garlic naan. GREAT food. the green chutney here is absolutely amazing. When all was said and done, we still were hungry, so I asked the guy for a chicken vindaloo. He said "right now?" and I was like "yes, please!" So the food comes 5 minutes later (the service is ridiculously quick, that's a plus), and it's lamb instead of chicken. Best vindaloo ever, and it turned out that the lamb was a good contrast--it was good quality lamb, too. The presentation is real homey -- the food comes in bowls that look like my cereal bowls at home. The kitchen area is right there in front of you, so the whole thing is real honest. You can see what's cooking right there and watch your food being prepared. Also, there's vintage, poor-quality bollywood on the TV. major yay. go here.

excerpts:
mango lassi was very mango-y and yogurt-y--almost as if they used real mangos 
-the lamb samosa had a very thin and somewhat-tough skin so i wasn't dropping crumbs with every bite (thank goodness), and the filling was very well-spiced albeit a little dry.
lamb samosa.author: Lydia Z.
lamb samosa.review:
Not a bad place but I wasn't impressed. I might be more accustomed to more savory Indian meals but I have no gauge of how authentic anything is so I sort of just compare places to each other.

Things I noted that were different from other Indian places I've been to:

-the garlic naan was very tough to rip, not fluffy, more fried garlic than fresh garlic, and somewhat bland (tasted mostly like pita)
-the saag paneer was very watery and not heavily spiced, which made it seem pretty clean
-the tiki masala wasn't very creamy and the meat was a little dry
-the mango lassi was very mango-y and yogurt-y--almost as if they used real mangos 
-the lamb samosa had a very thin and somewhat-tough skin so i wasn't dropping crumbs with every bite (thank goodness), and the filling was very well-spiced albeit a little dry. 

Also when you come in, you order up front, seat yourself (they have water/utensils you fetch for yourself), and then pay when you're done. When I went at  7pm the service was really slow (likely due to a lack of workers) and the tea was all gone. 

Nothing here was super unique in my opinion but perhaps I needed to try more items on the menu. A-OK place

excerpts: The Lamb Samosa appetizer was great.
lamb samosa.author: Mark C.
lamb samosa.review:
This place is DOPE! From start to finish, absolute greatness was delivered to our table. The Lamb Samosa appetizer was great. The Vegetable Korma and Chicken Makhani were hits. In general, the food had a bit of kick to it, but it was never too spicy. The Mango and Cashew Indian Ice Cream sealed the deal on our great meal. 

I can't believe I'm saying this, given the somewhat shady neighborhood, but I actually want to come back!

excerpts:
One star for their Garlic Naan 

One star for their Lamb Samosa
lamb samosa.author: Katy N.
lamb samosa.review:
NOTE to yourself,  do NOT dine here during  a HOT day/night because this place has NO AC!!!!!!!!!!  Only eager to dine here because of that stupid episode from "Check Bay Please" & NOT  looking forward to return here anytime soon! 

One star for their Garlic Naan 

One star for their Lamb Samosa 

Butter Chicken - The sauce was A-OK,  but the highlight of this dish aka Chicken was HARD & inedible; such disappointment! 

Lamb Kabab - Alright. 

Aloo Golbi - Cauliflower with potatoes  - Nothing special & quite  bland.

excerpts: The Lamb Samosa were good and the Naan was thick and filling which was great as those were the only two items we enjoyed.
lamb samosa.author: Yoram F.
lamb samosa.review:
We ordered a delivery through Eat24 for dinner.  The Lamb Samosa were good and the Naan was thick and filling which was great as those were the only two items we enjoyed.  

Shahi Paneer Tikka Masala was 6 pieces of cheese in a watery thin masala sauce.  It was far better than the Chicken Tikka Masala.  That one had few extra dry cubes of chicken with a sauce that separated into a thick layer of oil and a pinkish residue.   It was a very small portion but we did not manage to finish it.   

Lamb Biryani was OK and a Chicken Tandoori was missing from the delivery and was refunded by Eat24.

excerpts: Between the four of us we ordered the chicken curry, lamb korma, paneer tikka masala,  chicken boti tikka, and then two sides of rice, two cheese naans, one garlic naan, and one garlic and cheese naan (which isn't on the menu
but you can ask for).
When they come out, the bowls are pretty small but don't be fooled, the portions are ridiculously filling.
Two sides of rice was more than enough to leave our bellies extremely full.
The cheese naan is more flavorful than the garlic naan in my opinion, but both are so good it's really hard to pick your favorite (so get the combo of both!).
The cheese naan is more flavorful than the garlic naan in my opinion, but both are so good it's really hard to pick your favorite (so get the combo of both!).
The only thing I would say is that the chicken boti tikka was a little dry, but honestly that's just me trying to find something wrong with it.
I was so unbelievably happy with this food and wished I could make my stomach bigger to eat more of it.
Ughhh drooling just thinking about it now.
chicken boti tikka.author: Sam L.
chicken boti tikka.review:
So this place is in the TL but it honestly didn't seem that bad..other than the really awkward situation of one of the servers getting into an argument with another guy and straight up shoving him out the door. He hit the ground so hard his beanie came off, and that's how you know it's some real shit. BUT the food is legit so I think it's worth it to come back.

Between the four of us we ordered the chicken curry, lamb korma, paneer tikka masala,  chicken boti tikka, and then two sides of rice, two cheese naans, one garlic naan, and one garlic and cheese naan (which isn't on the menu but you can ask for). When they come out, the bowls are pretty small but don't be fooled, the portions are ridiculously filling. Two sides of rice was more than enough to leave our bellies extremely full. The cheese naan is more flavorful than the garlic naan in my opinion, but both are so good it's really hard to pick your favorite (so get the combo of both!). The only thing I would say is that the chicken boti tikka was a little dry, but honestly that's just me trying to find something wrong with it. I was so unbelievably happy with this food and wished I could make my stomach bigger to eat more of it. Ughhh drooling just thinking about it now.

excerpts: For the main meal, my partner ordered the chicken boti tikka.
This was fantastic -- 4 huge pieces of tender and moist chicken in a beautiful bright red color and sauteed onions with lime on a skillet.
chicken boti tikka.author: Priti K.
chicken boti tikka.review:
When I think of Christmas dinner I don't think of Indian food and I certainly don't think of eating it in the Tenderloin. But now, after this year these things will always be just one degree of separation for me.

We came here for Christmas eve. It was pretty busy around 8pm. You order up front, seat yourself, and pay at the end when you're finished with your meal. 

The unique thing about Lahore Karahi is all the self service which I've never really had experience with. There is unlimited hot chai tea, wine glasses, water jugs in the refrigerator all DIY. I actually kinda liked it, you don't have to wait around for a server for simple requests at this casual dining spot. 

The food did take kind of long to come but I think the kitchen is small and everything is so fresh, it takes a bit and it's definitely worth the wait. I suppose don't come when you're in a rush and want to be in and out quickly. 

We started off with an order of samosa. It's REALLY simple. Not too many spices, no peas. This is a very basic samosa that gets the job done. I needed some extra salt. Their tamarind sauce is a bit too watery, but the flavor is still good. The cilantro/mint one was spot on. For the main meal, my partner ordered the chicken boti tikka. This was fantastic -- 4 huge pieces of tender and moist chicken in a beautiful bright red color and sauteed onions with lime on a skillet. It doesn't come with a sauce for dipping if you get naan, so be mindful of that. 

I ordered the chicken tikka masala which I really did enjoy, but the flavors are little bit muted compared to a great chicken tikka. Still though, with the naan and gravy I thoroughly enjoyed my meal. I have to say the naan at Lahore Karahi is off the charts. I might even go so far as to say this is the one of the best, if not the best naan I've ever had. It was super fresh, sooooo soft and chewy and delicious. They have so many kinds of naan, so next time I going to try one of the different flavors -- sesame naan, cheese naan, aloo paratha, Afghani naan, etc.  

We will definitely be back even if it's just for the naan.

excerpts: The Chicken Boti Tikka was pretty amazing.
So moist and flavorful.
Chicken Tikka Masala was also very good.
chicken boti tikka.author: Vol T.
chicken boti tikka.review:
The food here is solid. The Chicken Boti Tikka was pretty amazing. So moist and flavorful. Chicken Tikka Masala was also very good. For starters, the Chicken Cheese Naan was so good. The vegtable samosa was the weakest, not enough flavor and a little bland. But overall, the food is very good here.

3 stars is due to really slow service. We were there for late lunch.. we were the only ones in the restaurant. We asked for water.. he gestured towards the fridge for us to get the water carafe ourselves. There were a few tables that remained dirty with dishes and never cleaned the whole time we were there. And he took his time cooking our food. So service is very lacking. 

So... my advice is maybe try it and see what your expereince is. You can do takeout also.

excerpts: Chicken Boti Tikka was also really good and sizzling hot when it was served.
chicken boti tikka.author: Nilesh G.
chicken boti tikka.review:
Karahi Chicken had amazing taste. Chicken Boti Tikka was also really good and sizzling hot when it was served.

Had prawns Biryani also but It was good enough... Not as great as other dishes.

But overall good place to have tasty food.

excerpts: We also got an order of chicken boti tikka and some aloo saag.
They were great.
Was surprised the tikka didn't come with lemons, it seems to in most places.
But the meat was flavorful and cooked properly.
The aloo saag was tasty and spicy, but
not overly so.
chicken boti tikka.author: Sweet A.
chicken boti tikka.review:
We stumbled onto this place while cruising the Tenderloin and loved the food. It's one of those little unassuming hole-in-the-wall places. The crowd was happy, the food was tasty and the prices were great.

The tablecloth was under glass but still dirty. The guy taking our order couldn't be forced to smile and I can usually break through to anyone. But it was a fun experience and we'd return. 

You order at the counter, grab some glasses, and help yourself to a carafe of water from the fridge. People around us were bringing in their own wine from a nearby store.

There were three of us. We got 3 orders of naan. Each piece was huge! Nice flavor, perfect combo of crisp outside and tender inside. We got 2 orders of rice. It was a little dry, like it had been cooked quite a bit earlier, but still flavorful. We also got an order of chicken boti tikka and some aloo saag. They were great. Was surprised the tikka didn't come with lemons, it seems to in most places. But the meat was flavorful and cooked properly. The aloo saag was tasty and spicy, but not overly so. The potatoes had good texture. 

Our total for all of this food, with plenty of leftovers, was $28. Amazing! If we lived nearby, we'd be regulars.

excerpts: We stuck to the fundamentals and ordered Garlic Naan and the Beef Seekh Kebab.
The kebab was so tender and juicy!
It was grilled well and burst with subtle flavor.
It was not spicy, but you can really taste the garam masala and cumin which pairs well with some lemon squeezed on top.
The Garlic Naan had the right amount of thickness.
beef seekh kebab.author: Sabina S.
beef seekh kebab.review:
Lahore Karahi is an authentic Pakistani hole-in-the-wall nestled in The Tenderloin. 

We weren't super hungry and just felt like nibbling, which always makes for the perfect time to order kebabs!

First off, Lahore Karahi makes fresh masala chai which they keep in a thermal carafe for customers to take on their own, along with sugar on the side so that you can make your perfect cup of chai. I absolutely love it when Indian and Pakistani restaurants do this because chai truly completes the meal!

We stuck to the fundamentals and ordered Garlic Naan and the Beef Seekh Kebab. The kebab was so tender and juicy! It was grilled well and burst with subtle flavor. It was not spicy, but you can really taste the garam masala and cumin which pairs well with some lemon squeezed on top. The Garlic Naan had the right amount of thickness. All too often naan is made to be too doughy, but these guys did it well and were generous with the roasted garlic on top. 

Pro tip: Take the naan to soak up and eat the grilled onions that come with the sizzling platter that the kebabs come on. Truly divine flavors!

Would recommend this place for some authentic Pakistani food in a casual setting!

excerpts: Their beef seekh kebab is a must try,
its the most authentic Pakistani style Kebab
I've had outside of Pakistan.
I have also tried their Karahi, which was very flavorful and had the right amount of spices.
beef seekh kebab.author: Saadullah S.
beef seekh kebab.review:
This is my new favorite Pakistani food spot in the city now. Its a whole in the wall, with great food and slow service. Well, actually the service seems slower because they make all their food fresh, so if your food is taking time its because they're preparing it fresh rather then just heating up left overs from yesterday.

Their beef seekh kebab is a must try, its the most authentic Pakistani style Kebab I've had outside of Pakistan. I have also tried their Karahi, which was very flavorful and had the right amount of spices. The Naans, buttered up, had the right amount of crispiness and softness. 

The interior isn't any special, much better then that of Shalimar though and as noted earlier, be prepared to wait for your food. 

Lahore Karahi is now my go to spot for Pakistani food (sorry Shalimar and Punjab).

excerpts: This evening we shared the Vegetable Samosas, Tandoori Lamb Chop, Tandoori Fish, Lahore Karahi Rice and garlic Naan.
The Vegetable Samosas were big and stuffed full, fried perfectly and served warm.
I liked the mint sauce that accompanied them, I thought these were the best part of my meal.
Next up was the Tandoori Lamb Chop, these were the smallest lamb chops I have ever seen.
To say there was a mouthful of meat on each chop would be generous.
We followed with the Tandoori Fish which I will say looked beautifully cooked
but I wasn't a fan of the type of fish that was used, maybe it was Catfish?
It had a muddy taste to it that just took away any desire to eat the rest of the fish.
The Karahi Rice was rice with some spice in it, nothing that caught my attention to make me order this rice dish again.
I did enjoy the Garlic Naan, I'm amazed how each Indian/Pakistani restaurant has their own way of making Naan.
Lahore's Naan is flat vs puffy and moist with lots of garlic and cilantro.

I like the location of Lahore because it's in the Tenderloin, it's a perfectly safe neighborhood although it looks sketchy but this seems to weed out the "Oh so trendy" from the "Gotta have authentic food" folks like me.
I like the size of the restaurant
, it worked when it was the German Cook and it seems to work well for Lahore.
I do wish they had a liquor license or at the very least we could bring our own.
I was going to give Lahore 2 stars because of tonight's meal but
because I have been here before and have had some great food I am giving 3 stars.
I'll come back to Lahore even after this mediocre review but will order something different.
lamb chop.author: David P.
lamb chop.review:
My good friend Lori and I went to dinner at Lahore Pakistani restaurant for dinner, she had never been and wanted to try it out. I have been coming to this location back when it was the German Cook  and have eaten at Lahore probably 6 or 7 times and always had a good meal.
We lucked out and grabbed the first table to the right as  you entered which could sit three persons, great for sharing food and having a good conversation. Unfortunately, as soon as we sat down we noticed a little roach on the table slowly crawling up the wall........not a good start but not enough to make me walk out the door.
The owner and waiter were very attentive and friendly but the service was slower than usual but I think that's kind of nice so you can visit longer.

This evening we shared the Vegetable Samosas, Tandoori Lamb Chop, Tandoori Fish, Lahore Karahi Rice and garlic Naan.
The Vegetable Samosas were big and stuffed full, fried perfectly and served warm. I liked the mint sauce that accompanied them, I thought these were the best part of my meal.
Next up was the Tandoori Lamb Chop, these were the smallest lamb chops I have ever seen. To say there was a mouthful of meat on each chop would be generous. 
We followed with the Tandoori Fish which I will say looked beautifully cooked but I wasn't a fan of the type of fish that was used, maybe it was Catfish? It had a muddy taste to it that just took away any desire to eat the rest of the fish. The Karahi Rice was rice with some spice in it, nothing that caught my attention to make me order this rice dish again. I did enjoy the Garlic Naan, I'm amazed how each Indian/Pakistani restaurant has their own way of making Naan. Lahore's Naan is flat vs puffy and moist with lots of garlic and cilantro.
 I like the location of Lahore because it's in the Tenderloin, it's a perfectly safe neighborhood although it looks sketchy but this seems to weed out the "Oh so trendy" from the "Gotta have authentic food" folks like me. I like the size of the restaurant, it worked when it was the German Cook and it seems to work well for Lahore. I do wish they had a liquor license or at the very least we could bring our own. I was going to give Lahore 2 stars because of tonight's meal but because I have been here before and have had some great food I am giving 3 stars.
I'll come back to Lahore even after this mediocre review but will order something different.

excerpts: Lamb Saag
- This was goood!
The lamb was all meat w/o bones and tender
* Fish Tandoori - YUMMY!
My friend said it was a bit dry.
I just thought it could have slightly less cooked, but not dry....
You get like six chucks of fish!
lamb saag.author: Fried Rice B.
lamb saag.review:
The great thing about this place is that you feel like you're in Uncle Guddu's kitchen... The not so great thing is that come out smelling like you've been in Uncle Guddu's kitchen! LOL... 

A couple of my friends and I checked this place out last night and it was a pretty good overall experience, waited only about five to ten minutes for a table and seated right away. From the first look of the place I thought is small, but when we sat down we didn't feel cramp at all. The place isn't the cleanest, but you get the value you pay for and tastier! 

The great thing is that appetizer are price accordingly, they're lower priced than the main dishes; it kind of bugs me that appetizers are priced the same as main dishes at a lot of restaurants nowadays. The same value system goes for the vegetarian dishes, they're slightly cheaper than meat dishes as they should be! : -) 

Food: 
* Vegetable Fritters - crispy and tasty! 
* Regular Naan - Not greasy and not doughy thick like Naan-N-Curry! That's good thing! 
* Garlic Naan - Tasty, but you only get one with an order... hmmm 
* Chicken Tikka Marsala - YUM, I always get this at Indian restaurants! Though I did notice that the curry had a sweet onion like taste, than the more common tomato curry base in other Indian places. Still tasty! 
* Lamb Saag - This was goood! The lamb was all meat w/o bones and tender 
* Fish Tandoori - YUMMY! My friend said it was a bit dry. I just thought it could have slightly less cooked, but not dry.... You get like six chucks of fish! A good value compared to other places. 

Drinks: 
* Mango Lassi - I think they use fresh mango (not frozen) which is a good thing, but the mango tasted too ripe. So that was bit of a let down. 

Service: 
Considering that there's only one cook, one guy making the naan by orders, and one waiter to take orders and serve the food, the service was fast! There is a guy who process the bills and another guy who wash dishes (?). Great friendly service! 

Go check this place out! Not the cleanest, but we didn't see and bugs that goodness....Lol

excerpts: My bf had the Saag Gosht, a lamb saag with spinach & lentils, which was also fabulous (& had considerably less clarified butter in it).
The Saag Gosht had a wonderful smoky, chocolatey, almost mole-like character to it, and the meat was tender & flavorful.
lamb saag.author: Angela B.
lamb saag.review:
Amazing!  Thus far, the best Indian I've had in the city.  I had the chicken korma - tender, white meat chicken in a spicy ginger/coriander sauce.  Delicious!  My only complaint would be the amount of clarified butter in the sauce (it was not an insignificant amount by any strentch).  My bf had the Saag Gosht, a lamb saag with spinach & lentils, which was also fabulous (& had considerably less clarified butter in it).  The Saag Gosht had a wonderful smoky, chocolatey, almost mole-like character to it, and the meat was tender & flavorful.  The rice was tasty, and the naan had almost a pizza crust texture to it (which, authentic or not, I really enjoyed).

Service was excellent, and the prices are more than reasonable ($23 for both entrees, rice, & two naan plus tax & tip).  One word of warning - the place is small, turnover is not quick, and the line can be long (there were four parties ahead of us & we waited 50 minutes to be seated - then again, this was at about 8:15 pm on Saturday night).  On the other hand, the food came out faster than I expected, considering that there's one guy doing all the cooking.  Still, the food was fabulous enough that we'll DEFINITELY be back for late-night take out during the week.

excerpts: The lamb saag and the 1.00 garlic naan were clear standouts.
lamb saag.author: A.J. S.
lamb saag.review:
Oh, I'll be the first to admit that I am a tourist and called in a reservation for 6:30 at Lahore Karahi.

.....after the laughter subsides I'll continue.

After we made our way to our empty deli table located next to an nonworking door, we were quite impressed with the food! Homemade Indian food was the best thing in my boyfriend's last relationship, and he helped me find a love for it too. This place was pakistani, I'm pretty sure, but overall the food was DELICIOUS AND CHEAP.

The lamb saag and the 1.00 garlic naan were clear standouts. The shrimp masala was a bit too sweet for my taste, but nevertheless fun to try and quite tasty.

The owner gave us a cube of free "homemade curry ice cream" on a toothpick on our way out. Priceless. We left quite satisfied on our journey through the Tenderloin dodging homeless men sucking on curried ice cream on toothpicks.

excerpts: I also enjoyed the lamb saag, but wanted something a bit spicier.
Still, I absolutely can't wait to return.
lamb saag.author: Brianne C.
lamb saag.review:
4.25 stars.

I have a serious issue with Lahore Karahi. I ate dinner here on my first night in San Francisco, a foodie city I have dreamed of visiting, and wanted to do nothing but return for dinner each subsequent night. It didn't matter that thousands of other places were waiting to change the way I think about food, I wanted Lahore's casual, lovingly prepared bowls of goodness! Guddu, I am holding you personally responsible.

The tandoori fish is incredible. Truly, this beautifully presented dish of spice-crusted butter fish is something special. The hot chai (deeper and more intense than I expected), chicken tikka masala, cheese naan, and paneer tikka were also memorable: comforting, perfectly spiced, and cleanly flavored. I also enjoyed the lamb saag, but wanted something a bit spicier. Still, I absolutely can't wait to return.

excerpts: The garlic naan is good and the lamb saag is fresh although needed more taste.
The food is cheap and good, the owner is friendly, but seriously, the food could be better!
But, hubby likes it a lot.
So, I guess, we are coming back for more.
lamb saag.author: Daisy S.
lamb saag.review: I thought it was good, but nothing to be brag about. All homemade. The garlic naan is good and the lamb saag is fresh although needed more taste. The food is cheap and good, the owner is friendly, but seriously, the food could be better! But, hubby likes it a lot. So, I guess, we are coming back for more.

excerpts: my friend said that the lamb saag ascended above, all these marvelous things.
dont pass this one up, give naan and curry, shalimar, chutney and pakwan a rest for five minutes ( listen, i know, its hard.
they are go to places that have all the accolades and what have you.
just do it, once.)
DUDE, UPDATE:
MY GOODNESS!
Gudoo really went overboard tonight.
I brought in three friends, and both chef and patron went to town.
Starting with samosas, we went traveled a saag ghost, dal makhani (extra spicy, no cream.
lamb saag.author: Christopher J.
lamb saag.review:
yes, yes. this place dominates the quadrant. that free kulfi he gave us at the end was magnificient, my cholay rich and filling, the best green sauce i have ever tasted. my friend said that the lamb saag ascended above, all these marvelous things. dont pass this one up, give naan and curry, shalimar, chutney and pakwan a rest for five minutes ( listen, i know, its hard. they are go to places that have all the accolades and what have you. just do it, once.)
DUDE, UPDATE: 3/22/06 OH MY GOODNESS! Gudoo really went overboard tonight. I brought in three friends, and both chef and patron went to town. Starting with samosas, we went traveled a saag ghost, dal makhani (extra spicy, no cream. MAMA SEITA), dal masala, beingan bhartha, 4 garlic naan, an order of rice, a salad and my friends shared the patented fish tandoori, which they said reached emperor status. He topped it off with free kulfi and bannana pudding, homeade. my friend uttered: "this man is the god of the moment." Doesn't everybody want to be, just once? this guys hits that every couple of minutes. Are you still eating at shalimar?

excerpts: The lamb tikka masala went very well with the cheese naan that we cleaned the whole bowl.
lamb tikka masala.author: Xinyu L.
lamb tikka masala.review: Surprisingly flavorful and cooked fresh! The tandoori chicken was excellently seasoned. The lamb tikka masala went very well with the cheese naan that we cleaned the whole bowl.

excerpts: Chicken/Lamb Tikka Masala:
Their chicken, again, tender and moist.
This is the most delicious Chicken Tikka Masala that I have ever had.
Their Masala is creamy and full of flavor.
lamb tikka masala.author: Alondra J.
lamb tikka masala.review:
Lahore Karahi is one of my favorite Pakistani/Indian restaurant in The City. Before anything this place is not beautiful its not a luxurious place. BUT the food is great!

What I love getting at Lahore Karahi is their:

Chiken Tandoori: Tender & moist, comes with a few lemon wedges and onions.

Chicken Karahi: THIS IS MY ALL time favorite dish. It has a hint of spice and the curry is amazing. Just like the tandoori chicken the chicken that's in the Karahi is super tender. 

Chicken/Lamb Tikka Masala: Their chicken, again, tender and moist. This is the most delicious Chicken Tikka Masala that I have ever had. Their Masala is creamy and full of flavor. Their lamb is just like their chicken juicy, tender and moist!

Along with these dishes we usually order naan and roti.

A must try place! Just remember it is NOT a fancy place!

excerpts: We had the lamb tikka masala with aloo naan and garlic naan.
We fed the two of us for less than $20.
The tikka masala was delicious!
A lot less creamy than others I've tried and a bit more of a kick.
Felt authentic.
My boyfriend said the lamb was tender.
I love how much flavor they pack into their naan!
When they say garlic naan, oh man do they mean it.
I can still taste the garlic on my breath right now lol!
You order and pay at the register, seat yourself, and then they'll bring you your meal.
They do take card
so that's a plus.
lamb tikka masala.author: Lexi R.
lamb tikka masala.review: Awesome no frills Indian spot right in the tenderloin. We had the lamb tikka masala with aloo naan and garlic naan. We fed the two of us for less than $20. The tikka masala was delicious! A lot less creamy than others I've tried and a bit more of a kick. Felt authentic. My boyfriend said the lamb was tender. I love how much flavor they pack into their naan! When they say garlic naan, oh man do they mean it. I can still taste the garlic on my breath right now lol! You order and pay at the register, seat yourself, and then they'll bring you your meal. They do take card so that's a plus.

excerpts:
Yums:
- lamb tikka masala (lamb SO tender!!
yummy!!!!)
lamb tikka masala.author: Nicole H.
lamb tikka masala.review:
Food was above average but gave me tummy aches at night/the day after.

Yums:
- lamb tikka masala (lamb SO tender!! yummy!!!!)
- keema naan
- garlic naan

Meh:
- butter chicken (chicken dry/sauce not as tasty as tikka masala)

excerpts: We went all in, talking saag paneer, lamb tikka masala, naan, pakoras, samosas, mutter paneer, chicken vindaloo, lamb curry, and maybe one more.
It's hard to remember in a blur of curry what I had, I just know I had more food than I think I've ever eaten in my entire life.
lamb tikka masala.author: Adam S.
lamb tikka masala.review:
Lahore Karahi is my happy place.

After a few cocktails from Rye, a group of us headed to Lahore Karahi hoping to find some awesome, hole-in-wall style Indian food. This is the real deal.

We went all in, talking saag paneer, lamb tikka masala, naan, pakoras, samosas, mutter paneer, chicken vindaloo, lamb curry, and maybe one more. It's hard to remember in a blur of curry what I had, I just know I had more food than I think I've ever eaten in my entire life. Seriously.

The spot is very unassuming, and you can see the big pots and pans cooking up the deliciousness right as you order. We confirmed that we could bring in our own beer so made a quick pit stop and brought them in as we waited. 

This was an all timer, an epic meal. This is the type of meal where I set my fork down saying I'm done only to pick it up about five more times. 

Find this place, go to this place and find your happy place.

excerpts: We had the lamb tikka masala and vegetable pakoras.
Both were ehhh.
The vegetable pakoras didn't have much flavor, I had to drench it in sauce to make it more edible.
Whatever the green sauce they gave us was bomb though.
Never seen green sauces in Indian food either.
I really liked it though!
The tikka masala was lacking flavor too, which is just whaaaaat (?!?!?!)
for Indian curry.
It tastes slightly bland if that's even possible.
It wasn't bad, but it wasn't amazing either.
It was just eh.
But the reason why I'm giving this place 2 stars is because THERE WAS A CREATURE CRAWLING ALONG THE WALLS.
I'm not sure what it was
but it looked like a baby cockroach or something very similar.
I understand this isn't a fancy restaurant but creatures are NEVER okay.
I felt so grossed out for the rest of my meal.
Not a feeling I enjoy when I'm trying to grub :|
lamb tikka masala.author: Angel C.
lamb tikka masala.review:
My friend and I sat there for a good 5 minutes wondering how come no waiter wants to take our order. Then we looked up and realized you order at the counter. Duhhhh.
 
Lots of amazing Indian places in San Francisco.. this one.. not so much. We had the lamb tikka masala and vegetable pakoras. Both were ehhh. The vegetable pakoras didn't have much flavor, I had to drench it in sauce to make it more edible. Whatever the green sauce they gave us was bomb though. Never seen green sauces in Indian food either. I really liked it though! The tikka masala was lacking flavor too, which is just whaaaaat (?!?!?!) for Indian curry. It tastes slightly bland if that's even possible. It wasn't bad, but it wasn't amazing either. It was just eh. A 3/5.
 
But the reason why I'm giving this place 2 stars is because THERE WAS A CREATURE CRAWLING ALONG THE WALLS. I'm not sure what it was but it looked like a baby cockroach or something very similar. I understand this isn't a fancy restaurant but creatures are NEVER okay. I felt so grossed out for the rest of my meal. Not a feeling I enjoy when I'm trying to grub :|

excerpts: The Chicken Korma, Sag Paneer and Lamb Dal (spicy!) are some of my favorites :)
lamb dal.author: Tara K.
lamb dal.review:
The walk from Van Ness at 10PM - questionable. The traditional Indian food made fresh with each order - worth it. Dinner generally ranges from 11-15 for each of us when we go, with Naan, tea, an entree and started... pretty amazing!

The food tastes amazing.. I've tried my fair share of Indian in SF, and this competes for the title of best flavor. 

BYOB without any sort of corking fee which is lovely. The Chicken Korma, Sag Paneer and Lamb Dal (spicy!) are some of my favorites :) 

Definitely worth your time - it'll be one we frequent often.

excerpts: Ordered the $16 goat curry.
I got a lot of bones with no meat on them and two Tiny pieces of meat in the bottom that were really dry.
Curry was also yellow in color - tasted
ok
but I have no idea what gave it that color.
The tandoori chicken was also small but tasted good.
Will not order from them again.
goat curry.author: reza n.
goat curry.review: Ordered the $16 goat curry. I got a lot of bones with no meat on them and two Tiny pieces of meat in the bottom that were really dry.  Curry was also yellow in color - tasted ok but I have no idea what gave it that color.   The tandoori chicken was also small but tasted good. Will not order from them again.

excerpts: The Goat Curry is also one of my favorites.
Super authentic!
Mango lassi is also a must!
Not tangy and very yogurt-y
goat curry.author: Leilani Y.
goat curry.review:
Mmmm..my favorite Indian/Pakistani  joint! :) Their curries are oh. so. goood...
Out of all the Indian/Pakistani places in the Tenderloin, this place is seriously the best!

I tried the Chicken Korma curry for the first time and omg.. it was soooo good. Buttery goodness. drools... goes perfectly well with garlic naan. 
The Goat Curry is also one of my favorites. Super authentic!
Mango lassi is also a must! Not tangy and very yogurt-y :)

excerpts: solid, lamb and goat curry rocked it.
The tandoori chicken was a little too dry for my taste and so was their roti.
Ok, must name drop again that this place pales in comparison to Shalimar, but it's actually the second best place I've had Indian/Pakistani food so far in the City.
Maybe I haven't tried enough Indian/Pakistani places yet then.
Close, but no cigar.
goat curry.author: Bailey N.
goat curry.review:
3.5 stars. 

If I knew about the poor safety score on Yelp, I would have stopped my boyfriend from ordering takeout from this place on EAT24.  Whatever we received though was pretty good.  Garlic naan was solid, lamb and goat curry rocked it.  The tandoori chicken was a little too dry for my taste and so was their roti.  Ok, must name drop again that this place pales in comparison to Shalimar, but it's actually the second best place I've had Indian/Pakistani food so far in the City.  Maybe I haven't tried enough Indian/Pakistani places yet then.  Close, but no cigar.

excerpts: We had garlic naan and regular naan, goat curry, sag paneer, tandoori chicken.
Everything tasty
REALLY good!
Chicken was tender, goat was well cook and the naan...
all
yeah
the naan, pretty bomb!
I highly recommend this place!
Only negative which is the reason why I removed one star: they have a safety health warning which popped up on their yelp page
so I really hope I won't be sick tomorrow
goat curry.author: Rachida I.
goat curry.review:
Great Indian food! We had garlic naan and regular naan, goat curry, sag paneer, tandoori chicken.
Everything tasty REALLY good! Chicken was tender, goat was well cook and the naan... all yeah the naan, pretty bomb!
I highly recommend this place! 
Only negative which is the reason why I removed one star: they have a safety health warning which popped up on their yelp page so I really hope I won't be sick tomorrow :/

excerpts: Ordered daal, goat curry, garlic naan, plain naan, rice and raita.
Everything was tasteless!
The goat curry was super oily and the lentils weren't cooked all the way.
Both naans were super chewy and had no flavor.
And a small box of rice was $3!!!
Waste of money and a chew.
goat curry.author: J S.
goat curry.review: Ordered daal, goat curry, garlic naan, plain naan, rice and raita. Everything was tasteless! The goat curry was super oily and the lentils weren't cooked all the way. Both naans were super chewy and had no flavor. And a small box of rice was $3!!! Waste of money and a chew.

excerpts: I think they do a great goat curry!
and the Biryani is good.
I go there sometimes just for the goat curry - very "tasteful".
goat curry.author: Babar Y.
goat curry.review: I think they do a great goat curry! and the Biryani is good. I go there sometimes just for the goat curry - very "tasteful".

excerpts: Ordered tandoori chicken leg, goat curry and garlic naan.
The goat is well cooked and tandoori is perfect.
Naan is decent.
Would order food here again.
goat curry.author: Ravi Teja P.
goat curry.review: Ordered tandoori chicken leg, goat curry and garlic naan. The goat is well cooked and tandoori is perfect. Naan is decent. Would order food here again.

excerpts: I've become a regular and I've had the pleasure of enjoying the lamb vindaloo, a cauliflower curry, chicken korma, goat curry, palak paneer, etc.
Honestly liked everything except for the veggie korma one time tasted a little funky, but I've ordered it since and been thrilled, so maybe it was just me.
This is not the cleanest place...
But does it matter?
It's cheap, pretty quick
and if it's cooked for long periods of time over high heat
why does it matter?
The employees are super nice too - just don't forget to pay on your way out!
I know I almost have like 5 times.
Good for smaller groups, lots of 4-top tables
and there's a big TV for sports fans
goat curry.author: Katie P.
goat curry.review:
What a great find in the TL. Delicious authentic Indian. I had been searching high and low for an Indian spot in SF for a couple years and this lands the spot of my número uno. Everything is under $10. BYOB w/ no corkage fee. Hope this lasts(!)

Usually opt for the classic "western" choices: chicken tikka masala, basmati rice, & (lots of) garlic naan. All items are consistently good. 

I've become a regular and I've had the pleasure of enjoying the lamb vindaloo, a cauliflower curry, chicken korma, goat curry, palak paneer, etc. Honestly liked everything except for the veggie korma one time tasted a little funky, but I've ordered it since and been thrilled, so maybe it was just me. This is not the cleanest place... But does it matter? It's cheap, pretty quick and if it's cooked for long periods of time over high heat why does it matter? The employees are super nice too - just don't forget to pay on your way out! I know I almost have like 5 times. Good for smaller groups, lots of 4-top tables and there's a big TV for sports fans always playing Warrior's games.

Lahore, I love you. Thanks for plumping me up and keeping me warm on most Friday nights.

excerpts: We ordered the lamb tikka and the goat curry, and they had various pieces of what looked like stomach lining, gristle, organs.
No actual meat included.
$15 a curry - is this a joke!
You think you can hide 3rd grade dog food in a thick curry sauce?
We were so grossed out we tossed the entire lot and went hungry that night.
goat curry.author: Anna M.
goat curry.review: DISGUSTING - the 'meat' (and I use that term loosely) in their curries is only fit for dog food. We ordered the lamb tikka and the goat curry, and they had various pieces of what looked like stomach lining, gristle, organs. No actual meat included. $15 a curry - is this a joke! You think you can hide 3rd grade dog food in a thick curry sauce? We were so grossed out we tossed the entire lot and went hungry that night.

excerpts: My favorites are the Chicken Karahi, Goat Curry even though the Chicken tandoori and Butter chicken are not bad.
goat curry.author: Vijay N.
goat curry.review:
This is by far the best N. Indian cuisine that one would find in SF even though it is Pakistani ( some parts of N.India and Pakistan share the same culture and food habits).

My favorites are the Chicken Karahi, Goat Curry even though the Chicken tandoori and Butter chicken are not bad. The Garlic Naan and Onion Kulcha are my staple orders for bread. Everything is cooked fresh and so will take some time but worth it. The Biryanis are good too here.

The  best part is that in the end, it is not expensive!

excerpts: Goat curry: if you don't like goat, get out of here!
The man behind the counter suggested we order this dish and he didn't steer us wrong.
The meat was tender and flavorful.
goat curry.author: N ..
goat curry.review:
First time here, won't be the last. I went at the time between lunch and dinner so I can't speak to the wait times or speed of service. My bf and I were the only ones in the joint.  

Garlic Naan: delicious. Chewy on the inside and crispy on the outside...garlic but not too much garlic.

Goat curry: if you don't like goat, get out of here! The man behind the counter suggested we order this dish and he didn't steer us wrong. The meat was tender and flavorful. The sauce was full of spices and not too salty. 

Chicken korma: stole my heart. Creamy, yummy, again, not too salty (I find that it's easily done). If you're wondering what to get, get this.
