Don't be intimidated if you see a roach on the wall. They too like good food. If you leave them alone, they will leave you be...true tenderloin spirit. 

Thank you for a wonderful meal!

excerpts: Their goat curry was boney but the sauce was amazing.
goat curry.author: Dash_Rendar _.
goat curry.review:
I think their food is great. Only Tikka Masala has better food in the Tenderloin. Shame on the reviews that gives props to Chutney's food. You guys are high or have shit palates.

Anyway, despite good food this place has TERRIBLE service. Way too long for food and absolutely not a hint of friendliness. I work in a restaurants, I am very sympathetic towards long waits for food. I usually know why the wait is long because I understand how kitchens work (generally). This place just doesn't want to make your food. It either picks and chooses what tables they want to serve first or has no idea of how to efficiently expedite their way through orders. They do not take any priority towards to-go orders either. Usually I call to order, wait 15 minutes,  go down there and once I show up and ask about my food, THEN they make it. I had a disaster of a to-go order recently and that was my last straw here.

My favorite place,  Tikka Masala on Ellis also has long waits for food but I look back at their kitchen and can kinda see why. Plus their owner and/or counterperson is friendly and helpful. The people at Lahore Kahari are straight up assholes. Seriously. 

They do have good food though. I love their chicken tikka masala and most of their lamb curries. Their goat curry was boney but the sauce was amazing. All their naan is good.

Its dirty but so are most Indian places. I don't care too much. Chai is on par with other places.

I'm not just bitter over one visit. I have been receiving terrible service and inexcusable wait times over years. Even when the previous owner was there. Fuck this place.

excerpts: Love their goat curry: if not, get out of here!
We were suggested we order this dish and he didn't steer us wrong.
The meat was tender and flavorful.
The sauce was full of spices and not too salty.
I will love to come back here again!
goat curry.author: Arnab K.
goat curry.review: Love their goat curry: if not, get out of here! We were suggested we order this dish and he didn't steer us wrong. The meat was tender and flavorful. The sauce was full of spices and not too salty. I will love to come back here again!

excerpts: The food was nicely spiced, but the goat curry my boyfriend had was very runny with a distinct lack of goat, but with an abundance of bones...and vertebrae at that.
I had the the eggplant curry, which was decent.
goat curry.author: Elena T.
goat curry.review:
First time visitor - will not be coming back. Here's the good, the bad and the downright ugly...

FOOD:
The food was ok, not great. Veggie samosa average.The food was nicely spiced, but the goat curry my boyfriend had was very runny with a distinct lack of goat, but with an abundance of bones...and vertebrae at that. I had the the eggplant curry, which was decent. Onion kulcha was burnt, and the garlic naan did not look or taste like it was made with fresh ingredients. Also, uhm, don't drink the water, it did not look or taste potable. Felt queasy when we got home, but boyfriend did not seem to experience any ill effects from the food.

Recap - food ok. On a 1-5 scale, maybe a 2.

WAIT:
Be prepared to wait. It's a small hole in the wall, which has limited staff. On top of that, it seems like only one person was cooking, with three others doing other stuff that was not customer-related. It mostly looked like they were standing around on the back-line, but I could be wrong. Plenty of time to observe what else was going on, as the wait was so long.

AMBIANCE and CUSTOMER SERVICE:
Ambiance was lacking, but is not usually a deal breaker for me. Although in this case, I could have done without the rolls of toilet paper on top of their drink fridge or the slew of unbussed tables. 

Speaking of which, don't expect anything from the customer service - seat yourself, come up, order at the kitchen/front-end and expect yourself and your needs to be ignored. We were there for an hour with 2 other tables being occupied, and at no point did ANYONE buss any of the empty tables with dirty plates and food still left on them. We did, however, see a customer buss a table by moving the last guests remains to another table and then sit down. Simply unacceptable. 

Also, while we where there, they were restocking their pantry it seems. I really could have done without seeing boxes of okra and basmati rice everywhere. I have worked extensively in food service, and if you don't have a back door, you NEVER get deliveries during business hours - the whole point is to focus on your customers, and not on everything else. 

CLEANLINESS
This is where this place gets some serious dings. Tablecloths with black dirt stains at the edge where they meet the clear plastic table top, broken soap dispenser with watered down soap in the bathroom, bathroom in general not in any great state of cleanliness, "Order Here" sign with big grease stain, kitchen visibly dirty from where you sit and plastic water glasses with cracks in them. Not good. 

All in all, this will not be somewhere we will re-visit.

excerpts: The best goat curry and chana masala
i have had so far!!
If u r in this area and are looking for good food , this is the place!
Highly recommend!
goat curry.author: Manpreet R.
goat curry.review: The best goat curry and chana masala i have had so far!! If u r in this area and are looking for good food , this is the place! Highly recommend!

excerpts: Occasionally they have posted specials like Goat Curry which are definitely worth ordering, so check the board behind the counter when ordering.
goat curry.author: Mark Y.
goat curry.review:
This place has come under new management recently, I believe the old owner moved back to Pakistan with his family. I had a conversation with the new owner and head chef and he told me he has been friends with the owner for a long time and promised to keep the same quality standards of home style food as has been already built up after all these years. I have actually noticed the eating area of the restaurant has been freshened up a bit and is cleaner than before which is nice to see given that the old place was pretty much a hole in the wall.

My favorite dishes here are the Tandoori Chicken Leg, Lamb Vindaloo, Chicken Korma, and Garlic Naan. Occasionally they have posted specials like Goat Curry which are definitely worth ordering, so check the board behind the counter when ordering.

excerpts: I always get goat curry with white rice.
Better than Chutney and Shalimar.
I recommend it
goat curry.author: Zulfi B.
goat curry.review: This place is awesome, the food is great, the service is nice. I always get goat curry with white rice. Better than Chutney and Shalimar. I recommend it

excerpts: My friend had the goat curry, it was delicious and the meat was falling off the bones - there were quite a few bones.
The naan bread was ok, a little crispy, the meals dont come with rice, so make sure you order it if you want it.
Not the kind of place to come for a date!
But a good place to satisfy your curry cravings!
goat curry.author: Wendy C.
goat curry.review:
Walked up to the door and was greeted by wonderful curry aromas... The menu has all the usual suspects with a good selection of seafood and vegetarian dishes. 
I had the chicken korma (apparently mild) which was quite spicy, huge chunks of chicken, which were a little dry.
My friend had the goat curry, it was delicious and the meat was falling off the bones - there were quite a few bones.
 The naan bread was ok, a little crispy, the meals dont come with rice, so make sure you order it if you want it. Not the kind of place to come for a date! But a good place to satisfy your curry cravings!

excerpts: I am a regular patron of Shalimar (Jones St), I wanted to see if there was another Indian/Pakistan restaurant on par w/the potato nan, lamb, ginger goat curry, and chix tiki masala i've come to love.
goat curry.author: Maggie L.
goat curry.review:
As a curry addict i've been all over the city enjoying indian/pakistan food. I am a regular patron of Shalimar (Jones St), I wanted to see if there was another Indian/Pakistan restaurant on par w/the potato nan, lamb, ginger goat curry, and chix tiki masala i've come to love.

After countless reviewing of reviews, Lahore Karahi seemed to stand out as a victor in this area of expertise with people often compairing the 2 establishments. I thought i had found the one!  Unfortunately, my expectations were far under exceeded. 

Myself and 3 of my fellow indian/pakistan loving friends patrooned Lahore Karah on a Thursday night in hopes that it would be just as mind blowing as our beloved.

General table consensus
- most currys had a strong vinegary aftertaste 
- Chicken was overcooked and chewy
- tiki masala curry tasted burnt
- nan was served luke warm and lifeless
- they didn't server goat and didn't allow beer

Underwhelmed and over hyped?!? I haven't been back since.

excerpts: - Goat curry was a not-on-the-menu recommendation... makes ya feel special to get it.
goat curry.author: Mari C.
goat curry.review:
...and I thought I was learnéd in the ways of the Pakistani mouth-love.  HA!  This place was dirt cheap, zesty, and encouraged me to drink outside beer.   What more could you ask of a relationship with a Tenderloin restaurant?

I went with about nine other people, all of whom carried with them 40's and 6packs purchased from the liquor stop around the corner.  We had a bit of a wait, but it was mostly because there were so many of us and the place was not huge.  

We ordered about one order of everything, which turned out to be way too much and not enough, all at the same time.  The potato naan was delectable, the sauces were fresh and sassy like a drag queen with a new pair of shoes.  It was pretty much an ideal meal.

The stars of the night were:
- fish tikka masala.  Even better than my usual chicken!
- Palek paneer.  I never really thought much of this plate at other places, but da-YUM this was a must-have here.
- Goat curry was a not-on-the-menu recommendation... makes ya feel special to get it.

Thank you to Tommy H and his wonderful comrades who opened my eyes to the new frontier of gustatory delights.

excerpts: Goat curry isn't on the menu but he always has it on hand.
Tandoor fish - best in the city.
Sheekh kebab - the lamb is mixed with these wonderful herbs and it comes sizzling to your table.
goat curry.author: Priya R.
goat curry.review:
This is my favorite indian/pakistani restaurant in the city.  The owner is the chef and the waiters work every day - they are the best people. Some people go in and expect american service - you aren't going to get that.  These people are salt of the earth and are very hard-working, but it may not translate to some five star tuxedo staff. (UPDATE: There is a NEW young waiter that SUCKS, but if you ignore him and even better yet, laugh at how bad he is, it won't be as bad.  UPDATE UPDATE: NEW WAITER AGAIN AND HE RULES!!!)

Now lets get to the food: everything is really spicy and each dish has its own set of spices.  You can go to the naan'n'curry's and shalimars and every dish tastes like each other.  NOT here.  Naan is buttery and fluffy, I've had the vegetable biriyani and it is SO yummy - full of interesting veggies.  Goat curry isn't on the menu but he always has it on hand.  Tandoor fish - best in the city.  Sheekh kebab - the lamb is mixed with these wonderful herbs and it comes sizzling to your table.  Saag, choley is great.  Dal Makhani is EXTRA spicy.  

The best part, if that is possible: the price.  We always leave HUGE tips because no one wants any money back.  

Perfect place for large parties (except you may not be able to get a table, this place gets PACKED), so try to go at an off time.

excerpts: Try the butter chicken with sesame naan, or the goat curry with Afghan naan.
Everything is delicious, and perfectly spicy.
The cook is the nicest man on the planet--if I were president he would be the White House Chef.
goat curry.author: Denny S.
goat curry.review: The most fantastic food west of Pakistan! Try the butter chicken with sesame naan, or the goat curry with Afghan naan. Everything is delicious, and perfectly spicy. The cook is the nicest man on the planet--if I were president he would be the White House Chef.

excerpts: I'm a big fan of the Chicken Tikka Masala, Saag Paneer, Lamb Bindi, and more recently the Aloo Keema (ground lamb & potatoes).
lamb bindi.author: Kevin L.
lamb bindi.review:
Ok - yes the interior isn't the tidiest, and yes, staff don't take your order at your table. BUT the food here is delicious! 

Spicy, rich, flavorful curries - I'm a big fan of the Chicken Tikka Masala, Saag Paneer, Lamb Bindi, and more recently the Aloo Keema (ground lamb & potatoes).

Their naan is best served in the restaurant - I often take it home and it gets a little soggy - and a world without their Aloo Naan (stuffed with peas & potatoes) wouldn't be a world I'd like to live in. Also, their lamb samosas, tandoori chicken, and biryanis are all must-tries.

BUT hey, let's not knock the interior of the restaurant too much: 1) they have a huge TV to watch Giants games 2) their chai is free (actually it's also free for to-go orders) 3) did I mention the TV?

Sitting on their cafeteria-like tables, watching the chai come off a fire-blackened vat and into the serving pumps, and feeling the fire blast over the stovetop curries makes me love coming to this local eatery.

excerpts: Ordered daal, goat curry, garlic naan, plain naan, rice and raita.
Everything was tasteless!
The goat curry was super oily and the lentils weren't cooked all the way.
Both naans were super chewy and had no flavor.
And a small box of rice was $3!!!
Waste of money and a chew.
plain naan.author: J S.
plain naan.review: Ordered daal, goat curry, garlic naan, plain naan, rice and raita. Everything was tasteless! The goat curry was super oily and the lentils weren't cooked all the way. Both naans were super chewy and had no flavor. And a small box of rice was $3!!! Waste of money and a chew.

excerpts: I had the butter chicken and plain naan.
Omg!
I've had a lot of butter chicken in my days and this may have been the best.
It's a bit spicy - my lips are still burning.
The bread was amazing.
I had good customer service - not sure what others have experienced.
I'll definitely be back.
plain naan.author: Jeff P.
plain naan.review: I had the butter chicken and plain naan. Omg!  I've had a lot of butter chicken in my days and this may have been the best. It's a bit spicy - my lips are still burning. The bread was amazing. I had good customer service - not sure what others have experienced. I'll definitely be back.

excerpts: Came here the other day and got the baingan bharta, chicken tikka masala, garlic naan, and plain naan.
Plain naan was better than the garlic naan.
Plain naan was better than the garlic naan.
The garlic naan was overly crispy and not as tasty as it looks.
I like naan to be soft and squishy, like eating a chewy cloud, and this was not it.
The plain naan is more naan-ish than the garlic one, for less than half the price ($1 v. $2.50).
plain naan.author: Tiffany Y.
plain naan.review:
Came here the other day and got the baingan bharta, chicken tikka masala, garlic naan, and plain naan. 

The baingan bharta (eggplant + peas) was spicy and had a great flavor to it, but did not find much eggplant in it at all? Even so, was quite tasty. 

Chicken tikka masala was flavorful and a little sweet, but the chicken chunks were very dry. I'm pretty picky about my chicken and like for it to be tender and moist, so would not get this again. 

Plain naan was better than the garlic naan. The garlic naan was overly crispy and not as tasty as it looks. I like naan to be soft and squishy, like eating a chewy cloud, and this was not it. The plain naan is more naan-ish than the garlic one, for less than half the price ($1 v. $2.50). 

Overall, solid place with reasonable price-to-portion ratio. Will be back to try more!

excerpts: Got takeout from this place the other day, ordered the butter chicken and plain naan.
There was nothing objectionable about the food but, and maybe this is because I was just in India, it was nothing to write home about.
The naan was denser than I would have expected/liked, and the butter chicken was more or less indistinguishable from a tikka masala.
plain naan.author: Max A.
plain naan.review:
Got takeout from this place the other day, ordered the butter chicken and plain naan. There was nothing objectionable about the food but, and maybe this is because I was just in India, it was nothing to write home about. The naan was denser than I would have expected/liked, and the butter chicken was more or less indistinguishable from a tikka masala. The sauce could also have done with being thicker.

Perfectly reasonable for the price, but if this is the best Punjabi food in SF then that's pretty disappointing.

excerpts: We also had the plain naan and a garlic naan.
Garlic naan was my fave out of these two.
Tons of spice and really tasty.
plain naan.author: Heidi L.
plain naan.review:
Another great hole-in-the-wall find! 

First they gave us papadams on the house and I heart papadams!!

Fish Tikka Masala had a really good amount of fish pieces in it with just the perfect amount of spice. But you can order anything to your spice liking.

Saag Paneer, spinach cooked with cheese and herbs was really rustic tasting because they make the cheese themselves and not at all oily like many of the other Indian/Pakistani restaurants out there.

We also had the plain naan and a garlic naan. Garlic naan was my fave out of these two. Tons of spice and really tasty. They gave us the plain one first and about 10 mins later, the garlic one which was great because who doesn't like "just out of the oven " naan?!

Everything was so good, we ate every last drop and were so full.Can't wait to come back and try their other dishes! One thing, put the fancy clothes away because you'll go home smelling like what you ordered!

excerpts: -Barlic and Plain Naan
plain naan.author: Jennifer H.
plain naan.review:
All I can say is don't bring your mama, cause this place is smack your mama good!!!!!  

BYOB!  We let the Sapporo flow all night.  Corner store about a block down sells libations.  My desire to drink beer out of a little brown bag became reality!

Crowded last night.  Happily waited for about 20 minutes because past experience has proven:

LINE = YUMMO FOOD

Okay, now to the GOOOOOOOD STUFF:

-Fish Tandoori
Comes out piping hot on this sizzling plate with the aroma filling the air.  The spices on the fish just merry so well together.  

-Vegetable Samosa
Best I've had.  Potatoes inside weren't mushed together, but separate small pieces with onion and spices, hot and jingling around in a perfectly fried pastry.  Woooo baby.

-Lamb Vindaloo
Leans cubes of lamb.  Sort of a faint lemony taste and not as spicy as I've normally had.  Very good.

-Chicken Tikka Masala
The added nuts, not sure if it's almonds or pistachio, gave it a more earthy taste.  Very good also.

-Barlic and Plain Naan
Nice balance between crisp, hot and chewy

-Basmati Rice
Soooooo fragrant.  The dish passed by my nose as he set it down and the smell was heavenly.  Tasted delish too!

-Mango Lassi
Served room temperature.  Great flavor.

Two guys who work the tables are super sweet and very helpful.  All in all, a really great meal, worth the visit and worth the wait.  If you like Indian, this is a must must try.

excerpts: Same thing with the naan - don't try to sneak in an order of two plain naan's or he'll get on your ass.
plain naan.author: Tsubasa O.
plain naan.review:
Gotta love the curries here. Tikka masala, vindaloo, keema and butter chicken are all fine choices...but I recently discovered the nihari (not on the menu) which is my new favorite. Nihari is a traditional Pakistani dish that's apparently served commonly for breakfast. I don't have prior nihari dishes to compare it to, but I thought it was damn good. It's a darker curry, a lot oilier, served with beef, (reminds you of Japanese curry) and packs a lot more punch with the spices. Ask your server if they've still got any nihari in the back because it ain't always gonna be around.

I'm not a huge fan of the tandoori fish (as I'm not a huge fan of tandoori to begin with), but it's still good. Naan's are solid here too, get them over the rice. 

I don't know where the old guy went (haven't seen him around the past couple times) but that guy's a character. If you try to get similar dishes - say CTM & Butter Chicken - he'll give you grief for getting the same thing and try to cajole you into ordering different tastes. Same thing with the naan - don't try to sneak in an order of two plain naan's or he'll get on your ass. 

When it's time to get the curry fix on in San Francisco, there's only one option - Lahore Karahi.

excerpts: I ordered Chicken Tikka Marsala, my Indian restaurant litmus test, and a chick pea dish, Lahori Chikkar Choley, along with rice and plain naan.
What a bargain ringing in at $20 including tip - very nice!
The Chicken Tikka Marsala wasn't the bright radioactive lava orange that I know and love - maybe that's actually a good thing!
The familiar spices and flavor came through on my first bite - but it was much denser, creamier, sweeter and less spicy than Shalimar.
It was a more subtle experience.
The juicy chicken was cooked perfectly and it all paired nicely with the lightly oiled brownish rice.
I enjoyed it, especially because it seemed less oily than Shalimar's.
The choley was another story.
It was super salty, cloying, dense and pretty much unpalatable.
I like chick peas in Indian dishes - but this one rubbed me the wrong way.
The naan also fell short of Shalimar.
Instead of offering a crisp exterior yielding to a delicately puffy and tender center, I gnawed on a crisp but dense hunk of flat bread.
And what was up with that yeasty sour flavor???
In fairness it served its purpose to cut the dish's sweet richness.
plain naan.author: Brady K.
plain naan.review:
Please accept my humble apology for the following novel in the guise of a review...

As a musician, I often fall into the trap of hearing only my favorite interpretation of a classic - such as Mozart's Requiem. Each crescendo or crack of the soprano's voice becomes the *only* way to hear the piece. My taste buds seem to have this dysfunction too because I kept comparing Lahore Karahi to Shalimar with each bite.

I was stoked to visit LK based on great feedback from yelpers with top notch cred. The delicious and filling food, super low price and my curiosity to find a new king of the hill over Shalimar beckoned my appetite.

I ordered Chicken Tikka Marsala, my Indian restaurant litmus test, and a chick pea dish, Lahori Chikkar Choley, along with rice and plain naan. What a bargain ringing in at $20 including tip - very nice! The Chicken Tikka Marsala wasn't the bright radioactive lava orange that I know and love - maybe that's actually a good thing! The familiar spices and flavor came through on my first bite - but it was much denser, creamier, sweeter and less spicy than Shalimar. It was a more subtle experience. The juicy chicken was cooked perfectly and it all paired nicely with the lightly oiled brownish rice. I enjoyed it, especially because it seemed less oily than Shalimar's. However I preferred the fiery kick and bolder flavors of Shalimar's orangey lava.  

The choley was another story. It was super salty, cloying, dense and pretty much unpalatable. I like chick peas in Indian dishes - but this one rubbed me the wrong way. The naan also fell short of Shalimar. Instead of offering a crisp exterior yielding to a delicately puffy and tender center, I gnawed on a crisp but dense hunk of flat bread. And what was up with that yeasty sour flavor??? In fairness it served its purpose to cut the dish's sweet richness. I shed a little tear cause I loves my naan.

I'll admit I avoid dining in the tenderloin. Walking from Van Ness to LK provides stereotypical tenderloin thrills and chills that I prefer avoiding. Unless we took a cab, I wouldn't be surprised if my girlfriend withheld sex because I made her walk in this crappy neighborhood.

I actually like the idea of hole in the wall restaurants, just so long as the cooking area is clean - or it's kept well hid. Nope, the kitchen's dirty and visible at LK. The show "Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares" should film on location at LK. LK scores 80 on the SF Dept of Health inspection for exposed storage of food, unclean non-cooking surfaces and poor handwashing facilities. http://sfscores.com/#Yz0zNy43ODksLTEyMi40MSZ6PTE1Jmk9KDM3Ljc4NTU3MiwgLTEyMi40MTUwNjEpJmY9TGFob3JlJTIwS2FyYWhpJnMxPTAmczI9MTAwJm89cm5k

I did admire the Jackson Pollack-style art splattered behind the filthy stoves in shades of day old curry - oh wait! that is day old curry.  Dirty pans were everywhere and containers of ingredients were on the floor in front of the ovens. This sh** makes you go "Hmmmm." Aren't we all believers that a clean kitchen produces tastier, healthier food?

The owner of LK, "Guddhu" was really friendly. I liked the feel of the place and how Bollywood movies were playing in the background. You can tell this restaurant is part of the fabric of our fair city. For example, a customer came back and said something in an Pakistani dialect - perhaps she forgot to tip - and Guddhu smiled and waved a "no problem" and she thanked him.

It's not like Shalimar has a much better health score (86 and I've seen cockroaches there), but I'm still locked into hearing my Indian dishes conducted by Maestro Shalimar.

excerpts: so we ordered some plain Naan too but upon its arrival she exclaimed
plain naan.author: Sean L.
plain naan.review:
I'm amused by the wide range of reviews for Lahore Karahi because my feelings after dining here were all over the map as well.  First impressions were quite dismal.  For starters, It was a struggle convincing my date to walk through the questionable neighborhood but once we entered what appeared to be a converted soup kitchen, I thought she was going to have a panic attack.

The menu was appealing however and the aromas from the open kitchen were quite tantalizing.  Once the food arrived (which was surprisingly fast considering other's experiences),  I was drawn to the meal and our surroundings disappeared.   We had modest appetites and regrettably only ordered two main dishes.  The Chicken Korma was mild and inviting but the Lamb Biryani stole the show.  With a requested "medium" spiciness, the flavors were heightened and not overwhelming.  The rice was light and the lamb was not too.... lamby?.  The garlic Naan was outstanding but the lightly roasted garlic with butter was a little much for my companion.  She has very light tastes so we ordered some plain Naan too but upon its arrival she exclaimed "oh, it's so greasy".

I think our host was already a bit irked with us at this point.  My date's questions about certain dishes while ordering were met with some confusion and impatience.  There was a dual language barrier going on so I let it go at the time.  But, the greasy Naan comment seemed to truly offend him.  He grabbed a paper napkin and very aggressively dabbed away the grease right in front of her face.  To say the least, Lahore Karahi is not a place for service and ambiance but that's not the reason to go.  I would be impressed with the food at any price but this was a downright bargain.

excerpts: (I'm generally not a fan, but I would get these again); saag ghost; the butter chicken; plain naan and the Afghani naan.
We were served a complimentary ice cream (All of this for $22.00)
If I was standing the saag would have brought me to my knees.
It will restore your faith.
Butter chicken was also divine.
plain naan.author: She-Ra ..
plain naan.review:
Thank you to everyone for recommending this place.  (Although my waistline will no doubt wish it remained undiscovered.)  Yes, there is a wait and it is disorganized.  But the food! And the service! The chef is an amazingly friendly person and he does wonderful things in his kitchen.  We had the samosas (I'm generally not a fan, but I would get these again); saag ghost; the butter chicken; plain naan and the Afghani naan.  We were served a complimentary ice cream (All of this for $22.00) If I was standing the saag would have brought me to my knees. It will restore your faith.  Butter chicken was also divine.  The Afghani naan was similar to a cross between panetoni and nann, but it was killer this morning toasted with my coffee.  

The only downside - apart from having to wait - were the feelings of guilt that I was taking advantage of Guddu due to his insanely low pricing for the quality of his food.

excerpts: , regular naan here comes with butter, be sure to ask for no butter if you are expecting plain naan).
plain naan.author: Megan H.
plain naan.review:
My girlfriend and I were visiting San Francisco and Napa last week on vacation and had a major craving for something spicy.  Lahore Karahi was a short walk from our Union Square area hotel so we set out on Thursday night.  The food was awesome!  It was better than almost all Indian food I've had living in NYC for 10 years.  We had aloo gobi (amazing with almost caramalized onions), chicken tikka masala (nicely spiced, more earthy and less spicy than all other tikka masalas I've had), and naan (warning, regular naan here comes with butter, be sure to ask for no butter if you are expecting plain naan).  

This place filled up on a Thursday night, so come early or expect to wait. My only complaint was it was really smoky from the grill and we left smelling of smoke all night.  I wish this placed existed in NYC and I'd be there once a week.

excerpts: So we choose a little of everything: the papadam ($1), wafer-thin flatbreads with a texture reminiscient of potato chips, paneer pakora ($3.50), deep-fried, French fry-shaped wedges of cheese, seekh kebab ($4), a very spicy lamb sausage on skewers, chicken tikka masala ($7), mildly spicy pieces of chicken in a creamy sauce, lamb vindaloo ($7), a very spicy stewy mixture of lamb and potatoes, plain naan ($1), garlic naan ($2), a side of rice ($1.25), and gulab jamun ($3.50) for dessert.
plain naan.author: Meghan P.
plain naan.review:
So it's Friday night after work, and we're starving. Indian food sounds fabulous. Something spicy. And cheap. And Yelp-approved. Lahore Karahi it is.

As soon as the menu hits my hands, my eyes are frantically scanning the page looking for anything and everything that sounds delicious. Dammit. It all does. So we choose a little of everything: the papadam ($1), wafer-thin flatbreads with a texture reminiscient of potato chips, paneer pakora ($3.50), deep-fried, French fry-shaped wedges of cheese, seekh kebab ($4), a very spicy lamb sausage on skewers, chicken tikka masala ($7), mildly spicy pieces of chicken in a creamy sauce, lamb vindaloo ($7), a very spicy stewy mixture of lamb and potatoes, plain naan ($1), garlic naan ($2), a side of rice ($1.25), and gulab jamun ($3.50) for dessert. 

The sole server, who had a room's full of hungry, needy patrons to attend to and therefore whose sympathy I had from the get-go, was quirky and odd but kind of fun. The food came out all out of order and sporadically but you know what? I didn't care. It was all just so good and satisfying, and it was a ton of food, but we cleaned each plate. Oh and P.S., mango lassi is my new favorite drink. 

My favorite moment of the evening came when our server dropped the check. I'm like, okay, I know this is cheap eats and all, but that was a crapload of food we just ordered, and S. has slipped into some comatose, food-drunken stupor that he will not have recovered from until the next afternoon. But somehow, after plate upon plate of deliciously satisfying food, the grand total of the evening was.... $38.78. What?!?!?! I began to loathe and regret each night we had spent $100+ on an appetizer, two entrees and a round of drinks at other, sub-par establishments. The value of this place just blew my mind.

So go here, it's delicious, amazingly priced, and my new go-to place for Indian food in the city.

excerpts: We ordered the food, an eggplant dish, chicken tikka and plain naan.
The food was delicious and so affordable!
The only thing I was disappointed with was that they ran out of samosas but the waiter who was incredible nice recommended another appetizer and it was just as tasty as the entrees.
Oh and they don't serve alcohol however you can run to the liquor store and bring it in (they dont charge for any corking or alcohol fees).
plain naan.author: Eva C.
plain naan.review: So on the walk over from my boyfriends place to LaHore, I was slightly uneasy..I thought to myself Indian food in the TL? No thanks. As we approached the restaurant I felt even more uneasy, it kinda resembled a shack in the TL. Anyways once we entered I initially noticed how packed this place was, nothing special about the inside, no decorations everything is very simple, not even nice dishes. We ordered the food, an eggplant dish, chicken tikka and plain naan. The food was delicious and so affordable! The only thing I was disappointed with was that they ran out of samosas but the waiter who was incredible nice recommended another appetizer and it was just as tasty as the entrees. Oh and they don't serve alcohol however you can run to the liquor store and bring it in (they dont charge for any corking or alcohol fees).

excerpts: Oh, and one plain naan, no butter.
plain naan.author: John G.
plain naan.review:
Lahore Karahi was incredible. It is the reviews on Yelp which led me to try this place.

I have been an avid Shalimar-er for the past 4 years. I literally go three nights per week. A few weeks ago, I decided to engage in some Indian/Pakistani food adultery and tried Chutney. Nothing at Chutney even came close to Shalimar. The gravy just was not there. Ahh--but that is for a different review!

Having ventured away from Shalimar once, I figured cheating on it twice was no biggy. I pass Lahore Karahi on my drive down O'Farrell every time I go to Shalimar. I have been curious about it for some time.

Parking was easier than at Shalimar even though the two are separated by just a block or two.

Walked into a restaurant with about 6 tables at about 7pm. There were only two couples in the restaurant. The server and the chef seem to be on equal levels within the Lahore Karahi hierarchy -- both look to be men in their 50s, both are jovial and extremely kind. It was the chef from whom I ordered --

I say:

"One cholay"
"One Saag Paneer"
"Do you have Nihari?" (I had read good things about the Nihari here on Yelp but could not find it on the menu). The chef smiles back and says
"Yes, for you we have Nihari"
"Great! One Chicken Tikka Masala"
"One Chicken Boti"
Chef interjects: "My chicken boti is excellent, but try the fish tandoori -- it is really special". Methinks let's give it a whirl. The chef adds that the fish (sea bass) is fresh.
"Oh, and one plain naan, no butter."

After about 15 minutes, the tandoori fish has arrived. Oh man, was it good. I don't usually enjoy dishes like this made with seafood, but I am in LOVE with this dish. It comes on a hot skillet, simmering, covered in a zestily-dressed lettuce. At first I was avoiding the lettuce as though it were a garnish. After a few bites I started mixing the lettuce with the fish -- now THAT is the way to have it! This was one of the most incredible dishes I have ever had. I think the chicken boti at Shalimar is divine -- literally made by gods. This is equally good, but completely different -- different spices and, of course, fish instead of chicken.

Next come the other dishes, minus the cholay which never came-- the chef must not have heard me order it -- which is just fine since I ordered way too much food.

The Nihari was incredible. Much tangier than at Shalimar and Chutney and, instead of being a block of beef in a stew-broth (as the dish is prepared at Shalimar and Chutney), the entire dish is shredded (and not-so-shredded) beef in a wonderful gravy. Very little sauce because the beef IS the sauce. It was incredible, though admittedly heavy.

The saag paneer (other restaurants call it palak paneer) was equally good. It was cream-based, but not too creamy. The flavor was out-of-this-world, much more complex than what one finds at Shalimar. As one reviewer wrote below, all the dishes at Lahore Karahi are something of an art -- not simple, but very complex and balanced. The paneer (cheese) in this dish was definitely homemade and quite different from any other paneer I have tasted -- it had almost a crisp exterior but was butter soft, almost melted inside. Imagine well-roasted marshmallows. That was the texture.

The bangan bharta was also incredible. I usually find bangan bharta to be one of the so-so dishes at Indian/Pakistani restaurants -- always good, but never something I am dying to eat. This was different. This was good enough that one might just come to Lahore Karahi for this single dish.

The chicken tikka masala was the disappointment of the bunch. It was great, certainly better than at Chutney and Naan'n'Curry (like it is at these restaurants, the CTM was cream-based at Lahore Karahi), but it was not orgasmic-kiss-the-floor-take-a-bath-in-it-good like at Shalimar. It was much more normal and non-special. Still excellent, though.

The naan came very heavily buttered -- tasted great, but clearly some of my order instructions were lost in the kitchen!

The chai was also quite good (and free). It was spiced so as to have a  much more interesting and flower-like flavor than the chai of Shalimar, N'n'C or Chutney.

After paying, on my way out, the chef and server INSISTED that I try their rice pudding, which was incredible. They dished it out for me on the house and watched me eat it with glee. It was like white grout (for laying bricks). Incredible. What gracious hosts!

Overall this place is excellent, incredible, and I would return to have any one of the dishes I ordered (except maybe the chicken tikka masala) -- I would also return just to see the gracious smile of the chef and the server. So kind.

Lahore Karahi is an excellent place with which to supplement Shalimar, and will surely become part of my weekly restaurant regimen. It's not better than Shalimar but certainly not worse. Just different. Each dish is so good and so different from Shalimar that my mood will determine which place I visit!

excerpts:
1 Plain Naan
1 Aluu Paratha (Potato)
1 Onion Kulcha (Onion Bread) - It's cooked but the onions inside are still raw. 
It was ok.
1 Began Bharta 
(eggplant) - creamy 
1 Saag Paneer (Spinach and Cheese)
1 Dal (lentils) - 
well done 
and I don't personally like Dal
2 Orders of Samosas (total of 4) - spicy but freshly made and fried
Yogurt - totally necessary for anyone who has mild tastebuds.
Rice Pudding (Kheer) for dessert - not as liquid as other places but still tasty.
plain naan.author: Happy D.
plain naan.review:
Wow!

As an Indian-American, this is the only place I've found that does both Veg and Non-Veg food equally awesome!

Cost: $36.00 for 6 ppl plus tip

What we ordered:
Chicken Biryani - a little spicy for people with mild tastebuds
1 Plain Naan
1 Aluu Paratha (Potato)
1 Onion Kulcha (Onion Bread) - It's cooked but the onions inside are still raw. It was ok.
1 Began Bharta (eggplant) - creamy 
1 Saag Paneer (Spinach and Cheese)
1 Dal (lentils) - well done and I don't personally like Dal
2 Orders of Samosas (total of 4) - spicy but freshly made and fried
**Yogurt - totally necessary for anyone who has mild tastebuds.
Rice Pudding (Kheer) for dessert - not as liquid as other places but still tasty.
Unlimited Free Chai (Indian Tea) while you're sitting there.

No reservations so you might have to wait.  On a Sat night at 8pm, we had to wait for 20 minutes for a big table.

excerpts: Garlic naan - delicious!

With garlic flavoring (my favorite of the two) 
*side tip you can get your brown and green chutney in the fridge section to dip your naan in.
Saag paneer - wonderful!
With large chunks of paneer in it.
It was mildly spicy and delicious over rice.
Lamb masala -
the sauce was creamy and really good with the naan and rice!!
I was impressed by how clean the tables we're and how friendly the staff was.
I will be back to try the other menu items in the future!!
garlic naan.author: Sara S.
garlic naan.review:
I wanted a low key feel comfortable in your sweater and leggings dinner date with my husband and this place was perfect!! I ordered...
Onion naan - it was delicious with chunks of onion and cilantro pieces.
Garlic naan - delicious! With garlic flavoring (my favorite of the two) 
*side tip you can get your brown and green chutney in the fridge section to dip your naan in.
Saag paneer - wonderful! With large chunks of paneer in it. It was mildly spicy and delicious over rice.
Lamb masala - the sauce was creamy and really good with the naan and rice!!
I was impressed by how clean the tables we're and how friendly the staff was. I will be back to try the other menu items in the future!! :)

excerpts: The garlic naan went perfectly with the flavorful curry in the chicken korma.
garlic naan.author: Iris H.
garlic naan.review:
I asked for a recommendation since I wanted to get something that's not tikka masala - the owner/cashier recommended Chicken Korma, I'm so impressed! The curry was not too spicy, but flavorful enough. The garlic naan went perfectly with the flavorful curry in the chicken korma. The chicken was tender and delicious, you can taste the freshness as you bite into it.

Pretty small place, but the tables and dishes are very clean. Very friendly service. And don't forget grab some fennel seeds to chew before you leave!

excerpts: Once we were done with our work in the neighborhood, we walked back to the establishment and ordered two Garlic Naan's and a plate of Chicken Karahi (recommended by the owner) between two people.
It is important to note that I set a high bar for an Indian/Pakistani place serving Chicken Karahi and in my heart, I really wanted this place to go above and beyond.
If I'm being completely honest about it, the Chicken Karahi looked bang average when it arrived at our table and I was a little unsure of how it was going to taste.
garlic naan.author: Gaurav K.
garlic naan.review:
I happened to walk past Lahore Karahi when I walking on O'Farell street and was immediately drawn by the aroma of the place. I quickly pulled out my phone to check it out on Yelp and wasn't surprised when I noticed that it was pretty highly rated. Yes, the aroma was good enough! 

Once we were done with our work in the neighborhood, we walked back to the establishment and ordered two Garlic Naan's and a plate of Chicken Karahi (recommended by the owner) between two people. The food was promptly brought to our table by one of the servers as we were just about settling down after grabbing a can of soda and a bottle of water. 

It is important to note that I set a high bar for an Indian/Pakistani place serving Chicken Karahi and in my heart, I really wanted this place to go above and beyond. The people behind the counter were sweet and the smell of the food was on point. 

If I'm being completely honest about it, the Chicken Karahi looked bang average when it arrived at our table and I was a little unsure of how it was going to taste. That along with the fact that it was missing the bell peppers we were promised on the menu, made me feel a little let down. 

All of my doubts vanished once I tasted the food and it was only after I had gobbled up my meal that I looked up and said another word. While Lahore Karahi din't turn out to be exceptional, it did just about meet the bar for a great place that serves authentic Pakistani food.

Would recommend it to people looking for good food in the city.

excerpts: My go-to order is shahi paneer tikka masala, saag paneer , onion naan and garlic naan.
Their onion naan is to die for.
The staff here are super friendly and the order is quite quick.
So we are in and out of the restaurant
In less than an hour.
It's not a fancy restaurant and the prices are very decent.
Definitely try this place when in San Francisco.
garlic naan.author: Sailaja B.
garlic naan.review:
I wonder what I have been doing all this while without reviewing Lahore Karahi. We have been regulars here for over an year. I love their food and Mango Lassi. They have complimentary chai which is pretty good. My go-to order is shahi paneer tikka masala, saag paneer , onion naan and garlic naan. Their onion naan is to die for. The staff here are super friendly and the order is quite quick. So we are in and out of the restaurant 
In less than an hour. It's not a fancy restaurant and the prices are very decent. Definitely try this place when in San Francisco.

excerpts: Garlic naan was sooo good.
Also ordered samosas, chicken sag, and chicken tikka masala.
Samosas were very crisp, spicy, a lot of flavor.
2 large piece for appetizer portion.
Chicken tikka masala was yummy- this sauce was creamy and flavorful.
Chicken sag was also very good, finished the entire bowl.
Restaurant space is very casual, not super clean or decorated or anything.
Service was okay, seemed like more of a self serve place/take out place.
not the best are, but we saw quite a few people get take out while we were eating.
Small dining space.
Fast service though and very reasonable prices!!
garlic naan.author: Amanda C.
garlic naan.review: Delicious  food. Garlic naan was sooo good. Also ordered samosas, chicken sag, and chicken tikka masala. Samosas were very crisp, spicy, a lot of flavor. 2 large piece for appetizer portion. Chicken tikka masala was yummy- this sauce was creamy and flavorful. Chicken sag was also very good, finished the entire bowl. Restaurant space is very casual, not super clean or decorated or anything. Service was okay, seemed like more of a self serve place/take out place. not the best are, but we saw quite a few people get take out while we were eating. Small dining space. Fast service though and very reasonable prices!!

excerpts: I usually get the Chicken Tikka Masala & Garlic Naan.
Today I got the Chicken Biryani w/ a side of Tikka masala sauce.
Im pretty sure anything you order here will be delicious.
I have also tried the Tandoori Chicken which was good too
but kinda dry might have been over cooked.
garlic naan.author: Ryan M.
garlic naan.review: This is the spot to go!!! The food is hella good especially when I have a craving for Indian food. I usually get the Chicken Tikka Masala & Garlic Naan. Today I got the Chicken Biryani w/ a side of Tikka masala sauce. Im pretty sure anything you order here will be delicious. I have also tried the Tandoori Chicken which was good too but kinda dry might have been over cooked.

excerpts: Got takeout here, ordered garlic naan, rice, chicken tikka masala and saag paneer.
Garlic naan was great, but everything else was too watery.
The paneer was cut into huge blocks, so the cheese wasn't particularly flavorful and the chicken tasted dry.
Delivery experience was fine
garlic naan.author: Melissa T.
garlic naan.review: Got takeout here, ordered garlic naan, rice, chicken tikka masala and saag paneer. Garlic naan was great, but everything else was too watery. The paneer was cut into huge blocks, so the cheese wasn't particularly flavorful and the chicken tasted dry. Delivery experience was fine

excerpts: Ordered Aloo Ghobi and Garlic Naan for a quick take out dinner.
The Aloo Ghobi was lacking all flavor and was dry-
did they forget to put the spices in?
I've never had Indian Food that I didn't finish, until now!
Maybe I chose the wrong dish?
Or maybe they were having a off night?
Major bummed out!
Wish I would have saved my $14.
garlic naan.author: Pamela R.
garlic naan.review: I really hate to be that person... but here I am.  Ordered Aloo Ghobi and Garlic Naan for a quick take out dinner.  The Aloo Ghobi was lacking all flavor and was dry- did they forget to put the spices in?  I've never had Indian Food that I didn't finish, until now!  Maybe I chose the wrong dish? Or maybe they were having a off night?  Major bummed out! Wish I would have saved my $14.

excerpts: We stuck to the fundamentals and ordered Garlic Naan and the Beef Seekh Kebab.
The kebab was so tender and juicy!
It was grilled well and burst with subtle flavor.
It was not spicy, but you can really taste the garam masala and cumin which pairs well with some lemon squeezed on top.
The Garlic Naan had the right amount of thickness.
garlic naan.author: Sabina S.
garlic naan.review:
Lahore Karahi is an authentic Pakistani hole-in-the-wall nestled in The Tenderloin. 

We weren't super hungry and just felt like nibbling, which always makes for the perfect time to order kebabs!

First off, Lahore Karahi makes fresh masala chai which they keep in a thermal carafe for customers to take on their own, along with sugar on the side so that you can make your perfect cup of chai. I absolutely love it when Indian and Pakistani restaurants do this because chai truly completes the meal!

We stuck to the fundamentals and ordered Garlic Naan and the Beef Seekh Kebab. The kebab was so tender and juicy! It was grilled well and burst with subtle flavor. It was not spicy, but you can really taste the garam masala and cumin which pairs well with some lemon squeezed on top. The Garlic Naan had the right amount of thickness. All too often naan is made to be too doughy, but these guys did it well and were generous with the roasted garlic on top. 

Pro tip: Take the naan to soak up and eat the grilled onions that come with the sizzling platter that the kebabs come on. Truly divine flavors!

Would recommend this place for some authentic Pakistani food in a casual setting!

excerpts:
I noted that were different from other Indian places I've been to:

-the garlic naan was very tough to rip, not fluffy, more fried garlic than fresh garlic, and somewhat bland (tasted mostly like pita)
garlic naan.author: Lydia Z.
garlic naan.review:
Not a bad place but I wasn't impressed. I might be more accustomed to more savory Indian meals but I have no gauge of how authentic anything is so I sort of just compare places to each other.

Things I noted that were different from other Indian places I've been to:

-the garlic naan was very tough to rip, not fluffy, more fried garlic than fresh garlic, and somewhat bland (tasted mostly like pita)
-the saag paneer was very watery and not heavily spiced, which made it seem pretty clean
-the tiki masala wasn't very creamy and the meat was a little dry
-the mango lassi was very mango-y and yogurt-y--almost as if they used real mangos 
-the lamb samosa had a very thin and somewhat-tough skin so i wasn't dropping crumbs with every bite (thank goodness), and the filling was very well-spiced albeit a little dry. 

Also when you come in, you order up front, seat yourself (they have water/utensils you fetch for yourself), and then pay when you're done. When I went at  7pm the service was really slow (likely due to a lack of workers) and the tea was all gone. 

Nothing here was super unique in my opinion but perhaps I needed to try more items on the menu. A-OK place

excerpts: + Garlic Naan ($3)
garlic naan.author: Justin L.
garlic naan.review:
This place was a bit pricey for what it was.  I ordered a chicken curry ($10) + Garlic Naan ($3) + Rice ($2)- totaling around $17 bucks after tax.  

$17 bucks for a meal for 1 person was more than I meant to spend.  

The portion of curry was not that large.  The naan was fairly good.  The rice I wish came with the curry but it didn't.  Perhaps it's a different portion size when you take out vs eat to stay.  The food was not bad, I will give it another try to see if I'll have a better experience.

excerpts: Ordered recently for the first time (Lamb Korma; Butter Chicken; Aloo Ghobi; Garlic Naan; Veggie Samosas; Rice).
Loved everything, especially the Butter Chicken and Lamb Korma.
Upon first glance, the meat dishes seemed somewhat "greasy" (this was mostly noticed upon hardening after refrigerating).
However, be it fat or oil or whatever
(and I have no issue with enjoying fat), the ingredients mixed back together wonderfully, and this was one of the tastiest places at which I've had these dishes.
garlic naan.author: Tommy M.
garlic naan.review:
Ordered recently for the first time (Lamb Korma; Butter Chicken; Aloo Ghobi; Garlic Naan; Veggie Samosas; Rice). 

Loved everything, especially the Butter Chicken and Lamb Korma. Upon first glance, the meat dishes seemed somewhat "greasy" (this was mostly noticed upon hardening after refrigerating). However, be it fat or oil or whatever (and I have no issue with enjoying fat), the ingredients mixed back together wonderfully, and this was one of the tastiest places at which I've had these dishes. Flavors were bold, spicy, consistent and very well balanced. 

Can't wait to order again. Very impressed with the flavor.

excerpts: We were starving after driving up from South Bay, and got our favorite starter: samosas, two curries, and regular naan and garlic naan--our usual order.
garlic naan.author: Jodi H.
garlic naan.review:
Ate dinner before a show at the Great American Music Hall just a block away, and felt that it didn't live up to the Indian food standards in South Bay--primarily Sunnyvale (whaddup).

We walked in and service wasn't on point, but they did seem understaffed. There were three guys in the open kitchen working their butts off, and only one cashier. SHOUTOUT to the workers because they seemed so tired and overworked. I give them 5 stars, but the food itself wasn't anything to get excited about.

We were starving after driving up from South Bay, and got our favorite starter: samosas, two curries, and regular naan and garlic naan--our usual order. We got the aloo ghobi (potato) and eggplant curry, but both came out in such a small portion order and everything was a little too overcooked (especially the dry samosas). The place wasn't full house status, but there were other groups and tables filled besides our party of two. They do give you take-home boxes in case you can't finish your food, and it's a no frills kind of spot, just how I like my Indian food joints.

Plus: they have a clean restroom and lots of tap water in their fridge, Indian style! It's convenient and there are lots of street parking spots nearby. However, for our Friday night, it wasn't the most affordable (total came out to approx $40 for two), largest portions, or tastiest (rather, it was really dry) food.

excerpts: I forget the name of the one I specifically get, but it's a milder curry and it is amazing with some garlic naan.
garlic naan.author: Monica R.
garlic naan.review:
10/10 my favorite! 

I love this place. The food is amazingly good. Complementary chai that is off the hook. Screw those street vending chai latte folk catering to corporate America's needs. Come fucking here and let your taste buds go on a trip. 

I love the curries. I forget the name of the one I specifically get, but it's a milder curry and it is amazing with some garlic naan. 

The first time I ever had this food was by pure chance. I had the opportunity to have the Aloo Gobi (probably wrong spelling), but it's a cauliflower and potatoes dish that's a little spicy but very fuckin good. One of my favorites! 

Even the rice is flavorful. 

The employees/cooks are all very nice dudes. Thy are attentive and will get your food out ASAP. Overall this place is a jem. It's in the TL and it's worth giving it a shot. 

I recommend this restaurant to errrrrbody.  

(No pictures because I demolish the food too damn fast)

excerpts: Their naans are always on point too, and we especially love the garlic naan.
Tons of garlic flavor and cooked just perfectly.
garlic naan.author: William L.
garlic naan.review:
Favorite Indian restaurant that delivers to my home!  We randomly found this place on Amazon Prime Now when we were craving some Indian food, and after sifting through a dozen or so Indian restaurants we decided to go with Lahore Karahi.  Since then, we've tried other Indian restaurants that deliver to us, but none of them compare to Lahore Karahi!  

Every time we order from here, we get the chicken tikki masala and the butter chicken.  Both dishes are always on point, and their "extra spicy" is genuinely spicy!  At some other Indian restaurants, their extra spicy would be mild for me.  Their naans are always on point too, and we especially love the garlic naan.  Tons of garlic flavor and cooked just perfectly.  I would skip the cheese naan as there is barely any cheese in it.  Once in a while, we'll order the tandoori chicken, which always comes out moist and super flavorful.

excerpts: We had the lamb tikka masala with aloo naan and garlic naan.
We fed the two of us for less than $20.
The tikka masala was delicious!
A lot less creamy than others I've tried and a bit more of a kick.
Felt authentic.
My boyfriend said the lamb was tender.
I love how much flavor they pack into their naan!
When they say garlic naan, oh man do they mean it.
I can still taste the garlic on my breath right now lol!
You order and pay at the register, seat yourself, and then they'll bring you your meal.
They do take card
so that's a plus.
garlic naan.author: Lexi R.
garlic naan.review: Awesome no frills Indian spot right in the tenderloin. We had the lamb tikka masala with aloo naan and garlic naan. We fed the two of us for less than $20. The tikka masala was delicious! A lot less creamy than others I've tried and a bit more of a kick. Felt authentic. My boyfriend said the lamb was tender. I love how much flavor they pack into their naan! When they say garlic naan, oh man do they mean it. I can still taste the garlic on my breath right now lol! You order and pay at the register, seat yourself, and then they'll bring you your meal. They do take card so that's a plus.

excerpts: Really can't stress how exceptional the garlic naan was.
garlic naan.author: Joel L.
garlic naan.review:
Some of the best  vindaloo I've had in ages. Super flavorful with just the right amount of spice. Raita and naan were both fully on point as well. Really can't stress how exceptional the garlic naan was. Probably the best I've had. 

This place is a total hole in the wall so don't go expecting any kind of ambiance or service. Just amazing Indian food. Can't wait to go back.

excerpts:
- keema naan
- garlic naan
garlic naan.author: Nicole H.
garlic naan.review:
Food was above average but gave me tummy aches at night/the day after.

Yums:
- lamb tikka masala (lamb SO tender!! yummy!!!!)
- keema naan
- garlic naan

Meh:
- butter chicken (chicken dry/sauce not as tasty as tikka masala)

excerpts: Between the four of us we ordered the chicken curry, lamb korma, paneer tikka masala,  chicken boti tikka, and then two sides of rice, two cheese naans, one garlic naan, and one garlic and cheese naan (which isn't on the menu
but you can ask for).
When they come out, the bowls are pretty small but don't be fooled, the portions are ridiculously filling.
Two sides of rice was more than enough to leave our bellies extremely full.
The cheese naan is more flavorful than the garlic naan in my opinion, but both are so good it's really hard to pick your favorite (so get the combo of both!).
The cheese naan is more flavorful than the garlic naan in my opinion, but both are so good it's really hard to pick your favorite (so get the combo of both!).
The only thing I would say is that the chicken boti tikka was a little dry, but honestly that's just me trying to find something wrong with it.
I was so unbelievably happy with this food and wished I could make my stomach bigger to eat more of it.
Ughhh drooling just thinking about it now.
garlic naan.author: Sam L.
garlic naan.review:
So this place is in the TL but it honestly didn't seem that bad..other than the really awkward situation of one of the servers getting into an argument with another guy and straight up shoving him out the door. He hit the ground so hard his beanie came off, and that's how you know it's some real shit. BUT the food is legit so I think it's worth it to come back.

Between the four of us we ordered the chicken curry, lamb korma, paneer tikka masala,  chicken boti tikka, and then two sides of rice, two cheese naans, one garlic naan, and one garlic and cheese naan (which isn't on the menu but you can ask for). When they come out, the bowls are pretty small but don't be fooled, the portions are ridiculously filling. Two sides of rice was more than enough to leave our bellies extremely full. The cheese naan is more flavorful than the garlic naan in my opinion, but both are so good it's really hard to pick your favorite (so get the combo of both!). The only thing I would say is that the chicken boti tikka was a little dry, but honestly that's just me trying to find something wrong with it. I was so unbelievably happy with this food and wished I could make my stomach bigger to eat more of it. Ughhh drooling just thinking about it now.

excerpts: The garlic naan was also great, and a mango lassi finished off the meal (definitely bit through the spiciness of the chicken).
garlic naan.author: Ruby H.
garlic naan.review: Incredible food without any fluff to the place. I will definitely come back and would highly recommend. The tandoori chicken was spiced in a most delicious way. The lamb korma was super tasty the lamb cooked well. The garlic naan was also great, and a mango lassi finished off the meal (definitely bit through the spiciness of the chicken).

excerpts: drools... goes perfectly well with garlic naan.
garlic naan.author: Leilani Y.
garlic naan.review:
Mmmm..my favorite Indian/Pakistani  joint! :) Their curries are oh. so. goood...
Out of all the Indian/Pakistani places in the Tenderloin, this place is seriously the best!

I tried the Chicken Korma curry for the first time and omg.. it was soooo good. Buttery goodness. drools... goes perfectly well with garlic naan. 
The Goat Curry is also one of my favorites. Super authentic!
Mango lassi is also a must! Not tangy and very yogurt-y :)

excerpts: Garlic naan was
garlic naan.author: Bailey N.
garlic naan.review:
3.5 stars. 

If I knew about the poor safety score on Yelp, I would have stopped my boyfriend from ordering takeout from this place on EAT24.  Whatever we received though was pretty good.  Garlic naan was solid, lamb and goat curry rocked it.  The tandoori chicken was a little too dry for my taste and so was their roti.  Ok, must name drop again that this place pales in comparison to Shalimar, but it's actually the second best place I've had Indian/Pakistani food so far in the City.  Maybe I haven't tried enough Indian/Pakistani places yet then.  Close, but no cigar.

excerpts: We had garlic naan and regular naan, goat curry, sag paneer, tandoori chicken.
Everything tasty
REALLY good!
Chicken was tender, goat was well cook and the naan...
all
yeah
the naan, pretty bomb!
I highly recommend this place!
Only negative which is the reason why I removed one star: they have a safety health warning which popped up on their yelp page
so I really hope I won't be sick tomorrow
garlic naan.author: Rachida I.
garlic naan.review:
Great Indian food! We had garlic naan and regular naan, goat curry, sag paneer, tandoori chicken.
Everything tasty REALLY good! Chicken was tender, goat was well cook and the naan... all yeah the naan, pretty bomb!
I highly recommend this place! 
Only negative which is the reason why I removed one star: they have a safety health warning which popped up on their yelp page so I really hope I won't be sick tomorrow :/

excerpts: My boyfriend and I shared the garlic naan, lamb korma, and lamb curry.
All were great.
The dishes were a little on the oily side, but not overly so.
garlic naan.author: Amanda R.
garlic naan.review:
Interesting Indian food. Very good flavor. I find it interesting how generous they are with the cilantro in their Korma sauce.

My boyfriend and I shared the garlic naan, lamb korma, and lamb curry. All were great. The dishes were a little on the oily side, but not overly so. The food did not make us sick.

If In the area, I would definitely come back. 

Tip: here you order food at the counter, sit down, eat, then pay your bill. A bit different than most restaurants.

excerpts: Ordered daal, goat curry, garlic naan, plain naan, rice and raita.
Everything was tasteless!
The goat curry was super oily and the lentils weren't cooked all the way.
Both naans were super chewy and had no flavor.
And a small box of rice was $3!!!
Waste of money and a chew.
garlic naan.author: J S.
garlic naan.review: Ordered daal, goat curry, garlic naan, plain naan, rice and raita. Everything was tasteless! The goat curry was super oily and the lentils weren't cooked all the way. Both naans were super chewy and had no flavor. And a small box of rice was $3!!! Waste of money and a chew.

excerpts: The garlic naan was super thick...
Overall, the food tasted just okay.
garlic naan.author: Tejashree M.
garlic naan.review: I ordered food from here online. The chicken tikka masala gravy was watery and not spicy at all in spite of selecting spice level. The chicken biryani was decent; it could have more flavor though...The garlic naan was super thick...Overall, the food tasted just okay.

excerpts: I ordered take out chicken vindaloo, some garlic naan, and a side of rice since the main dish didn't actually come with it.
garlic naan.author: Michael Z.
garlic naan.review:
I tried this place on a whim since the only other Indian places I like in the neighborhood are either a bit of a walk or not that great. Definitely glad I tried this place. 

I ordered take out chicken vindaloo, some garlic naan, and a side of rice since the main dish didn't actually come with it. It was a huge amount of delicious food, and I will definitely be ordering again, although probably without as many carbs!

Also just has a really great, chill location. Really convenient, and even while sitting there for a minute before grabbing my takeout, I appreciated how understated the vibe was. Thinking next time I might do sit down to see how chill it is that way. 

Regardless, if you're looking for a reasonably priced, delicious Indian restaurant in the Tenderloin, look no further.

excerpts: I got the veggie curry with potatoes & cauliflower & garlic naan.
garlic naan.author: Phuong H.
garlic naan.review:
Came in on a boiling, humid day & there was absolutely no ventilation whatsoever. My first impression when I stepped in was that this place was not sanitary at all. I was 100% right because I saw bugs, more specifically coach roaches, crawling on the walls when I was waiting for my food, which btw was a 30-45 minute wait. My friends & I decided to give this place the benefit of the doubt & tried to focus on the food.

FOOD: The food here is great. The downside is obviously the cleanliness which made me not enjoy the food all that much. I got the veggie curry with potatoes & cauliflower & garlic naan. The naan hit the spot! 

CUSTOMER SERVICE: There was nothing special about the customer service. They did not greet us when we walked through the door and the water is self served, as in everyone in the little restaurant shares one bucket of water. Strange. 
 
Overall, come here if you want some authentic Indian food, but stay away if you're looking for a nice setting, good customer service, and a sanitary area.

excerpts:
*Garlic naan: naan stuffed with garlic ($2.75)
Huge!
The naan was actually the favorite part of my meal.
Soft with a nice chew.
garlic naan.author: Elena N.
garlic naan.review:
I was tired, hungry and maybe just a little hung over. So what was I craving? Deliciously comforting Indian food! Decided to pick up take out from Lahore Karahi for lunch.

*Vegetable samosa: two crispy puffs filled with potatoes, green peas ($3.99)
The samosas were a good size and crispy. The only disappointing thing? They didn't give me any mint dipping sauce. So I didn't get that refreshing mint contrast.

*Chicken tikka masala: barbecued boneless chicken sauteed with herbs and spices ($9.99)
Nice flavor with a subtle spice. I usually like my curry thick, so this was a little on the runny side for me. It didn't really coat the naan when I dipped it in the curry.

*Garlic naan: naan stuffed with garlic ($2.75)
Huge! The naan was actually the favorite part of my meal. Soft with a nice chew. And some good garlic flavor.

This could have easily been a 4 star review if they didn't forget the mint dipping sauce and the curry was thicker. But alas, those two misses made this a 3 star review. But the good thing about getting Indian for lunch? I can also have it for dinner. I had enough leftovers for two more meals!

excerpts: I love the garlic naan, and I feel like their naan is bigger than what other restaurants give.
garlic naan.author: Grace D.
garlic naan.review:
Despite the place being a complete hole-in-the-wall in TL, I find myself coming back (and recently, ordering from UberEats!) because the food is just toooo good! Despite the low food safety score... which didn't scare me away, and it hasn't gotten me sick yet (knock on wood). I love the garlic naan, and I feel like their naan is bigger than what other restaurants give. The butter chicken is also one of the best I've had, mostly due to the tenderness of the chicken. Most chicken curries at other places are dry, so I was surprised that they cooked the chicken so well here! I also get the paneer tikka masala which is delicious, though I think I might like the butter chicken sauce better than the tikka masala (though they only offer paneer tikka masala, not paneer makhani, afaik).

If you can look past its slightly sketch location and the low food safety score, this is an Indian place you cannot skip! Might be my favorite Indian place in the city.

excerpts: And the Garlic naan is the best I've had in SF.
Get over the looks of the place.
Never judge a book by it's cover!
Try some good Indian.
The Tenderlion has a lot of good places to eat!
garlic naan.author: Oliver S.
garlic naan.review:
I don't give a F@&$ about some health inspection score.  I've traveled the world eating great food at places that would make this place seem like a 5 star restaurant. I decided to try this place b/c I walk by it all the time and the smell of Indian spices and garlic and such coming out of the place is intoxicating. This place is the best Indian I've had in SF hands down and it's a dive too!

They have this take on mutter paneer called shahi paneer.  They fry the cheese and then add it to the sauce.  The cheese eventually melts into the sauce if you stir it up a bit.  Essentially a cheezy tomato-y curry dip. OMFG!

And the Garlic naan is the best I've had in SF.  Get over the looks of the place.  Never judge a book by it's cover!  Try some good Indian.  The Tenderlion has a lot of good places to eat!

excerpts: , I thought the garlic naan was delicious and wish we had gotten more
garlic naan.author: Luke H.
garlic naan.review:
Great spot to grab very tasty Indian/Pakistani food with a group. It's very low key - order at the counter, seat yourself, etc., and it's BYOB. Few things to note: 

-Samosas were delicious, definitely throw some of that mint sauce all over those things
-We went with a bunch of vegetarians and they were very pleased
-Contrary to some other reviews, I thought the garlic naan was delicious and wish we had gotten more

excerpts: Got the saag paneer, chicken tikka masala, aloo gohbi, garlic naan and rice.
Portions are not huge, but perfect for sharing.
Saag paneer was exceptional.
Everything else was fresh and flavorful.
Good hospitality and reasonably priced.
Would definitely go back to try more!
garlic naan.author: Julie P.
garlic naan.review: Finally got to try this place today.  Did not disappoint.  Got the saag paneer, chicken tikka masala, aloo gohbi, garlic naan and rice.  Portions are not huge, but perfect for sharing.  Saag paneer was exceptional.  Everything else was fresh and flavorful.  Good hospitality and reasonably priced.  Would definitely go back to try more!

excerpts: Get the chicken tikka masala and some garlic naan, you'll love it!
100% recommend!
garlic naan.author: Rija A.
garlic naan.review: This place was incredible! We were exploring San Fran during a long layover and my family enjoyed this place so much! We drive around all the key attractions and the location was great. The people were super nice, the place had authentic food, and whoever made the Naans deserves an award! They stayed soft the entire time, even a day later the food was so good! Get the chicken tikka masala and some garlic naan, you'll love it! 100% recommend!

excerpts: The garlic naan was incredible!
Very thick and soft and super fresh.
The masala was good, I ordered spicy and it was a little under the spicy I prefer and small portions but over all great to go food!
garlic naan.author: Jada M.
garlic naan.review: The garlic naan was incredible! Very thick and soft and super fresh. The masala was good, I ordered spicy and it was a little under the spicy I prefer and small portions but over all great to go food!

excerpts: we order so many things for 3 people - half a tandoori chicken, shrimp briyani, saag paneer, fish tikka masala, veg tikka masala, cheese naan and garlic naan.
garlic naan.author: Christina L.
garlic naan.review:
lahore karahi has been on my list for a while, but since they dont deliver and is in a sketchier part of town, i've been holding off on trying. since the parents are in town though, and were shopping downtown, we decided to stop in because authentic indian food is hard to come by in shanghai...

the restaurant is very minimal and simple - everything is self serve (though they brought us plates and utensils (maybe we looked a bit lost).  we order so many things for 3 people - half a tandoori chicken, shrimp briyani, saag paneer, fish tikka masala, veg tikka masala, cheese naan and garlic naan. haah SUCH FATTIES. 

food came out reasonably fast and all of a sudden our table was full.  the naans were really thin and crispy, and the cheese one was delicious with the tikka sauce.  saag paneer was a bit underwhelming, not as liquidity as i usually like my saag. briyani had good flavors, but not a lot of shrimp.  my mom really enjoyed the tandoori chicken, and here was a good amount of it!  i thought the tikka was flavorful, but....missing SOMETHING.  dinner after tax & tip was $75 - a bargain for all this food (we had a bit of leftovers for my lunch the next day).  i probably wont be coming back given the location...and lack of memorable-ness.

excerpts: Ordered tandoori chicken leg, goat curry and garlic naan.
The goat is well cooked and tandoori is perfect.
Naan is decent.
Would order food here again.
garlic naan.author: Ravi Teja P.
garlic naan.review: Ordered tandoori chicken leg, goat curry and garlic naan. The goat is well cooked and tandoori is perfect. Naan is decent. Would order food here again.

excerpts: We got the following dishes and I recommend them all: garlic naan, lamb naan, bengan bharta, saag paneer, lamb biryani and chicken vindaloo.
For four people, came up to ~$13 per person - super reasonable!
I'm definitely coming again soon.
garlic naan.author: Sarah M.
garlic naan.review: Finally got to check out this place after hearing so many positive reviews. Got a table easily on a Monday evening. Similar to Pakwan in Mission where you grab your own water, sauces, etc. We got the following dishes and I recommend them all: garlic naan, lamb naan, bengan bharta, saag paneer, lamb biryani and chicken vindaloo. For four people, came up to ~$13 per person - super reasonable! I'm definitely coming again soon.

excerpts:
Come here for a tasty, no-frills, and cheap Pakistani meal - highly recommend the:

- chicken karahi (slow cooked in oil and a creamy sauce; not healthy but so yummy!)
- beef sikh kebab (minced, mixed with spices, and reassembled)
- garlic naan (sprinkled with paprika and garlic roasted; comes out fresh and hot)
- aloo gobhi (a very tasty potatoes and cauliflower dish)
garlic naan.author: Amelia C.
garlic naan.review:
Come here for a tasty, no-frills, and cheap Pakistani meal - highly recommend the:

- chicken karahi (slow cooked in oil and a creamy sauce; not healthy but so yummy!)
- beef sikh kebab (minced, mixed with spices, and reassembled)
- garlic naan (sprinkled with paprika and garlic roasted; comes out fresh and hot)
- aloo gobhi (a very tasty potatoes and cauliflower dish)

There's also free chai that you can serve yourself! This place deserves five stars for taste and value, and people recognize it - every table was taken by 8 pm on a Tuesday night.

excerpts: The garlic naan, ohhhh man the garlic naan...
garlic naan.author: Debbie H.
garlic naan.review:
Love this place!! Absolutely the best Pakistani/Indian food around!! 

The lamb vindaloo, chicken tikka masala, and butter chicken are absolutely delicious and the best I've ever had! The chicken tandoori was good too but I wasn't in love with it like the other dishes. The garlic naan, ohhhh man the garlic naan... It was like love at first sight hahah. 

BYOB kind of place with liquor stores all around

excerpts: (lots of) garlic naan.
garlic naan.author: Katie P.
garlic naan.review:
What a great find in the TL. Delicious authentic Indian. I had been searching high and low for an Indian spot in SF for a couple years and this lands the spot of my número uno. Everything is under $10. BYOB w/ no corkage fee. Hope this lasts(!)

Usually opt for the classic "western" choices: chicken tikka masala, basmati rice, & (lots of) garlic naan. All items are consistently good. 

I've become a regular and I've had the pleasure of enjoying the lamb vindaloo, a cauliflower curry, chicken korma, goat curry, palak paneer, etc. Honestly liked everything except for the veggie korma one time tasted a little funky, but I've ordered it since and been thrilled, so maybe it was just me. This is not the cleanest place... But does it matter? It's cheap, pretty quick and if it's cooked for long periods of time over high heat why does it matter? The employees are super nice too - just don't forget to pay on your way out! I know I almost have like 5 times. Good for smaller groups, lots of 4-top tables and there's a big TV for sports fans always playing Warrior's games.

Lahore, I love you. Thanks for plumping me up and keeping me warm on most Friday nights.

excerpts: We ordered Butter Chicken and Prawn Tikka Masala, and Garlic Naan and Roti to accompany them.
The Butter Chicken of course is thick, creamy and buttery.
The sauce is slightly spicy, enhances the chicken and goes with Naan awesomely.
The chicken is a tiny bit dry but still a lot better than Chutney's.
They're cut into bite-sized chunks of chicken breast.
The Prawn Tikka Masala is cooked in a creamy tomato sauce.
This sauce has awesome consistency - it's less fatty than the butter chicken, there no oily layer on top.
The shrimp was still crisp - tasted very nice and fresh.
The Garlic Naan looks cute and perfectly rounded.
It's topped with garlic and herbs.
This Naan is not too thick and smells nice.
It's not too soft and floppy but not too dey either.
garlic naan.author: Châu B.
garlic naan.review:
