This place is pretty good for what it is. The food tasted awesome, it's cooked to order. 

This place is still in the Tenderloin but a block away from the Chutney, Shalimar, etc. bunch. It looks clean and tidy. The tables are spacious. This place is Self Service. You choose your own seat and take the menu, choose what you want and go up to the counter to order. You can help yourself to water from the fridge or free chai tea. Your food will come to you when it's done. And when you're done - you can go to the counter to pay. 

My friend introduced me to this place. We ordered Butter Chicken and Prawn Tikka Masala, and Garlic Naan and Roti to accompany them. 

The food took awhile but they make everything individually to order so the wait isn't a bad thing. The portion may look small but it will fill you up. The Naan will especially help. 

The Butter Chicken of course is thick, creamy and buttery. The sauce is slightly spicy, enhances the chicken and goes with Naan awesomely. The chicken is a tiny bit dry but still a lot better than Chutney's. They're cut into bite-sized chunks of chicken breast. It's $8.99 

The Prawn Tikka Masala is cooked in a creamy tomato sauce. This sauce has awesome consistency - it's less fatty than the butter chicken, there no oily layer on top. The shrimp was still crisp - tasted very nice and fresh. It's really worth the $11.99. 

The Garlic Naan looks cute and perfectly rounded. It's topped with garlic and herbs. This Naan is not too thick and smells nice. It's not too soft and floppy but not too dey either. This was $2.50. 

The Roti is made of whole wheat so it's druer and less fluffy. It's more dry than Naan - but it's healthy. The crisp bread is good to pick up the sauces. I think this was $1.50. 

This place is tidy and bright and the food is flavorful and taste good. The price is a bit higher than Chutney's but the flavor is more authentic and it's really worth it. At least give it a try.

excerpts: Enjoyed the veggie samosas, garlic naan, Chicken Tikka Masala and Tandoori Fish.
garlic naan.author: Candace L.
garlic naan.review:
Order up front, be seated and pay when you're finished not a bad concept :)

We stopped off for dinner here on Saturday. Enjoyed the veggie samosas, garlic naan, Chicken Tikka Masala and Tandoori Fish.

Super casual, hole in the wall type place where you aren't rushed and can sit and hang out while enjoying good food.

It appeared to be BYOB, although we didn't know this ahead of time.

Good spot to grab Indian food.

excerpts: Garlic naan.
Yum!
CTM was so good
like I haven't had since college and New Haven.
If you're craving some great Indian food with friendly service definitely check Lahore out now!
garlic naan.author: Joseph L.
garlic naan.review:
Hot hot tea! Wow this was some great Indian food that hit the spot. Good thing they deliver and I went during the day, otherwise this is a pretty sketch area.

Garlic naan. Yum! CTM was so good  like I haven't had since college and New Haven. If you're craving some great Indian food with friendly service definitely check Lahore out now!

excerpts: The garlic naan was also very good.
We stayed there for about 2 hours and hung out there.
The place is a good size and could probably have a decent size group of 8 people.
Service was quick and good.
They only bring out the food.
The price was good for the amount of food provided.
garlic naan.author: Abbas B.
garlic naan.review: Great food and nice place to hang out.  We were a group of 4 people.  We all loved our food.  I ate the chicken saag and enjoyed it very much.  The garlic naan was also very good.  We stayed there for about 2 hours and hung out there.  The place is a good size and could probably have a decent size group of 8 people.  Service was quick and good.  They only bring out the food.  The price was good for the amount of food provided.

excerpts: Garlic Naan: 2/5
Despite how good it looked (refer to my photos), there was no flavor.
garlic naan.author: Courtni W.
garlic naan.review:
Ordered: 
Butter Chicken Masala: 2/5 The chicken was WAY too dry. It was impossible to break apart with my fork and I could probably chew on a piece for days if I wanted to because it was so overcooked. The masala was neither rich nor creamy, it tasted quite bland. 

Chicken Tikka Masala: 3/5 The flavor was a lot better than the butter chicken. Chicken was still very dry. 

Garlic Naan: 2/5 Despite how good it looked (refer to my photos), there was no flavor. I expected the naan to be a mouthful of garlic yumminess but instead received a mouthful of bland carbs instead. 

Service: 1/5 I highly recommend this restaurant to hire someone to bus tables because all the tables around me were filled with dirty dishes. The tub where you usually put your dirty dishes in was already filled to the brim with dirty dishes. Only two people were working and they were both cooking and taking orders. It took a solid 20 minutes for my boyfriend and I to receive our food and took another 5 minutes standing at the counter for one of the employees to give us the check and for us to pay and leave. This restaurant is not run well at all, they definitely need more employees working because it seems like it takes forever for things to get done. 

If you're looking for a quick place to grab a bite to eat, I would not recommend this restaurant but if you're trying to kill time and don't mind an under-averaged plate of Indian food, you could try this place.

excerpts:
Had the garlic naan, chicken cheese naan, chicken tikka masala, butter chicken, and lamb vindaloo.
The butter chicken was the best out of the three.
I prefer the chicken tikka masala better at Chutney, although the meat is really dry there.
The lamb vindaloo was nothing memorable but it wasn't bad.
You couldn't taste the chicken in the chicken cheese naan.
The meal was pretty inexpensive.
garlic naan.author: Heejin L.
garlic naan.review:
3.5
I thought this place maybe slightly better than some of the other places I have been to.  You order first, then sit.

Had the garlic naan, chicken cheese naan, chicken tikka masala, butter chicken, and lamb vindaloo.
The butter chicken was the best out of the three.
I prefer the chicken tikka masala better at Chutney, although the meat is really dry there.
The lamb vindaloo was nothing memorable but it wasn't bad.
You couldn't taste the chicken in the chicken cheese naan.
The meal was pretty inexpensive.

excerpts: We got the Chicken Tikka Masala, Butter Chicken Masala and Garlic Naan.
The Butter Chicken Masala was a tad bland.
It wasn't nearly as creamy or rich as most Butter Chicken Masalas and the chicken was extremely dry as well.
The Garlic Naan smelled and looked delicious
Overall, the Butter Chicken and Garlic Naan lacked flavor.
However, the Chicken Tikka Masala was delicious.
They were understaffed leading to very slow service.
Overall, the Butter Chicken and Garlic Naan lacked flavor.
However, the Chicken Tikka Masala was delicious.
They were understaffed leading to very slow service.
garlic naan.author: Ray W.
garlic naan.review:
I came here for lunch with my girlfriend. We got the Chicken Tikka Masala, Butter Chicken Masala and Garlic Naan. 

The Chicken Tikka Masala was great. it was well seasoned and had the perfect taste to it. However, the chicken was extremely dry.

The Butter Chicken Masala was a tad bland. It wasn't nearly as creamy or rich as most Butter Chicken Masalas and the chicken was extremely dry as well.

The Garlic Naan smelled and looked delicious but it wasn't very garlic-y. 

Overall, the Butter Chicken and Garlic Naan lacked flavor. However, the Chicken Tikka Masala was delicious. They were understaffed leading to very slow service. There were only two people working the register and kitchen combined. 

Would definitely come back but only for the Chicken Tikka Masala.

excerpts:
One star for their Garlic Naan 

One star for their Lamb Samosa
garlic naan.author: Katy N.
garlic naan.review:
NOTE to yourself,  do NOT dine here during  a HOT day/night because this place has NO AC!!!!!!!!!!  Only eager to dine here because of that stupid episode from "Check Bay Please" & NOT  looking forward to return here anytime soon! 

One star for their Garlic Naan 

One star for their Lamb Samosa 

Butter Chicken - The sauce was A-OK,  but the highlight of this dish aka Chicken was HARD & inedible; such disappointment! 

Lamb Kabab - Alright. 

Aloo Golbi - Cauliflower with potatoes  - Nothing special & quite  bland.

excerpts: It's a mixed bag, however, very uneven, some stuff (like that garlic naan that people have raved about)
being excellent -- loved the tandoori chicken -- but other things like the saag paneer, which is usually can't miss, being very bland and watery.
I'd go back, as friends have told me they have good nights and lesser nights, but it's not really a discovery.
garlic naan.author: George G.
garlic naan.review: Don't be scared off by the Tenderloin location or the health department rating that Yelp reminds you of.  The food is fine.  It's a mixed bag, however, very uneven, some stuff (like that garlic naan that people have raved about) being excellent -- loved the tandoori chicken -- but other things like the saag paneer, which is usually can't miss, being very bland and watery.  I'd go back, as friends have told me they have good nights and lesser nights, but it's not really a discovery.

excerpts: Chilli Cheese Naan - Garlic naan is usually my go-to choice, but saw the chilli naan mentioned in some yelp reviews.
Had a nice kick to it.
garlic naan.author: Andrey L.
garlic naan.review:
Summary - Good Indian food. Hole-in-the-wall place that's good for lunch. Try the tandoori fish.

I came here for lunch on a weekday around noon. The place was pretty empty (2 - 3 other people there). There was a bit of a wait for the food to arrive (~25 minutes).

Tandoori Fish - Best dish by far. I haven't ordered fish at an Indian restaurant before, so wasn't sure what to expect, but turned out to be a great choice.

Chilli Cheese Naan - Garlic naan is usually my go-to choice, but saw the chilli naan mentioned in some yelp reviews. Had a nice kick to it. Would order again.

Lamb Vindaloo - Pretty good dish. Not extremely memorable, but the lamb was cooked well.
 
The place itself is pretty hole-in-the-wall, with about 10 - 15 tables.

excerpts: I ordered the Lamb Vindaloo and Saag Paneer with an order of garlic naan and basmati rice.
These are staples that are pretty hard to mess up, but this new "master" chef did.
Lamb vindaloo had some heavy oil, filled with a invasive chili powder that gave me almost instant heart burn.
I love spicy foods and its pretty rare to trigger that response inside me, but I think its the liberal use of cooking oil that is causing this reaction.
Not only that,
but there's only three pieces of lamb in my dish.
garlic naan.author: Peter C.
garlic naan.review:
I'm updating my review because of the serious degradation in food quality and value. The new owner is longer present at the restaurant. Looks like the new owner promoted the kitchen aid to the master chef. This is a serious mistake and is the reason why I must downgrade my review to one star (I gave this place three stars after the new owner took over, after he bought the place from the previous owner). 

I ordered the Lamb Vindaloo and Saag Paneer with an order of garlic naan and basmati rice. These are staples that are pretty hard to mess up, but this new "master" chef did. Lamb vindaloo had some heavy oil, filled with a invasive chili powder that gave me almost instant heart burn. I love spicy foods and its pretty rare to trigger that response inside me, but I think its the liberal use of cooking oil that is causing this reaction. Not only that, but there's only three pieces of lamb in my dish. Each lamb piece is the size of my pinky finger. 

The Saag Paneer was bland yet spicy at the same time, an odd combination that left the same bad taste in my mouth as trickle-down economics. Saag Paneer is supposed to have this explosive, orgasmically spiced creamy flavor mixed with the mild subtlety of cheese. This Saag Paneer lacked most of those qualities. 

Some may seriously disagree with my review, but that's because they're not acquainted with a) the Old Lahore or b) good Indian/Pakistani food. This new chef is merely throwing things into a pan without understanding how the ingredients complement each other (so he doesn't know how to control each ingredient). Combined with the expensive dish prices (I paid $22.10 for my above order: yes, that's expensive for this "hole-in-the-wall" place), this place lost any respect I had after the new owner took over.

excerpts: The garlic naan was especially good and the samosas were nice and flaky.
Good vegetarian options, and my only complaint is I wish my curry had been a bit spicier.
This is a safe bet if you're in the area and don't feel like table service.
garlic naan.author: Adrienne G.
garlic naan.review: Charming and casual hole in the wall. Good Indian food at great prices. We enjoyed being able to grab our own chutney and sauces. The garlic naan was especially good and the samosas were nice and flaky. Good vegetarian options, and my only complaint is I wish my curry had been a bit spicier. This is a safe bet if you're in the area and don't feel like table service.

excerpts: Ordered the chicken tikka masala, chicken tandoori and garlic naan.
Tikka masala was fabulous.
Just about the best i have had in the bay area.
Garlic naan was good too.
This is a self service place and the establishment looks more like a dhaba than a restaurant.
If you are not a stickler for ambiance, do give this place a try.
The food is really awesome.
Do not miss it due to the stupid yelp warning.
garlic naan.author: Manish S.
garlic naan.review: Really great food. Ordered the chicken tikka masala, chicken tandoori and garlic naan. Tikka masala was fabulous. Just about the best i have had in the bay area. Garlic naan was good too. This is a self service place and the establishment looks more like a dhaba than a restaurant. If you are not a stickler for ambiance, do give this place a try. The food is really awesome. Do not miss it due to the stupid yelp warning.

excerpts: Don't skip the garlic naan no matter what else you order.
Saag paneer was very tasty as well as the classic tikka masala.
The lamb vindaloo had nice spice and the raita helped to cool the pallet.
garlic naan.author: Jin R.
garlic naan.review:
Taken for what it is, Lahore Karahi is my favorite Indian/Pakastani restaurant so far. I'm no expert of the cuisine but the favors are on point. Most dishes seem to be made to order so you will have to wait a bit after you order. I'm fine with that and it's worth it. 

Don't skip the garlic naan no matter what else you order. Saag paneer was very tasty as well as the classic tikka masala. The lamb vindaloo had nice spice and the raita helped to cool the pallet. Will have to try some tandoori next time. 

Give them a try and byob!

excerpts: Get the Tandoor fish, pakoras and samosas, garlic naan
garlic naan.author: Jacqueline C.
garlic naan.review:
Every dish was spectacular. Tandoori chicken was crispy on outside and juicy and flavorful on inside. Best tikka masala I have ever had (I take my tikka masala seriously)

Get the Tandoor fish, pakoras and samosas, garlic naan

Another plus, big squeeze bottle sauces .

So good!! 

They were out kheer ( rice pudding- was a bummer.. And you have to bring your own beer. Another bummer.


Feels like you are in someone's kitchen--meaning the food was like home cookin.

excerpts: Their garlic naan is wonderful and I can't get enough of their Butter Chicken.
They're doing it the right way here and the staff is super friendly.
No frills here.
Just good food.
garlic naan.author: Steve T.
garlic naan.review: Great food that's relatively cheap and quick. Their garlic naan is wonderful and I can't get enough of their Butter Chicken. They're doing it the right way here and the staff is super friendly. No frills here. Just good food.

excerpts: The Garlic Naan and Onion Kulcha are my staple orders for bread.
Everything is cooked fresh and so will take some time but worth it.
garlic naan.author: Vijay N.
garlic naan.review:
This is by far the best N. Indian cuisine that one would find in SF even though it is Pakistani ( some parts of N.India and Pakistan share the same culture and food habits).

My favorites are the Chicken Karahi, Goat Curry even though the Chicken tandoori and Butter chicken are not bad. The Garlic Naan and Onion Kulcha are my staple orders for bread. Everything is cooked fresh and so will take some time but worth it. The Biryanis are good too here.

The  best part is that in the end, it is not expensive!

excerpts: Lahore Karahi's garlic naan is the best naan in San Francisco, hands down.
Everything else is pretty fantastic.
Chicken tikka & sag dal are my favorites.
I'm pretty sure it's BYOB too.
garlic naan.author: Natalie P.
garlic naan.review: Food safety scores are for squares. We all know the best places in SF look like (and often are) someone's family kitchen that's been dishing out food nonstop for years. Lahore Karahi's garlic naan is the best naan in San Francisco, hands down. Everything else is pretty fantastic. Chicken tikka & sag dal are my favorites. I'm pretty sure it's BYOB too.

excerpts: Garlic naan: probably one of my favorite things here!!
garlic naan.author: Chrystal Z.
garlic naan.review:
Was really craving some good Indian food when I came across this little joint on Yelp, and decided to try it out. Originally came here to satisfy my lamb biryani craving...

It's a small place in the TL, where a ton of great cheap food is located. They were out of lamb stock so we couldn't order any lamb entrees, which is usually my favorite meat to order at Indian restaurants. They also didn't have vegetable samosas that we wanted, so that was kind of a bummer.

Chicken tikka masala: absolutely amazing. Creamy and flavorful in all the ways you want your tikka masala to be. 

Chicken biryani: I thought the chicken in this dish was pretty dry, although it had great flavor otherwise. We spooned some of the masala from our other entree into the rice which made it taste pretty good.

Garlic naan: probably one of my favorite things here!! I'll definitely be back to try this.

Mango lassi: excellent flavor; sweet, a bit tangy, not too thick, but could definitely taste the yogurt.

The only qualm I had about this place was that it took really long to get our food, so budget some time for that.

excerpts: Garlic Naan: delicious.
garlic naan.author: N ..
garlic naan.review:
First time here, won't be the last. I went at the time between lunch and dinner so I can't speak to the wait times or speed of service. My bf and I were the only ones in the joint.  

Garlic Naan: delicious. Chewy on the inside and crispy on the outside...garlic but not too much garlic.

Goat curry: if you don't like goat, get out of here! The man behind the counter suggested we order this dish and he didn't steer us wrong. The meat was tender and flavorful. The sauce was full of spices and not too salty. 

Chicken korma: stole my heart. Creamy, yummy, again, not too salty (I find that it's easily done). If you're wondering what to get, get this.

Don't be intimidated if you see a roach on the wall. They too like good food. If you leave them alone, they will leave you be...true tenderloin spirit. 

Thank you for a wonderful meal!

excerpts: Their Garlic naan is yum.
We ordered kourma, chicken tandoori, chicken tikka masala, garlic naan, fish curry, and daal.
I would suggest to go there with an empty stomach cause it's a lot of food!
Love it .
garlic naan.author: Jennie C.
garlic naan.review: Love their food. I've been here a few times and everything is made fresh and consistent. Their Garlic naan is yum. We ordered kourma, chicken tandoori, chicken tikka masala, garlic naan, fish curry, and daal. I would suggest to go there with an empty stomach cause it's a lot of food! Love it .

excerpts: At Lahore, I like to order the Chicken Tikka Masala, an order of rice, and a garlic naan.
That will feed two people and it costs less than $15.
You can't beat that deal.
The tea is free.
garlic naan.author: Sethy Wethy ..
garlic naan.review:
Me and my satanic, devil-worshipping ex-gal pal ate here often. I still do but she ran off to be with Satan in his hellbent orgy circus. I ordered love and she ordered lies with a side of sex with every man she met. 

At Lahore, I like to order the Chicken Tikka Masala, an order of rice, and a garlic naan. That will feed two people and it costs less than $15. You can't beat that deal. The tea is free. Drink up, glutton. 

It's the best of its kind in the neighborhood. BYOB though. 

I give it 5 stars because I frequent the place. I pretty much order the same thing every time. It's cheap. It's consistent. Other Indian/Pakistani restaurants in the area are either too dirty or just not as tasty. 

The staff has always been chill and nice. That is always key for me. If you were to serve me a plate of garbage but were friendly and kind and nice and sweet about it, I'd come back for more trash. Thx so much.

excerpts: We ordered a Veggie pakora as an appetizer, a butter chicken and a tandoori chicken for entrees, and garlic naan and basmati rice for sides.
The garlic naan was the best naan I've ever had.
It was so crispy and hot.
You can't fake that freshness.
The entrees were good, but not much better than at other indian restauarnts in the area.
The garlic naan alone was worth the trip.
garlic naan.author: Richard T.
garlic naan.review:
My buddy and I came here for lunch on President's Day.  If I was going to base this review on the service, I would have to give it 2 stars. We ordered a Veggie pakora as an appetizer, a butter chicken and a tandoori chicken for entrees, and garlic naan and basmati rice for sides.  They forgot our pakoras which is when I drafted the review and saved it as 2 stars.  

That's when the food came out.  It was great.  The garlic naan was the best naan I've ever had.  It was so crispy and hot.  You can't fake that freshness.  The entrees were good, but not much better than at other indian restauarnts in the area.  The onion naan was not as good as the garlic one.  

It was a reasonable price for two starving guys.  The garlic naan alone was worth the trip.

excerpts: We had Chicken Tiki Marsala, Lamb Vindaloo (described as hot on menu but is not), rice, and Chili as well as Garlic Naan.
garlic naan.author: Polska K.
garlic naan.review:
Be aware that this is a straight hole in the wall. After having seen this place on T.V., and all the reviews we had to give it a try. I'm not exactly sure what all the rave is? This is not a full service restaurant. You have to get your own drinks, and order at the counter. The only drink options are some cans of soda in the fridge, some kind of tea, and water I guess that is in some type of containers in the fridge. A whole tableful of used glass water containers sitting to the right of the fridge was a sign that someone had not done dishes in a long while. Gross.

 I asked the cook if he had any chili sauce or something spicy to accommodate the meal. He told me no, but then said he could make up something. He basically took some type of chili powder and mixed it with water creating a paste. The dry powder on the edges of the little bowl were a dead give away. 

The food lacked any flare and quite frankly was a bit on the bland side. We had Chicken Tiki Marsala, Lamb Vindaloo (described as hot on menu but is not), rice, and Chili as well as Garlic Naan. The Naan was good, and the Lamb Vindaloo was not gamey at all. 

Another odd occurrence was the arrival of a couple of men in a van. They came out with a large plastic container containing some kind of sauce, as well as a plateful of Samosa or something that looked like it. That tells me they make some things off sight. That's not comforting because things made off sight need to be at the right temperature for transport, and who knows where this stuff was made? 
 
The restroom was very small and the toilet cleaner sitting there right next to the toilet paper...well...odd. It wasn't overly clean and the place is run down. 

This was hardly a food experience that had "wow" factor in a positive way. There is so much better out there!

excerpts: Came here the other day and got the baingan bharta, chicken tikka masala, garlic naan, and plain naan.
Plain naan was better than the garlic naan.
Plain naan was better than the garlic naan.
The garlic naan was overly crispy and not as tasty as it looks.
I like naan to be soft and squishy, like eating a chewy cloud, and this was not it.
The plain naan is more naan-ish than the garlic one, for less than half the price ($1 v. $2.50).
garlic naan.author: Tiffany Y.
garlic naan.review:
Came here the other day and got the baingan bharta, chicken tikka masala, garlic naan, and plain naan. 

The baingan bharta (eggplant + peas) was spicy and had a great flavor to it, but did not find much eggplant in it at all? Even so, was quite tasty. 

Chicken tikka masala was flavorful and a little sweet, but the chicken chunks were very dry. I'm pretty picky about my chicken and like for it to be tender and moist, so would not get this again. 

Plain naan was better than the garlic naan. The garlic naan was overly crispy and not as tasty as it looks. I like naan to be soft and squishy, like eating a chewy cloud, and this was not it. The plain naan is more naan-ish than the garlic one, for less than half the price ($1 v. $2.50). 

Overall, solid place with reasonable price-to-portion ratio. Will be back to try more!

excerpts: - Garlic Naan:
The naan was legit.
I'm a tough critic, but I genuinely enjoyed my garlic naan and for this sole reason I am rating this place
garlic naan.author: Moniza M.
garlic naan.review:
As a self proclaimed subject matter expert (SME) on pakistani/indian food, I was extremely disappointed in Lahore Karahi. I had heard good things about the restaurant, so I was excited to try it. But, as many things on Yelp, this place was all hype. I've been to practically every Pakistani restaurant in the tandoor-loin, and Lahore Karhai is literally one of the worst. The food was SO BLAND, I question if they are even allowed to call themselves a Pakistani-Indian restaurant. 

A friend and I ordered the following: 
- Beef Seekh Kabob: Horrendous. Had absolutely no flavor or seasoning. 

- Palak Aloo: Extremely bland, but not terrible. It was probably my favorite dish of the evening, but thats not saying much since everything else was gross. 

- Karhai Chicken: When your restaurant has the word KARAHI in it, you'd think you'd want this dish to be your bread and butter, a dish to show off. Sadly, Lahore Karhais karhai chicken was amongst the worst i've ever had. 

- Garlic Naan: The naan was legit. I'm a tough critic, but I genuinely enjoyed my garlic naan and for this sole reason I am rating this place TWO not ONE star. 

In conclusion, the food capital of Pakistan, Lahore, would be ashamed to have such a mediocre restaurant named after it. 

Lahore Karhai, you let this Pakistani girl down. I will probably never come back to eat your food. Next time, i'm not going to cheat on Shalimar or Mela.

excerpts:
We got:

Garlic naan $2.5 - fine.
garlic naan.author: Ann L.
garlic naan.review:
2nd time to Lahore Karahi w/ my 2010 SF Entertainment coupon.  It's on 612 O'Farrell St (@ Leavensworth).  Easy walk from the Asian Art Museum or Powell St Bart.

We got:

Garlic naan $2.5 - fine.  Comes w/ cilantro & I noticed sesame seeds on top.  Like a thin pizza.

Daal masala $5.5 - yellow lentils cooked in mild sauce.  It was tasty.

Matar paneer $7.5 - green peas cooked w/ cheese in mild tomato sauce.  I didn't notice any cheese, saw some potatoes in there - weird they didn't mentioned potatoes.  Tasted ok.

Tandoori Fish $11.95 - fish marinated w/ zesty herbs  spices.  I think they added lime for us which I don't mind.  It was nice & tender white fish maybe swordfish?  It was pretty good, comes out sizzling w/ onions & cabbage.

mango lassi $2.5 - nice

rice $2 - fine, enough for 2.

Subtotal w/ coupon & Tax (not tip) was $28.95

Hrs: Tu-Su 11a-11p
Credit cards over $15
Halal Meat

excerpts: Between my two friends and I, we ordered the Garlic Naan, Regular Naan, Butter Chicken, Fish Tikka Masala, Tandoori Chicken, and the Saag Paneer.
As a whole, nothing really stood to me as being anything special.
The Fish Tikka Masala was definitely the best of the bunch, as they did a good job with cooking the fish.
Even then though, it didn't strike me as amazing flavor-wise.
Decent, but not great.
And while none of the dishes were bad per se, it's not like
garlic naan.author: Mike L.
garlic naan.review:
One star...yup, haven't given out one of these in a while.  I guess I've been pretty fortunate so far with where I've been (which is something I'm quite appreciative of).  But then, it's not everyday you see a ROACH while you're eating.  Yeaaaaah....game over.  Thanks for playing.

Now, before you write this review off as a one star just because of a roach...well, you're partially right.  Seeing a roach certainly put this one a one star path, but it's not like I found the rest of the experience that fantastic anyways.  Unlike other Yelpers, I didn't find the food that remarkable the first time I was here a year or two ago, and it really wasn't any different this time around.  

Between my two friends and I, we ordered the Garlic Naan, Regular Naan, Butter Chicken, Fish Tikka Masala, Tandoori Chicken, and the Saag Paneer.  As a whole, nothing really stood to me as being anything special.  The Fish Tikka Masala was definitely the best of the bunch, as they did a good job with cooking the fish.  Even then though, it didn't strike me as amazing flavor-wise.  Decent, but not great.  And while none of the dishes were bad per se, it's not like you can't find something just as good (or better) elsewhere in the City or the Bay Area.

Considering the fact that we had to wait almost 40 minutes for our food and that they still forgot our order of Tandoori Chicken, Lahore already wasn't going to be getting anything better than two stars before the roach showed up anyways.  Now, I'm not so naive to think that roaches aren't a problem at other places, including those that I'm actually fond of.  However, there's a BIG difference between suspecting or thinking they might be around, and then actually seeing the damn things on the wall.

If people want to keep coming back because they think the food is still great despite it all, then by all means.  That just means the lines will be shorter somewhere else.  I just know I won't be back, and I wouldn't even give it a second thought.  The only part that I'll still be thinking about is whether or not it was a good or bad thing that we didn't see the roach until towards the end of our meal.  Ugh...disgusting regardless.

excerpts: The fish curry, chana sag, and garlic naan were all quite tasty but for some reason my friend got sick (while I didn't).
The only thing she had which
I didn't was the mints and pepsi.
So beware of those I guess?
garlic naan.author: Misha T.
garlic naan.review: The fish curry, chana sag, and garlic naan were all quite tasty but for some reason my friend got sick (while I didn't). The only thing she had which I didn't was the mints and pepsi. So beware of those I guess?

excerpts: We ordered the Chicken Tikka Masala, Vegetable Korma, and Garlic Naan.
The Vegetable Korma was gross.
It lacked variety of vegetables and tasted chemically.
Some of the vegetables tasted pickled...maybe.
Either way, fresh it was not.
The garlic naan was nothing to write home about.
I did not get the impression
it was fresh.
garlic naan.author: Kiki I.
garlic naan.review:
I give them 3 stars because the Giants game was on and the free tea was solid.

We ordered the Chicken Tikka Masala, Vegetable Korma, and Garlic Naan.  We later realized we needed rice.

The chicken was dry.  Although they cook to order, the chicken and other items are prepared ahead of time and sitting out.  So, that explains it.  Otherwise, the flavor of the Tikka Masala was fairly well rounded and a bit sweet.  We asked for spicy and it was not.

The Vegetable Korma was gross.  It lacked variety of vegetables and tasted chemically.  Some of the vegetables tasted pickled...maybe.  Either way, fresh it was not.  It was disappointing to say the least.

The garlic naan was nothing to write home about.  I did not get the impression it was fresh.  The garlic was a boost, but not enough to save it.

Based upon the reviews, I was disappointed.  I do not think I would go back.

excerpts: Chicken Tikka Masala, Chicken Vindaloo,Garlic Naan,  Veg Biryani, Chicken Biryani
Must try.. amazing test.
Delicious.
Highly recommended.
garlic naan.author: Omkar P.
garlic naan.review: The best Indian food in SFO till now. Chicken Tikka Masala, Chicken Vindaloo,Garlic Naan,  Veg Biryani, Chicken Biryani Must try.. amazing test. Delicious. Highly recommended.

excerpts: The garlic naan is outstanding and the chicken tikka masala is really good!!
The two are my favorites but over all I tried other things too
garlic naan.author: Michael L.
garlic naan.review:
The place is not that impressing but the food is delicious! 
The garlic naan is outstanding and the chicken tikka masala is really good!! 
The two are my favorites but over all I tried other things too and it's really good.

TIP: If you like spicy food, ask for the green peppers in your rice bowl - yum!!

excerpts: - Garlic Naan: probably the highlight of Karahi's.
It was one of the best naans I've tried--
it was crispy, doughy, and 'reeked' of garlic... just the way I like it.
Did it go well with the Chicken Tikka Masala?
garlic naan.author: Jenny O.
garlic naan.review:
Solid 4.0 for Karahi's, a quaint restaurant that serves very good Pakistani food!

The food is real. You see the chefs preparing your food in the corner and you can smell the spices as each are thrown into the pan.

- Rice: good, decent... not too dry, not exactly fluffy.

- Mango Lassi: YUMMY! Probably my favorite mango lassi from anywhere... :) perfect mango flavor and a slight tartiness from the yogurt.

- Chicken Tikka Masala: decent, not the best I've ever had.  It was slightly spicy for me even though we requested "mild."  The chicken could've been more tender but it wasn't exactly dry.

- Garlic Naan: probably the highlight of Karahi's.  It was one of the best naans I've tried--it was crispy, doughy, and 'reeked' of garlic... just the way I like it. Did it go well with the Chicken Tikka Masala? Yes!

The ambiance is decent; there aren't too many seats available but the service is good. The waiters were quick and very helpful.

excerpts: The garlic naan and lamb vindoori was simply amazing.
The lamb vindoori was spicy and amazingly flavorful.
I am going back today to try another dish as it is my last day in town.
I too will be haunted by this experience because that meal ranks number one of all time.
garlic naan.author: Steve J.
garlic naan.review: I had an out of body experience having lunch here yesterday.  Thanks to all of the Yelpers out there for your recommendations.  The garlic naan and lamb vindoori was simply amazing.  The lamb vindoori was spicy and amazingly flavorful.  I am going back today to try another dish as it is my last day in town.  I too will be haunted by this experience because that meal ranks number one of all time.

excerpts: Onion kulcha was burnt, and the garlic naan did not look or taste like it was made with fresh ingredients.
Also, uhm, don't drink the water, it did not look or taste potable.
garlic naan.author: Elena T.
garlic naan.review:
First time visitor - will not be coming back. Here's the good, the bad and the downright ugly...

FOOD:
The food was ok, not great. Veggie samosa average.The food was nicely spiced, but the goat curry my boyfriend had was very runny with a distinct lack of goat, but with an abundance of bones...and vertebrae at that. I had the the eggplant curry, which was decent. Onion kulcha was burnt, and the garlic naan did not look or taste like it was made with fresh ingredients. Also, uhm, don't drink the water, it did not look or taste potable. Felt queasy when we got home, but boyfriend did not seem to experience any ill effects from the food.

Recap - food ok. On a 1-5 scale, maybe a 2.

WAIT:
Be prepared to wait. It's a small hole in the wall, which has limited staff. On top of that, it seems like only one person was cooking, with three others doing other stuff that was not customer-related. It mostly looked like they were standing around on the back-line, but I could be wrong. Plenty of time to observe what else was going on, as the wait was so long.

AMBIANCE and CUSTOMER SERVICE:
Ambiance was lacking, but is not usually a deal breaker for me. Although in this case, I could have done without the rolls of toilet paper on top of their drink fridge or the slew of unbussed tables. 

Speaking of which, don't expect anything from the customer service - seat yourself, come up, order at the kitchen/front-end and expect yourself and your needs to be ignored. We were there for an hour with 2 other tables being occupied, and at no point did ANYONE buss any of the empty tables with dirty plates and food still left on them. We did, however, see a customer buss a table by moving the last guests remains to another table and then sit down. Simply unacceptable. 

Also, while we where there, they were restocking their pantry it seems. I really could have done without seeing boxes of okra and basmati rice everywhere. I have worked extensively in food service, and if you don't have a back door, you NEVER get deliveries during business hours - the whole point is to focus on your customers, and not on everything else. 

CLEANLINESS
This is where this place gets some serious dings. Tablecloths with black dirt stains at the edge where they meet the clear plastic table top, broken soap dispenser with watered down soap in the bathroom, bathroom in general not in any great state of cleanliness, "Order Here" sign with big grease stain, kitchen visibly dirty from where you sit and plastic water glasses with cracks in them. Not good. 

All in all, this will not be somewhere we will re-visit.

excerpts: The garlic naan was delicious and nicely oiled.
garlic naan.author: Silver T.
garlic naan.review: Ordered lamb vindaloo. It was nearly flavorless. Sauce is supposed to be red but this was an orange Brown color. Ordered very hot and it was a little hot. Small rice costs $4. The garlic naan was delicious and nicely oiled.

excerpts: The garlic naan was amazing, and the garlic wasn't just tossed on but could be tasted throughout the bread.
My boyfriend and I shared the lamb vindaloo and chicken tiki masala (which is my personal favorite) and they were cooked to perfection, the curry was delicious.
The affordable prices sealed the deal.
We'll definitely be back again!!
garlic naan.author: Jillian F.
garlic naan.review: Absolutely fantastic. The garlic naan was amazing, and the garlic wasn't just tossed on but could be tasted throughout the bread. My boyfriend and I shared the lamb vindaloo and chicken tiki masala (which is my personal favorite) and they were cooked to perfection, the curry was delicious. The affordable prices sealed the deal. We'll definitely be back again!!

excerpts: We ordered butter chicken, daal masala and garlic naan; and it was all outstanding!
garlic naan.author: Rick J.
garlic naan.review: I'm not exactly sure how anyone couldn't rate this place 5 stars. We ordered butter chicken, daal masala and garlic naan; and it was all outstanding!

excerpts: My favorite dishes here are the Tandoori Chicken Leg, Lamb Vindaloo, Chicken Korma, and Garlic Naan.
garlic naan.author: Mark Y.
garlic naan.review:
This place has come under new management recently, I believe the old owner moved back to Pakistan with his family. I had a conversation with the new owner and head chef and he told me he has been friends with the owner for a long time and promised to keep the same quality standards of home style food as has been already built up after all these years. I have actually noticed the eating area of the restaurant has been freshened up a bit and is cleaner than before which is nice to see given that the old place was pretty much a hole in the wall.

My favorite dishes here are the Tandoori Chicken Leg, Lamb Vindaloo, Chicken Korma, and Garlic Naan. Occasionally they have posted specials like Goat Curry which are definitely worth ordering, so check the board behind the counter when ordering.

excerpts: The bengan bhartha was awesome and the garlic naan was some of the best that I have ever had.
Only reason that it is lacking a star is the ambiance.
Not a date place but a perfect place to order in from or stop by for a quick bite
garlic naan.author: Molly M.
garlic naan.review: Great Indian food! The bengan bhartha was awesome and the garlic naan was some of the best that I have ever had. Only reason that it is lacking a star is the ambiance. Not a date place but a perfect place to order in from or stop by for a quick bite

excerpts: , their garlic naan is great too.
garlic naan.author: Anneke B.
garlic naan.review: Best Butter Chicken ever but a bit pricey! However I come here anyway, their garlic naan is great too.

excerpts: Not to worry, I settled in and ordered the Lamb Vindaloo, Basmati Rice and Garlic Naan.
After a short wait my food arrived.
It all looked great.
I found the Vindaloo to be some of the best I have eaten, the lamb was lean and tender, the potatoes perfectly cooked and sauce not a bit greasy and perfect sinus clearing heat.
The rice nicely seasoned and cooked perfectly.
The Garlic Naan to put it simply, the best I have ever eaten.
Portions were excellent and would leave most people plenty to take home.
Service was good; however since I was the only person in the place it's hard to judge if there had been a crowd.
Décor is nothing special but clean.
garlic naan.author: Dave J.
garlic naan.review:
On a cold windy San Francisco day Lahore Karahi Pakistani Indian Cuisine is a great place to hunker down for some excellent Indian food. Its faults are few, none of which have anything to do with the food. 

I arrived for lunch just after noon. The place was small and deserted, which generally is not a good sign during prime lunch time.  Not to worry, I settled in and ordered the Lamb Vindaloo, Basmati Rice and Garlic Naan. After a short wait my food arrived. It all looked great. I found the Vindaloo to be some of the best I have eaten, the lamb was lean and tender, the potatoes perfectly cooked and sauce not a bit greasy and perfect sinus clearing heat. The rice nicely seasoned and cooked perfectly. The Garlic Naan to put it simply, the best I have ever eaten. Portions were excellent and would leave most people plenty to take home.  Service was good; however since I was the only person in the place it's hard to judge if there had been a crowd. Décor is nothing special but clean. Entrees in $9 range.

It's a bit tough to find fault with Lahore Karahi, nit picking faults: Not the greatest of neighborhoods, its safe just a bit rundown though not overly so. The serve only canned soft drinks and bottled water.  I saw no beer or wine.  

Lahore Karahi Pakistani Indian Cuisine is hard to beat if in the mood for Indian or a cold windy San Francisco day. As a matter fact a great choice any time.  This really is stellar food.

excerpts: Garlic naan good..
The funny thing too
is-
I always ask for a smaller raita..
This not just Lahore.
I don't need the big sizes that always go to waste
but they always give the big sizes...
Cost effectiveness?
Oh we'll probably not that much.
I'm taking another star off because of the bathroom.
Handle was broken-
it actually pulled out when I tried to flush!
I thought it may not flush because of it
but I pushed it back in
and it did thank gosh..
no toilet paper and soap dispenser was a mess w no top.
Like I said I like Lahore and used to go there regularly
but they need to ramp things up a bit if they want to be competitive..
There are just so many other choices in the city for same price fast service great taste and clean amenities.
garlic naan.author: Margo R.
garlic naan.review: I have frequented Lahore usually for dinner about once every 2-1 months and always get the fish tandoori, naan and raita.  This time for lunch I tried the chicken kabob (comes w 2) naan and raita... I was a tad disappointed as first of all I ordered at 1230 and food didn't come out until 1246... I had to wolf down my food ASAP... Anyone on a 30 min lunch may try another place.. ( of course I didn't finish all of it either) I won't take off a star for that because it did come out freshly made and piping hot.  Plus I rarely come in for lunch but I do recall now the one other time I came in for lunch that it took about the same time and we were all sweating looking at the clocks.  The kabob had some spice but lacked flavor- almost dry.. It would have been better if they marinated it first. Garlic naan good.. The funny thing too is- I always ask for a smaller raita.. This not just Lahore.  I don't need the big sizes that always go to waste but they always give the big sizes... Cost effectiveness? Oh we'll probably not that much. I'm taking another star off because of the bathroom. Handle was broken- it actually pulled out when I tried to flush! I thought it may not flush because of it but I pushed it back in and it did thank gosh..no toilet paper and soap dispenser was a mess w no top.  Like I said I like Lahore and used to go there regularly but they need to ramp things up a bit if they want to be competitive.. There are just so many other choices in the city for same price fast service great taste and clean amenities.

excerpts: Then I subtracted a star because when the waiter came back, and we were ready to order more DELICIOUS garlic naan, he handed us a check.
And we didn't get any more delcious garlic naan.
Then I added a star for the delicious garlic naan.
THAT
garlic naan.author: Emily D.
garlic naan.review:
Indian food to Jenna F. and me is no joke. We don't f. around. Especially not Jenna F. That b. is no f.er. 

Our weekly dinner date rolls around, and its my week to pick. This week in the land of legal eduaction sucked some major b's. Thus, I made the decision. It was time. Time for Jenna F. and I to quit f.ing around and try some S.F. indian. 

Yelp, you did not let me down. But because law school has left me f.'d in the head, I f.'d around hard deciding what stars to give it. Below is my thought process:

I subtracted a star for the amount of oil in my Aloo Ghobi. F. thats a lot of oil....

Then I added a star because of how home cooked and REAL it was. F. that s. was home cooked!

Then I subtracted a star because when the waiter came back, and we were ready to order more DELICIOUS garlic naan, he handed us a check. And we didn't get any more delcious garlic naan. =( F.! that naan is great!

Then I added a star for the delicious garlic naan. F.! THAT NAAN IS GREAT!

Then I added another imaginary star because our food was F.ING FANTASTIC!!!

excerpts: We loved loved LOVED the garlic naan!
It is a must try for everyone and very reasonably priced!
Added bonus = free chai!
Can't get better than this
garlic naan.author: J K.
garlic naan.review:
This place was a pleasant surprise! We loved loved LOVED the garlic naan!
It is a must try for everyone and very reasonably priced!
Added bonus = free chai! Can't get better than this :)

excerpts: Not sure what impact review #904 will have, but I have 2 words: GARLIC NAAN.
garlic naan.author: Sona P.
garlic naan.review:
Not sure what impact review #904 will have, but I have 2 words: GARLIC NAAN.  I ordered the chana saag and it was amazingly flavorful.  It paired well with the naan and plain rice.  

Minor drawback is that your hair/clothes/jacket will come out smelling like spices, but it's well worth it.

excerpts: Oh and garlic naan!
There's more but just GO!
Its great and super reasonable!
You won't be disappointed!
garlic naan.author: Sarah S.
garlic naan.review: I can't believe I haven't written a review for Lahore! This place is my bf's FAVORITE restaurant. He is a super picky eater but when we started dating I wanted to take him to one of my favorite cuisines as he had never had Indian before. I had been here once before and thought it was pretty good so brought him and the best friend here. HE FELL IN LOVE and we come here at least once a month every month. Now he has his coworker and his gf hooked and we just love it. The people here know us now obviously and are always very friendly. Its BYOB and they have awesome butter chicken and tandoori chicken. Oh and garlic naan! There's more but just GO! Its great and super reasonable! You won't be disappointed!

excerpts: We ordered a garlic naan, two regular naans, tandoori fish, chicken biriyani, and a mixed grill platter.
We all absolutely LOVED everything.
The biriyani was amazing.
The rice was perfectly cooked, not too soft, not too hard.
The fresh aroma of the cilantro blended nicely with the turmeric and other spices.
The food definitely wasn't overspiced the way most "Indian" restaurants do it.
Everything was light with the right amounth of flavor.
The garlic naan was delicious as well.
The tandoori fish was very tender and fragrant, but it was a bit too sour for my liking.
I think I tasted a bit of tamarind as well.
It would've been nice in a salad.
The lamb and chicken on the mixed grill platter were very tender and juicy.
Oh, don't forget to eat the vegetables that accompany the meat!
The onions and lettuce that came along with the meat tasted soooo sweet and  good.
garlic naan.author: Colleen W.
garlic naan.review:
When it comes down to Indian, I can get really picky. Maybe it's just because my dad cooked curry for us almost every DAMN DAY of my childhood. I learned to grow accustomed to all the spices of the middle east and south asia. Curry, masala, cumin, saffron, cardamom, you name it. My parents grew up eating kulfi, malai, and all that  cardiac health goodness and often crave those sweets.  I've never been a fan of those milky desserts, but I comply.

We were actually aiming to dine at the Sultan down the street, but we found out that they still hadn't opened. I wonder if they're even going to reopen... ever. Anyways, a quick search on Yelp led us down to Lahore Karahi. Off we went.

Our waiter was very nice. He treated everybody with respect and went out of his way many times just to answer my talkative dad's many questions.

We ordered a garlic naan, two regular naans, tandoori fish, chicken biriyani, and a mixed grill platter. We all absolutely LOVED everything. The biriyani was amazing. The rice was perfectly cooked, not too soft, not too hard. The fresh aroma of the cilantro blended nicely with the turmeric and other spices. The food definitely wasn't overspiced the way most "Indian" restaurants do it. Everything was light with the right amounth of flavor. The garlic naan was delicious as well. The tandoori fish was very tender and fragrant, but it was a bit too sour for my liking. I think I tasted a bit of tamarind as well. It would've been nice in a salad. The lamb and chicken on the mixed grill platter were very tender and juicy. Oh, don't forget to eat the vegetables that accompany the meat! The onions and lettuce that came along with the meat tasted soooo sweet and  good. Mmmm....

They roll the kulfi right in front of you. In fact, they make everything in front of you since the kitchen is out in the open. My parents enjoyed the kulfi and malai a lot, but I didn't eat it so I can't say much about it. They said it was heavenly.

We are definitely coming back. This is definitely one of the better Indian places in the city. 

Good stuff!

excerpts: My favorites: chicken tikka masala, tandoori chicken, tandoori fish, and garlic naan.
garlic naan.author: Andreia G.
garlic naan.review: The food here is amazing. I am so glad I live so close by. My favorites: chicken tikka masala, tandoori chicken, tandoori fish, and garlic naan.

excerpts: We ordered a Chicken Vindaloo and Lamb Korma  with two sides of onion kulcha and garlic naan.
I asked for the chicken vinadaloo to be extra spicy and they did not disappoint!
I felt like standing up on the chair and whistling 'cause it was just that dam good.
garlic naan.author: Jessica K.
garlic naan.review:
Oh my gosh, this place is one of the best kept secrets in the TL. It's just steps away from Naan and Curry (or "Naan and "Fury" as it's sometimes called) and the food is cheaper and much better. I'm not even sure if Naan and Curry can even say they serve halal meat.

This is one of those places that completely take you by surprise. Looking in, it's nothing special but you're immediately greeted by genuinely friendly faces and a cheerful conversation. The menu is simple, made to order and the restaurant is clean and has a direct view of the open kitchen. 

We ordered a Chicken Vindaloo and Lamb Korma  with two sides of onion kulcha and garlic naan. I asked for the chicken vinadaloo to be extra spicy and they did not disappoint! I felt like standing up on the chair and whistling 'cause it was just that dam good. Eating good Indian food just brings me back to great childhood memories of Chicago and exploring new restaurants on Devon Ave. 

The chicken vindaloo has hardly any oil seeping in the bottom, the sauce didn't separate, their was no trace of fat or mystery parts of chicken and the spices kicked my butt. The lamb korma was tender, almost like cutting through butter and a little gamey which I was all too impressed with but that's why I ordered chicken vindaloo. The naan and kulcha was hot, fluffy and complimented the spices in the vindaloo well. We spoiled our appetite by eating bread before coming to the restaurant so we had to wrap up the food but that didn't stop us from ordering dessert.

We split a kheer and honest to God, it was the first decent kheer I've ever had in San Francisco during the 2+ years here. I'm a big fan of rice pudding and this was real rice pudding that almost looked green! There was so much pistachio and just enough milk that it was a thick pudding that just exploded with flavor. Usually, Indian restaurants do the opposite where you have to search for the pistachio and it's swimming in a pool of milk but they don't cut corners here and I really do appreciate that. 

The owner was so nice that he even shared his homemade ice cream with it. I have no idea what was in it really but it was thick, hardly melted and had thick pieces of pistachio, mango and all kinds of other bits of yum. It was a difficult task to keep eating after the sensation to pop open a button happened, but I kept pushing onward because genuine warm hospitality like that is hard to come by. 

I even noticed the server turned the lights on brighter after taking note of me looking up at all the light bulbs in the center of the restaurant. I don't mind a dim lit place, especially if we're the only table but he took notice and acted on it. I was touched and definitely coming back because of the little touches they make sure happen.

excerpts: I went for a standard (Chicken Tikka Masala) and Garlic Naan.
The taste didn't hit you quite in the face as the garlic naan.
garlic naan.author: Corey G.
garlic naan.review:
This is one of those meals you have to save in your "brain folder":

[ coreyg@yelp ] $   pwd
[ coreyg@yelp ] $   /usr/dining/ecstasy/2010/Lahore Karahi

The night before I left my debit card at a bar.  The next day, this got me to thinking.  What if I wasn't able to pay for my meal at Lahore Karahi?  The bill would come, I would pull out my empty pockets and flash a sad face.  Would they send me to the kitchen to wash dishes?

I could only hope.  

As I sat at my table, I daydreamed about how Guddu the chef would order me to the sink to clean all the pots, pans, plates, etc.  I'd sadly meander back to the sink with my head down, and then (when he wasn't looking) I'd flash a wink & a smile to myself and get to work.  It would be my duty to lick every living morsel, spice, and drip of sauce off of everything.  Since my crime was so dire, I'd have to do this for hours.  

Ah, to dream.  But alas, I had cash in hand.  Let's go to the beginning.....

I was staying in the Tenderloin for the weekend, and Lahore Karahi was bookmarked months in advance.  I finally had a free afternoon, so I slushed and slogged through the San Francisco rain to Guddu's Pakistani/Indian dining mecca.  

The dining area is small.  I patiently waited & shivered at the entry for a few minutes.  I noticed many happy & smile-y faces.  I watched Guddu performing his magic in the kitchen (Yeah, I could do some dish washing/licking in there).    Within seconds I was warmed up.  I was then seated at the table next to the door (it was a little cold there, and I waited a bit, but it made the end result all the more better).

The server was very apologetic about the wait.  As I waited, I did notice some useful info--they are applying for their liquor license so they can serve beer and wine.  They also received an "A" grade for cleanliness.

I went for a standard (Chicken Tikka Masala) and Garlic Naan.  Within a few minutes, the coolness of where I sat was enveloped in steam as my food was brought to me (and my pores were cleared).  

Oh the aroma.

I smiled.  I wafted the steamy fragrant aroma to my face with my hands a few times, and let it soak in for a good minute before touching anything.

I then tore a piece of the naan, and placed it on my tongue.  THIS.  WAS. THE.  BEST.  NAAN.  I'VE.  EVER.  HAD!  Oh man, it's been a few weeks, but I still have dreams about the flavor & texture of it.  

The Chicken Tikka Masala was more subtle.  The taste didn't hit you quite in the face as the garlic naan.  But y'know, that's what I liked about it.  

It was like a slow and quiet orchestral piece.  It builds.  The way my taste buds soaked it in was an experience in that all of my little taste buds had a party with every bite.  The crescendo for the party was at the end.  I don't know how food can tell stories, but Guddu's cuisine does it.

I was transported.

excerpts: We shared the Saag Panner, Bengan Bharta, Lamb Vindaloo, Bhindi Gosht and Garlic Naan.
garlic naan.author: Nicole R.
garlic naan.review:
As a first time visitor, I did not know what to expect from Lahore Karahi, but I have to agree with the other reviewers.  If this place was once great, its Yelp page should have been retired when the restaurant changed hands.  Everything at Lahore Karahi is average at best.  

The food is OK, but my socks were not blown off.  Time for an adjustment in spice level. We shared the Saag Panner, Bengan Bharta, Lamb Vindaloo, Bhindi Gosht and Garlic Naan.  While nothing was bad, nothing stood out above currys from Trader Joes.

Additionally, the walls may have been recently painted, but the atmosphere is still severely lacking.  Please explain to me why  restaurants keep the front door open all winter?  Is it so that people don't linger?  Is it to cool off the kitchen?  What does that tell you about how much they respect their patrons?

What it does have going for it is it's cheap.  Out the door for under $12 a person.

excerpts: The garlic naan was very garlicky.
At the end of the meal the Tandoori Fish came out.
Wow.
It was totally worth waiting for.
It's unlike any fish dish I've had before.
Fresh (coriander, lime?) and hot (chilies).
garlic naan.author: Jean K.
garlic naan.review:
Although Shalimar is still my favorite place for curry, Lahore Kahari is right up there.  While at Shalimar I prefer the vegetarian curries, at Lahore Kahari it's the fish that really shines.  On the recommendation of Yelpers I ordered the Tandoori Fish and Bengan Bartha.  

Here I'll have to digress and give you some tips to ease your time here.  The owner is the cook.  The only cook.  So do yourself a favor and do not come here with a group of 10 people during lunch.  You can imagine how long it took to cook dishes for our table plus the other tables with only 1 cook and 2 burners.  If you do come here hungry, the food comes out in the order of 1) biryani, 2) curry and 3) tandoori.  They were nice and gave us dishes of complimentary pappadams.  Also, if the chai tea runs out, they will make more last, after all the food is finishes and the kitchen is quiet.  I'm not complaining; I want my food.  Just FYI.

The Bengan Bartha was really smooth and smoky.  Not too oily.  I would recommend this.  While I was waiting for my Tandoori Fish I had the opportunity to try the Chicken Biryani (good) and Chicken (korma).  The naan was pretty good but not amazing like I was expecting.  The garlic naan was very garlicky.  At the end of the meal the Tandoori Fish came out.  Wow.  It was totally worth waiting for.  It's unlike any fish dish I've had before.  Fresh (coriander, lime?) and hot (chilies).  I also recommend the Fish Tikka Masala.  Not quite a traditional Tikka Masala sauce but very good.  

I would go back just for the Tandoori Fish.

excerpts: The tandoori fish was the highlight of my culinary week, and the garlic naan was incredible.
garlic naan.author: Jeremy A.
garlic naan.review: Excellent! Not my favorite part of town at night, but definitely worth it. The tandoori fish was the highlight of my culinary week, and the garlic naan was incredible.

excerpts: i ordered the lamb samosas, garlic naan, fish tikka masala and mango lassi.
the samosas, naan and lassi were perfect.
the tikka masala sauce was a wee bit too watery and the color is a little too light and not spicy-
it didn't have enough cumin, cayenne pepper, or paprika.
the fish itself was done very well-
garlic naan.author: The Hangry Chef O.
garlic naan.review:
larhore karahi is a-okay. this little hole in the wall in the heart of the tenderloin does pretty well amongst all the gazillion indian places in the area. the food is good and more importantly, not overpriced. i ordered the lamb samosas, garlic naan, fish tikka masala and mango lassi. the samosas, naan and lassi were perfect. the tikka masala sauce was a wee bit too watery and the color is a little too light and not spicy- it didn't have enough cumin, cayenne pepper, or paprika. the fish itself was done very well- it just falls apart when you put it in your mouth.

so overall 3 stars. why? the place was good but nothing extraordinary. the masala sauce needs a little more spice. they didn't have gulab jamun (crazy! i know) and the staff could definitely crack a smile once in a while.

excerpts: Went with the basics- Chicken tikka masala and Chicken Lahore, garlic naan.
Chicken Lahore was
garlic naan.author: Rebecca S.
garlic naan.review:
When people say things like, "I am going to take you to the best ____ restaurant ever" My expectations are often unmet because the build up was so big. Definitely not the case with Lahore. 

This is a quick, but sketchy walk from Union Square where we stayed. My boyfriend has been raving about this place from college days and no Indian food we have had could ever compare for him. 

Let me tell you, Lahore did not disappoint And I am 100% in agreement with him that this is the best Indian food. 

Went with the basics- Chicken tikka masala and Chicken Lahore, garlic naan.  Chicken Lahore was juicy and flavorful and tikka masala hit the spot. 

Atmosphere is perfect because it feels authentic and they certainly do not try too hard.... It's all about the food. Oh yeah, BYOB.

excerpts: My mixed veggie dish, the Mill Juli Sabzi with accompanying rice and garlic naan, was packed up and I was sent on my way.
garlic naan.author: Justin N.
garlic naan.review:
I walked into this eatery and got kicked square to the face. A shot right in the nose by a little Indian ninja or something.

Metaphorically of course. Kicked in the face with the aroma of a slew of Indian spices, right when I opened the door. Something is lost in restaurants where kitchens are tucked far to the back. The sounds and smells of the food being prepared are part of the journey to a good meal.

I walked in and to the left was the chef on a 4 burner stove, 4 pans of food, all going at once, cooking like a mad man yet still having everything under control. He didn't even looked phased. The smell was captivating.

My food wasn't quite ready so I watched as he rotated through the pans, stirring and tending, tossing and spicing. The line cook was singing away, a sure sign of a happy employee. Happy employees make happy food. The vibe small and welcoming, I was disappointed I had chosen food to go.

My mixed veggie dish, the Mill Juli Sabzi with accompanying rice and garlic naan, was packed up and I was sent on my way. 

I was home for 2 minutes tops before my entire apartment smelled like I had been cooking Indian food all day. Hopefully my neighbors think so and are impressed, then they'll come ask me to cook for them and I can laugh and tell them no. The first bite I took I could tell the meal at a mere $11 was a steal. Many Indian places in SF would charge $11 for the dish alone, and that's before rice, naan, and tax.

I asked for medium to hot on the spicy scale and I could not have asked for it to be more accurate. It was absolutely delicious.

I have to give a shout out to Jessica V. on this one, had she not alerted me to the presence of this joint I'd likely never have even stopped to check a menu.

Soooooooooooo good.

excerpts: Concretely, it's because I ordered a garlic naan and did not get it.
Abstractly, it's because I'm an engineer, and it's my job to obsess over things like efficiency and fault-tolerance.
This is my trade; it's how my brain works.
I simply cannot believe that Lahore Karahi's byzantine order fulfillment methodology is the most effective possible solution.
garlic naan.author: Greg P.
garlic naan.review:
I ate here tonight, and my experience was stupid. It was a stupid experience and it made me angry. This is Yelp, and Yelp is a place where I'm going to talk about my Emotions, and my Emotions after eating at Lahore Karahi were as follows:

(1) Stupid.
(2) Angry.

But hold on, I'm getting ahead of myself. First things first. What did I get? Well, I'm glad you asked! I got the tandoori fish. It was delicious. It was spicy and zesty and sizzling and really kind of unique. I don't know where else in the city I'd get tandoori fish. So good work on the tandoori fish, Lahore Karahi! You tandoori'ed the heck out of that fish. That fish had no idea what was coming to it, and what came to it was a tandoor.

Better still: the menu was generally impressive, and there were a lot of things that I don't normally see on Indian restaurant menus that I wanted to try.

And oh man, that naan sure did look good. It looked very good! It looked better than any naan I've ever seen in my life, and let me tell you, I almost certainly have seen a greater-than-average amount of naan in my life. (Provided you take the average across Americans, rather than a worldwide average, in which case it's actually quite possible that I've seen a lower-than-average amount of naan in my life.)

Which brings me to the "stupid" part of my review.

Look, I'm no restauranteur, so I may be talking out of my butt here. But it seems to me that the problem of taking orders and serving customers has been encountered innumerable times throughout the history of the world, in practically every corner of the planet. Surely the top handful of solutions to this problem would have been determined by now.

For instance, an example methodology might be to have hosts to seat customers and waiters to communicate their orders to the kitchen staff. This is by no means the only possible methodology, nor the most efficient one in every case; it's merely an example of the sort of thing I'm talking about.

Furthermore, the benefits of adopting one of these efficient service methodologies seem clear: increased customer throughput, higher accuracy in fulfilling orders, quicker service, etc. Even if you don't give a care about customer satisfaction, the sheer economic logic of increasing customer throughput seems to demand that you adopt one of these time-tested methodologies.

I mention all this, because as soon as you walk into Lahore Karahi it is apparent that they have closely scrutinized the book of well-established customer service methodologies, stroked their metaphorical chin thoroughly for a few seconds, and then promptly tossed the book over their shoulder with a dismissive, "Naaaaah, we don't need that."

As far as I can tell, this is how it's supposed to go at Lahore Karahi:

- Walk in, grab your own menu, and seat yourself.
- Decide on what you want.
- Walk up to the counter and write down on your ticket what you'd like to order. (!)
- Hand this ticket to someone working behind the counter and sit back down.
- After some indeterminate period of time, someone will walk over to you with your food.
- When you are done eating, you go up to the counter, whereupon someone there will know what you ordered and how much to charge you. You pay and are done.

It is entirely mysterious how they are supposed to know who you are and what you ordered.

It is considerably less mysterious once you consider that they appear to get it wrong a lot of the time.

And this, THIS is what gets my goat. This is the whole point of this ridiculous essay I've written. Concretely, it's because I ordered a garlic naan and did not get it. Abstractly, it's because I'm an engineer, and it's my job to obsess over things like efficiency and fault-tolerance. This is my trade; it's how my brain works. I simply cannot believe that Lahore Karahi's byzantine order fulfillment methodology is the most effective possible solution. And this fact saddens me, and it hurts me inside.

Heck, if this system were *practical* at the expense of pure efficiency, I would be okay with that. Maybe the most theoretically efficient system is weird and difficult to explain and impossible to get people to participate in. But the thing is: so is Lahore Karahi's system! I mean, who the heck has ever written down their own order on the order ticket? How is that a normal thing at all in California? How is anyone supposed to know how to do this a priori?

So you get the worst of both worlds: a system that regularly gets people's orders wrong, yet still burdens the customer with a weird learning curve.

Anyway, that it. That's all I've got. Maybe I'm being a jerky jerk McJerkface for writing this idiotically long and ranty review. Maybe I'm just a close-minded dummy who perceives everything different as being weird and terrible. Maybe I just need to relax, chill out, and recognize that sometimes, occasionally, stuff ain't perfect.

Or maybe everyone needs to just recognize that I'm right about everything, all the time, forever.

excerpts: The tikka masala and garlic naan were very tasty!
Just what we were craving.
Don't forget to order a side of rice, it comes separately.
Will visit again on our next trip.
garlic naan.author: Amy R.
garlic naan.review: A hidden gem! We were on a hunt for tasty tikka masala. A local recommended we try this place, but warned us that it was a "hole in the wall and dirty". We were happily surprised to find thar the restaurant is actually very clean and run by some adorable people. They obviously take pride in their food and location. Sure, its a little older building, but the bathrooms were extremely clean and staff were very friendly and doting. The tikka masala and garlic naan were very tasty! Just what we were craving. Don't forget to order a side of rice, it comes separately. Will visit again on our next trip.

excerpts: The garlic naan was bland and almost stale.
All was mediocre.
The portions were decent.
1 star because we found a roach behind the cup stand after we ate.
Will not be returning.
garlic naan.author: Jacquelynne S.
garlic naan.review: I prefer Chutney which is nearby.  The garlic naan was bland and almost stale.  All was mediocre.  The portions were decent.  1 star because we found a roach behind the cup stand after we ate.  Will not be returning.

excerpts: Get the lamb vindaloo, garlic naan, and butter chicken!
I like that they spent 20+ minutes to make my food - signs of quality and freshness!
garlic naan.author: Gina H.
garlic naan.review: The best Indian restaurant in SF so far. Get the lamb vindaloo, garlic naan, and butter chicken! I like that they spent 20+ minutes to make my food - signs of quality and freshness!

excerpts: Got the garlic naan, lamb vindaloo, and fish curry.
All of the meat was perfectly tender with great flavor.
The spiciness definitely builds.
The flavor was great, but didn't overpower the taste of the meat.
Wanted to try the samosas too, but unfortunately they were sold out.
Maybe another time.
garlic naan.author: Tiffany C.
garlic naan.review: Honestly I'm not a great judge of indian food.  Got the garlic naan, lamb vindaloo, and fish curry.  All of the meat was perfectly tender with great flavor.  The spiciness definitely builds.  The flavor was great, but didn't overpower the taste of the meat.  Wanted to try the samosas too, but unfortunately they were sold out.  Maybe another time.

excerpts: We got 3 dishes (lamb korti, ckn tikka masala and a green pea potato and nut dish) and garlic naan for ~$26.
garlic naan.author: Jessica S.
garlic naan.review:
Yummy Indian food. I wish I hadn't gotten medium spice, because it was a bit spicy, but it was still yummy.

This place gets crowded, so expect to wait for a seat for at least 20 minutes in peak times. 

Also, pretty cheap. We got 3 dishes (lamb korti, ckn tikka masala and a green pea potato and nut dish) and garlic naan for ~$26. 

It's just hard to bring leftovers home from this place because it's in the TL. (Your bound to have someone ask for your food, and I just feel bad if I'm being selfish, and just want to save it for tomorrow's lunch)

I don't know why Indian food takes so long, but a couple who sat after us were smart and ordered while they were waiting before they were sat. I was super jealous, and I'll use that tip next time.

excerpts: The chicken karahi is unbelievable, and the garlic naan is no joke either.
The dishes are actually spicy which is more than I can say for most other places.
garlic naan.author: Mike G.
garlic naan.review:
This is the best indian food I've had in the city! The chicken karahi is unbelievable, and the garlic naan is no joke either. The dishes are actually spicy which is more than I can say for most other places. I can't wait to come back.

I've heard that they have up to two employees, but right now from what I've seen, this is a one man show, so be prepared to wait--but boy, do good things come to those who wait! It seems like any bad reviews here are focused on dinner taking 45 min or more for the food to come out, which I just expect if I'm getting Lahore Karahi...

excerpts: The spices/the color of food/the sprinkles of raw ginger/the perfect Garlic naan or the oily curry (needed to blend the spice and bring out the flavor) are there in the right amounts and hit the right tone with the customer.
garlic naan.author: Akshay K.
garlic naan.review:
Playing second child to other establishments of the Tenderloin such as Shalimar is Lahore Karahi.

Although the food is rotund, the place is lacking character. The fewer number of people coming to this establishment could be adding to it.

However, when it comes to flavors of the Sind region they are all there.

The spices/the color of food/the sprinkles of raw ginger/the perfect Garlic naan or the oily curry (needed to blend the spice and bring out the flavor) are there in the right amounts and hit the right tone with the customer.

I would like to call out the Sheek kebab to mention that is feels more processed compared to the other places and if you are going for a sheek kebab roll, then this is not the place for it.

I must add a note about the new or the old owners, they are always smiling and very receptive.

There is room for improvement in the Lahore Karahi. I am going with a generous 3 stars!

excerpts: Their garlic naan and the chicken tikka masala may have brought all the forgiveness from this impatient fatty (didn't like their fish tandoori however).
It was so authentic and tasty.
Garlic naan was fresh, thin but slightly chewy and went so well with their tikka masala's sauce.
Great pricing as well.
garlic naan.author: Jang David K.
garlic naan.review:
If you have over an hour to waste after you order the food, you found the right restaurant!  

If you want to get your own plates, water, utensils and WRITE DOWN your order to hand it to the server in the front, you found the right restaurant!

You wait and do all the work to get your food here.  It's self seating and gotta go to the counter to pay as well.  I'm surprised they didn't ask me to cook my own dish and clean the bathroom while waiting.  

One chef in a small open kitchen cooking one order at a time, this place just tests your patience.  Their garlic naan and the chicken tikka masala may have brought all the forgiveness from this impatient fatty (didn't like their fish tandoori however).  It was so authentic and tasty.  Garlic naan was fresh, thin but slightly chewy and went so well with their tikka masala's sauce.  Great pricing as well.

excerpts: Tandoori fish is their specialty and a must with a more than ample portion - get the garlic naan on the side.
garlic naan.author: K S.
garlic naan.review: Small and cozy...and not fancy but delicious. It's all about the food and the food is delicious. Tandoori fish is their specialty and a must with a more than ample portion - get the garlic naan on the side.

excerpts: The garlic naan came out hot n toasty-
just how I like it.
garlic naan.author: Petri Y.
garlic naan.review:
Came here after the "new owner" conversation so I really didnt know the difference between old and new. Came on a sunday afternoon and found parking right away across the st!

It was 2pm, hardly anyone in there but the place was clean and neat and orderly. There were 2 cooks behind the counter who greeted us upon coming in. From the reviews i expected a REAL hole in the wall bu was surprised to find there were actual tables and chairs and even table side service now.

You still order at the counter but they bring you your food and everything is cooked to order.
The garlic naan came out hot n toasty- just how I like it. I could eat this all day with their curries!

We also had the chicken vindaloo- which is pretty standard and it was really good, + a lamb dish- tasty and the vegetarian dish with the tofu inside (I forgot the name) + basmati rice.

Everything was super delicious, and hot and spicy.

The portions could be bigger for $9 a plate but its perfect for two to get a few dishes to share.

While we were eating, we saw a indian couple pull up in a SL that ran in to get their take out. Hey, if its good for them, then its good for us!

A new indian fav for me in the hood!

excerpts: Barring the biryani, the other dishes we ordered-chicken karahi, kheema naan, garlic naan were pretty reasonable.
garlic naan.author: Minu M.
garlic naan.review:
If you claim to be an Indian/Pakistani restaurant then it is is imperative to get the biryani right, period. 
The biryani served here is pakki biryani (as opposed to kachi). It takes considerable amount of expertise to get kachi biryani right.
