The first spoonful of the biryani had a strong taste of unwashed rice. It is good not to wash the rice to retain the nutrients but this left a strong unpleasant taste. Also, the best chicken biryani is made with all parts of chicken, the dark meat tastes the best. The version here was just made with breast meat. Biryani typically has multiple layers of flavors but they used an overdose of green chillies rendering the dish singular flavored and extremely spicy.

Barring the biryani, the other dishes we ordered-chicken karahi, kheema naan, garlic naan were pretty reasonable.

excerpts: The garlic naan is delicious and it's made from scratch.
I also had the tikka masala which was also gloriously tasty and spicy.
garlic naan.author: Charlie A.
garlic naan.review:
Christ!! Absolutely the best Pakistani/Indian food I've EVER HAD!

The garlic naan is delicious and it's made from scratch. I also had the tikka masala which was also gloriously tasty and spicy. The chef/owner is very generous with the portions and friendly.

But friends, the tandoori fish was off the fucking chain, yo! Maybe it's because I was drunk when I first walked in, but this place was unlike any I have ever been before. 

I highly recommend it just for the fish.

excerpts: The garlic naan is thin and too crispy.
Omg, I think Trader Joes' garlic naan tastes better.
garlic naan.author: Novalina N.
garlic naan.review:
Not sure what the big deal is but most of the food that I try here isn't that great. I really want to like this place because I haven't found my favorite Indian place in the city yet.

The lamb biryani is really dry. I need to keep drinking water while eating it. The chicken karahi is not bad, but a bit too salty. The garlic naan is thin and too crispy. Omg, I think Trader Joes' garlic naan tastes better.

The tandoori chicken however tastes really good, as most people point out. I haven't tried the tandoori fish yet, maybe I'll come back some other time just to try that one dish.

excerpts: If I were to recommend something, I would say chicken tikka masala and garlic naan.
But there were lots more, rather, all of them more.
Please ask someone who is good at describing Pakistani food because all I can say is, "yes, and again.
garlic naan.author: Ellenor L.
garlic naan.review:
I don't remember what those dishes were called, and I'm not going to bother trying. They were all good. All of them. If I were to recommend something, I would say chicken tikka masala and garlic naan. But there were lots more, rather, all of them more. Please ask someone who is good at describing Pakistani food because all I can say is, "yes, and again." The wait is annoying, but worth it, and for some reason, I don't feel the after-indian-food urges, which is a great sign.

Go again? Why yes!

excerpts:
Garlic naan took awhile to get to our table, and luckily we got them in two separate intervals so the second batch was fresh and warm...yumm...

Butter Chicken - Tandoori chicken pieces cooked in a creamy/buttery sauce was just perfect to scoop up with the garlic naan.
garlic naan.author: Casey L.
garlic naan.review:
BYOB and write up your own order! My friend decided on Lahore and Karahi and opted to even bring the wine and beer. Grabbing a free table, hellos were exchanged and foolishly we didn't realize we had to write out own menu, good thing we caught it early on and the person with the most legible handwriting wrote up the menu. 

Wait time for our food was longer than expected, but we did read how there is one chef making everyone's order so good conversation mixed with alcohol helped pass the time.

Samosas were a good bite but wasn't as crispy as I wanted them to be.

Garlic naan took awhile to get to our table, and luckily we got them in two separate intervals so the second batch was fresh and warm...yumm...

Butter Chicken - Tandoori chicken pieces cooked in a creamy/buttery sauce was just perfect to scoop up with the garlic naan. 

Lamb looked and smelled amazing, but I couldn't have any at the time, but the general comment was it had a nice strong spicy kick to it. 

Eggplant was a nice change of pace to our palates, by means of nonmeat, but it was good and spicy as well, so I found myself sucking down on water by the end of the night. 

Parking can be atrocious in the Tenderloin if you opt to find a free meter after hours. Décor was nothing special, and felt cramp most times, but for the food we received and the experience we got, I'll gladly suffer anytime. Food overall had a nice spicy taste so be warned for those who don't like spicy food, but the flavor hits the mark and that's all I could ever hope for. Make sure to grab a free table or prepare to wait, write your own menu, and grab a bottle to help lighten the mood. Yes, prepare to wait if you don't see a free table, and the food will come out relatively slow if there is a packed house.

excerpts: We think our garlic naan went to wrong table
garlic naan.author: Foodlover B.
garlic naan.review:
We really loved the flavors of everything but of the four dishes we ordered, two were wrong and it may be because we were there late last night, after 10 p.m. And he ran out of BENGAN BHARTIIA - And pawned the plain daal on us.  We think our garlic naan went to wrong table so we got the sesame naan towards end of meal

The lamb boti was very good, but take it off the sizzling plate as soon as it arrives at your table because it quickly over cooks and inedible (took remainder home to our dogs)

Our favorite was the saag panner.  The mango lassi was weird.

I don't know if we will ever go back because the whole process of writing your order and getting all the plates and drinks in a cramped smoky setting was not worth it to us.  Even though the other diners were fun and friendly and asking about what we ordered.

It is the best of all the Pakistani restaurants in the area, we usually alternate among all of them

  But trying to sneak wrong dishes leaves a bad vibe.......

excerpts: Some favorites included a ground beef dish, garlic naan, and the sesame naan.
garlic naan.author: Andrea R.
garlic naan.review:
If you haven't packed enough clothes for your 10 day trip in SF and plan on repeating outfits this probably isn't the restaurant for you.  My clothes from last night's dinner at Lahore Karahi absolutely reek of Indian food...guess I won't be wearing those again on this trip!

Lahore Karahi was worth the smelly clothes!  By far the best Indian food I've enjoyed in a long time (or perhaps ever!).  Miriam W did the honor of ordering for our party of 10 so I had no idea what was coming out to our table.  I had a bit of everything and it was all fabulous (well besides the tandori fish...didn't like that one!). Some favorites included a ground beef dish, garlic naan, and the sesame naan. Can you tell I love my naan?

Oh, and BYOB too- an added bonus to make up for the smelly clothes!

excerpts:
$7
Garlic Naan...
He was kneading fresh balls of dough as he made ours fresh...
garlic naan.author: Kevin D.
garlic naan.review:
This place is somewhere that is all about the food. If your in search of ambiance, and great service (if at all) then don't expect to find it at Lahore Karahi. The owner/chef is full of smiles and is eager to engage his customers in friendly conversation. Everything made here is all home made from what I can tell, and the food is outstanding, and very reasonably priced:

Vegetable Samosas... 2 Large, flaky, aromatic boys for $3
Tikka Masala... Not your run of the mill same old shit, traditional and un-real! $ 7.50
Lamb Korma... Succulent and tender pieces of lamb in a zesty curry only $7.50
Saag Paneer... So far the best spinach and cheese ive ever had. $7
Garlic Naan... He was kneading fresh balls of dough as he made ours fresh... $2.50
Basmati Rice... Somehow this rice stood out all on its own among great dishes... $2

Bottom line... $30 for a meal that would probably cost at least double this much at any other of the so called "traditional" indian joints here in the city. Expect to find good food at a great price with a very casual and laid back atmosphere at Lahore.

excerpts:
butter chicken - rich, nutty, creamy
Lahore rice - nice blend of flavored rice cooked on karahi
Tandoori roti - simple all purpose traditional unleavened bread 
garlic naan - crispy, smokey and garlicky simplicity
garlic naan.author: Daidan J.
garlic naan.review:
Truly one of the best Lahori cuisine in Sf!  Coming from San Jose This has been our 4th times eating here. And in every visit, we always come to appreciate this place as having the authenticity of Pakistani cuisine.

Seekh kebab - succulent and complex mixed of spices 
fish tandoori - chef's specialty - spicy, flavorful, and scrumptious (quite rare in pakistani cuisine)
lamb biryani - complex, nutty, tangy, smokey 
butter chicken - rich, nutty, creamy
Lahore rice - nice blend of flavored rice cooked on karahi
Tandoori roti - simple all purpose traditional unleavened bread 
garlic naan - crispy, smokey and garlicky simplicity 

This place is a treasure!

excerpts: Followed the advice of some other Yelpers and had the Chicken Tikka Masala and garlic naan.
It will haunt my dreams.
garlic naan.author: Garet M.
garlic naan.review: Followed the advice of some other Yelpers and had the Chicken Tikka Masala and garlic naan. It will haunt my dreams.

excerpts: We ordered garlic naan, lamb curry, lamb chops, & tandoori chicken.
The food took a while, but the guy who took our order did say it would take 15 min, more like 30!
But that was ok
, they allow you to have free chai tea.
garlic naan.author: susan w.
garlic naan.review: The 3 of us got there around 6:20, so no problem parking right in front & not real busy. We ordered garlic naan, lamb curry, lamb chops, & tandoori chicken. The food took a while, but the guy who took our order did say it would take 15 min, more like 30! But that was ok, they allow you to have free chai tea. Anyways, the 2 lamb dishes were very tasty, the chicken a little dry, the basmati rice yummy, & the naan a generous portion. If we go back, but I won't order the tandoori chicken again. Tip included, I paid $63! Kinda a lot for a whole in the wall, and don't lean on the walls!! Saw a roach crawling on it!! Saw Tycoon Thai right next door...looked much cleaner!

excerpts: and I have to say that I think their garlic naan may be the best naan I've ever had anywhere.
garlic naan.author: Dani D.
garlic naan.review:
I have to remember to not show up already starving on a Friday or Saturday night... depending on when you show up on those nights you may have a bit of a wait (I've waited as long as half an hour for a party of two). On my most recent visit this weekend, we waited 20 minutes for two.

But with the delicious food and cheap prices, the wait is definitely worth it.  I eat a lot of Indian and Pakistani food and I have to say that I think their garlic naan may be the best naan I've ever had anywhere.

I usually order the Chicken Vindaloo and their version is perfectly spicy with plenty of pieces of chicken and potatoes.

One of these days I will remember the BYOB and stop at the liquor store on my way here...

excerpts:
Two experiences in the last week:

1) Chicken Tikka + Garlic Naan.
garlic naan.author: Jerry T.
garlic naan.review:
Sadly, this place has completely fallen off. Once the owner left the dishes are not just different - but bad! Two experiences in the last week:

1) Chicken Tikka + Garlic Naan. The Chicken TIkka curry had the consistency of water (no exaggeration, it was colored, flavorless water). The chicken was bone dry and completely flavorless.

I thought it was an off night...

2) Bhuna Gosht and Naan - naan was fine, but the BG was bland and drab; I even ordered it spicy and it was just not there.

Burn me once? Shame on thee. Burn me twice? Shame on me.

This is really sad because under the old owner this place was by far the best and most reliable Indian / Pakistani place in SF. Someone get out the black arm band...

excerpts:
* Aloo Paratha
* Garlic Naan
* Tandoori Roti
The sprinkle of sesame seeds on the garlic naan is a nice touch.
Though personally, I prefer my naan to be a little thicker, more pillowy (can't say I've found good naan outside of Old Delhi, honestly).
garlic naan.author: Tak N.
garlic naan.review:
TL;DR: For now, as long as Zulfiqar is manning the stove, my go to place for solid Punjabi food in the Bay Area. 


It might seem that I have universal contempt for veg fare, though that's not really true. The fact of the matter is that, more often than not, veg dishes at many Punjabi joints here well... suck. That the non-veg dishes never quite measure up to my expectations either--well I figure, better to just cut my losses. 

What's missing exactly? Some kind of weltanschauung--a totality of experience--encompassing the things we love and the art to express it? 

Difficult to imagine in a status obsessed, foodie-ville like SF, but opulence and cost have nothing to do with it. Some of my most memorable meals in the subcontinent were for less than a dollar... 

For example, in Old Delhi, Ustad Moinuddin's seekh kababs, made at a tiny street-side charcoal brazier on a congested side lane down from the old haveli of the great Urdu poet Ghalib, are probably the best I've ever had (or will have). While President Clinton can shell out 25 USD for a plate at Bukhara, I'm happy to know that a cycle-rickshaw-wallah can get equal (or better) ones at 4 Rs (10 cents) a pop (this was after a 1 Rs price hike a few years ago). Ustad Moinuddin-ji could easily charge double or triple, but I think that it's not just about money, but about art, along with an obstinate refusal to compromise. 

***



THE REVIEW:

For now Lahore Karahi will be my go to place for Punjabi khanna. This is the first place I've been to in the Bay Area where both the non-veg and veg items were done equally well. The food is honest, straightforward--reflecting something of the cook's dedication and skill. Definitely not trying to ingratiate itself to local tastes. While inexpensive, (like nita m. said below) if you choose well, you can get some amazing food.

The dishes:

* Butter Chicken
* Palak Paneer
* Dal Makhani
* Aloo Paratha
* Garlic Naan
* Tandoori Roti
* Raita

My measure of a good Punjabi restaurant is how well they make their dal and tandoori rotis. While a North Indian staple, for most restaurants here they are an afterthought. What's more telling about a place is not the specials, but their approach to the basics. To me a flavorless dal, or mediocre tandoori roti reflects a basic lack of skill or respect for the food.  And a shame really, because a good plate of dal accompanied by chawal (rice) or a simple tandoori roti, is to me, basic comfort food.

Zulfiqar, the chef and owner in the kitchen, has a touch. The food actually has personality. The tandoori roti was decent, not some kind of dry cracker, and the dal? Flavorful.

Butter chicken is really what CTM aspires to be. The latter being merely its pale, poultry shadow. LK's version was a little heavy on the fenugreek and onion for my tastes and lacked a hint of sweetness, but was decent. But what really stood out was the palak paneer. 

Compared to other places the flavors were distinct and had depth. The paneer was fried to a golden color with brown edges, giving it a nice firm texture. 

As far as the bread goes, it's okay. The aloo paratha was decent, better than the one that I had at Kabana. The sprinkle of sesame seeds on the garlic naan is a nice touch. Though personally, I prefer my naan to be a little thicker, more pillowy (can't say I've found good naan outside of Old Delhi, honestly). And the fact that they can make tandoori roti already speaks volumes. 

The only thing that kind of sucked was the raita. While they may make their own yogurt at the restaurant--which is great--the raita was way too tart, with a bit of a 'carbonated' taste from being overly fermented.

Sans hipsters, all-in-all, LK could be a neighborhood joint in Delhi or Lahore. Like some other reviewers said, if you're missing real Punjabi food, I recommend this place.


Service was friendly, prompt and good. 

Cleanliness-wise: during our wait for a table, a roach did double duty as a greeter on a stack of Urdu newspapers by the entrance. Though I'm not really all that squeamish and don't care that much, it does detract from the overall experience.

excerpts: garlic naan
garlic naan.author: Jenny L.
garlic naan.review:
Definite benefits in having a big group come to Lahore.  That way, you get to try everything, and you're not the only one walking down the street smelling like Indian food.

+ byob.  $10 for a 6-pack at the corner liquor store.  makes all the difference.
+ butter chicken
+ chicken tikka masala
+ chicken vandaloo
+ lamb biryani
+ aloo bengan
+ saag paneer
+ naan
+ onion kulcha
+ garlic naan

Maybe I'm not too good at distinguishing all the different flavors of the dishes, but after 10 minutes, everything started to taste the same to me.

At least I walked out full and happy.

excerpts: Garlic Naan, $2.50, very good.
Total price: $18.00, and
garlic naan.author: Dan C.
garlic naan.review:
Lamb Korma, $7.00, very good.
Bengan Bharta, $6.50, Delicious!
Lahore Karahi Rice, $2.00, very good. 
Garlic Naan, $2.50, very good. 
Total price: $18.00, and I had plenty for lunch the next day. 

I was skeptical, given the reviews, however, I arrived on Sunday at 6:05pm, and was able to order right away. Dining room was only 2/3 full.  20 minutes later, I had my entire order, no problem.  Right after I ate, I paid for an extra order of rice, and got it right away. In all, I was there less than 50 minutes.  

Perhaps arriving when they're busy would be a different experience.  But coming when it's slow was perfectly fine.  The tables could have been cleaner, but that's my only complaint.

excerpts: Garlic Naan was pretty tasty.
I think the other two dishes we got were vegetarian, the Galoo Gobhi (cauliflower and potato) and Aloo Bengan (eggplant and potato).
They were both bleh to me.
Might be because I'm a carnivore
and I'm not happy unless there's meat.
Everything was spicy too.
garlic naan.author: Jane N.
garlic naan.review:
I had been craving Indian food so I thought just as long as I had butter chicken or chicken tikka masala, I'd be good.  Sadly I left this place feeling unsatisfied and a bit annoyed.

It's a small place and always crowded, so be prepared to wait.  You're not going to just be waiting for a seat, but you're going to be waiting for your food also.  My friends and I came super hungry and it took an hour to get our food.  Not sure if it's because they didn't put in our order, but the fact that they only have one cook (and one guy making the naan) probably didn't help matters.  They also got our order wrong but since we were so hungry, we didn't care and just took whatever dish they made us.

The butter chicken was easily the favorite dish amongst our table.  Garlic Naan was pretty tasty.  I think the other two dishes we got were vegetarian, the Galoo Gobhi (cauliflower and potato) and Aloo Bengan (eggplant and potato).  They were both bleh to me.  Might be because I'm a carnivore and I'm not happy unless there's meat.  Everything was spicy too.  Two of my friends were dying.

In the end, I wasn't very impressed.  There's better Indian food around where you don't have to wait around forever for everything.

excerpts: ...wrap these in there fresh garlic naan, yummm...
Chicken Tikka Masala- chicken breast in creamy tomato sauce, delish...
Don't forget to order extra garlic naan, the meal is not complete without it!!
Also if sensitive on spiciness make sure to ask for medium spice level, seems to be spicier than some other Pakistani spots I've been to...definitely cleared my sinuses haha
Warning: refrain from planning any dates/meetings/social interaction after leaving this place without leaving time for multiple showers and a change of clothing
, you will smell like a walking bowl of curry!
garlic naan.author: Mahsa K.
garlic naan.review:
Talk about value! Best Pakistani food I've had at a eatery that doesn't burn a hole in your pocket....
Favs: 
Tandoori Mixed Grill- probably the most expensive dish on the menu at a whooping $11, awesome :), came with a mix of marinated chicken & lamb on a sizzling platter...wrap these in there fresh garlic naan, yummm...
Chicken Tikka Masala- chicken breast in creamy tomato sauce, delish...
Don't forget to order extra garlic naan, the meal is not complete without it!! Also if sensitive on spiciness make sure to ask for medium spice level, seems to be spicier than some other Pakistani spots I've been to...definitely cleared my sinuses haha 
Warning: refrain from planning any dates/meetings/social interaction after leaving this place without leaving time for multiple showers and a change of clothing, you will smell like a walking bowl of curry!

excerpts: Our favorite meal:  chicken tikka massala, safron rice and garlic naan.
mmm mmm good
garlic naan.author: Jeanine M.
garlic naan.review:
My only question, "Why didn't I know about this place years ago???"

My boyfriend and I have been coming here for the last two years, and we have NEVER been disappointed. 

Reasons: 
Tasty food. friendly staff. Clean environment. and the food comes reasonably quick. 
They also make it fresh right after you order! 
The seating is a little small, but I find it cozy!

Basically, we travel from castro valley all the way here JUST to eat this delicious food. How could it not get 5 stars?

Our favorite meal:  chicken tikka massala, safron rice and garlic naan. 
mmm mmm good

excerpts: bread - garlic naan and onion kulcha - which were VERY GOOD, definitely freshly made - warm and chewy and generously studded with garlic and onion and cilantro.
garlic naan.author: cecilia y.
garlic naan.review:
When I first heard the name of this restaurant I snickered to myself because I am five.

Had two types of bread - garlic naan and onion kulcha - which were VERY GOOD, definitely freshly made - warm and chewy and generously studded with garlic and onion and cilantro.  The two curries, chicken tikka masala and matar paneer (peas and cheese) were a bit on the creamy, buttery side, but well balanced salt and spice-wise.

Really rich and filling meal, but it hit the Indian comfort food spot. Service was a bit slow, but the waiters were friendly and sweet, so whatever. I don't expect to be waited on hand and foot at a hole in the wall place in the tenderloin.

Bill was under $30 for the two curries and two naans (naan? Can it be plural?).

excerpts: We had sag paneer, lamb boti and garlic naan which were excellent, and the prices were too.
Another
plus - it's BYOA
and you can make your purchases from any of the nearby corner shops.
Several tables had brought wine.
The host was happy to lend us a bottle opener, too!
I wish they didn't have TVs on
but they're easy to ignore.
I'll definitely be back when I need my Pakistani/Indian food fix again!
garlic naan.author: Sean C.
garlic naan.review: On a Friday night the place was crowded but tables still opened up regularly. We had sag paneer, lamb boti and garlic naan which were excellent, and the prices were too. Another plus - it's BYOA and you can make your purchases from any of the nearby corner shops. Several tables had brought wine. The host was happy to lend us a bottle opener, too! I wish they didn't have TVs on but they're easy to ignore. I'll definitely be back when I need my Pakistani/Indian food fix again!

excerpts: The garlic naan is wonderful.
garlic naan.author: Margaret C.
garlic naan.review:
Yum!  This place is divine!  A friend and I were in the mood for meat and we ordered Chicken Tikka Masala and Saag Gosht.  Both were flavorful and delicious.  The garlic naan is wonderful.  I was wired from the complimentary chai all day, so be forewarned: one cup is enough.  

Great prices and friendly, helpful service.  I'll definitely be back.

excerpts: Got the Chicken Curry, Lamb Vindaloo, Potato Naan, two orders of Garlic Naan, and Fish Tandoori.
They forgot one of our garlic naan orders.
The food was good but not as awesome as it should be for the long wait and long line up.
Overall the whole restaurant was a little dirty.
garlic naan.author: K S.
garlic naan.review: Went on a Saturday night, around 9ish... had to wait in line and then waited forever for our food. The place was packed and the lineup never ended and was out the door the whole time we were there. Got the Chicken Curry, Lamb Vindaloo, Potato Naan, two orders of Garlic Naan, and Fish Tandoori. They forgot one of our garlic naan orders. The food was good but not as awesome as it should be for the long wait and long line up. Overall the whole restaurant was a little dirty.

excerpts: Garlic naan was really good, came out nice fresh and hot!
garlic naan.author: Amy L.
garlic naan.review:
My rating might be bias because my knees gets weak even from the smell of Pakistani/Indian cuisine. Walked in to a little tiny restaurant, pretty packed. People were waiting to be seated but the wait was less than 10 minutes. It get's super smoky inside, cleaniness? not so much. 

Sat down to a dirty table but the waiter came right away to clean it. Served us water and gave us our menus. We ordered the Chicken tikka masala, an eggplant curry, a lamb curry and 4 naan's (3 regular and a garlic).

Chicken Tikka masala came out with the naan's and then the eggplant. I love chicken tikka masala and this one was pretty good. There were sprinkles of pistachios on top which made it look pretty and if you bite into a bigger chunk you get that bit of pistachio flavor which is nice because I like pistachios. Chicken was pretty tender, not dried. Very flavorful, we ordered mild so it was not overly spicy.

Eggplant curry was ok, the flavor didn't stood out in any particular way. Lamb curry, my friend said it was pretty good. I didn't really eat too much of the lamb because of the game-y taste.

Garlic naan was really good, came out nice fresh and hot! Tons of garlic on top. 

Food was good, waiting time for our food was a bit long...price is decent.

excerpts: I had the tandoori chicken, garlic naan (perfect complement to the curries here...), aloo tikki, and lamb vindaloo, and couldn't find a fault with anything I ordered.
garlic naan.author: Joshua L.
garlic naan.review:
Food: 5 stars - I was told to come here for authenticity and spiciness, and Lahore Karahi delivered. I had the tandoori chicken, garlic naan (perfect complement to the curries here...), aloo tikki, and lamb vindaloo, and couldn't find a fault with anything I ordered.

Service: 3 stars - This place is understaffed, and service times reflect that.

Price: 5 stars - Food good enough to be fat for the stomach, cheap enough to be lean on the wallet. Win.

excerpts: For main course, we ordered Vegetable Korma, Bhindi Masala, Roti and Garlic Naan.
The Garlic Naan was good, the Roti was fine, the Bhindi Masala was barely palatable, and the Vegetable Korma was simply un-eatable.
The Garlic Naan was good, the Roti was fine, the Bhindi Masala was barely palatable, and the Vegetable Korma was simply un-eatable.
garlic naan.author: Saurabh G.
garlic naan.review:
Close to the worst Indian/Pakistani Food I have ever had in the US over the last 2 years. 

For starters, we ordered Vegetable Pakoras, most of them were over-fried. For main course, we ordered Vegetable Korma, Bhindi Masala, Roti and Garlic Naan. The Garlic Naan was good, the Roti was fine, the Bhindi Masala was barely palatable, and the Vegetable Korma was simply un-eatable. On top of food being absolutely tasteless, there was an overwhelming amount of oil in the entres. 

Apart from the food, the ambience was pretty bad too, and the place could seriously use better cleaning of utensils (yes!!!), and tables.

I would not revisit this place.

excerpts: The garlic naan was pretty amazing.
The lamb was too spicy for me and a bit chewy.
The tikka masal was good as well.
Overall pretty good meals.
However I did order rice and never saw it and the place isn't the cleaniest.
But it is cheap
so I guess you really do get what you pay for.
When I went there was one guy serving the whole restaurant
but we got our food pretty fast,
garlic naan.author: Natalie F.
garlic naan.review:
Wait this place has a website? 

Anywho..this place was okay. I'm not a big fan of Indian food but my girl wanted to try something new. So we went for lunch one day and it was pretty packed..packed and tiny.  The garlic naan was pretty amazing. The lamb was too spicy for me and a bit chewy. The tikka masal was good as well. Overall pretty good meals. However I did order rice and never saw it and the place isn't the cleaniest. But it is cheap so I guess you really do get what you pay for. When I went there was one guy serving the whole restaurant but we got our food pretty fast, just towards the middle of the meal I was getting our own pitcher of water, so don't be surprised if there's moments of self service going on...lol.

Again, I'm not a fan of Indian food but if you are you will probably dig this place.

excerpts: * Garlic Naan - Tasty, but you only get one with an order... hmmm
* Chicken Tikka Marsala - YUM, I always get this at Indian restaurants!
Though I did notice that the curry had a sweet onion like taste, than the more common tomato curry base in other Indian places.
Still tasty!
garlic naan.author: Fried Rice B.
garlic naan.review:
The great thing about this place is that you feel like you're in Uncle Guddu's kitchen... The not so great thing is that come out smelling like you've been in Uncle Guddu's kitchen! LOL... 

A couple of my friends and I checked this place out last night and it was a pretty good overall experience, waited only about five to ten minutes for a table and seated right away. From the first look of the place I thought is small, but when we sat down we didn't feel cramp at all. The place isn't the cleanest, but you get the value you pay for and tastier! 

The great thing is that appetizer are price accordingly, they're lower priced than the main dishes; it kind of bugs me that appetizers are priced the same as main dishes at a lot of restaurants nowadays. The same value system goes for the vegetarian dishes, they're slightly cheaper than meat dishes as they should be! : -) 

Food: 
* Vegetable Fritters - crispy and tasty! 
* Regular Naan - Not greasy and not doughy thick like Naan-N-Curry! That's good thing! 
* Garlic Naan - Tasty, but you only get one with an order... hmmm 
* Chicken Tikka Marsala - YUM, I always get this at Indian restaurants! Though I did notice that the curry had a sweet onion like taste, than the more common tomato curry base in other Indian places. Still tasty! 
* Lamb Saag - This was goood! The lamb was all meat w/o bones and tender 
* Fish Tandoori - YUMMY! My friend said it was a bit dry. I just thought it could have slightly less cooked, but not dry.... You get like six chucks of fish! A good value compared to other places. 

Drinks: 
* Mango Lassi - I think they use fresh mango (not frozen) which is a good thing, but the mango tasted too ripe. So that was bit of a let down. 

Service: 
Considering that there's only one cook, one guy making the naan by orders, and one waiter to take orders and serve the food, the service was fast! There is a guy who process the bills and another guy who wash dishes (?). Great friendly service! 

Go check this place out! Not the cleanest, but we didn't see and bugs that goodness....Lol

excerpts: We ordered samosas, chicken tikka masala, and vindaloo with two orders of garlic naan.
Let me say this, you have not had garlic naan until you have been to Lahore Kahari.
Best.
Naan.
garlic naan.author: David G.
garlic naan.review:
5 stars for the food
3 stars for the speed and service

I finally went here last night with my girlfriend after she told me about it somewhere around 100 times.  We ordered samosas, chicken tikka masala, and vindaloo with two orders of garlic naan.

The food did take forever to get there which is kind of ridiculous considering some people who had to go orders who arrived after us got served first.  

But the food!  The vindaloo is the best, most flavorful, and full of the right kind of spice.  Amazing.  The chicken tikka masala was decent.  Well, I guess just different than the Americanized versions I am used to.  It is not at tomato based as the usual.  I think there was a yogurt base in there.  Not bad, just different.  Let me say this, you have not had garlic naan until you have been to Lahore Kahari.  Best. Naan. Ever.

All in all, a good meal, decent prices, decent service.  Highly reccomended.

excerpts: You MUST get the palak paneer & garlic naan, and the mango kulfi if you want dessert.
The place is a hole in the wall in an unspectacular neighborhood of San Francisco, but is full of well to-do professionals.
By hole in the wall
I mean I didn't drink out of the water glass.
I think it's only the chef & one waiter, so service can be kind of slow but they are very kind.
- Garlic Naan
: Lahore puts garlic and a spice rub on their garlic naan, and it's amazing.
I saw the cook pat out the dough & stick it into the tandoor fresh to order, so the bread came out super soft and warm.
- Mango Kulfi:
Wow.
They make their own homemade, which is amazing on it's own, and it turns out really really good.
The flavors of mango, cream, saffron, pistachio, and a little cardamom come together beautifully.
Chai Tea:
How nice that it's complimentary.
It was a nice end to our meal, and way better than Starbucks.
garlic naan.author: Jasmine A.
garlic naan.review:
Lahore Karahi serves some amazing Indian food with great value. By choosing your dishes carefully you can have a five star meal here. You MUST get the palak paneer & garlic naan, and the mango kulfi if you want dessert. The place is a hole in the wall in an unspectacular neighborhood of San Francisco, but is full of well to-do professionals. By hole in the wall I mean I didn't drink out of the water glass. I think it's only the chef & one waiter, so service can be kind of slow but they are very kind. We had: 

- Palak Paneer: Probably the best palak paneer I've ever had, my mom has ever had, and my dad has ever had (and between the three of us, that is a lot of palak paneer). This stuff is so fresh! The flavor is amazing, the texture is perfect, and it's a must (order two). 
- Lahore Channa: Their channa masala was ok. It's not the best I've ever had, but rounded out our meal nicely. It's a bit more sweet than most, darker in color, and more 'soft' (the garbanzo beans are more mushed up). Also I thought it tasted a little peanut buttery, which is not a flavor commonly found in channas. 
- Aloo Gobhi: This is a dish I would recommend avoiding. It's really oily & doesn't have very good flavor. 
- Garlic Naan: Lahore puts garlic and a spice rub on their garlic naan, and it's amazing. I saw the cook pat out the dough & stick it into the tandoor fresh to order, so the bread came out super soft and warm. 
- Mango Kulfi: Wow. They make their own homemade, which is amazing on it's own, and it turns out really really good. The flavors of mango, cream, saffron, pistachio, and a little cardamom come together beautifully. 
- Chai Tea: How nice that it's complimentary. It was a nice end to our meal, and way better than Starbucks.

excerpts: Loved the chicken tikka masala and garlic naan.
garlic naan.author: Winston S.
garlic naan.review: Best Indian food ever! Loved the chicken tikka masala and garlic naan.

excerpts: The garlic naan, tandoori fish and butter chicken were standouts.
At the time, the restaurant was BYOB
(I'm not sure if it still is) and that was/is an awesome perk!
The new owners were very kind and accommodating!
The new LK is a great idea for groups or even a party of 1.
The bill for our group was very reasonable and the food was outright delicious!
Thank-you, Mr. & Mrs. Sheikh!
Also, don't miss the rice pudding; amazing!
garlic naan.author: Baroness M.
garlic naan.review: I had the pleasure of eating here with a group of co-workers and friends. Our entire group loved all the dishes we ordered. The garlic naan, tandoori fish and butter chicken were standouts. At the time, the restaurant was BYOB (I'm not sure if it still is) and that was/is an awesome perk! The new owners were very kind and accommodating! The new LK is a great idea for groups or even a party of 1. The bill for our group was very reasonable and the food was outright delicious! Thank-you, Mr. & Mrs. Sheikh! Also, don't miss the rice pudding; amazing!

excerpts: Also had the garlic naan
and it was ok.
Saw two other groups of people who had brought their own drinks (six pack of beer)
w/ them.
Service was kind of fast, waited about 10 mins for our food and getting a seat wasn't too bad.
Stopped in here on a Thur evening, probably would try other places before I come back here.
garlic naan.author: Irene L.
garlic naan.review: The food is good here, but not amazing. I liked the cutesy small SF restaurant atmosphere feel. Self service (you even write your own order), but they take credit card. I had the roasted eggplant curry dish. It was good, but a little spicy. Also had the garlic naan and it was ok. Saw two other groups of people who had brought their own drinks (six pack of beer) w/ them. Service was kind of fast, waited about 10 mins for our food and getting a seat wasn't too bad. Stopped in here on a Thur evening, probably would try other places before I come back here.

excerpts: Their garlic naan is the best I've ever had!
Some of their other dishes were slightly powerful in spices but overall, the food was steaming and tasty.
garlic naan.author: Brenda L.
garlic naan.review: Their garlic naan is the best I've ever had!  Some of their other dishes were slightly powerful in spices but overall, the food was steaming and tasty.

excerpts: We also had the plain naan and a garlic naan.
Garlic naan was my fave out of these two.
Tons of spice and really tasty.
garlic naan.author: Heidi L.
garlic naan.review:
Another great hole-in-the-wall find! 

First they gave us papadams on the house and I heart papadams!!

Fish Tikka Masala had a really good amount of fish pieces in it with just the perfect amount of spice. But you can order anything to your spice liking.

Saag Paneer, spinach cooked with cheese and herbs was really rustic tasting because they make the cheese themselves and not at all oily like many of the other Indian/Pakistani restaurants out there.

We also had the plain naan and a garlic naan. Garlic naan was my fave out of these two. Tons of spice and really tasty. They gave us the plain one first and about 10 mins later, the garlic one which was great because who doesn't like "just out of the oven " naan?!

Everything was so good, we ate every last drop and were so full.Can't wait to come back and try their other dishes! One thing, put the fancy clothes away because you'll go home smelling like what you ordered!

excerpts: The lamb vindaloo is a favorite, as well as the tandoori fish, the prawn biryani, and the garlic naan.
Again, I'm not too fond of seafood, but the fish is one of the highlights of the meal when some friends and I ate there.
The chicken tikka masala was a bit sweeter than the tikka masalas I have tried in other restaurants.
garlic naan.author: Samantha A.
garlic naan.review:
I was debating on whether to give this place 4 or 5 stars.

5 stars for the food.  The mere thought of eating there is making my mouth water right now.  Their dishes might be a little too spicy for some who are not used to it, but that's just how I like it.  Mm-hmm!  The lamb vindaloo is a favorite, as well as the tandoori fish, the prawn biryani, and the garlic naan.  Again, I'm not too fond of seafood, but the fish is one of the highlights of the meal when some friends and I ate there.  The chicken tikka masala was a bit sweeter than the tikka masalas I have tried in other restaurants.  It's interesting...

I don't know what to make of the Afghani naan.  On one hand, I liked it because it's fruity and sweet.  On the other hand, I think it's a stand-alone that's more for dessert than for dipping in curry.  I also LOVED the pistachio (?) ice cream they gave us in the end.  I'm not sure what it's called though.

Minus 1 star because of the service, the location, and the ambiance.  It's in the Tenderloin--what more can I say?  It's hard to get a table.  And for the busy-ness of the place, I think they are understaffed even if they really try to cater to every customer.  They were pretty fast when it comes to take-outs though.

All in all, I say, don't be fooled by the interior/exterior of this restaurant.  It's one of the best Indian/ Pakistani restaurants I have been to--if only for the food!

excerpts: I usually get the garlic naan, biryani, and palak paneer.
They have the most amazing piping-hot samosas I've had outside of India!
garlic naan.author: Anubhav J.
garlic naan.review:
The other reviews say it all. The best Indian food in town. And inexpensive. 

I usually get the garlic naan, biryani, and palak paneer. They have the most amazing piping-hot samosas I've had outside of India!

excerpts: But yeah, I ordered the Garlic naan, and when he brought it to my table, I was intoxicated by the amount of garlic in it.
garlic naan.author: Xavier G.
garlic naan.review:
I went here on a suggestion from a friend, surprisingly it was only 2 blocks from my house, and I never noticed it. Anyway, it was pretty good for Indian food, which I'm not a huge fan of.

This was probably the only Indian restaurant in the city where the Naan didn't taste burnt, haha. But yeah, I ordered the Garlic naan, and when he brought it to my table, I was intoxicated by the amount of garlic in it. :) Loved it!

I also ordered the Prawn Curry, and it wasn't bad. It was spicy but not overly so. I didn't finish it though, because like I said, not a huge fan of Indian food.

The total was $15 so not too expensive but not too cheap, but now that I think about it, my meal could have fed two people, so then $7.50 isn't a bad deal.

The service itself was kind of 3 starsish...My waiter didn't know how to use the credit card machine so I had to wait until the owner came back. Kind of weird...

**Oh uber uber bonus for having free chai. Luckily my friend told me about it, or I would never had noticed it. It's not on the menu, but you have to go up for self service chai, and I think self service water, bc my waiter never filled my glass back up. But yeah, the chai was pretty tasty, with sugar, without sugar it tasted pretty awful. Not too sure why that is. Maybe it's super healthy? But yeah the main reason this place is 4 stars instead of 3 is for the free chai. :)

excerpts: Garlic naan is delic!
garlic naan.author: Romita J.
garlic naan.review: Lamb vindaloo, tandoori fish are decent. Garlic naan is delic!

excerpts: We also ordered some garlic naan, rice and some chicken & lamb kebobs.
garlic naan.author: Timothy W.
garlic naan.review:
In a word Yumm!  This place has really good Indian food.  We went the safe route and ordered Tikka Masala and the Vindaloo and we asked for both to be spicy.  We also ordered some garlic naan, rice and some chicken & lamb kebobs.  All of the food tasted great, super fresh and super tasty!

The resto is located only a few blocks from Union Square, albeit a few shady blocks but it's worth the walk (and the risk;-).  I could see the casual visitor being dissuaded from dining here since it's not the cleanest of establishments.  In any case if you've done your homework you know what this place is all about.

The prices were really affordable, I'm not sure how this guy stays in business...   It cost us $50 for a party of three.  Easily the most affordable meal that we've had while we've been in San Francisco.

One last thing, the owner \ cook reminds me of Babu from Seinfeld...  "You very bad man!"  :-)

excerpts:
favorite dishes: 
- chicken karahi
- palak paneer
- tandoori fish
- garlic naan
garlic naan.author: Greg D.
garlic naan.review:
tasty indian/pakistani treats!

favorite dishes: 
- chicken karahi
- palak paneer
- tandoori fish
- garlic naan
- plain rice (cooked with cinnamon and cloves -- mmm!)

it's a super tasty dive restaurant (a bit smoky inside; place-settings, water, and chai are self-service; somewhat dated interior design), very casual. go there for the food, you will not be disappointed!

excerpts: The garlic naan was really good, but twice the price of the regular naan.
And don't miss out on the Saag Paneer (spinach cooked with homemade cheese and herbs)!
garlic naan.author: Adrian G.
garlic naan.review:
I've eated at a ton of Indian restaurants (and Indian/Pakistani hybrids for that matter) and this is the best ever!  The tandoori fish is out of this world.  The garlic naan was really good, but twice the price of the regular naan.  And don't miss out on the Saag Paneer (spinach cooked with homemade cheese and herbs)!  The Chicken Tikka Masala is above average, but I've had better.

The food here is about the same quality or better than Amber India, but waaaay cheaper.  The neighborhood is a little seedy, but so what!  Be prepared to wait at least thirty minutes for a table.  And you will smell like food.  It seems the kitchen doesn't have vents, but again, who cares?!!

excerpts: garlic naan was good.
garlic naan.author: Neero D.
garlic naan.review:
self service...wasnt crowded , still took lot of time to deliver the order.
pros: nice appetizers ,tea . garlic naan was good. especially the boti kabab chicken .

cons : Chicken curry wasnt spciy enough , had less salt . 
rotis were too hard.  

Will probably give it one more try.

excerpts: Chicken Tikka Masala was perfect, and the garlic naan was the best I've ever had.
Staff isn't the friendliest but the food was so good that I don't even care.
garlic naan.author: Kimberly C.
garlic naan.review: Food here is amazing. Chicken Tikka Masala was perfect, and the garlic naan was the best I've ever had. Staff isn't the friendliest but the food was so good that I don't even care.

excerpts:
Garlic Naan - VERY GOOD
Chicken Kabab 
- This was pretty spicy, but tasty, please note it's GROUND chicken, so it's a bit of a shaped kabob, but good if you can handle the heat.
Chicken Vindaloo - Amazing.
Vegetable Biryani - Perfect to mix everything with and wrap up in a piece of Naan.
Tandori Fish - Was good, but ours was cold and refired and not as fresh tasting.
garlic naan.author: Mack L.
garlic naan.review:
I'm only NOT giving them a perfect score because of some nitpicky things. Our Tandori fish came out late and cold, then the refire on it was still a bit unsatisfactory, but that is really the biggest negative of the experience at Lahore Karahi and possibly some lack of service here and there.

Me and 3 friends showed up on a Sunday evening around 7pm. We were seated in a couple minutes. 

We ordered:
Vegetable Pakora - Crispy, Tasty and Amazing.
Garlic Naan - VERY GOOD
Chicken Kabab - This was pretty spicy, but tasty, please note it's GROUND chicken, so it's a bit of a shaped kabob, but good if you can handle the heat.
Chicken Vindaloo - Amazing.
Vegetable Biryani - Perfect to mix everything with and wrap up in a piece of Naan.
Tandori Fish - Was good, but ours was cold and refired and not as fresh tasting. Would try this again to see if I missed out on the magic or not.

I saw this restaurant on Check Please Bay Area and I'm so thankful I did. I'm not one to just guess about getting indian/pakistani food. So Yelp and that show gave me the shove I needed to try it out. 

It is now one of my favorite places to eat in SF. 

My belly is smiling.

excerpts: The garlic naan was hot and fresh and rice was tasty.
The bhindi masala was ok.
The okra was a little hard and chewy and overall the dish was oily.
I'm going to say that bhindi masala just isn't something I will ever like
so I'm going easy on it.
I was just trying something new with that one.
garlic naan.author: Chuck W.
garlic naan.review: Lahore Karahi... why do I love you so?  no, really why?   Self service restaurant in the Tenderlion. Inconsistent food.  But I do love this place.  It's cozy yet dodgy and the food can be hit or miss at times but I keep going back.  Today I had the vegetarian korma and bhindi masala.    The korma was excellent.  I had a wonderful sauce and a perfect mix of vegies.   The garlic naan was hot and fresh and rice was tasty.   The bhindi masala was ok.  The okra was a little hard and chewy and overall the dish was oily.   I'm going to say that bhindi masala just isn't something I will ever like so I'm going easy on it.  I was just trying something new with that one.

excerpts: The garlic naan was perfect and tasty.
garlic naan.author: Lauren S.
garlic naan.review:
I went here for the first time last night, and I must say I was not expecting it to be that effing amazing, and well they totally proved me wrong...With a bag filled with stella artois we were definitely set. We got the paneer pekora (I'm sure the vegetable one was much better- these were glorified cheese sticks but hey I love me some cheese)...then the chicken tikka masala and the lamb korma. The chicken tikka masala was by far the best I've had so far in the city, and the lamb was just so so in comparison. The garlic naan was perfect and tasty. 

The girl sitting behind my friend was rubbing her date's beard. Creepy.  That was the only thing that bothered me while I was there. 

Seriously, this is as good as it gets.
Real talk.

excerpts: Lamb seekh kebabs, garlic naan are my favorite
garlic naan.author: Pranav C.
garlic naan.review:
Best Indo/pak food in the bay area. Period. 

Lamb seekh kebabs, garlic naan are my favorite

excerpts: Garlic Naan: Awesome!
Tasted great!
Sheesh Kabob: Awesome!
garlic naan.author: Limzer L.
garlic naan.review:
Pretty tasty food I must say.

Chicken Tikka Masala: Okay, not the finer point of the meal.
Garlic Naan: Awesome!  Tasted great!
Sheesh Kabob: Awesome!  Very Flavorful!

Next time I'm trying the fish...

excerpts: I typically order the chicken tikka marsala, mango lassi, garlic naan and a few samosos.
garlic naan.author: Peter G.
garlic naan.review:
This might just be my favorite restaurant in San Francisco! 

Lahore is nestled in a very a safe/ un-sketch block in the tandor-loin.  Parking is always easy, prices are right, service is great, and the food is heavenly..

I've tried several Pakistani/Indian places, and this by far exceeds any competition.  Lahore is seriously in a league of its own!  

I typically order the chicken tikka marsala, mango lassi, garlic naan and a few samosos.  My girl friend gets the butter chicken. 

Trust me you can't go wrong!

excerpts: Garlic Naan is AMAZING and the rice is AMAZING.
garlic naan.author: Mary M.
garlic naan.review:
I would wait in a two hour line in the rain to eat here. Luckily I only had to wait about 30 minutes and it was not raining. 

The chicken tikka masala is the best that I have ever tasted. I am sad that I only get to have it when I am in San Francisco, which is a rare occasion. Paneer Pakora and Vegetable Pakora are both great. Garlic Naan is AMAZING and the rice is AMAZING.

excerpts: The best part of the meal was the garlic naan.

Other Indian restaurants just add chopped garlic and olive oil to the regular naan (don't get me wrong, I have no problem with that - I'd order a side of chopped garlic if it was on the menu), but at Lahore Karahi it was like a whole different delicious dish.
My entree, shrimp curry, was fine but nothing to write home about.
garlic naan.author: Adam B.
garlic naan.review:
This is a nice place. I'd give the food a 4 and the service a 2. When I went there was just one poor waiter in the crowded restaurant, and he was clearly overwhelmed. 

The best part of the meal was the garlic naan. Other Indian restaurants just add chopped garlic and olive oil to the regular naan (don't get me wrong, I have no problem with that - I'd order a side of chopped garlic if it was on the menu), but at Lahore Karahi it was like a whole different delicious dish. My entree, shrimp curry, was fine but nothing to write home about.

excerpts: All that's missing is the garlic naan, which I also order.
But whatev.
garlic naan.author: Mehul P.
garlic naan.review:
Not everything is a winner, but these are 5-star-worthy:

* butter chicken--this one is different than the one at Amber, which is more tomatoey; it's creamy and has a combination of spices I can't ID.
* kheer--mushy like it's supposed to be, not milky which seems to be the norm.
* biryani--better than (Mission) Pakwan. Pakwan biryani is rustic, and here it's tender, spicy, and refined.

Looking back at my list, it looks like an unadventurous order of a Indo/Paki dilettante. All that's missing is the garlic naan, which I also order. But whatev.

excerpts: Jerry, Omar and I feasted on Chicken Vindaloo, Butter Chicken, some other chicken fantastakabobbie thing, garlic naan and mango laasi's.
The butter chicken was indescribable.
It seemed to be a combination of a light curry, a smattering of sweetness (cinnamon, I assume) with a tub and a half of butter thrown in for good measure.
I wanted to doggy paddle in the freakin' sauce...
it was that good.
garlic naan.author: Mc Matty b.
garlic naan.review:
I've been wanting to get my 'curry on' over here for years, because it's just a few doors down from the loved ones house. The place is usually packed to the gills, but since I no longer have the temperament to dodge the occasional stray bullet and/ or hooker, we'd always end up elsewhere. And then came the rain...washing all the hoodlums away, and the customers apparently. Lahore Karahi was empty! Jerry, Omar and I feasted on Chicken Vindaloo, Butter Chicken, some other chicken fantastakabobbie thing, garlic naan and mango laasi's. 

The chicken vindaloo was perfectly spiced, although if I had it my way - I would have made it bloodcurdling hot. My fellow diners have weaker constitutions.  The naan was thinner than what I am usually accustomed to...less dense, with a light crisp to it.  More importantly: the garlic was fully-cooked, not thrown on at the end, rendering it too pungent.  The butter chicken was indescribable.  It seemed to be a combination of a light curry, a smattering of sweetness (cinnamon, I assume) with a tub and a half of butter thrown in for good measure.  I wanted to doggy paddle in the freakin' sauce...it was that good.  The mango laasi's were perfectly paired for the dishes as well...not too thick, and not too sweet like some other places I've been to.

And now the pet peeves:  The Bollywood film playing on the television was simply terrible...and yet I could not peel my eyes away from it.  The food was brought out awkwardly...one dish at a time, then the naan.  By the time the raita came - there was nothing left on the table to dip (other than my spoon, and so I ate it like soup).  Also they did not give us enough rice for three people.  Lastly, Jerry bit down on a 

R
O
C
K

(okay, it was a pebble)  But still - WTF.  He sank it in his water glass, cleaned it off and passed it around the table.  Sure enough - it was a rock.  We banged it against the table...scratched the table with it in fact.   And then we scratched our heads.  Maybe it was a spicy rock? A spice rock?  A cinna-pebble? We debated how such a pebble could get into the vindaloo, and then debated some more whether to tell the chef-owner when paying.  Jerry decided he should.  The owner just kinda looked at it for a bit.  Then he picked it up and rolled it between his fingers.  The smile never left his face.  I felt awkward.  US/ Pakistani relations are slightly strained right now, and I thought this might add to the tension, so I went out for a smoke...

Moral of story:  Enjoy the food...order extra rice and avoid rocks and uncomfortable situations.

excerpts: We got the chicken tikka masala with two orders of garlic naan and some balsamic rice!
Every friggen' bite sent a jolt flavor and spice that never stopped coming until the last of it went extinct on our plates.
The craft and expertise of the cook is matched by no one.
garlic naan.author: Matt B.
garlic naan.review:
Lahore Karahi has some hidden aptitude that will reconcile whatever quarrel you have with your hunger . 

Run by an upbeat cook who really perfected the art of multi-tasking, you have to respect the guy. Granted he does have a helpful staff of about 2-3,  but heavy lies the task of keeping that place functional. Expect to wait a bit if there are a lot of people (and there usually are, the place is phenomenal). 

Valentine's Day was hectic in the city but my girlfriend and I braved the trek from the East Bay. Parking is always a joke, come with a few quarters and a lot of good karma. After 6pm though, the meters go into sleep mode which is convenient to know (a bummy dude told us as he disappeared into the night haha).

You get to snack on an interesting wafer that has a taste resembling corn flakes;  it comes with two dipping sauces. Once the wait is over, all that is left is to immerse yourself in whatever you ordered. 

We got the chicken tikka masala with two orders of garlic naan and some balsamic rice! Every friggen' bite sent a jolt flavor and spice that never stopped coming until the last of it went extinct on our plates. The craft and expertise of the cook is matched by no one. Kudos my friend, I WILL be coming back.

All hail Lahore Karahi

excerpts: The Garlic Naan was like a mini garlic pizza - delicious!
The Chicken Tikka Masala was surprisingly not just sauce and a few bits of chicken like at other places.
garlic naan.author: Tinna H.
garlic naan.review:
Updated without a true update because it deserves five stars. I can easily say this is one of my favorite Indian places. Delicious and cheap, just the way I like it. 

I can never remember the full name of this restaurant. I always say something along the lines of "Lahore Blah Blah Blah" or "that Lahore place." Service is slow and strange. Over the fantastic birthday weekend, we had the most bizarre dining experience ever. It was a little stressful, but oh-so-delicious! Twilight zone dinner. Every action taken was first discussed in our committee of three. 

Should we sit down? 

Do we order here, or will he come over here? 

Do we get our own plates? 

Should we grab some water? Silverware, maybe? 

Is this our food? 

Does this come with rice?

Where's our other naan? 

Should we pay our bill from the table or bring it to the register? 

What's going on!?!

Why isn't he bringing our change? Should we have paid with credit card instead? 

The Garlic Naan was like a mini garlic pizza - delicious! The Chicken Tikka Masala was surprisingly not just sauce and a few bits of chicken like at other places. We also ordered two vegetable curries - Benghan Bharta and Aloo Saag. Tasty!

With all the discussions that took place, the dinner lasted quite a long time. So come here if you have the time. Plus, there is just one person cooking the delicious food. Well worth the wait if you've got the time! I'm trying the Tandoori Chicken next time - it's supposedly their signature dish.

excerpts:
We got:
Garlic Naan
garlic naan.author: Emily W.
garlic naan.review:
My friend brought me here for dinner one night and I have to say it  was so good! I was not sure what to think since it is not in the nicest part of town and it was a hole in the wall place.

We went to dinner on a Friday night and it was very crowded - we had to wait a little bit for a table.

We got:
Garlic Naan
Sesame Naan
Seekn Kabab
Butter Chicken
Lahore Karahi Rice

Everything we order was good. It did take a bit to get the food since there is only one person who works the front of the restaurant but it was well worth the wait. 

When I went it was BYOB - but from what I have heard that has not changed (too bad too).

The dinner is also very inexpensive....

excerpts:
Highlights:
Garlic naan ($2.50)
garlic naan.author: Cersei T.
garlic naan.review:
Highlights:
Garlic naan ($2.50)
Butter chicken ($6.50)

The prices were fair, just like the weather.  We also had mill juli sabzi ($5.50) and regular naan ($1).  The dishes were all really good- not too oily.  The chicken in the butter chicken was awesome- definitely marinated in something yummy!  Lahore Karahi is small, cheap, and yummy- infinitely better than Naan n' Curry buffet at 2am that I didn't go to (okay I did, but I regret it!).  I only subtracted a star because the portions were pretty tiny.  My boyfriend and I split the two dishes and two naans and my half was just barely enough food for me.  When we got home, he started eating again.

excerpts:
2 Garlic Naan -- with butter!
1 Raita - aight.
1 Gulab Jamun -- was disappointed =
garlic naan.author: Anjali V.
garlic naan.review:
THREE YEARS!!!! - They've been around for THREE flippin' YEARS!!
I have been living in the Yay-Areaaa for 6 years now, and I just find out about this place like, NOW?!?!?!  Heights of unfairness.

Can I just say that the food was nothing short of FREAKIN' amazing?! - I was there with a vegetarian friend, so we didn't touch the meat dishes, but dang they were awesome:

1 Veg Pakoras -- holy-mother.
1 Shahi Paneer (equivalent of Paneer TIkka Masala) -- divine.
1 Daal Makhaney -- just like home.
1 Pala Methi Aloo -- sigh!
2 Garlic Naan -- with butter!
1 Raita - aight.
1 Gulab Jamun -- was disappointed =`(

Grand Sum of All Things Yummy ~ $30.50
(read: $15 per person and we both ate like Maharani's bitches)

Neighbourhood/ Ambiance? -- Sketch-a-licious baby! 
-- There's this raised TV in the back upper right hand corner of the restaurant, which looked like it had once been afflicted with brown packaging tape (supreme fix-it tool of my childhood) -- lets just say I wouldn't wanna sit underneath it -- and no, NOT cos it would threaten to plop on my head at any given moment, but because I wouldn't get to watch the HILAAARIOUS reruns of old-school 90's era Indian Film Awards they play on repeat!! -- I knew all the songs by heart, and was totalmente diggin' it and a-boppin' in mah seat..

The Gulab Jamun was what they lost a star on, for me though -- I have supreme expectations for my belovedly sweet brown balls (ahem), and I had a momentary let-down.  They tasted slightly stale, and the syrup was watered-downy type..Ah well, ya just can't win 'em all!

After a little chit-chattin' with the brothers (one cooks, one serves) I got to hear a few stories of theirs, and when I got back to my table a (freeeeeeeee!) dish of 'Kheer' followed suite... and THAT my friends made me happy ever after in the land of "Desert" (yes, this is how they spell it on their website!=D) -- and made me re-consider "4 stars" to "5"... oh joy!

NB: -- This grub ain't for ye faint hearted -- the dishes are spicy -- so when uncle takes your order, be sure to say "mild" and I can almost guarantee you it'll be just as tantalizing to your taste buds. Oh and: BYOB.

I came.  
I ate.  
I drank 2 Peach-Hefeweizens.  
I went home.
& Passed Le Fuck Out.

excerpts: Total for the meal was $25 before tip, including a coke, garlic naan, and rice.
I'm definitely a fan now!
One of my bengali buddies introduced me to shalimar back in the day.
I'm gonna have to take him here next time
he's in town!
garlic naan.author: Fong L.
garlic naan.review:
WOW.  I never thought I'd say this, but I think it is better than Shalimar.  I need to go back a few more times to be sure...but wow.  Where shalimar feels like they just threw some curry into a dish and served it to you, the food just felt...crafted here.

First of all, unlike the other places, you actually have a waiter, and he actually takes your order and serves you your food.  The chef Guddu makes GUDDU FOOD!!!  (har har har)  but damn he's aptly named.

We started with those little cracker-like, naan-shaped pieces of unrisen bread and chutney, on the house.  Took a while for the food to come, and there was no beer in the fridge (I'm guessing it's BYOB like shalimar), but it was worth the wait.

We had the chicken karahi, the eggplant dish (starts with a b), and the tandoori chops.  I couldn't believe the lamb chops could be better than shalimar, but they were actually better marinated, and well grilled.  Served on a hot iron plate, it gets that nice korean bbq smell in your clothes, so BE WARNED.  But it was really tasty.
The chicken karahi was perfectly stir-fried--just chewy enough, yet still moist, with some flavorful pasty stuff all over, and some good bite (we got all the dishes "spicy"), and some good balance of sweetness and flavor in general.
The eggplant dish was very tasty!  Perhaps a little too sweet, but overall well balanced and flavorful.
The naan was just right, and we saw Guddu kneading and throwing around the dough as we walked in. 

Prices were good, not quite as cheap as shalimar, but still inexpensive.  I believe the tandoori chop was $8, chicken was $6, eggplant was $6.  But I can't remember, so don't quote me on that.  Total for the meal was $25 before tip, including a coke, garlic naan, and rice.

I'm definitely a fan now!  One of my bengali buddies introduced me to shalimar back in the day.  I'm gonna have to take him here next time he's in town!

excerpts: garlic naan...
ehh....

no thanks
fish tandori
...bomb!!!
but hella spicey.
garlic naan.author: Ashley H.
garlic naan.review:
i have been here three times but this is the first time i wanted to write a review. the first time i wasnt really impressed with the food. the naan is doughy and burnt....dont know how that happens...but it just wasnt that appealing. the first time i had the chicken tikka masala. again...not too happy with the quality. last night i got the following

garlic naan...ehh....no thanks
fish tandori...bomb!!! but hella spicey.
butter chicken....on point.... its sweet with some nuts. great texture super yummy.
lamb biyrani.... the rice is soo good! i would just get this alone next time.
rice...it was okay but not the best i have had.

its ok. it reminds me of naan and curry which i am not a super fan of either. i think some people might like it but im sure that if i dont mind walking one more block i can just go to chutney.

excerpts: All we wanted was chicken tikka masala, bengan bhartila (roasted eggplant curry) and garlic naan.
garlic naan.author: Heather U.
garlic naan.review:
Lahore Karahi has thus far been the restaurant I hate to love. Let me explain. My boyfriend and I stopped by Lahore Karahi for dinner last week after reading the Yelp reviews. We showed up and figured we would place a to-go order and be in and out in 20 minutes or so. Not the case. Yes, there were a handful of people in the dining area but by no means were they crowded. We placed our order and sat down at one of the large tables with our tasty little cups of complementary tea and waited for our food. And waited. And waited. The longer we waited, the more to shambles the service fell. We watched as tables were being delivered the wrong items and some items never came at all. The poor server (granted there was just one guy taking orders, delivering said orders and ringing people up) seemed to have no idea what was going on. After about 40 minutes, we decided to check where our 2 dishes had ended up. Still not ready. Another 10-15 minutes and, alas, our food was ready! We paid and busted out of there as fast as we could only to get home to find out they din't give us one of our dishes. All we wanted was chicken tikka masala, bengan bhartila (roasted eggplant curry) and garlic naan. But it would seem that we would have to settle for the naan, rice and eggplant. 

Yes, we were incredibly disappointed but, by god, if that wasn't the most delicious Pakistani/Indian food I have ever placed in my flavor-loving mouth, then I don't know what is. Curse you, Lahore! 

Of course, we had to go back. There was no way I could turn down the flavor town that is Lahore Karahi. We had to try the chicken tikka masala. This time, we placed a phone order and headed over. The place was empty and everyone working that night seemed super competent as our oder was packaged and we were rung up and out the door in minutes. This time they did not disappoint. Our food was everything I hoped it would be and more!

If you have the patience of a saint, I strongly advise you try this place!

excerpts:
For something closer to home cooked food, try New Ganges

Try the Palak Paneer and Garlic Naan here..
garlic naan.author: Brijesh K.
garlic naan.review:
The best Indian veg food (restaurant) in town , without a doubt. The food takes a long time to cook, but its definitely worth the wait. 

For something closer to home cooked food, try New Ganges

Try the Palak Paneer and Garlic Naan here..

excerpts: The lamb saag and the 1.00 garlic naan were clear standouts.
garlic naan.author: A.J. S.
garlic naan.review:
Oh, I'll be the first to admit that I am a tourist and called in a reservation for 6:30 at Lahore Karahi.

.....after the laughter subsides I'll continue.

After we made our way to our empty deli table located next to an nonworking door, we were quite impressed with the food! Homemade Indian food was the best thing in my boyfriend's last relationship, and he helped me find a love for it too. This place was pakistani, I'm pretty sure, but overall the food was DELICIOUS AND CHEAP.

The lamb saag and the 1.00 garlic naan were clear standouts. The shrimp masala was a bit too sweet for my taste, but nevertheless fun to try and quite tasty.

The owner gave us a cube of free "homemade curry ice cream" on a toothpick on our way out. Priceless. We left quite satisfied on our journey through the Tenderloin dodging homeless men sucking on curried ice cream on toothpicks.

excerpts: The taste of the lamb vindaloo & garlic naan
garlic naan.author: Ryan W.
garlic naan.review:
Dig:
* The 'authentic' (read: low-rent) vibe
* The Indian musicals playing on a constant loop on TV
* The friendliness of the main man/ chef (owner?), who greeted me with a smile and suggested I try the fish vindaloo the next time.
* The taste of the lamb vindaloo & garlic naan I had.

Don't Dig:
* The fact that the chef had a cold and was handling my food.
* That I could see EVERYTHING happening in the kitchen.
* That I had to get up to get my own place setting (silverware, napkin, etc.)
* That the chef pretty much had to do everything himself - incl. take my order, make my meal, and figure out my tab.  Here's an idea: put those 2 latino gentlemen who mill about behind the scenes to work.
* The creepy dude with a bandage on his (recently?) chopped finger who sat by the door and watched me eat.
* I'm pretty sure I saw a roach running across the kitchen counter.

Whatever - the service sucks (he's only one man!) and it has all the ambience of a garage, but this is a cheap Indian/ Pakistani place in the Tenderloin.  What did you expect?  Lahore is flavor country, but I wouldn't bring my parents or any high-maintenance sorts here.

PS ~ Bringing your own refreshments is a GREAT CALL.

excerpts: some garlic naan and basmati rice.
The garlic naan is goooood.
A warning though, they take their garlic seriously here, so if you're a faux or a semi garlic lover, I suggest going for the regular.
garlic naan.author: Erika I.
garlic naan.review:
My quest to find the best tikka masala among the Tandoorloin's many Indian places brought me to Lahore. Upon entering, we were promptly seated and given our drinks. We got fish tikka masala, chicken biryani, tandoori chicken leg, some garlic naan and basmati rice. 

The fish tikka masala is beyond superb. Chilean sea bass cooked in a buttery tikka masala sauce that has a great depth of flavors. Unlike most places where the TM sauce is very smooth and creamy (sometimes almost too creamy), Lahore's version is chunkier, has more texture to it (I think there were nuts in the sauce...or some other crunchy thing) and has a lot more flavor. Some people prefer their tikka masala smooth and creamy -- I was one of those -- but I'm now a convert for the chunkier and more flavorful sauce that Lahore makes. 

The chicken biryani is also good. We asked for it spicy though, which is a little too spicy for me. I must admit that I have a low tolerance level for anything hot, so I think I downed two cups of water for the small portion of biryani that I tasted. 

The tandoori chicken is yum-o as well. For $3, you get a tandoori chicken thigh/leg on a big plate of grilled veggies. It's moist, delicious and just has the right amount of kick to it.

The garlic naan is goooood. A warning though, they take their garlic seriously here, so if you're a faux or a semi garlic lover, I suggest going for the regular. The garlic and cilantro is just ooozing from the naan and since I love both, I was in naan heaven after having some. 

Oh and of course, forget about parking when you go here. Try walking instead. I know, it's the Tenderloin, but it's a short little walk from Union Square, the muni, bart, so getting here is no problemo at all. 

Just clutch that purse to your chest, have 911 already dialed on your cellphone -- you just need to press the call button -- bring that pepper spray and you're good to go. Just kidding. Seriously, the Tenderloin gets too much bad rap for what it is. You'll be fine.

excerpts: and it was amazing, the best aromatic rice ever and the daal makhany nice and spicy and the garlic naan cooked perfectly, saag paneer out of this world and samosas to die for!
Every single thing that I try is better than the previous one!
This is my new go to indian even though I have to trek to the Loin to eat in or pick up and grub at home.
And best of all is the fact that it is a bargain!
garlic naan.author: Chris D.
garlic naan.review: Best spices hands down here, everything fresh and fantastic flavors on every bite. The chicken tikka masala was amazing there was some kind of crunch in the sauce (almonds?) and it was amazing, the best aromatic rice ever and the daal makhany nice and spicy and the garlic naan cooked perfectly, saag paneer out of this world and samosas to die for! Every single thing that I try is better than the previous one! This is my new go to indian even though I have to trek to the Loin to eat in or pick up and grub at home. And best of all is the fact that it is a bargain!

excerpts: He also gave me a side of garlic naan for the road.
I absolutely love the unassuming goodness of this place.
garlic naan.author: Renee K.
garlic naan.review:
I adore this place and used to eat it for lunch twice a week, which was oh-so-good but sent me straight to a food coma at my office.  I now try to eat it once a week.  Beware that this is a one-man show (well, two, counting the waiter) and he cooks from scratch so the wait for your food can be about 30 minutes or more.  It's totally worth it once the smoking mixed tandoori platter, steamy basmati and milky curries make their way over.  

I once asked the chef at this place what is "halal" while hovering around the register counter.  He waved me into to his tiny kitchen and, while explaining, showed me his awesome tandoor in which naan was baked.  He also gave me a side of garlic naan for the road.  I absolutely love the unassuming goodness of this place.

excerpts: The garlic Naan was outstanding but the lightly roasted garlic with butter was a little much for my companion.
She has very light tastes
garlic naan.author: Sean L.
garlic naan.review:
I'm amused by the wide range of reviews for Lahore Karahi because my feelings after dining here were all over the map as well.  First impressions were quite dismal.  For starters, It was a struggle convincing my date to walk through the questionable neighborhood but once we entered what appeared to be a converted soup kitchen, I thought she was going to have a panic attack.

The menu was appealing however and the aromas from the open kitchen were quite tantalizing.  Once the food arrived (which was surprisingly fast considering other's experiences),  I was drawn to the meal and our surroundings disappeared.   We had modest appetites and regrettably only ordered two main dishes.  The Chicken Korma was mild and inviting but the Lamb Biryani stole the show.  With a requested "medium" spiciness, the flavors were heightened and not overwhelming.  The rice was light and the lamb was not too.... lamby?.  The garlic Naan was outstanding but the lightly roasted garlic with butter was a little much for my companion.  She has very light tastes so we ordered some plain Naan too but upon its arrival she exclaimed "oh, it's so greasy".

I think our host was already a bit irked with us at this point.  My date's questions about certain dishes while ordering were met with some confusion and impatience.  There was a dual language barrier going on so I let it go at the time.  But, the greasy Naan comment seemed to truly offend him.  He grabbed a paper napkin and very aggressively dabbed away the grease right in front of her face.  To say the least, Lahore Karahi is not a place for service and ambiance but that's not the reason to go.  I would be impressed with the food at any price but this was a downright bargain.

excerpts: The garlic naan was not overly garlicy, and probably the best I've ever had.
garlic naan.author: Ron L.
garlic naan.review:
A group of 13 from work went there for lunch today. Lucky for us, there were not many other people in the place when we went.  We started getting our food in around 30-40 minutes after we arrived, and it kept coming for the next 30 minutes. Tip: call in advance to give Guddu (the cook) some time to prepare.

The food was extraordinary. We ordered all sorts of tandoori items, fish, chicken, lamb, etc. The tandoori fish is Chilean Sea Bass, and was extremely good. All the curries and biryanis were wonderfully spiced, and FRESH. The naan was perfectly done, light and fluffy. The garlic naan was not overly garlicy, and probably the best I've ever had. The aloo naan had some bonus onion inside, which made it extra tasty.

My Indian coworkers, who always say that Shalimar is #1, actually want to go back here next time. That says a lot. Guddu rules!

excerpts: The food remains amazing, I like the garlic naan and kulfi.
The owner Guddu has a huge smile that brings me joy.
Sometimes my friends and I wave to him as we're walking by just to see his grin.
garlic naan.author: Meghan F.
garlic naan.review:
I'm really sad that the waiter with terrible service (who was totally amusing as a result) is no longer here. The food remains amazing, I like the garlic naan and kulfi. The owner Guddu has a huge smile that brings me joy. Sometimes my friends and I wave to him as we're walking by just to see his grin. Yes, we're weird.

Best recent experience here: sitting at a table next to the window, a man on the street peered in, stared, smiled and waved at my friend & I for like five minutes. I love the TL its delightful character.

excerpts: Although the service has been slow both times I've been there, the lentil dal and garlic naan are the best veggie options in a wasteland of dive bars and food joints.
Bring a book or co-workers and pass the time watching Bollywood television.
Cheap & hearty, this grub will stick to your ribs.
garlic naan.author: Jasmine T.
garlic naan.review:
Fresh faced geeks looking to be the next Bill Gates, gossiping mental health counselors and budget-minded non-profit fundraisers wooing donors give a whole new meaning to "power" lunch.
