Although the service has been slow both times I've been there, the lentil dal and garlic naan are the best veggie options in a wasteland of dive bars and food joints. Bring a book or co-workers and pass the time watching Bollywood television.  Cheap & hearty, this grub will stick to your ribs.

excerpts: Also terrific was the garlic naan, which tasted much like a tasty Italian "garlic bread" except on naan.
I wasn't that thrilled with the shahi paneer, which tasted too earthy for my tastes--lots of onion and tomatoes, not enough rich dairy fat.
garlic naan.author: Anonymous P.
garlic naan.review:
I ordered for takeout to bring to my room at the Hilton.  They told me it would be ready in 40-45 minutes.  Walking up O'Farrell, I could smell the spices and tandoori smoke from half a block away.  When I got there, the tiny restaurant was full, and a line of people waiting for a table or waiting to order takeout extended chaotically out the door.  It was unpleasantly cramped.

The food was tasty but cold.  (Clearly 40-45 minutes was a bad estimate.)  The best item was tandoori fish.  The fish itself was high quality, and the spices were wonderful; too bad it was cold.  They forgot to include the side of rice I had ordered and paid for.  In retrospect, I wish I had ordered biryani--a plate of it looked absolutely divine.

It doesn't surprise me that some people consider Lahore Karahi a great restaurant, and I suspect I would too on more visits, but on this one visit I was slightly disappointed.

Edit: So I went back and tried some more items, including the biryani.  Vegetable biryani is one of my favorite dishes, and Lahore Karahi served up one of my favorite renditions of it.  Very spicy, incredibly flavorful and complex, interesting textures.  Also terrific was the garlic naan, which tasted much like a tasty Italian "garlic bread" except on naan.  I wasn't that thrilled with the shahi paneer, which tasted too earthy for my tastes--lots of onion and tomatoes, not enough rich dairy fat.

excerpts:
We ordered the deep fried potatoes and peppers, butter chicken, lamb roti, garlic naan and regular naan.  

Even though the garlic naan was good, I still think Shalimar's garlic naan tops Lahore.
garlic naan.author: Jon T.
garlic naan.review:
Actual rating: 4.5

I used to be fearful of Indian food, but recently had a change of heart.  The food here was absolutely amazing!  We ordered the deep fried potatoes and peppers, butter chicken, lamb roti, garlic naan and regular naan.  

Even though the garlic naan was good, I still think Shalimar's garlic naan tops Lahore.

I would take .5 stars off because the flatware was a little dirty and the staff was a little slow.

excerpts: The garlic naan was ok, but the regular naan was really good.
garlic naan.author: Benjina D.
garlic naan.review:
Really, people? What's the big deal about this place? We went in for an early dinner on Sunday evening. The place was pretty empty and we were seated on the big table in the middle, even though there were only two of us. Next to a us was a little table in the corner full of dirty dishes. I looked around to see four tables that still had dirty dishes...all this was a huge turn-off, but we decided to stay anyway since the reviews were so good. The place is small, and only a few tables were taken, so why the waiter/buss boy was so damn slow in doing his work was beyond me. 

It was irritating to see him walk around, answering his phone every few minutes while doing everything in slow-mo. I asked for a straw...he actually looked around for one when there was a container full sitting in a prominent place next to the drink glasses. Anyone who's been to this place knows how tiny it is...I'd never been there, but still, I knew where the straws were! Near the entrance, somebody was peeling potatoes and onions on a small table. It sure didn't add to the already crappy ambiance.

The food was not so great, either. We ordered vegetable pakoras which were overdone. The butter chicken had a weird consistency and tasted nothing like any butter chicken I've ever had. The chicken karahi was nicely spicy, but all you could taste was dry chicken and green chillies. The garlic naan was ok, but the regular naan was really good. Mango lassi was watered down and they had no ice for our Cokes.

Needless to say, dinner sucked. The kitchen was dirty, the owner kept coming and going indoors and out...he actually met a friend at the front door and played with her dog...eeew! The waiter was incompetent, and I've had better Pakistani food elsewhere. Actually, I wouldn't even call it Pakistani food...that would be an insult to Pakistani food. Guddu needs to learn how to cook!

excerpts: I generally don't care for garlic naan, but it's excellent here . . .
lots of seeds and other tasty stuff in addition to the garlic.
It's true that the service is slow .
There was only one other party in the restaurant when we went, and it still took about 20 minutes to get our food.
But everything was timed perfectly, so nothing was cold.
I'm giving 4 stars since I've only been there once, but if future visits are as good, I'll definitely be upgrading my rating to 5!
garlic naan.author: J S.
garlic naan.review:
I've been burnt out on North Indian/Pakistani food for awhile, and have been sticking with South Indian places.   My coworkers swear by Lahore, though, so I thought I'd tag along with them.  And I was not disappointed . . .

We got the tandoori fish, chicken tikki masala, and matter paneer.  I'm not a big fan of fish, but if I was, I would've loved the tandoori fish.  The chicken tikka masala was wonderful -- really juicy chicken, and fresh flavorful saunce.  The mattar panner was probably the best I've had -- no cubed panner straight from the freezer here -- it was so fresh, it squeaked!  

Normally, I will eat a couple of naan on my own.  So when we ordered only two for the 3 of us, I thought that wouldn't be enough.  My coworkers assured me that the naan was huge, and indeed it was . . . I generally don't care for garlic naan, but it's excellent here . . . lots of seeds and other tasty stuff in addition to the garlic.

It's true that the service is slow .  There was only one other party in the restaurant when we went, and it still took about 20 minutes to get our food.  But everything was timed perfectly, so nothing was cold.  

I'm giving 4 stars since I've only been there once, but if future visits are as good, I'll definitely be upgrading my rating to 5!

excerpts: Garlic Naan
: Naan usually fluffy and super soft bread with garlic and cilantro pretty much melting on top with the heat of the Naan.
garlic naan.author: Karthick S.
garlic naan.review:
I figure that if i use yelp, i should also contribute. So from here on you will be seeing more from me. I tend to visit a new restaurant every weekend and i am a big fan of food\cooking myself.

My first ever review and sorry that it has to be a negative one. But here is why:

This is what i feel when i follow a Yelp review:

When it comes to food, there is a difference between good tasting food and ORIGINAL tasting food. 
Yelp reviewers can agree on good tasting food, but not on the later. For example, I have found myself loving certain
Chinese &Mediterranean restaurants which are detested by my Chinese &Mediterranean friends. Reason: I liked how the 
food at these places tasted, but had no exact idea as to how they were supposed to taste. It is like going to a sushi 
place and enjoying a sushi with cooked fish(Might be exaggerating a bit :-) ). 


Lahore Karahi will probably fit the former(In my case not even that). Here are reasons why:

My order:

1)Sheek Kebab
2)Lamb Biryani
3)Garlic Naan
4)Butter Chicken

In this case, me being from that part of the world(Indian& Pakistan) and being an avid food lover, I know how each of the above should taste like, or how each 
of the above taste in the best restaurants, cooked by the best chefs in that part of the world. let me explain how
it should have been cooked and how it should have tasted, and how it actually did.

1) Sheek Kebab: Ground lamb kebabs which when pulled out of the tandoor(grill), should never be overcooked.
When served, the meat is tender and juicy and is still cooking from the heat. at Lahori: burnt on the outside, really
dry meat, overcooked. spices were not bad.

2)Lamb Biryani: usually cooked in a big pot\vessel with alternate layers of 
rice and meat(Slow cooked for a long time and simmered and when served, the layers are mixed and a serving portion is taken out of the big 
pot/vessel). At Lahori: rice and meat mixed together in a frying pan(I saw him do this!).

3) Garlic Naan: Naan usually fluffy and super soft bread with garlic and cilantro pretty much melting on top with the heat of the Naan.
At Lahori: dry bread, garlic not fresh.

4) Butter chicken: Creamy sauce, with butter floating on top with super soft chicken pieces. At lahori: Not creamy at all, 
but rather like a paste of onions and tomatoes. the texture was so that i could feel the onions and tomatoes in my mouth.
the color which should be bright red or orange is just red. can barely taste the fresh butter. 

A lot of you might be thinking if should expect all this in a small restaurant in tenderloin. But as a matter of fact, Every good\well known
street side restaurant in that part of Indian/Pakistan serve the above dishes just as explained above.

Reasons why my 2 stars: The use of spices were pretty decent .But failed in all other aspects (texture, the way it is 
cooked, served, size, taste) . The service was friendly and good.

Also to note, probably a reason why this place gets great reviews, is the service part. The old man serving tends to do a great job
in hyping up the restaurant. I hear him say things like "No one cooks this dish as good as we do" and it seems to be working with the
customers as well. i don't rate restaurants on decor unless it fits that category. The decor in this place seems to be good enough for this
place. 

As it is my first one, i hope you enjoyed it and also be easy on me!

excerpts: The garlic naan was to die for..
we ordered just another naan after we finished eating.
garlic naan.author: Kaushal P.
garlic naan.review:
The owners remind you of 'Babu' from Sienfeld.. LOL. But they are very friendly. 

The food is absolutely amazing, even the veggie options. You can see them prepare everything from scratch in the kitchen so it probably takes slightly longer than say naan-n-curry but it tastes a lot fresher. And you can have it made as spicy as you like. 

The garlic naan was to die for.. we ordered just another naan after we finished eating. :)

The taste beats all the restaurants in the Tandoorloin and its probably the best Tandoori/Punjabi food I have had in the US so far.

excerpts: The garlic naan was my least favorite part of the meal.
I like my naan with crispy bits, but this was all quite soggy and it tasted very sour.
Lastly, we tried to order samosas and were offered Pakoras instead.
When I asked if we could just have samosas, he evaded acknowledging that they didn't have any.
No samosas?
At an Indian restaurant?
Weird.
garlic naan.author: Jessica L.
garlic naan.review:
After all the positive reviews of this place, I decided to hit it up last night.  I was craving Butter Chicken and was so excited to try it after all the glowing comments.
Unfortunately, I was less than blown away.  The food was pretty good, but just that.  My boyfriend described it as "edible."  The Butter Chicken was very sweet, which was not what I was used to.  I liked that the sauce had little bits of nuts, however.  But, overall, it was a bit flavorless and nothing amazing.
The garlic naan was my least favorite part of the meal.  I like my naan with crispy bits, but this was all quite soggy and it tasted very sour.  
Lastly, we tried to order samosas and were offered Pakoras instead.  When I asked if we could just have samosas, he evaded acknowledging that they didn't have any.  No samosas?  At an Indian restaurant?  Weird.

excerpts: We ordered the Chkn Kabob, Tandoori Chicken,  CHICKEN TIKKA MASALA, wth an order of Garlic Naan and a side of Basmati Rice.
It was plenty for the two of us.
The staff was friendly and the food was fresh....
YUM!
Definitely would visit again the next time I head out to SF. ^^
garlic naan.author: Kitty L.
garlic naan.review: This place was a gem! My boyfriend and I were desperate for Indian food and I believe this spot was the third one down from the list of Indian restaurants recommended by Yelp users. It was the only one with good reviews open on a Sun. The wait was a little long...but the food was absolutely delicious and worth the wait. We ordered the Chkn Kabob, Tandoori Chicken,  CHICKEN TIKKA MASALA, wth an order of Garlic Naan and a side of Basmati Rice. It was plenty for the two of us.The staff was friendly and the food was fresh....YUM! Definitely would visit again the next time I head out to SF. ^^

excerpts: Bengan Bartha, Butter Chicken, Garlic Naan, Aloo Saag.
garlic naan.author: Heather R.
garlic naan.review:
Lahore Karahi is that "little spot" you bring your new girlfriend or boyfriend to in the city to show off how you, too, know a quaint family- owned joint in the heart of the Tenderloin that only a true San Franciscan would know about. One time, I showed up with a group of friends for dinner. We decided we were to have a feast of epic proportions and after checking out the menu, we ordered whatever sounded good.  The waiter totally indulged us, making great recommendations on the menu and helping set up a SERIOUS spread of INEXPENSIVE food.  

Even though the wait for food can be a little long (I wouldn't recommend Lahore if you're in a rush, but definitely must after seeing a show at the Great American Music Hall) because of the two-man crew that runs the restaurant, you don't mind because you're either a) completely engrossed in the Bollywood movies playing on the tiny monitor in the corner of the restaurant or you're b) enjoying the view of a crack deal outside.    

Thumbs up for: Bengan Bartha, Butter Chicken, Garlic Naan, Aloo Saag.  Enough options for the meat lover AND the humble herbivore.

Pick up beer or wine from one of the liquor stores just outside.  And don't listen to the waiter when he gives you a hard time for refilling your own water.  Enjoy.

excerpts: Their curry's are amazing and the garlic naan, well lets just say you should definitely order at least one per person.
The only draw back is that they tend to serve the curry dishes before the rice, which is actually pretty damn annoying.
(Imagine finishing half of your curry before you have any rice!)

Tikka Masala
Lamb vindaloo
Saag paneer
Bengan baarta
garlic naan
rice
In regards to size portioning: One curry entry per person, one garlic naan per person and get two rice orders if you have over 3 people.
garlic naan.author: E-dough R.
garlic naan.review:
Alright, so what the place lacks in ambiance it definitely makes up for in delicious food.  Have you seen Ratatouille, the movie with the cute little rat that makes you question why you always hated rats so much and then you realize its just a cartoon and that you still hate rats? Well, Lahore is exactly like that - an explosion of flavors.  Their curry's are amazing and the garlic naan, well lets just say you should definitely order at least one per person.  The only draw back is that they tend to serve the curry dishes before the rice, which is actually pretty damn annoying. (Imagine finishing half of your curry before you have any rice!) Nonetheless, this place has amazing food and I doubt there are any better Pakistani curry venues in the city.

Oh and I would recommend ordering:

Tikka Masala
Lamb vindaloo
Saag paneer
Bengan baarta
garlic naan
rice

In regards to size portioning: One curry entry per person, one garlic naan per person and get two rice orders if you have over 3 people.

excerpts: Lamb Vindaloo, Tandoori Fish, Garlic Naan, Vegetable Biryhani, and Eggplant something or other.
Out of everything the Eggplant was by far the best!
garlic naan.author: Ann T.
garlic naan.review:
Lahore Karahi...great Indian food! Probably some of the best I've had. Good enough to return?! No way in hell. Maybe if I order to go or something. Looks like Brad L. beat me to the review! Damn that Yelper Elite!!!

We were sat at what the waiter called a "special table" he arranged just for us. Did it come with an invisible cloaking device b/c once he sat us, he forgot about us for 40 minutes. YEAH! 40 minutes. Other tables that were sat AFTER us got their orders taken and their food served before our order was even taken. Come on now! Every time we flagged down our waiter, he averted his eye contact. One person in our party actually went TO the counter to give him our order, and once she was done, his question to her was... (get this!) "Is your order for here or to go?" *Puzzled look* You're kidding right? I can understand the restaurant was packed, but there are only about 8 tables. So what gives?

The mango lassi was definitely the worst I've ever had in my life. Once sip and I tossed it aside.

The only reason this place is getting 2 stars is that the food was excellent. Just the right amount of spice, heat, and meat in each dish. We had a group of 5 and ordered Butter Chicken, which was almost the exact same dish as the chicken tikki masala we ordered! Lamb Vindaloo, Tandoori Fish, Garlic Naan, Vegetable Biryhani, and Eggplant something or other. Out of everything the Eggplant was by far the best! Yummerz!

2 Yummerz stars for this place..and I'm hesitant for even THAT!

excerpts: The garlic naan was freshly baked and tasted very good.
I had the takeout so didn't have to wait.
Just call to make sure your order is ready before going to pick up since the guy told me 15 mins and it turns out to be 1 hour!
garlic naan.author: Jim J.
garlic naan.review: I think the saag paneer and chicken korma is pretty good.  The Butter Chicken and tandoori fish and bengan bartha is also quite good.  The Saag Ghost was the most tender lamb I ever had, the sauce was a little salty.  Chicken tika masala was delicious albeit a little oily.  The garlic naan was freshly baked and tasted very good.  I had the takeout so didn't have to wait.  Just call to make sure your order is ready before going to pick up since the guy told me 15 mins and it turns out to be 1 hour!

excerpts: I ordered the Seekh kabab (came steaming hot on a grill plate and was one of the best I have had), also the Karahi Chicken which was pretty good and garlic naan
(tasty, but thinner and smaller than most other Desi restaurant naans).
The chai was very good too.
The service was a little slow (but since it was lunch time rush with a lot of people I understand why).
The interior of the restaurant is small and a little cramped when full, so not good for large groups.
The restrooms are small and dirty.
Typical for most hole in the wall desi places- great food, but lacking in ambiance.
Halal meat is served here.
garlic naan.author: Irfan R.
garlic naan.review: Went here for lunch recently after some recommendations by friends. The food was good quality and tasty. I ordered the Seekh kabab (came steaming hot on a grill plate and was one of the best I have had), also the Karahi Chicken which was pretty good and garlic naan (tasty, but thinner and smaller than most other Desi restaurant naans). The chai was very good too. The service was a little slow (but since it was lunch time rush with a lot of people I understand why). The interior of the restaurant is small and a little cramped when full, so not good for large groups. The restrooms are small and dirty. Typical for most hole in the wall desi places- great food, but lacking in ambiance.  Halal meat is served here.

excerpts: - garlic naan -- yum!!!
we will definitely be back for the tandori fish, more chicken tikka masala, garlic naan, rice, mango lassi & kufta!!!!
i left with such a WARM, REAL FEEL GOOD
FEELING due to the owner's incredible genuine & sincere friendliness.
so will be back because the owner also makes me smile & feel good!!!!
garlic naan.author: Cindi N.
garlic naan.review:
DELICIOUS!!!!!  my #2 favorite indian restaurant!!!!  enjoyed the following:

- mango lassi -- soooo goood!!!!  nice, thick, sweet & mangoey --  perfect on a warm, sunny day!!!!
- chicken tikka masala -- sooooo goood!!!!  different from any other one i had.  this one was thick & chunky........
- tandori chicken (boneless, breast) -- came out sizzling on an iron plate -- looked, smelled & sounded good but i didn't really like it as much as my hub.  kind of plain to me.
- garlic naan -- yum!!! tasty & garlicky!!!
-  rice -- good flavor, agree w/ other review, had nice crispy bits 

on our way out, we got to talk to the owner -- who was INCREDIBLY FRIENDLY & was very proud of his restaurant.....i really loved his sense of warm, open friendliness.........he told us to try his specialty tandori fish (sea bass).   voted the best tandori fish in sf weekly (forgot what year).  he proudly pointed to the framed best of sf weekly & showed us a laminated article review of his restaurant.   he also gave us a sample of his kufta,  homemade icecream (the owner makes it himself).   that day's flavor was cardamom, pistacchio & mango.  YUM!!!!

we will definitely be back for the tandori fish, more chicken tikka masala, garlic naan, rice, mango lassi & kufta!!!!  i left with such a WARM, REAL FEEL GOOD FEELING due to the owner's incredible genuine & sincere friendliness.  so will be back because the owner also makes me smile & feel good!!!!

excerpts: I had the tandoori fish, saag paneer and garlic naan.
Rice pudding for dessert.
I thought the fish, though cheap, was a bit dry due to the pieces of fish being a tad thin.
The saag paneer was delicious as was the naan.
The rice pudding is of the drier variety, be warned.
garlic naan.author: william c.
garlic naan.review:
Just like the other reviewers said, this place is great.  I had the tandoori fish, saag paneer and garlic naan.  Rice pudding for dessert.  I thought the fish, though cheap, was a bit dry due to the pieces of fish being a tad thin.  The saag paneer was delicious as was the naan.  The rice pudding is of the drier variety, be warned.  I tend to favor the runnier kind you find at some indian places.

There'll definitely be a next time, though I am going to try chicken and gulab jamun instead.

excerpts: We had the tandoori lamb and lamb vindaloo, with some garlic naan.
The tandoori was pretty good, but I wasn't that impressed with the naan.
The vindaloo though.....
SO FUCKING GOOD!
Seriously, we're still talking about how good the curry was.
garlic naan.author: Brittney H.
garlic naan.review:
Fantastic place!

At first I was a little scared of trying this place, but I have learned over the years that small, out of the way food is generally good, and it wasn't wrong this time either.

We had the tandoori lamb and lamb vindaloo, with some garlic naan. The tandoori was pretty good, but I wasn't that impressed with the naan.  The vindaloo though.....SO FUCKING GOOD! Seriously, we're still talking about how good the curry was.

excerpts: So we choose a little of everything: the papadam ($1), wafer-thin flatbreads with a texture reminiscient of potato chips, paneer pakora ($3.50), deep-fried, French fry-shaped wedges of cheese, seekh kebab ($4), a very spicy lamb sausage on skewers, chicken tikka masala ($7), mildly spicy pieces of chicken in a creamy sauce, lamb vindaloo ($7), a very spicy stewy mixture of lamb and potatoes, plain naan ($1), garlic naan ($2), a side of rice ($1.25), and gulab jamun ($3.50) for dessert.
garlic naan.author: Meghan P.
garlic naan.review:
So it's Friday night after work, and we're starving. Indian food sounds fabulous. Something spicy. And cheap. And Yelp-approved. Lahore Karahi it is.

As soon as the menu hits my hands, my eyes are frantically scanning the page looking for anything and everything that sounds delicious. Dammit. It all does. So we choose a little of everything: the papadam ($1), wafer-thin flatbreads with a texture reminiscient of potato chips, paneer pakora ($3.50), deep-fried, French fry-shaped wedges of cheese, seekh kebab ($4), a very spicy lamb sausage on skewers, chicken tikka masala ($7), mildly spicy pieces of chicken in a creamy sauce, lamb vindaloo ($7), a very spicy stewy mixture of lamb and potatoes, plain naan ($1), garlic naan ($2), a side of rice ($1.25), and gulab jamun ($3.50) for dessert. 

The sole server, who had a room's full of hungry, needy patrons to attend to and therefore whose sympathy I had from the get-go, was quirky and odd but kind of fun. The food came out all out of order and sporadically but you know what? I didn't care. It was all just so good and satisfying, and it was a ton of food, but we cleaned each plate. Oh and P.S., mango lassi is my new favorite drink. 

My favorite moment of the evening came when our server dropped the check. I'm like, okay, I know this is cheap eats and all, but that was a crapload of food we just ordered, and S. has slipped into some comatose, food-drunken stupor that he will not have recovered from until the next afternoon. But somehow, after plate upon plate of deliciously satisfying food, the grand total of the evening was.... $38.78. What?!?!?! I began to loathe and regret each night we had spent $100+ on an appetizer, two entrees and a round of drinks at other, sub-par establishments. The value of this place just blew my mind.

So go here, it's delicious, amazingly priced, and my new go-to place for Indian food in the city.

excerpts: the garlic naan soaking up all the goo from my lamb bhunna.
I am still a bit of a newbie to Pakistani food, so they may be getting by on my ignorance.
But, as far as I am concerned, other places will have to live up to the expectations that this place has given me.
garlic naan.author: Craig H.
garlic naan.review: Loved it. The chili naan dipped in the sauce from the fridge...the garlic naan soaking up all the goo from my lamb bhunna. I am still a bit of a newbie to Pakistani food, so they may be getting by on my ignorance. But, as far as I am concerned, other places will have to live up to the expectations that this place has given me.

excerpts: This evening we shared the Vegetable Samosas, Tandoori Lamb Chop, Tandoori Fish, Lahore Karahi Rice and garlic Naan.
The Vegetable Samosas were big and stuffed full, fried perfectly and served warm.
I liked the mint sauce that accompanied them, I thought these were the best part of my meal.
Next up was the Tandoori Lamb Chop, these were the smallest lamb chops I have ever seen.
To say there was a mouthful of meat on each chop would be generous.
We followed with the Tandoori Fish which I will say looked beautifully cooked
but I wasn't a fan of the type of fish that was used, maybe it was Catfish?
It had a muddy taste to it that just took away any desire to eat the rest of the fish.
The Karahi Rice was rice with some spice in it, nothing that caught my attention to make me order this rice dish again.
I did enjoy the Garlic Naan, I'm amazed how each Indian/Pakistani restaurant has their own way of making Naan.
Lahore's Naan is flat vs puffy and moist with lots of garlic and cilantro.

I like the location of Lahore because it's in the Tenderloin, it's a perfectly safe neighborhood although it looks sketchy but this seems to weed out the "Oh so trendy" from the "Gotta have authentic food" folks like me.
I like the size of the restaurant
, it worked when it was the German Cook and it seems to work well for Lahore.
I do wish they had a liquor license or at the very least we could bring our own.
I was going to give Lahore 2 stars because of tonight's meal but
because I have been here before and have had some great food I am giving 3 stars.
I'll come back to Lahore even after this mediocre review but will order something different.
garlic naan.author: David P.
garlic naan.review:
My good friend Lori and I went to dinner at Lahore Pakistani restaurant for dinner, she had never been and wanted to try it out. I have been coming to this location back when it was the German Cook  and have eaten at Lahore probably 6 or 7 times and always had a good meal.
We lucked out and grabbed the first table to the right as  you entered which could sit three persons, great for sharing food and having a good conversation. Unfortunately, as soon as we sat down we noticed a little roach on the table slowly crawling up the wall........not a good start but not enough to make me walk out the door.
The owner and waiter were very attentive and friendly but the service was slower than usual but I think that's kind of nice so you can visit longer.

This evening we shared the Vegetable Samosas, Tandoori Lamb Chop, Tandoori Fish, Lahore Karahi Rice and garlic Naan.
The Vegetable Samosas were big and stuffed full, fried perfectly and served warm. I liked the mint sauce that accompanied them, I thought these were the best part of my meal.
Next up was the Tandoori Lamb Chop, these were the smallest lamb chops I have ever seen. To say there was a mouthful of meat on each chop would be generous. 
We followed with the Tandoori Fish which I will say looked beautifully cooked but I wasn't a fan of the type of fish that was used, maybe it was Catfish? It had a muddy taste to it that just took away any desire to eat the rest of the fish. The Karahi Rice was rice with some spice in it, nothing that caught my attention to make me order this rice dish again. I did enjoy the Garlic Naan, I'm amazed how each Indian/Pakistani restaurant has their own way of making Naan. Lahore's Naan is flat vs puffy and moist with lots of garlic and cilantro.
 I like the location of Lahore because it's in the Tenderloin, it's a perfectly safe neighborhood although it looks sketchy but this seems to weed out the "Oh so trendy" from the "Gotta have authentic food" folks like me. I like the size of the restaurant, it worked when it was the German Cook and it seems to work well for Lahore. I do wish they had a liquor license or at the very least we could bring our own. I was going to give Lahore 2 stars because of tonight's meal but because I have been here before and have had some great food I am giving 3 stars.
I'll come back to Lahore even after this mediocre review but will order something different.

excerpts: Garlic Naan, Butter Chicken.
For when I'm feeling white.
Saag Paneer, Chole are great as well.
garlic naan.author: Srini P.
garlic naan.review:
This is the best North Indian / Pakistani food in the city and is up there for the best in the Bay Area.

Garlic Naan, Butter Chicken.  For when I'm feeling white.  Saag Paneer, Chole are great as well.  I don't get the hype about the Chicken Karahi.  It's not that great (neither are the Tandoori or Biryanis), but there's plenty of other great stuff on the menu.

The place is BYOB, but I don't.  I don't think Guddu the chef really approves of drinking in his place.

excerpts: But that food (chicken tikka masala, lamb curry, rice with this and that mixed in, garlic naan) was all very good.

The location's classic TL:  scooted right past the O'Farrell theater and the New Century (and who knows what else) (got a nice shout out from some customers leaving the O'Farrell for the Obama '08 sticker on my '86 Honda Elite 80 cc)
(yeah, I'm cool) (not so much).
The owner/chef was terribly nice (hospitable and charming)
(by contrast to the more detached service at the also-very-good Shalimar on Polk) (though this ambiance is homier), and he definitely cemented my return visit (he says the fish tandoori is great).
I got the food medium, which was perfect, and it was terribly complex in flavor(fruits and pistachios and all sorts of subtle flavors rolling around).
They have mango lassi (probably one of my all-time favorite drinks).
garlic naan.author: Laurel B.
garlic naan.review:
I ordered food to go, so got only food that could travel the fifteen minutes home without getting dried out.  But that food (chicken tikka masala, lamb curry, rice with this and that mixed in, garlic naan) was all very good.  The location's classic TL:  scooted right past the O'Farrell theater and the New Century (and who knows what else) (got a nice shout out from some customers leaving the O'Farrell for the Obama '08 sticker on my '86 Honda Elite 80 cc) (yeah, I'm cool) (not so much).  The owner/chef was terribly nice (hospitable and charming) (by contrast to the more detached service at the also-very-good Shalimar on Polk) (though this ambiance is homier), and he definitely cemented my return visit (he says the fish tandoori is great).  I got the food medium, which was perfect, and it was terribly complex in flavor(fruits and pistachios and all sorts of subtle flavors rolling around).  They have mango lassi (probably one of my all-time favorite drinks).  If the fish and other tandooris are all that on my return visit, this could be five stars.

Update:  Hmm.  I did like it, but there have been suggestions on the consuming front (those I consume with) (he I consume with) (yeah, that's right:  the BF) that they (he) prefer(s) Shalimar for certain reasons that perhaps one should refer to delicately and not in a review.  Publicly, well, he thinks Shalimar is better on the merits, too, as in, the quality of the tikki masala and so forth.   So I am back to take-out from Shalimar on Polk (and lunch, too).  

Update May 2008:  And now we have found Meftil, which not only delivers to Potrero Hill but also is super high quality.   Scooting for take-out may be a thing of the past.

excerpts: I highly recommend the Tandoori fish, the garlic naan, sesame naan, vegetable biryani, and ask for raita to quench the heat.
If you're at all sensitive to spicy food, let them know because in Pakistan the heat scale is logarithmic.
Out of the many Pakistani/Indian restaurants in the TL, Lahore Karahi stands on the top of the hill for quality and service.
garlic naan.author: Phil M.
garlic naan.review:
Lahore Karahi represents what I love about SF. You get a guy like Guddu who comes to the US to share his love of authentic Lahore cuisine, and he finds primo TL real estate, and then serves up some hot, fresh and delicious Pakistani fare. It's a simple story of the American dream come true, with Bollywood shaking it's proverbial ass in your face on the overhead TV. 
On a relatively quiet monday night, I was surprised to find this serene sanctum in the otherwise rough and tumble TL.  After grabbing bottles of beer for our table we sat down to some incredibly hot peppers thanks to an overzealous dining companion. 
I highly recommend the Tandoori fish, the garlic naan, sesame naan, vegetable biryani, and ask for raita to quench the heat. If you're at all sensitive to spicy food, let them know because in Pakistan the heat scale is logarithmic. 
Out of the many Pakistani/Indian restaurants in the TL, Lahore Karahi stands on the top of the hill for quality and service.

excerpts: The vegatable pakoras were perfectly fried and not at all greasy and the garlic naan was also excellent.
garlic naan.author: Aaron S.
garlic naan.review:
The food here is absolutely great curry-house fare but the service is nearly non-existent.

We went here just before the dinner rush on New Year's Eve and as soon as we walked in I was a bit dismayed that most the tables were really messy. However, I knew from the beginning that this was a curry joint in the Tenderloin not an upscale restaurant

The Lamb Vindaloo (often a benchmark in my evaluation of curry houses) was extremely flavorful and the lamb perfectly cooked. However, I ordered it "extra spicy" and it wasn't hot at all. The Aloo Saag was also had great flavor and a rich, creamy texture. The vegatable pakoras were perfectly fried and not at all greasy and the garlic naan was also excellent.

The price is right so I will definitely return if I'm in the area. The only detractor is that the service is awful. Expect to ask for things like silverware, your bill, etc. and don't expect them to honor any special requests. The upside is that this saves you from having to leave a big tip!

excerpts: n naan n garlic naan
o n last but not the least Rice Pudding (best rice pudding
I have ever had n very similar to what you get in India @my house)
garlic naan.author: Vik P.
garlic naan.review: I have been to almost all the other places and this is undobtedly the best Pakistani/Indian place in the city. "Guddu" owner, chef of this place knows me n my friends very well now n talk to us very friendly and its really interesting how he manages that place so clean with such a little help when he s cooking, taking checks n also taking orders sometimes. Try his Tandoori Fish, Lamb Kheema (in the menu you'll see Lamb-Alu kheema I always ask him to make it without Alu aka potatoes) n naan n garlic naan o n last but not the least Rice Pudding (best rice pudding I have ever had n very similar to what you get in India @my house)

excerpts:
mmmmmm even more
regular naan, onion naan, garlic naan.....
garlic naan.author: Nelson W.
garlic naan.review:
Chicken Korma....mmmmm
Spinach with cheese....mmmmm
Eggplant with cream sauce....mmmmmm even more
regular naan, onion naan, garlic naan.....Mmmmmm!!!

I "mmmmmm" so many times my friend told me to stop MMMmmm-ing!  
My other friend said it was like eating baby food...well that was the best damn baby food I ever had.  The texture does resemble baby food since it is nice and chunky.   I can't describe the food any better than that.   It's baby food and a lot of "MMmmms"  Anyways, they rarely ever refill water, but like some indian places, this joint is 'self service'.  So be the cool and polite guy by walking up and grabing the pitcher to  fill all your buddies up with some H2O.  You'll probably need it if you order spicy foods.  They also have indian tea which is quite unique too.  Ok one last thing before I post this.

MMMMMmmmmmmmmm!!!!!  *breaths in* Mmmmmmm!! 
Ahhhh my belly is happy.

excerpts: But my garlic naan should be simpler than naan +
garlic + lots of spice mixes.
I just want naan
+ garlic
garlic naan.author: T T.
garlic naan.review:
OK now I had to change my review.  I have been there twice, but the second time was even worse than the first time.  

I had an impression that this chef does not know how to cook Indian food by picking right amount of spices mixed well.  

I had Chicken Tikka Masala and I seriously doubted why so many Yelpers love this place - it tasted like wrong spice mixes, and just made the flavor "simple" so that more people will accept it even if they are not familiar with Indian food.  This curry tasted so horrible that I did not even want to finish - I wonder what makes it "creamy" but NO, that's NOT curry!!!  That is not Tikka Masala!!!  

This may sound arrogant but I just do not think it is real Indian/Pakistani food.

Lassi was way too sweet although the server mixed with water before bringing it to me.  

The first time I had Lamb Vindaloo but this was not good either - it just below being OK, it tasted too sour for some reason.  

Their naans are certainly OK, could be better than other places but for me, not better than Shalimar's one.  It may be better than Pakwan's naan though.  But my garlic naan should be simpler than naan + garlic + lots of spice mixes.  I just want naan + garlic, maybe a hint of cilantro.  

So I don't know - it is possible that I went there on bad days.  Some people talk good things about their Tandori, so I may give them a last chance - but so far, no I did not like it.

excerpts: the garlic naan is delicious!
garlic naan.author: Tara A.
garlic naan.review:
best. funking. indian. food.... ever!!!!

i always always always get something with spinach, and i'm not even really into cooked spinach!
the garlic naan is delicious! 
kulfi cubes? yes please!
special non-menu dishes, funk yeah!

don't expect a quick meal though, when there's only one chef [the owner] things take a little longer, but it's so worth it! 

eat here. and often!

excerpts: The garlic naan is good and the lamb saag is fresh although needed more taste.
The food is cheap and good, the owner is friendly, but seriously, the food could be better!
But, hubby likes it a lot.
So, I guess, we are coming back for more.
garlic naan.author: Daisy S.
garlic naan.review: I thought it was good, but nothing to be brag about. All homemade. The garlic naan is good and the lamb saag is fresh although needed more taste. The food is cheap and good, the owner is friendly, but seriously, the food could be better! But, hubby likes it a lot. So, I guess, we are coming back for more.

excerpts: The onion and garlic naan were not worth the extra price and the garlic naan didn't seem to have fresh garlic in it.
The regular naan were plenty good: crispy outside and airy inside.
Grilled platter had tandoori chicken, lamb roti and two lamb kebabs.
All were flavored very well.
The chicken masala did not have as much tomato flavor as other places
but it's good nonetheless.
Veggie samosas were pretty big and delicious, spicy too!
Goes well with the mint yogurt and tamarind sauces that you get.
I like to eat them mixed together.
garlic naan.author: Andy B.
garlic naan.review:
Went to the Fabulous Food Festival this morning expecting to be somewhat full from all the samples of food but I was sorely disappointed. It wasn't worth the $10 per ticket we paid for. Anyways, I was pretty hungry when we decided to go to Lahore Karahi for an early dinner about 5:30pm. The place is pretty small maybe seats about 30 and only a few people were eating when we got in. We sat ourselves and ordered right away. I was surprised that it was an open kitchen. I actually got to see the chef/owner prepare our dishes. Big plus. Ordered the veggie samosas, grilled platter, chicken tikki masala, lamb korma and mixed veggies. Our waiter ask if we like it mild, medium or spicy. Of course, we went for spicy. Also, had two regular naans, one onion and one garlic. Highlights were the samosas, chicken tikki masala, mixed veggies, grilled platter and the regular naan. Lamb korma was not to my taste but the girlfriend enjoyed it. The onion and garlic naan were not worth the extra price and the garlic naan didn't seem to have fresh garlic in it. The regular naan were plenty good: crispy outside and airy inside. Grilled platter had tandoori chicken, lamb roti and two lamb kebabs. All were flavored very well. The chicken masala did not have as much tomato flavor as other places but it's good nonetheless. Veggie samosas were pretty big and delicious, spicy too! Goes well with the mint yogurt and tamarind sauces that you get. I like to eat them mixed together. Another surprising thing, other than the open kitchen, was that the food was not overly oily. 

I would definitely head here again when I'm in the area. A nice mom and pop feel to it. The chef/owner asked what we thought of the food, a very nice touch. I am a sucker for those type of gestures. But the best part of the dinner? The price. $45.50 with tax and all four of us were full. Good place to go after shopping at Union Square and the price will still leave you with money to shop after, if you don't go into a food coma that is.

excerpts: Garlic Naan, the best ever.
garlic naan.author: Ali W.
garlic naan.review:
Grilled chicken.

$3

HELLA GOOD.

Garlic Naan, the best ever.

The rice is not so much. Don't bother ordering it.

Overall, the dishes taste very home cooked and I love the prices.

excerpts: Not only is the food really freaking good (we had chicken tikka masala, eggplant, garlic naan, lamb kebab, and biryani), but they play Bollywood movies while you eat!
Could anything be better?
I think not.
Being there made me feel like I was in India all over again, even though I guess it should make me feel like I am in Pakistan, whatever, it was rad.
garlic naan.author: Rikki D.
garlic naan.review: Not only is the food really freaking good (we had chicken tikka masala, eggplant, garlic naan, lamb kebab, and biryani), but they play Bollywood movies while you eat! Could anything be better? I think not. =) Being there made me feel like I was in India all over again, even though I guess it should make me feel like I am in Pakistan, whatever, it was rad.

excerpts: garlic naan that was the perfect texture and covered in garlic and saag paneer that was neither too sweet nor too creamy.
The chef was also our waiter and - call me a sucker for a pretty smile - but he knows exactly what to do when some white chick and her lunch pal request in unison "Spicy!!
"  We're in the TL
so there's nothing fancy here.
just incredible food served in dishes that look like they're from an actual kitchen.
Perfect.
garlic naan.author: Valerie D.
garlic naan.review: I am about to have a torrid affair with a restaraunt.  While we've never been exclusive or had "the talk" Raja has been my main squeeze for as long as I have lived here.  . . . until today when my friend introduced me to Lahore Karahi and WHAM - just like that .   This place floored me with the best butter chicken I've ever had. . . garlic naan that was the perfect texture and covered in garlic and saag paneer that was neither too sweet nor too creamy.  The chef was also our waiter and - call me a sucker for a pretty smile - but he knows exactly what to do when some white chick and her lunch pal request in unison "Spicy!!"  We're in the TL so there's nothing fancy here. . . just incredible food served in dishes that look like they're from an actual kitchen.   Perfect.

excerpts: We had the garlic naan, veggie samosas with some great sauces and a collection of chicken and veggies.
The atmosphere was a bit on the creepy side but the old Bollywood movies in the retro tv was a nice touch.
Definitely a good hole-in-the-wall spot but not really the hot spot for a date.
Especially if you are going to park in the neighborhood.
garlic naan.author: Gil L.
garlic naan.review:
I was pretty impressed by what I had read in Yelp and within the Chron's bargain bites list. Despite the tough surroundings (the 'Loin) and the spartan atmosphere, I had a good time at Lahore Karahi. 
I had some issues with the service as it took a while for things things like drinks to arrive (imagine: reminding our waiter about the lasse that we ordered, watching him tell a coworker and then having having the waiter and the coworker stand around doing nothing for about 3 minutes before one of them poured the premade drink-- yeah, that should have taken 30 seconds)
The food was very tasty and cheap which was a plus. We had the garlic naan, veggie samosas with some great sauces and a collection of chicken and veggies.
The atmosphere was a bit on the creepy side but the old Bollywood movies in the retro tv was a nice touch. Definitely a good hole-in-the-wall spot but not really the hot spot for a date. Especially if you are going to park in the neighborhood.

excerpts: butter chicken is always a must when we go, along with the garlic naan.
the portions are solid and the prices are good.
this place is always worth the wait (when i'm not starving, of course).
garlic naan.author: Meredith K.
garlic naan.review: best indian i've had in sf. sure, there's usually a wait, but the food is made to order and there are only so many tables they can fit in there. i've just learned not to go when i'm too hungry. butter chicken is always a must when we go, along with the garlic naan. the portions are solid and the prices are good. this place is always worth the wait (when i'm not starving, of course).

excerpts: The chicken tika masala rated about 3 stars, saag paneer was not spicy enough - garlic naan was tasty and vegetable pakora was too doughy.
Fair pricing, plenty of food but not exciting enough to go racing back.
The neighborhood is so dicey that one might not want to walk around there after dark, let alone in daylight.
It, the neighborhood speaks of the sadness of run-down San Fran.
Maybe former NY Mayor Guiliani needs to clean up the slums of SF!
garlic naan.author: Chloe M.
garlic naan.review: Went with a friend during the week for dinner - our expectations were pretty high but the results were a little disappointing. Pleasant enough service, the food came quickly. The chicken tika masala rated about 3 stars, saag paneer was not spicy enough - garlic naan was tasty and vegetable pakora was too doughy. Fair pricing, plenty of food but not exciting enough to go racing back.  The neighborhood is so dicey that one might not want to walk around there after dark, let alone in daylight. It, the neighborhood speaks of the sadness of run-down San Fran. Maybe former NY Mayor Guiliani needs to clean up the slums of SF!

excerpts:
We ordered Bengan Bartha ($5.50), Butter Chicken ($6.00), and Garlic Naan ($2.00)
Bengan Bartha was good but Butter Chicken was many times better.
Garlic Naan was good too.
garlic naan.author: Oribel ..
garlic naan.review:
We went here and tried Prawn Tikka Masala ($10.95), Fish Tandoori ($10.95), Onion Kulcha ($2.00), Seekh Kabab ($4.00).
The food taste a little different than the Indian restaurants we usually go to such as Chutney or Naan 'n Curry.
Perhaps because Lahore Karahi is Pakistani cuisine(?)
I mean... tandoori in Indian restaurants usually has reddish color but at Lahore Karahi, the tandoori is brown.
The Fish Tandoori and the Seekh Kabab were served on a hot plate. What a nice surprise!
The food are excellent although they are different from what we used to, and the owner is nice and I will definitely come back again in the future.
The service was a little bit slow though. It took about an hour of waiting to get table, to order, and to get the food.
I will definitely upgrade the rating once the service is a little bit faster.
They accept Visa and Master Card.
-----
Despite of the slow service, we decided to come here again only 2 days apart because of its good food.
It took 5 minutes to be seated (great!) but 25 minutes to have the waiter - the guy with the index finger amputated - came and took our order (!!).
He was like in dazed and confused or something!!!

When finally he came and took our order, starting with: "What do you want to order?"
Us: "I want... (point at the menu)..."
He just turned around left before I finished the sentence and talked to another customer that just came without even saying any "excuse me, please", or "would you mind to wait a second?" (if that customer is so important to talk to right away)
Then, he went talking to another customer, then walking around and around, and bringing a couple of plates for another table, then again, walking around and around (yes, we saw all the process because we were just sitting there watching him), then went to another table (that came after us) taking order, then again walking around and around, bringing water jug here and there, before finally coming to our table again without even saying sorry or offering explanation of what happened.
I'm not sure why he did that. I do not mean to insult, but either he was negligent or rude.
Negligent means he did not realize what he did, he lost track, he does not have good memory which table came first, and therefore he was not capable to apologize.
Rude means he meant to do that to ignore us.
I hope it was the first one.

We ordered Bengan Bartha ($5.50), Butter Chicken ($6.00), and Garlic Naan ($2.00)
Bengan Bartha was good but Butter Chicken was many times better.
Garlic Naan was good too.

The food came pretty fast though within 15 minutes.
Now that I understand that Zulfikar "Guddu" Haider is the only guy cooking the dishes, actually we do not mind waiting for the food to be cooked to its excellence but we do mind being IGNORED with that waiter (not Guddu).
Overall was supposed to be 5 stars minus 1 star for the bad service from the waiter.

excerpts: If the Bollywood flicks on t.v. don't steal your heart, the palak paneer, aloo ghobi, garlic naan, and samosas will!
Truly a place where my Tandoori-culinary-love can roam!
Lahore Karahi is, hands down, the BEST Indian/Pakistani food I've had in San Francisco!
(And Gudu is a real charmer too!)
garlic naan.author: G D.
garlic naan.review: If the Bollywood flicks on t.v. don't steal your heart, the palak paneer, aloo ghobi, garlic naan, and samosas will! Truly a place where my Tandoori-culinary-love can roam! Lahore Karahi is, hands down, the BEST Indian/Pakistani food I've had in San Francisco! (And Gudu is a real charmer too!) ;)

excerpts: The garlic naan was delicious, as well as our entrees, the lamb vindaloo and chicken karahi.
Both were spicy, but not overwhelming.
Almost as enjoyable was the rice, which, according to the owner, is their specialty.
garlic naan.author: Erwin C.
garlic naan.review:
Went to early dinner on Saturday night, and immediately sat down. We started with the vegetable pakora, which was flavorful, but not crispy, like most restaurants. The garlic naan was delicious, as well as our entrees, the lamb vindaloo and chicken karahi.  Both were spicy, but not overwhelming.  Almost as enjoyable was the rice, which, according to the owner, is their specialty.  The rice is cooked with cinnamon sticks, and contains serrano peppers, although they don't crack the peppers to keep the heat down.

Parking is a cinch, though given the neighborhood, that is not a surprise. Be alert, and enjoy the fare.

excerpts: so one gets a cozy and raw urban experience that is unlike any other (for better or for worse).The butter chicken is addictive and full of juicy white meat the garlic naan is hot, fresh and delicious.
I don't like my food spicy
and they always honor my request for very mild.
Plus the hospitality is unbeatable; it's like dining at a friend's house, home cooking and all.
garlic naan.author: April H.
garlic naan.review: soooooooo good! every time i eat here i can not believe how tasty everything is. By far the best Indian food i have had in the city. It is in the loin so one gets a cozy and raw urban experience that is unlike any other (for better or for worse).The butter chicken is addictive and full of juicy white meat the garlic naan is hot, fresh and delicious. I don't like my food spicy and they always honor my request for very mild. Plus the hospitality is unbeatable; it's like dining at a friend's house, home cooking and all.

excerpts: I like to order 2 sides of their garlic Naan bread to dip in the sauce, hella good.
And the owner is awesome, he's always smiling!
garlic naan.author: kirehleen f.
garlic naan.review: If you love curry, this is the place. Though small in capacity, their tasty food and nice people that work there make up for it. Me and my boyfriend used to always get their chicken korma until I order their Chicken tikki masala (another type of curry they have) SOOOOO GOOODDD...It taste wayy better than regular curry, this one has a tang to it. I like to order 2 sides of their garlic Naan bread to dip in the sauce, hella good. And the owner is awesome, he's always smiling!

excerpts: MAMA SEITA), dal masala, beingan bhartha, 4 garlic naan, an order of rice,
a salad and my friends shared the patented fish tandoori, which they said reached emperor status.
garlic naan.author: Christopher J.
garlic naan.review:
yes, yes. this place dominates the quadrant. that free kulfi he gave us at the end was magnificient, my cholay rich and filling, the best green sauce i have ever tasted. my friend said that the lamb saag ascended above, all these marvelous things. dont pass this one up, give naan and curry, shalimar, chutney and pakwan a rest for five minutes ( listen, i know, its hard. they are go to places that have all the accolades and what have you. just do it, once.)
DUDE, UPDATE: 3/22/06 OH MY GOODNESS! Gudoo really went overboard tonight. I brought in three friends, and both chef and patron went to town. Starting with samosas, we went traveled a saag ghost, dal makhani (extra spicy, no cream. MAMA SEITA), dal masala, beingan bhartha, 4 garlic naan, an order of rice, a salad and my friends shared the patented fish tandoori, which they said reached emperor status. He topped it off with free kulfi and bannana pudding, homeade. my friend uttered: "this man is the god of the moment." Doesn't everybody want to be, just once? this guys hits that every couple of minutes. Are you still eating at shalimar?

excerpts: samosas, pakoras, garlic naan, rice, dal masala, a chickpea dish, ice cream (on recommendation), and a can of pop for 24  dollars.
the best  thing ever.
it tastes like paradise.
even though i hate the walk, if you wear headphones it's not so bad.
on a skateboard (or im sure on a bike) it'd be easy.
garlic naan.author: aerin w.
garlic naan.review: samosas, pakoras, garlic naan, rice, dal masala, a chickpea dish, ice cream (on recommendation), and a can of pop for 24  dollars.  the best  thing ever. it tastes like paradise. even though i hate the walk, if you wear headphones it's not so bad. on a skateboard (or im sure on a bike) it'd be easy.

excerpts: the garlic naan alone is worth a trip from new york
garlic naan.author: John M.
garlic naan.review: as with most indian food, great vegetarian options here.  possibly the best indian food i've ever had.  the garlic naan alone is worth a trip from new york

excerpts: The Dal Makhni was decent and the Garlic Naan was good.
Finished off my meal with another chai.
Would I go back?
Maybe if I am in the neighborhood
but I doubt that I will make a special effort to go there as I did tonight.
garlic naan.author: Sanjay C.
garlic naan.review: Just had dinner here. It was a mixed experience. Fortunately there wasn't much of a wait. Ordered my food and had a chai while waiting. It took about 15-20 minutes before the food showed up. The Chicken Tikka Masala gravy was a bit sweetish, which was weird (I prefer the CTM at Pakwan). The Dal Makhni was decent and the Garlic Naan was good. Finished off my meal with another chai. Would I go back? Maybe if I am in the neighborhood but I doubt that I will make a special effort to go there as I did tonight.

excerpts: We ordered the vegetable pakora, butter chicken, aloo mattar, a couple orders of rice and a garlic naan.
GREAT food.
the green chutney here is absolutely amazing.
When all was said and done, we still were hungry, so I asked the guy for a chicken vindaloo.
He said "right now?
" and I was like "yes, please!"
So the food comes 5 minutes later (the service is ridiculously quick, that's a plus), and it's lamb instead of chicken.
Best vindaloo ever, and it turned out that the lamb was a good contrast
--it was good quality lamb, too.
The presentation is real homey -- the food comes in bowls that look like my cereal bowls at home.
The kitchen area is right there in front of you, so the whole thing is real honest.
You can see what's cooking right there and watch your food being prepared.
Also, there's vintage, poor-quality bollywood on the TV.
major yay. go here.
garlic naan.author: Ethan K.
garlic naan.review: This place is great. We walked here from Powell before the show at Herbst and had a leisurely, great meal. We picked up drinks from the next-door market and the dude supplied us with a bottle opener when he asked. Very courteous service; a Mexican dude is the cook, and they treat him like family. We ordered the vegetable pakora, butter chicken, aloo mattar, a couple orders of rice and a garlic naan. GREAT food. the green chutney here is absolutely amazing. When all was said and done, we still were hungry, so I asked the guy for a chicken vindaloo. He said "right now?" and I was like "yes, please!" So the food comes 5 minutes later (the service is ridiculously quick, that's a plus), and it's lamb instead of chicken. Best vindaloo ever, and it turned out that the lamb was a good contrast--it was good quality lamb, too. The presentation is real homey -- the food comes in bowls that look like my cereal bowls at home. The kitchen area is right there in front of you, so the whole thing is real honest. You can see what's cooking right there and watch your food being prepared. Also, there's vintage, poor-quality bollywood on the TV. major yay. go here.

excerpts: Onion naan - it was delicious with chunks of onion and cilantro pieces.
onion naan.author: Sara S.
onion naan.review:
I wanted a low key feel comfortable in your sweater and leggings dinner date with my husband and this place was perfect!! I ordered...
Onion naan - it was delicious with chunks of onion and cilantro pieces.
Garlic naan - delicious! With garlic flavoring (my favorite of the two) 
*side tip you can get your brown and green chutney in the fridge section to dip your naan in.
Saag paneer - wonderful! With large chunks of paneer in it. It was mildly spicy and delicious over rice.
Lamb masala - the sauce was creamy and really good with the naan and rice!!
I was impressed by how clean the tables we're and how friendly the staff was. I will be back to try the other menu items in the future!! :)

excerpts: My go-to order is shahi paneer tikka masala, saag paneer , onion naan and garlic naan.
Their onion naan is to die for.
The staff here are super friendly and the order is quite quick.
So we are in and out of the restaurant
In less than an hour.
It's not a fancy restaurant and the prices are very decent.
Definitely try this place when in San Francisco.
onion naan.author: Sailaja B.
onion naan.review:
I wonder what I have been doing all this while without reviewing Lahore Karahi. We have been regulars here for over an year. I love their food and Mango Lassi. They have complimentary chai which is pretty good. My go-to order is shahi paneer tikka masala, saag paneer , onion naan and garlic naan. Their onion naan is to die for. The staff here are super friendly and the order is quite quick. So we are in and out of the restaurant 
In less than an hour. It's not a fancy restaurant and the prices are very decent. Definitely try this place when in San Francisco.

excerpts: Weekly order is onion naan and Karahi chicken.
onion naan.author: Christine L.
onion naan.review: This place is THE best. I order takeout almost once a week. Weekly order is onion naan and Karahi chicken.

excerpts: We ordered onion naan and paneer tikka masala
and it was just awesome.
This place has good options for vegetarians.
Don't miss Naan at this place.
They have complimentary chai as well.
Love this place, will definitely come back for Naan
onion naan.author: Arati S.
onion naan.review: They serve awesome Naan. We ordered onion naan and paneer tikka masala and it was just awesome. This place has good options for vegetarians. Don't miss Naan at this place. They have complimentary chai as well. Love this place, will definitely come back for Naan

excerpts: The onion naan was not as good as the garlic one.
onion naan.author: Richard T.
onion naan.review:
My buddy and I came here for lunch on President's Day.  If I was going to base this review on the service, I would have to give it 2 stars. We ordered a Veggie pakora as an appetizer, a butter chicken and a tandoori chicken for entrees, and garlic naan and basmati rice for sides.  They forgot our pakoras which is when I drafted the review and saved it as 2 stars.  

That's when the food came out.  It was great.  The garlic naan was the best naan I've ever had.  It was so crispy and hot.  You can't fake that freshness.  The entrees were good, but not much better than at other indian restauarnts in the area.  The onion naan was not as good as the garlic one.  

It was a reasonable price for two starving guys.  The garlic naan alone was worth the trip.

excerpts: We tried a little of everything: tandori fish, chicken tikka masala, chicken kebabs, onion naan, and basmati rice.
Our host was really nice, he told us "you ordered enough food" and advised us not to order the pakora we wanted.
The naan and the basmati rice equally tasty.
The only thing that we didn't love was the tandori fish.
onion naan.author: Betty C.
onion naan.review:
Teeny tiny place that I would have never found without Yelp!

Was in the mood for some authentic mediterranean food and went to my go to source to see what it would recommend and found this place.

The hubs and I walked here from Union Square (it's not really in the Tenderloin and the walk was pretty safe)

Definitely a family feel to this restaurant that seats no more than 25 people. We came here on a Friday night and the place remained fully occupied the whole time we were there.

We tried a little of everything: tandori fish, chicken tikka masala, chicken kebabs, onion naan, and basmati rice. Our host was really nice, he told us "you ordered enough food" and advised us not to order the pakora we wanted. we liked how he actually told us not to order more!

If you are really hungry you might want to get a little snack before you come here because the food definitely takes its time before it gets to your table. 

Chicken Kebabs and the chicken tikka masala was definitely delicious. We finished every bite. The naan and the basmati rice equally tasty. The only thing that we didn't love was the tandori fish. Maybe next time we will try the tikka masala fish.

Loved the value and the home cooked feel of this place. Would definitely come back or order to go from here.

Note: the bathroom is dirty, make sure you use it before you come here!

excerpts: Both were really spicy and went perfectly with the soft, freshly made garlic and onion naan.
The lamb was perfect but the prawns were overcooked in my opinion.
I also tried my friend's Afghani naan, which is supposed to be filled with raisins and nuts, but it tasted more like a fruitcake (guessing they ran out of ingredients?)
onion naan.author: Jessie C.
onion naan.review:
SPICY!! but delicious definitely. Somehow my group of 12 friends managed to snag a table here with no reservation on Friday night (our waiter was kind enough to move a few people to another table). We were expecting some slow service since this place was literally packed- almost every seat filled. But it wasn't bad at all! We all ordered and got our food at the same time though they did take a while to get all our naan out. 

The food is very rich, and according to my Indian friend- pretty authentic. We tried the Saag Gosht (lamb and spinah curry) and Prawn Vindaloo. Both were really spicy and went perfectly with the soft, freshly made garlic and onion naan. The lamb was perfect but the prawns were overcooked in my opinion. I also tried my friend's Afghani naan, which is supposed to be filled with raisins and nuts, but it tasted more like a fruitcake (guessing they ran out of ingredients?) Unfortunately, they didn't have any of the appetizers we wanted. 

Another bad thing was that toward the end of the meal, the restaurant started getting really smokey due to the open kitchen. Some of my friends really liked the smell, but it irritated my nose and made it unbearably warm inside. 

Overall the food is excellent (especially if you need to accomodate vegetarians) and the service is acceptable (given the restaurant was jam packed.) It's a great place to warm up with some HOT indian food on a cold winter night. (Chinese diners may find this place oddly homey since they use those dishes and coasters that you usually find in chinese restaurants- you know those blue and white fake porcelain plates.)

excerpts: The Onion Naan, actually had a good amount of decent sized chucks of onion cooked in the middle of the bread.
onion naan.author: Paul V.
onion naan.review:
I *really* *really* *really* wanted to like this place. I like spots like this, that are total whole in the wall, greasy spoon type places.. The food should have been much better tasting. I thought the Chicken Biryani was dry and tasteless. I ordered 2 other curries, the Butter Chicken and the Lamb Vanadloo. Both were good. Nothing to write home about, but good.

I was very hopeful when after placing my order the waiter turned and asked, do you want that mild or spicy? I immediately responded excitedly.. "SPICY." When the food came, everything was  about as spice-less as possible.

I've been in a 3 Star rut of trying new spots lately, I checked the reviews well on this one and had high-hopes. Unfortunately, maybe I got them on a bad day.

The Naan's were smaller than I'm used to but had a much more home made-taste to them. The Onion Naan, actually had a good amount of decent sized chucks of onion cooked in the middle of the bread. Big plus for any Onion Lovers..

No Beer or Wine either..

excerpts:
mmmmmm even more
regular naan, onion naan, garlic naan.....
onion naan.author: Nelson W.
onion naan.review:
Chicken Korma....mmmmm
Spinach with cheese....mmmmm
Eggplant with cream sauce....mmmmmm even more
regular naan, onion naan, garlic naan.....Mmmmmm!!!

I "mmmmmm" so many times my friend told me to stop MMMmmm-ing!  
My other friend said it was like eating baby food...well that was the best damn baby food I ever had.  The texture does resemble baby food since it is nice and chunky.   I can't describe the food any better than that.   It's baby food and a lot of "MMmmms"  Anyways, they rarely ever refill water, but like some indian places, this joint is 'self service'.  So be the cool and polite guy by walking up and grabing the pitcher to  fill all your buddies up with some H2O.  You'll probably need it if you order spicy foods.  They also have indian tea which is quite unique too.  Ok one last thing before I post this.

MMMMMmmmmmmmmm!!!!!  *breaths in* Mmmmmmm!! 
Ahhhh my belly is happy.

excerpts: The Aloo naan was great.
I'd definitely order here again.
aloo naan.author: Derek F.
aloo naan.review: Delivery was fast. The lamb vindaloo was spicy and had a lot of flavor. My only complaint was the amount of lamb. Only got as few pieces. But the flavor was awesome.  The Aloo naan was great. I'd definitely order here again.

excerpts: We had the lamb tikka masala with aloo naan and garlic naan.
We fed the two of us for less than $20.
The tikka masala was delicious!
A lot less creamy than others I've tried and a bit more of a kick.
Felt authentic.
My boyfriend said the lamb was tender.
I love how much flavor they pack into their naan!
When they say garlic naan, oh man do they mean it.
I can still taste the garlic on my breath right now lol!
You order and pay at the register, seat yourself, and then they'll bring you your meal.
They do take card
so that's a plus.
aloo naan.author: Lexi R.
aloo naan.review: Awesome no frills Indian spot right in the tenderloin. We had the lamb tikka masala with aloo naan and garlic naan. We fed the two of us for less than $20. The tikka masala was delicious! A lot less creamy than others I've tried and a bit more of a kick. Felt authentic. My boyfriend said the lamb was tender. I love how much flavor they pack into their naan! When they say garlic naan, oh man do they mean it. I can still taste the garlic on my breath right now lol! You order and pay at the register, seat yourself, and then they'll bring you your meal. They do take card so that's a plus.

excerpts: Their naan is best served in the restaurant - I often take it home and it gets a little soggy - and a world without their Aloo Naan (stuffed with peas & potatoes)
wouldn't be a world I'd like to live in.
aloo naan.author: Kevin L.
aloo naan.review:
Ok - yes the interior isn't the tidiest, and yes, staff don't take your order at your table. BUT the food here is delicious! 

Spicy, rich, flavorful curries - I'm a big fan of the Chicken Tikka Masala, Saag Paneer, Lamb Bindi, and more recently the Aloo Keema (ground lamb & potatoes).

Their naan is best served in the restaurant - I often take it home and it gets a little soggy - and a world without their Aloo Naan (stuffed with peas & potatoes) wouldn't be a world I'd like to live in. Also, their lamb samosas, tandoori chicken, and biryanis are all must-tries.

BUT hey, let's not knock the interior of the restaurant too much: 1) they have a huge TV to watch Giants games 2) their chai is free (actually it's also free for to-go orders) 3) did I mention the TV?

Sitting on their cafeteria-like tables, watching the chai come off a fire-blackened vat and into the serving pumps, and feeling the fire blast over the stovetop curries makes me love coming to this local eatery.

excerpts: Had the lamb boti and aloo naan for lunch.
I would have to say that both were fantastic and flavorful.
The lamb was tender and delicious with flavor.
The aloo naan, the potato made it a soft texture and it made the meal hearty.
Only other thing I know about naan is if they (restaurant) messes up on that, you're in for a bad surprise on the other dish.
aloo naan.author: Daniel K.
aloo naan.review:
Had the lamb boti and aloo naan for lunch. I would have to say that both were fantastic and flavorful. The lamb was tender and delicious with flavor. The aloo naan, the potato made it a soft texture and it made the meal hearty. Only other thing I know about naan is if they (restaurant) messes up on that, you're in for a bad surprise on the other dish. ;) 

If there has to be a complaint, the wait was longer than expect (sat for about an hour), but it was worth the wait. I would definitely be coming back again to try out other stuff on the menu.

excerpts: The aloo naan had some bonus onion inside, which made it extra tasty.
My Indian coworkers, who always say that Shalimar is #1, actually want to go back here next time.
That says a lot.
Guddu rules!
aloo naan.author: Ron L.
aloo naan.review:
A group of 13 from work went there for lunch today. Lucky for us, there were not many other people in the place when we went.  We started getting our food in around 30-40 minutes after we arrived, and it kept coming for the next 30 minutes. Tip: call in advance to give Guddu (the cook) some time to prepare.

The food was extraordinary. We ordered all sorts of tandoori items, fish, chicken, lamb, etc. The tandoori fish is Chilean Sea Bass, and was extremely good. All the curries and biryanis were wonderfully spiced, and FRESH. The naan was perfectly done, light and fluffy. The garlic naan was not overly garlicy, and probably the best I've ever had. The aloo naan had some bonus onion inside, which made it extra tasty.

My Indian coworkers, who always say that Shalimar is #1, actually want to go back here next time. That says a lot. Guddu rules!

excerpts: The lamb tikka masala went very well with the cheese naan that we cleaned the whole bowl.
cheese naan.author: Xinyu L.
cheese naan.review: Surprisingly flavorful and cooked fresh! The tandoori chicken was excellently seasoned. The lamb tikka masala went very well with the cheese naan that we cleaned the whole bowl.

excerpts: The chicken and cheese naan was like a sauce less inside out pizza, not sure how they did it
but it was great and actually tasted like a basic garlic pizza
cheese naan.author: Megan K.
cheese naan.review:
Absolutely everything was delicious except for the raita, it had a little too much carrot not enough cucumber but still good. 

Lamb tikka was slow braised and packed with creamy flavor/

The simple basmati rice was fluffy and pleasant and paired nicely with all dishes

The chicken and cheese naan was like a sauce less inside out pizza, not sure how they did it but it was great and actually tasted like a basic garlic pizza

excerpts: I would skip the cheese naan as there is barely any cheese in it.
Once in a while, we'll order the tandoori chicken, which always comes out moist and super flavorful.
cheese naan.author: William L.
cheese naan.review:
Favorite Indian restaurant that delivers to my home!  We randomly found this place on Amazon Prime Now when we were craving some Indian food, and after sifting through a dozen or so Indian restaurants we decided to go with Lahore Karahi.  Since then, we've tried other Indian restaurants that deliver to us, but none of them compare to Lahore Karahi!  

Every time we order from here, we get the chicken tikki masala and the butter chicken.  Both dishes are always on point, and their "extra spicy" is genuinely spicy!  At some other Indian restaurants, their extra spicy would be mild for me.  Their naans are always on point too, and we especially love the garlic naan.  Tons of garlic flavor and cooked just perfectly.  I would skip the cheese naan as there is barely any cheese in it.  Once in a while, we'll order the tandoori chicken, which always comes out moist and super flavorful.

excerpts: Between the four of us we ordered the chicken curry, lamb korma, paneer tikka masala,  chicken boti tikka, and then two sides of rice, two cheese naans, one garlic naan, and one garlic and cheese naan (which isn't on the menu
but you can ask for).
When they come out, the bowls are pretty small but don't be fooled, the portions are ridiculously filling.
Two sides of rice was more than enough to leave our bellies extremely full.
The cheese naan is more flavorful than the garlic naan in my opinion, but both are so good it's really hard to pick your favorite (so get the combo of both!).
The cheese naan is more flavorful than the garlic naan in my opinion, but both are so good it's really hard to pick your favorite (so get the combo of both!).
The only thing I would say is that the chicken boti tikka was a little dry, but honestly that's just me trying to find something wrong with it.
I was so unbelievably happy with this food and wished I could make my stomach bigger to eat more of it.
Ughhh drooling just thinking about it now.
cheese naan.author: Sam L.
cheese naan.review:
So this place is in the TL but it honestly didn't seem that bad..other than the really awkward situation of one of the servers getting into an argument with another guy and straight up shoving him out the door. He hit the ground so hard his beanie came off, and that's how you know it's some real shit. BUT the food is legit so I think it's worth it to come back.

Between the four of us we ordered the chicken curry, lamb korma, paneer tikka masala,  chicken boti tikka, and then two sides of rice, two cheese naans, one garlic naan, and one garlic and cheese naan (which isn't on the menu but you can ask for). When they come out, the bowls are pretty small but don't be fooled, the portions are ridiculously filling. Two sides of rice was more than enough to leave our bellies extremely full. The cheese naan is more flavorful than the garlic naan in my opinion, but both are so good it's really hard to pick your favorite (so get the combo of both!). The only thing I would say is that the chicken boti tikka was a little dry, but honestly that's just me trying to find something wrong with it. I was so unbelievably happy with this food and wished I could make my stomach bigger to eat more of it. Ughhh drooling just thinking about it now.

excerpts: Ask for garlic cheese naan and the saag paneer
cheese naan.author: Delaney C.
cheese naan.review: This place is BYOB which makes it a routine staple for my friends and I! Staff is friendly and welcoming, too. Ask for garlic cheese naan and the saag paneer

excerpts: next time I going to try one of the different flavors -- sesame naan, cheese naan, aloo paratha, Afghani naan, etc.
cheese naan.author: Priti K.
cheese naan.review:
When I think of Christmas dinner I don't think of Indian food and I certainly don't think of eating it in the Tenderloin. But now, after this year these things will always be just one degree of separation for me.

We came here for Christmas eve. It was pretty busy around 8pm. You order up front, seat yourself, and pay at the end when you're finished with your meal.
