The garlic naan was also very good.  We stayed there for about 2 hours and hung out there.  The place is a good size and could probably have a decent size group of 8 people.  Service was quick and good.  They only bring out the food.  The price was good for the amount of food provided.

excerpts: Got the chicken saag, lamb vindaloo, sesame naan (don't recommend this one), and basmati rice.
chicken saag.author: Kenny L.
chicken saag.review:
Closed until December 1st due to family emergency! :( 

Lahore (not "Tha Whore) possibly serves some of the best tasting and cheap Indian/Pakistani food around. 

Tip: Get to the counter. Fill out the check yourself with all the yummies that you want, then fill yourself up some delicious free chai! 

Got the chicken saag, lamb vindaloo, sesame naan (don't recommend this one), and basmati rice. 

This will make you go "Mmmmmm" in the TL.

excerpts: We had butter chicken (fyi, when you order it hot, it will be HOT!) and chicken saag with naan and pappadam.
Everything was delicious, and the place is casual and homey.
chicken saag.author: Elli F.
chicken saag.review:
I can't believe I lived across the street from this place for a year and then in the area for another year and a half and just tried it out now.  Seriously!  The food was really good.  We had butter chicken (fyi, when you order it hot, it will be HOT!) and chicken saag with naan and pappadam.  Everything was delicious, and the place is casual and homey.  I will certainly be coming back.

If you are looking to use your airline miles through restaurant.com (which is how I ended up trying Lahore Karahi out, they do accept the certificates!

excerpts:
My companions had:
- saag gosht - fair
- chicken saag - barely touched
- butter chicken - adequate
- chicken biryani - barely touched

Breads:
- Onion kulcha was soggy and needed salt
- Naan was OK but buried under the kulcha in layers, became soggy.
chicken saag.author: Martha M.
chicken saag.review:
I don't understand the hype about this place.  I was excited to try it after reading all the good Yelp reviews, and was sadly disappointed.

First off, we tried to order some appetizers for a table of 5.  Vegetable samosas?  "Sorry, we are out."   Aloo Tikki?  "Sorry".  OK, then just some vegetable Pakoras, and some Aloo Paratha.  Papadams?  "No need to order, they are on the house".

- There were no discernible vegetables in the pakoras. They were heavy and  without good flavor. The "chutneys" accompanying them were watered down sauces with flat flavors.
- The papadams never arrived; we had to ask twice and they finally showed up with the entrees
- The paratha never showed up
- "Out" of samosas, probably the most popular Indian appetizer, early on a Saturday evening?  What, they ran out of flour and potatoes?

Main courses:  

- having read so many raves about the tandoori fish, I had to try it.  The flavor, spice and burn were all good, but something must have been unbalanced since I found myself burping tandoori for the next 6 hours.

My companions had:
- saag gosht - fair
- chicken saag - barely touched
- butter chicken - adequate
- chicken biryani - barely touched

Breads:
- Onion kulcha was soggy and needed salt
- Naan was OK but buried under the kulcha in layers, became soggy.

Summary:
Service: slow, missed items
Atmosphere: dank
Food: sub-par

excerpts: true in the style of the food, but its good quality (not unhealthy like fast food) and authentic indian taste (there was a cinnamon stick in with my chicken saag dish, the basmati rice had one spicy pepper and some unknown spices (tree bark?) along with it..
There was def.
some interesting stuff going on and the chef is also the cashier, etc.
I'd  expect to wait a long time as there's three people running the entire show.
But its tasty and prices are fantastic.
chicken saag.author: Alex S.
chicken saag.review: Indian restaurant. It's authentic indian. It's listed at "divey" and thats def. true in the style of the food, but its good quality (not unhealthy like fast food) and authentic indian taste (there was a cinnamon stick in with my chicken saag dish, the basmati rice had one spicy pepper and some unknown spices (tree bark?) along with it.. There was def. some interesting stuff going on and the chef is also the cashier, etc. I'd  expect to wait a long time as there's three people running the entire show. But its tasty and prices are fantastic.

excerpts: We ordered the usual Chicken Saag, Tikka Masala, and Roti.
Delish!
chicken saag.author: Lily T.
chicken saag.review:
A wise man once told me that the Tenderloin may become the next up-and-coming place in the next ten years, and I believe Lahore Karahi may be sending them in the right direction. I was recommended to come here by a culinary expert. She reported that this place has excellent food though not so great service, and she absolutely right. We ordered the usual Chicken Saag, Tikka Masala, and Roti. Delish! And get this: they are inexpensive!

I did notice that their health inspection grade card indicates they score only 78, which is alarming. For now, my stomach's saying "Who cares?  What's done is done."

excerpts:
The aloo paratha - tasteless again 
chicken saag - i tried eating the saag / spinach out of it
but it was way too bland and oily
chicken saag.author: champa m.
chicken saag.review:
The place has a decent ambience . First the guy would not give us a bigger table - then he agreed. The service was ok . The food was terrible - chicken boti - sizzling and succulent but tasteless,
The aloo paratha - tasteless again 
chicken saag - i tried eating the saag / spinach out of it but it was way too bland and oily 
The chicken karahi - did not taste like karahi at all - put lahore to shame 
naan was chewy and cold

excerpts: i came here, based on yelp reviews, to catch up with a good friend over some chicken saag and baigan bharta.
medium spice was perfect heat and full of flavor (was that cardamon in the saag?)
naan was fresh out of the oven and perfect was to sponge up the saag and eggplant that did not disappoint.
the baigan bharta was different than what i have had in the past, this one had much more spice, garlic and onions.
chicken saag.author: Karen Y.
chicken saag.review:
when i was planning out my conference trip to sf, i realized that it's been months since i had quality indian and that sf is the place to fulfill my indian food craving.

i came here, based on yelp reviews, to catch up with a good friend over some chicken saag and baigan bharta.  medium spice was perfect heat and full of flavor (was that cardamon in the saag?)  naan was fresh out of the oven and perfect was to sponge up the saag and eggplant that did not disappoint.  the baigan bharta was different than what i have had in the past, this one had much more spice, garlic and onions.  the afghani naan was a perfect end to our lunch chat- fruit and cheese baked into the middle of fresh naan. 

service is kind, but the kitchen can be slow if the restaurant is full.  the food took quite a while.  which was okay this one time, since we had a lot of catching up to do.

excerpts: had the chicken saag, potato naan
(i think it's called aloo paratha on the menu) and the vegetable biryani.
in the past i've also had the lamb korma, saag gosht, and galoo gobhi  BYOB and cheap.
chicken saag.author: Christy I.
chicken saag.review:
this is my favorite place in the city for indian/pakistani food.  now, which is it.. indian or pakistani?  i admit i am still a tad ignorant about indian/pakistani food, but all i know so far is that i love it, especially at this place.

i'm not sure what i'd recommend.  seems like everything that i've tried so far has been excellent.  i was just there yesterday... had the chicken saag, potato naan (i think it's called aloo paratha on the menu) and the vegetable biryani.  in the past i've also had the lamb korma, saag gosht, and galoo gobhi  BYOB and cheap.

excerpts: We recommend the Lamb Korma and Chicken Saag, and the baliwood movies on the tv the whole time provided entertainment for lulls in conversation.
chicken saag.author: L F.
chicken saag.review:
Great food, great price, ok service (hence the 4 instead of 5 stars).

Very good place to sit and enjoy conversation with several strangers at your table.  We got seats pretty quickly at a table for 6 with 4 other friendly diners.  The waiter got slightly confused when we asked for a special kind of naan, but he ended up bringing us a combo of regular and special naan.  We recommend the Lamb Korma and Chicken Saag, and the baliwood movies on the tv the whole time provided entertainment for lulls in conversation.

excerpts: wasn't too big a fan of any of the chicken dishes asides from the chicken saag which was on point.
the tandoori fish has to be one of the best indian dishes i've ever had in the city!  not a big fan of goat
so i won't rate that.
the lamb vindaloo was incredible as was the bengan bertha
was so d-e-l-i
-c-i-
chicken saag.author: Swarup B.
chicken saag.review: quite possibly the 2nd best indian meal i have had in SF.  my co-workers adore this place and know the owner very well and always get the hookup.  so on to the food.  wasn't too big a fan of any of the chicken dishes asides from the chicken saag which was on point.  the tandoori fish has to be one of the best indian dishes i've ever had in the city!  not a big fan of goat so i won't rate that.  the lamb vindaloo was incredible as was the bengan bertha was so d-e-l-i-c-i-o-u-s!  and top it of, the mango lassi and mango kulfi excellent.  this was all in a lunch w/ 16 people today!  needless to say the productive at work after lunch was non-existent...

excerpts: Based on reviews about the Chicken Karahi, that's what I got.
The curry isn't over the top spicy.
It tastes flavorful and onion-y.
chicken karahi.author: AnneMarie W.
chicken karahi.review:
I went to the other Pakistani restaurant a couple blocks away (one of my favs), instinctively got a "No" and came here. Although the place was filled with dirty plates when I walked in (they were quickly cleared), it felt good. 

Based on reviews about the Chicken Karahi, that's what I got. The curry isn't over the top spicy. It tastes flavorful and onion-y. The chicken is moist and really good. 

Because a Yelper raved about the Saag Paneer (spinach with cheese), I got that too. I couldn't stop eating it. It isn't like one I've ever tasted. It is rich and really super good!!!! 

And a nan... covered in ghee, it was thick and divine!!!

Have to agree that they have the best chai tea. I wouldn't have tried it had a Yelper not raved about it. How do they get it to be sooo thick and yummy?!!! 

This is now my new favorite Pakistani restaurant!!!! 

(Lahore is a city in Pakistan close to the border of India.)

excerpts: Once we were done with our work in the neighborhood, we walked back to the establishment and ordered two Garlic Naan's and a plate of Chicken Karahi (recommended by the owner) between two people.
It is important to note that I set a high bar for an Indian/Pakistani place serving Chicken Karahi and in my heart, I really wanted this place to go above and beyond.
If I'm being completely honest about it, the Chicken Karahi looked bang average when it arrived at our table and I was a little unsure of how it was going to taste.
chicken karahi.author: Gaurav K.
chicken karahi.review:
I happened to walk past Lahore Karahi when I walking on O'Farell street and was immediately drawn by the aroma of the place. I quickly pulled out my phone to check it out on Yelp and wasn't surprised when I noticed that it was pretty highly rated. Yes, the aroma was good enough! 

Once we were done with our work in the neighborhood, we walked back to the establishment and ordered two Garlic Naan's and a plate of Chicken Karahi (recommended by the owner) between two people. The food was promptly brought to our table by one of the servers as we were just about settling down after grabbing a can of soda and a bottle of water. 

It is important to note that I set a high bar for an Indian/Pakistani place serving Chicken Karahi and in my heart, I really wanted this place to go above and beyond. The people behind the counter were sweet and the smell of the food was on point. 

If I'm being completely honest about it, the Chicken Karahi looked bang average when it arrived at our table and I was a little unsure of how it was going to taste. That along with the fact that it was missing the bell peppers we were promised on the menu, made me feel a little let down. 

All of my doubts vanished once I tasted the food and it was only after I had gobbled up my meal that I looked up and said another word. While Lahore Karahi din't turn out to be exceptional, it did just about meet the bar for a great place that serves authentic Pakistani food.

Would recommend it to people looking for good food in the city.

excerpts: Chicken Karahi: THIS IS MY ALL time favorite dish.
It has a hint of spice and the curry is amazing.
chicken karahi.author: Alondra J.
chicken karahi.review:
Lahore Karahi is one of my favorite Pakistani/Indian restaurant in The City. Before anything this place is not beautiful its not a luxurious place. BUT the food is great!

What I love getting at Lahore Karahi is their:

Chiken Tandoori: Tender & moist, comes with a few lemon wedges and onions.

Chicken Karahi: THIS IS MY ALL time favorite dish. It has a hint of spice and the curry is amazing. Just like the tandoori chicken the chicken that's in the Karahi is super tender. 

Chicken/Lamb Tikka Masala: Their chicken, again, tender and moist. This is the most delicious Chicken Tikka Masala that I have ever had. Their Masala is creamy and full of flavor. Their lamb is just like their chicken juicy, tender and moist!

Along with these dishes we usually order naan and roti.

A must try place! Just remember it is NOT a fancy place!

excerpts: This is one of the best aloo ghobi and chicken Karahi place with chilli naan I've experienced in San Francisco area.
The crown and ambience might not be the best but this rating is purely based on the taste and authenticity of the dishes ordered.
Keep up the great tasting Pakistani and Indian cuisine!!
chicken karahi.author: Moon S.
chicken karahi.review: This is one of the best aloo ghobi and chicken Karahi place with chilli naan I've experienced in San Francisco area. The crown and ambience might not be the best but this rating is purely based on the taste and authenticity of the dishes ordered. Keep up the great tasting Pakistani and Indian cuisine!!

excerpts: I have tried chicken karahi and naan.
And will try more dishes in my stay hopefully.!
5/5 from myside...!
chicken karahi.author: Zac K.
chicken karahi.review: As the name of the restaurant is Lahore Karahi and I belong to same city Lahore :) and obviously know alot about Lahore food. This food is really quite close to the food of Lahore. And the attitude of staff and cleanliness also give you a real experience of old town of Lahore restaurant  , where taste matters nothing else matters...! And yeah same here taste is awesome not like fancy indian/paki restaurant which are good looking from outside and food taste is zero...! I have tried chicken karahi and naan. And will try more dishes in my stay hopefully.! 5/5 from myside...!

excerpts: Chicken Karahi has white curry and was sweet.
Karahi should not have curry and sweet.
chicken karahi.author: Farhan K.
chicken karahi.review: Good service. One star is because all the Curry's have same taste. Chicken Karahi has white curry and was sweet. Karahi should not have curry and sweet.

excerpts: Chicken Karahi was solid.
Looking forward to trying their other options.
chicken karahi.author: Matthew M.
chicken karahi.review: Naans were outstanding! Biryani was one of the best in the bay. Chicken Karahi was solid. Looking forward to trying their other options. I think my personal favorite was the aloo and Keema naan.

excerpts: We ordered chicken karahi and aloo gobee (potato and cauliflower).
These tasted ok but not superb.
Maybe I expected too much.
chicken karahi.author: Akihiro I.
chicken karahi.review:
Disappointed about the quality of curries and raita.
I expected more since the smell from the restaurant reminds me of Pakistan where I visited many times. We ordered chicken karahi and aloo gobee (potato and cauliflower). These tasted ok but not superb.
Maybe I expected too much.

excerpts:
Come here for a tasty, no-frills, and cheap Pakistani meal - highly recommend the:

- chicken karahi (slow cooked in oil and a creamy sauce; not healthy but so yummy!)
- beef sikh kebab (minced, mixed with spices, and reassembled)
- garlic naan (sprinkled with paprika and garlic roasted; comes out fresh and hot)
- aloo gobhi (a very tasty potatoes and cauliflower dish)
chicken karahi.author: Amelia C.
chicken karahi.review:
Come here for a tasty, no-frills, and cheap Pakistani meal - highly recommend the:

- chicken karahi (slow cooked in oil and a creamy sauce; not healthy but so yummy!)
- beef sikh kebab (minced, mixed with spices, and reassembled)
- garlic naan (sprinkled with paprika and garlic roasted; comes out fresh and hot)
- aloo gobhi (a very tasty potatoes and cauliflower dish)

There's also free chai that you can serve yourself! This place deserves five stars for taste and value, and people recognize it - every table was taken by 8 pm on a Tuesday night.

excerpts: My favorites are the Chicken Karahi, Goat Curry even though the Chicken tandoori and Butter chicken are not bad.
chicken karahi.author: Vijay N.
chicken karahi.review:
This is by far the best N. Indian cuisine that one would find in SF even though it is Pakistani ( some parts of N.India and Pakistan share the same culture and food habits).

My favorites are the Chicken Karahi, Goat Curry even though the Chicken tandoori and Butter chicken are not bad. The Garlic Naan and Onion Kulcha are my staple orders for bread. Everything is cooked fresh and so will take some time but worth it. The Biryanis are good too here.

The  best part is that in the end, it is not expensive!

excerpts:
Lamb isn't gamey at all n sauce is very delicious

Chicken Karahi - oddly enough this was the only Karahi dish on the menu even though this place is named Lahore Karahi.
chicken karahi.author: Mai C.
chicken karahi.review:
The indie/paki food in the tenderloin is so good it's actually hard to be disappointed. 

Lamb vindaloo - so good and legitimately spicy. Lamb isn't gamey at all n sauce is very delicious

Chicken Karahi - oddly enough this was the only Karahi dish on the menu even though this place is named Lahore Karahi. It was good but not as good as the Karahi at shalimar 

Okra - very good and well seasoned. Okra wasn't slimy at all which is usually the case w most okra dishes

excerpts: a friend of mine asks to replace chicken with paneer in chicken karahi as he loved the gravy.
chicken karahi.author: Srinivas R.
chicken karahi.review:
Amazing food especially delight for non-vegetarians. Tandoori and Lamb and Goat dishes are finger-licking good. My usual order is Goat Bhuna which is very tasty and I keep eating the same dish each time I go there. Service is slow though and so if you are in a hurry eat, use order ahead or call in your ordere else it's at least a 20 mins wait.

They can custom make the dishes too. eg. a friend of mine asks to replace chicken with paneer in chicken karahi as he loved the gravy.

guys who work there are silent and shy so don't mistake them for being rude.

excerpts: The chicken karahi is unbelievable, and the garlic naan is no joke either.
The dishes are actually spicy which is more than I can say for most other places.
chicken karahi.author: Mike G.
chicken karahi.review:
This is the best indian food I've had in the city! The chicken karahi is unbelievable, and the garlic naan is no joke either. The dishes are actually spicy which is more than I can say for most other places. I can't wait to come back.

I've heard that they have up to two employees, but right now from what I've seen, this is a one man show, so be prepared to wait--but boy, do good things come to those who wait! It seems like any bad reviews here are focused on dinner taking 45 min or more for the food to come out, which I just expect if I'm getting Lahore Karahi...

excerpts: Barring the biryani, the other dishes we ordered-chicken karahi, kheema naan, garlic naan were pretty reasonable.
chicken karahi.author: Minu M.
chicken karahi.review:
If you claim to be an Indian/Pakistani restaurant then it is is imperative to get the biryani right, period. 
The biryani served here is pakki biryani (as opposed to kachi). It takes considerable amount of expertise to get kachi biryani right. The first spoonful of the biryani had a strong taste of unwashed rice. It is good not to wash the rice to retain the nutrients but this left a strong unpleasant taste. Also, the best chicken biryani is made with all parts of chicken, the dark meat tastes the best. The version here was just made with breast meat. Biryani typically has multiple layers of flavors but they used an overdose of green chillies rendering the dish singular flavored and extremely spicy.

Barring the biryani, the other dishes we ordered-chicken karahi, kheema naan, garlic naan were pretty reasonable.

excerpts: The chicken karahi is not bad, but a bit too salty.
chicken karahi.author: Novalina N.
chicken karahi.review:
Not sure what the big deal is but most of the food that I try here isn't that great. I really want to like this place because I haven't found my favorite Indian place in the city yet.

The lamb biryani is really dry. I need to keep drinking water while eating it. The chicken karahi is not bad, but a bit too salty. The garlic naan is thin and too crispy. Omg, I think Trader Joes' garlic naan tastes better.

The tandoori chicken however tastes really good, as most people point out. I haven't tried the tandoori fish yet, maybe I'll come back some other time just to try that one dish.

excerpts: i'm torn about this place - some of the items we ordered were delicious (lamb boti kebob), others were barely mediocre (chicken karahi, CTM, garlic naan)...
my friend and i paid about $45 for everything, which was quite a bit more than we realized since the place is one of those whole-in-the-wall-probably-known-because-its-open-late places.
anyway, i've def had better south asian food in the city and will probably not be back.
chicken karahi.author: Asmita J.
chicken karahi.review: i'm torn about this place - some of the items we ordered were delicious (lamb boti kebob), others were barely mediocre (chicken karahi, CTM, garlic naan)...my friend and i paid about $45 for everything, which was quite a bit more than we realized since the place is one of those whole-in-the-wall-probably-known-because-its-open-late places. anyway, i've def had better south asian food in the city and will probably not be back.

excerpts: I especially like the Chicken Karahi dish -- a great blend of tomatoes, bell peppers, spices and pieces of chicken breast (my favorite)!
I also recommend the Chikkar Cholay (puree of garbanzo beans).
It reminds me of haleem minus the meat.
Overall solid 3.5 stars!
chicken karahi.author: Helen Y.
chicken karahi.review:
Better than Shalimar? Nah I don't think so. 
Don't come here if you're in a hurry or if you're starving because the food takes forever. I thought it was because there's only one chef in the kitchen but when you're the only table being served you have to wonder why it's taking SOOOOOO long?

The good news is that the food is very tasty and the ingredients are fresh. I especially like the Chicken Karahi dish -- a great blend of tomatoes, bell peppers, spices and pieces of chicken breast (my favorite)! I also recommend the Chikkar Cholay (puree of garbanzo beans). It reminds me of haleem minus the meat.

Overall solid 3.5 stars!

excerpts: Chicken Karahi was anything but Karahi...
There are far better eateries out there than this average one.
chicken karahi.author: Muhammad D.
chicken karahi.review:
Very slow service. Food came after about 45 minutes of ordering, and no it was not freshly cooked. We were the only Pakistani Indian family eating there, this means the people who were eating could not verify the authenticity of the taste. Chicken Karahi was anything but Karahi...
There are far better eateries out there than this average one.  They are expensive tangibly, but, intangibly the prices are off the charts because taste of the food does not justify the cost :( only thing that was at par in taste was naan or bread.

To reiterate, this place does not have authentic Pakistani Indian cuisine,

excerpts: The chicken karahi and fish tandoori were my favs, always fresh and yummy.
I ordered the chef's special Nihari, one of my fav dishes but one that was never on the previous LK menu, as well as the chicken karahi, my LK fav.
They obviously can't have exactly the same taste as Guddu, every chef has their own way of making food, but the nihari was better than i expected and the chicken karahi flavorful.
You've gotta remember, i walked in to this expecting it to be terrible, but I'm still giving them four stars because it's hard learning to run a restaurant
and they were clearly trying.
Yes, the service could be better, the food could come faster, and the naan could actually make it on time, but I truly think they'll get to that point very soon.
chicken karahi.author: Shafaq C.
chicken karahi.review:
Lahore Karahi was my fav pakistani restaurant in the city -- and that's holding pretty high standards because I know what Pakistani food is supposed to taste like. The chicken karahi and fish tandoori were my favs, always fresh and yummy.

Recently, I learned that Lahore Karahi had new owners and Guddu was no longer the chef. It was the only Pakistani restaurant I fully endorsed and somehow I was sure the new owners just wouldn't be able to cut it. Lahore Karahi would now be added to the list of other mediocre Pakistani restaurants in the City.

Well, since I was already there when I learned of this change, I figured I might as well give them a chance and eat something. I expected the worst...no one I knew had eaten here since the new owners and yelp reviews weren't updated yet. I ordered the chef's special Nihari, one of my fav dishes but one that was never on the previous LK menu, as well as the chicken karahi, my LK fav. 

The cons to the new owners are that they're still finding their groove. They don't have service down just yet, they didn't bring us plates or drinks or anything to begin with. The food took a bit longer than expected, especially since most of the tables in the restaurant had already been served, but we could see that they were still trying to move quickly. The food arrived and my primary disappointment was the portion sizes -- smaller than most restaurants. If the owners are reading this, take my word of advice on the service and portions -- you'll need to step it up to restaurant standard, this isn't your dining room at home. My second disappointment was that although the main entrees arrived, there was no naan in sight. We silently waiting a few mins but our food was getting cold and we still had no naan. We politely asked the owner and he rushed an order and sent over naan one by one as soon as he could and we began eating.

Now you must wonder, if I have so many suggestions and disappointments thusfar, then why the 4 stars? Well, because to my dismay and against all expectations, the food was still good. They obviously can't have exactly the same taste as Guddu, every chef has their own way of making food, but the nihari was better than i expected and the chicken karahi flavorful. You've gotta remember, i walked in to this expecting it to be terrible, but I'm still giving them four stars because it's hard learning to run a restaurant and they were clearly trying. Yes, the service could be better, the food could come faster, and the naan could actually make it on time, but I truly think they'll get to that point very soon. They're just experiencing a couple of the pains of working a new business, especially one where everyone has such high expectations.

I know it's hard for a lot of people to look passed the fact that Guddu is gone, but give them a chance. And if you're into beef stew, try the nihari, It was pretty yummy and I think they may just have a couple tricks up their sleeves. Fingers crossed that they work out the kinks.

excerpts:
favorite dishes: 
- chicken karahi
- palak paneer
- tandoori fish
- garlic naan
chicken karahi.author: Greg D.
chicken karahi.review:
tasty indian/pakistani treats!

favorite dishes: 
- chicken karahi
- palak paneer
- tandoori fish
- garlic naan
- plain rice (cooked with cinnamon and cloves -- mmm!)

it's a super tasty dive restaurant (a bit smoky inside; place-settings, water, and chai are self-service; somewhat dated interior design), very casual. go there for the food, you will not be disappointed!

excerpts: We had the chicken karahi, the eggplant dish (starts with a b), and the tandoori chops.
I couldn't believe the lamb chops could be better than shalimar, but they were actually better marinated, and well grilled.
Served on a hot iron plate, it gets that nice korean bbq smell in your clothes, so BE WARNED.
But it was really tasty.

The chicken karahi was perfectly stir-fried--just chewy enough, yet still moist, with some flavorful pasty stuff all over, and some good bite (we got all the dishes "spicy"), and some good balance of sweetness and flavor in general.
The eggplant dish was very tasty!
Perhaps a little too sweet, but overall well balanced and flavorful.
The naan was just right, and we saw Guddu kneading and throwing around the dough as we walked in.
Prices were good, not quite as cheap as shalimar, but still inexpensive.
I believe the tandoori chop was $8, chicken was $6,
eggplant was $6.
But I can't remember, so don't quote me on that.
chicken karahi.author: Fong L.
chicken karahi.review:
WOW.  I never thought I'd say this, but I think it is better than Shalimar.  I need to go back a few more times to be sure...but wow.  Where shalimar feels like they just threw some curry into a dish and served it to you, the food just felt...crafted here.

First of all, unlike the other places, you actually have a waiter, and he actually takes your order and serves you your food.  The chef Guddu makes GUDDU FOOD!!!  (har har har)  but damn he's aptly named.

We started with those little cracker-like, naan-shaped pieces of unrisen bread and chutney, on the house.  Took a while for the food to come, and there was no beer in the fridge (I'm guessing it's BYOB like shalimar), but it was worth the wait.

We had the chicken karahi, the eggplant dish (starts with a b), and the tandoori chops.  I couldn't believe the lamb chops could be better than shalimar, but they were actually better marinated, and well grilled.  Served on a hot iron plate, it gets that nice korean bbq smell in your clothes, so BE WARNED.  But it was really tasty.
The chicken karahi was perfectly stir-fried--just chewy enough, yet still moist, with some flavorful pasty stuff all over, and some good bite (we got all the dishes "spicy"), and some good balance of sweetness and flavor in general.
The eggplant dish was very tasty!  Perhaps a little too sweet, but overall well balanced and flavorful.
The naan was just right, and we saw Guddu kneading and throwing around the dough as we walked in. 

Prices were good, not quite as cheap as shalimar, but still inexpensive.  I believe the tandoori chop was $8, chicken was $6, eggplant was $6.  But I can't remember, so don't quote me on that.  Total for the meal was $25 before tip, including a coke, garlic naan, and rice.

I'm definitely a fan now!  One of my bengali buddies introduced me to shalimar back in the day.  I'm gonna have to take him here next time he's in town!

excerpts: The Chicken Karahi is as good as you'll find anywhere - it's only better - well, yes in Lahore.
The chikkar cholay (garbanzo beans) are flavorful and have the pureed touch, which is exactly how they should be.
Naans are fresh and maybe a little too greased (though we were told, there the oil is cholestrol free! phew).
The tandoori fell a little short of my expectations, especially the seekh kababs.
However the fish was quite tasty, but I still prefer Rotee's tandoori fish.
All in all a great place.
Although I have to say the food turnaround was a little slow (25 mins) given that we were the only other table being served at the restaurant.
I guess it's all made fresh.
And did I say, I met Guddoo?
The CEO, founder and executive chef.
Very personable guy.
God, I love SF...get to eat home cookin' any day of the year thanks to the Pakloin...
not that I do given all the other great restaurants in this town, but it's so comforting to know that I can!
chicken karahi.author: Mamoon H.
chicken karahi.review:
Being a Lahori,  I can say with authority that Lahore Karahi comes close to real Lahori food.  

The Chicken Karahi is as good as you'll find anywhere - it's only better - well, yes in Lahore.  The chikkar cholay (garbanzo beans) are flavorful and have the pureed touch, which is exactly how they should be.  Naans are fresh and maybe a little too greased (though we were told, there the oil is cholestrol free! phew).  The tandoori fell a little short of my expectations, especially the seekh kababs.  However the fish was quite tasty, but I still prefer Rotee's tandoori fish.  All in all a great place.  Although I have to say the food turnaround was a little slow (25 mins) given that we were the only other table being served at the restaurant.  I guess it's all made fresh.

And did I say, I met Guddoo? The CEO, founder and executive chef.  Very personable guy.

God, I love SF...get to eat home cookin' any day of the year thanks to the Pakloin...not that I do given all the other great restaurants in this town, but it's so comforting to know that I can!

excerpts: The chicken karahi was nicely spicy, but all you could taste was dry chicken and green chillies.
chicken karahi.author: Benjina D.
chicken karahi.review:
Really, people? What's the big deal about this place? We went in for an early dinner on Sunday evening. The place was pretty empty and we were seated on the big table in the middle, even though there were only two of us. Next to a us was a little table in the corner full of dirty dishes. I looked around to see four tables that still had dirty dishes...all this was a huge turn-off, but we decided to stay anyway since the reviews were so good. The place is small, and only a few tables were taken, so why the waiter/buss boy was so damn slow in doing his work was beyond me. 

It was irritating to see him walk around, answering his phone every few minutes while doing everything in slow-mo. I asked for a straw...he actually looked around for one when there was a container full sitting in a prominent place next to the drink glasses. Anyone who's been to this place knows how tiny it is...I'd never been there, but still, I knew where the straws were! Near the entrance, somebody was peeling potatoes and onions on a small table. It sure didn't add to the already crappy ambiance.

The food was not so great, either. We ordered vegetable pakoras which were overdone. The butter chicken had a weird consistency and tasted nothing like any butter chicken I've ever had. The chicken karahi was nicely spicy, but all you could taste was dry chicken and green chillies. The garlic naan was ok, but the regular naan was really good. Mango lassi was watered down and they had no ice for our Cokes.

Needless to say, dinner sucked. The kitchen was dirty, the owner kept coming and going indoors and out...he actually met a friend at the front door and played with her dog...eeew! The waiter was incompetent, and I've had better Pakistani food elsewhere. Actually, I wouldn't even call it Pakistani food...that would be an insult to Pakistani food. Guddu needs to learn how to cook!

excerpts: Tandoori fish is also a treat (if not somewhat pricey for the 'Loin), as is the Chicken Karahi.
chicken karahi.author: Zubair J.
chicken karahi.review:
Lamb curry is quite possibly the best in the City (wonderfully soft meat, perfectly pungent sauce). Tandoori fish is also a treat (if not somewhat pricey for the 'Loin), as is the Chicken Karahi.

The wait, however, is the reason this place does not get 5 stars. With an unwavering insistence on keeping the cookstaff at one person (the owner), Lahore Karahi will make you wait for some time before you eat.

excerpts: I highly recommend the Chicken Karahi.

: It is extremely hot so if your not into spicy food you can consider yourself warned

Value: I ordered the chicken biryani, chicken korma, chicken karahi, lamb vindaloo and two naans = $33.50 

Ladies and gentlemen of Yelp....
chicken karahi.author: manoj r.
chicken karahi.review:
Ok ! I think I've found what I've been looking for. 

For those who are less familiar with Indian/Pakistani food, there is a real difference between Indian and Pakistani food. I've been to a few Indian restaurants masquerading as Pakistani and Lahore Karahi is not one of them.

Taste: Very flavorful. I highly recommend the Chicken Karahi. It's the best Karahi I've had.

Spice: It is extremely hot so if your not into spicy food you can consider yourself warned

Value: I ordered the chicken biryani, chicken korma, chicken karahi, lamb vindaloo and two naans = $33.50 

Ladies and gentlemen of Yelp....It doesn't get cheaper than this and the food can easily serve 4. 

I noticed that some reviewers complained of the slow service..but hey..at these prices..you cannot expect a Ritz Carlton. It's a hole in the wall and I would gladly wait an extra 10-15 mins.

excerpts: The chicken karahi - did not taste like karahi at all - put lahore to shame
naan was chewy and cold
chicken karahi.author: champa m.
chicken karahi.review:
The place has a decent ambience . First the guy would not give us a bigger table - then he agreed. The service was ok . The food was terrible - chicken boti - sizzling and succulent but tasteless,
The aloo paratha - tasteless again 
chicken saag - i tried eating the saag / spinach out of it but it was way too bland and oily 
The chicken karahi - did not taste like karahi at all - put lahore to shame 
naan was chewy and cold

excerpts: The chicken karahi, daal, kadahi rice, and more, all just amazing.
chicken karahi.author: John S.
chicken karahi.review:
Compares to the best Pakistani food anywhere in the U.S. and very reasonably priced.  The guy who cooks the food knows his craft. The big plus: the food is made fresh.  The chicken karahi, daal, kadahi rice, and more, all just amazing.  Will try the seafood (Tandoori Fish and the like), the next time. 

Don't expect quick waiter service. Order at the counter and get your own plates, cutlery, etc.   You can request spices according to your taste from mild to hot.

excerpts: I don't get the hype about the Chicken Karahi.
chicken karahi.author: Srini P.
chicken karahi.review:
This is the best North Indian / Pakistani food in the city and is up there for the best in the Bay Area.

Garlic Naan, Butter Chicken.  For when I'm feeling white.  Saag Paneer, Chole are great as well.  I don't get the hype about the Chicken Karahi.  It's not that great (neither are the Tandoori or Biryanis), but there's plenty of other great stuff on the menu.

The place is BYOB, but I don't.  I don't think Guddu the chef really approves of drinking in his place.

excerpts: The amazing chicken karahi, nan and tandoori fish more than make up for the poor service
This is definitely the best indian/pakistani restaurant in SF and is an amazing bargain.
As long as you go are prepared to wait to wait an hour for your food and repeat your order to the waiter multiple times, it is more than worth the trip.
chicken karahi.author: Niraj P.
chicken karahi.review:
I hesitate to give this place 5 stars only because the service is horrible.  That being said, I still return to Lahore all the time because the food is amazing and is a great bargain.  The amazing chicken karahi, nan and tandoori fish more than make up for the poor service
This is definitely the best indian/pakistani restaurant in SF and is an amazing bargain.  As long as you go are prepared to wait to wait an hour for your food and repeat your order to the waiter multiple times, it is more than worth the trip.

excerpts: The chicken karahi is particularly tasty.
And the chai is quite good.
chicken karahi.author: Faisal G.
chicken karahi.review:
The food here is off the charts, the service I'm afraid is awful. You need be prepared to eat at least an hour after you order. The owner insists on making the food himself which means there is no fast turn-around time. 

The chicken karahi is particularly tasty. And the chai is quite good.

excerpts: Chicken karahi was good but the two veggie dishes that we ordered were below average.
chicken karahi.author: Venetian P.
chicken karahi.review:
Me and my wife decided to go to Lahore Karahi based on Yelp reviews but we were little disappointed with the taste and quality of the food, may be we went with too much expectation. 

Service was good in general and particularly the server who served us did a good job, which is odd for Indian/Pakistani restaurants. 

Based on one review I tried tandoori fish. It was OK, I think it is better to get tandoori lamb or chicken than fish in most Indo/Pak places.

Chicken karahi was good but the two veggie dishes that we ordered were below average. I understand that these types of restaurants are not the places to order veggie dishes but when they are in the menu they should taste moderate if not good.

Not sure whether I'll go to Lahore Karahi again.

excerpts: The garlic naan was delicious, as well as our entrees, the lamb vindaloo and chicken karahi.
Both were spicy, but not overwhelming.
Almost as enjoyable was the rice, which, according to the owner, is their specialty.
chicken karahi.author: Erwin C.
chicken karahi.review:
Went to early dinner on Saturday night, and immediately sat down. We started with the vegetable pakora, which was flavorful, but not crispy, like most restaurants. The garlic naan was delicious, as well as our entrees, the lamb vindaloo and chicken karahi.  Both were spicy, but not overwhelming.  Almost as enjoyable was the rice, which, according to the owner, is their specialty.  The rice is cooked with cinnamon sticks, and contains serrano peppers, although they don't crack the peppers to keep the heat down.

Parking is a cinch, though given the neighborhood, that is not a surprise. Be alert, and enjoy the fare.

excerpts: The flavors were horribly out of balance - the tandoori dish lacked salt and the chicken karahi was too sweet.
And the seekh kebab was a dry dense mass that needed to be washed down with a ton of chutney.
Needless to say, I will not be returning.
chicken karahi.author: Felice L.
chicken karahi.review: The only great thing about this place is their tamarind and mint chutneys. Being a big fan of both Shalimar and Naan N Curry I was extremely disappointed.  The flavors were horribly out of balance - the tandoori dish lacked salt and the chicken karahi was too sweet. And the seekh kebab was a dry dense mass that needed to be washed down with a ton of chutney.  Needless to say, I will not be returning.

excerpts: Loved everything but the chicken in my butter chicken.
Chicken wasn't soft enough for me to eat it with a naan with my hands.
I think the chicken should kinda fall apart when you smoosh it with your naan?
It felt dry... that was a bummer.
The guy at the counter was very nice!
butter chicken.author: Alex K.
butter chicken.review: I love Indian/Pakistani food!!!! Have to say, the flavor is definitely there! Portions are just right but hubby think they are small.  Loved everything but the chicken in my butter chicken. Chicken wasn't soft enough for me to eat it with a naan with my hands. I think the chicken should kinda fall apart when you smoosh it with your naan? It felt dry... that was a bummer. The guy at the counter was very nice!

excerpts: I had the Butter Chicken here
and it was so good and creamy!
The mains don't include naan or rice though
butter chicken.author: Sophia L.
butter chicken.review: I had the Butter Chicken here and it was so good and creamy! The mains don't include naan or rice though

excerpts: Ordered recently for the first time (Lamb Korma; Butter Chicken; Aloo Ghobi; Garlic Naan; Veggie Samosas; Rice).
Loved everything, especially the Butter Chicken and Lamb Korma.
Upon first glance, the meat dishes seemed somewhat "greasy" (this was mostly noticed upon hardening after refrigerating).
However, be it fat or oil or whatever
(and I have no issue with enjoying fat), the ingredients mixed back together wonderfully, and this was one of the tastiest places at which I've had these dishes.
butter chicken.author: Tommy M.
butter chicken.review:
Ordered recently for the first time (Lamb Korma; Butter Chicken; Aloo Ghobi; Garlic Naan; Veggie Samosas; Rice). 

Loved everything, especially the Butter Chicken and Lamb Korma. Upon first glance, the meat dishes seemed somewhat "greasy" (this was mostly noticed upon hardening after refrigerating). However, be it fat or oil or whatever (and I have no issue with enjoying fat), the ingredients mixed back together wonderfully, and this was one of the tastiest places at which I've had these dishes. Flavors were bold, spicy, consistent and very well balanced. 

Can't wait to order again. Very impressed with the flavor.

excerpts: Every time we order from here, we get the chicken tikki masala and the butter chicken.
Both dishes are always on point, and their "extra spicy" is genuinely spicy!
At some other Indian restaurants, their extra spicy would be mild for me.
butter chicken.author: William L.
butter chicken.review:
Favorite Indian restaurant that delivers to my home!  We randomly found this place on Amazon Prime Now when we were craving some Indian food, and after sifting through a dozen or so Indian restaurants we decided to go with Lahore Karahi.  Since then, we've tried other Indian restaurants that deliver to us, but none of them compare to Lahore Karahi!  

Every time we order from here, we get the chicken tikki masala and the butter chicken.  Both dishes are always on point, and their "extra spicy" is genuinely spicy!  At some other Indian restaurants, their extra spicy would be mild for me.  Their naans are always on point too, and we especially love the garlic naan.  Tons of garlic flavor and cooked just perfectly.  I would skip the cheese naan as there is barely any cheese in it.  Once in a while, we'll order the tandoori chicken, which always comes out moist and super flavorful.

excerpts: - butter chicken (chicken dry/sauce not as tasty as tikka masala)
butter chicken.author: Nicole H.
butter chicken.review:
Food was above average but gave me tummy aches at night/the day after.

Yums:
- lamb tikka masala (lamb SO tender!! yummy!!!!)
- keema naan
- garlic naan

Meh:
- butter chicken (chicken dry/sauce not as tasty as tikka masala)

excerpts: The butter chicken is eh and the vegetable curry is meh.
Fast service but other than that the service is quite lacking.
butter chicken.author: H A.
butter chicken.review: Naan and chicken kababs were good. The butter chicken is eh and the vegetable curry is meh. Fast service but other than that the service is quite lacking.

excerpts: My favorite dish here is the butter chicken.
I have been to several Indian restaurants (in the U.S and U.K) and can easily say that this one makes it to the top five.
It was packed full of flavor and even had a subtle kick to it.
I wish I can make this at home.
butter chicken.author: Danny L.
butter chicken.review:
The good Yelp reviews caught my attention but the sanitation warning almost deterred me away. I'm glad it didn't, because the food here was fantastic!

The sanitation warning made me paranoid so I was initially more aware of my surroundings. As I stepped inside, nothing immediately threw me off, but I did notice that the kitchen was a bit messy and there were a few open food containers left exposed on random counter top spaces. Realistically though, this probably happens all the time in other restaurants and we just don't see it. At this restaurant, the kitchen area is exposed to the eating area so you see everything. Despite the questionable cleanliness, no one in our group got sick after eating and we all really enjoyed our meal. 

My favorite dish here is the butter chicken. I have been to several Indian restaurants (in the U.S and U.K) and can easily say that this one makes it to the top five. It was packed full of flavor and even had a subtle kick to it. I wish I can make this at home. I recommend it.

We had a vegan and vegetarian in our group and they both enjoyed their meal.

Note that everything here is self serve. You order at the counter, you pick up your own silverware, and you pour your own water. This makes it cheaper and it would be up to you to leave a tip or not. Not sure what the right tipping etiquette here is, but to me, no service means no tip.

Overall, this place is cheap and delicious. The cleanliness might throw some people off, but it wasn't enough for me not to want to come back again.

excerpts: I ordered butter chicken , nann and raita.
The raita was completely spilled in the bag all over everything.
Fine.
It happens.
The butter chicken though!
Orange water!!
I have never received something so inedible!
I do not know how this place has such good reviews.
The entire order went into the trash.
When I complained they said I had to return the delivery order to them myself.
In the tenderloin.
Great , let me grab an Uber to return this mess.
Thanks.
I can get past the spill, but the food was disgusting.
butter chicken.author: Kate P.
butter chicken.review: This review is for delivery only. I ordered butter chicken , nann and raita. The raita was completely spilled in the bag all over everything. Fine. It happens. The butter chicken though! Orange water!! I have never received something so inedible! I do not know how this place has such good reviews. The entire order went into the trash. When I complained they said I had to return the delivery order to them myself. In the tenderloin. Great , let me grab an Uber to return this mess. Thanks. I can get past the spill, but the food was disgusting.

excerpts: The food was mediocre and I'm pretty sure we got up-charged, regret not speaking up when we got rang out (got charged almost $40 for chicken korma and butter chicken).
The pictures of this place are deceiving it's basically a hole in the wall but without tasty food.
there was this taco place across the street that looked busy
I regret not going there instead.
butter chicken.author: Samantha N.
butter chicken.review: Idk how this place has so many good reviews. Our server seemed nice but we were never offered any water. The food was mediocre and I'm pretty sure we got up-charged, regret not speaking up when we got rang out (got charged almost $40 for chicken korma and butter chicken). The pictures of this place are deceiving it's basically a hole in the wall but without tasty food. there was this taco place across the street that looked busy I regret not going there instead.

excerpts: Chicken tikka and butter chicken taste identical - neither great.
Saag paneer watery and flavorless.
butter chicken.author: David W.
butter chicken.review: I'm amazed at the positive reviews. We just got delivery. Raita is no more than colored water. Chicken tikka and butter chicken taste identical - neither great. Saag paneer watery and flavorless.

excerpts: This is  We ordered chicken biriyani, butter chicken and naan.
Butter chicken and naan was good.
butter chicken.author: Tanver M.
butter chicken.review: Placing this eview while sitting in the resturant. This is  We ordered chicken biriyani, butter chicken and naan. The chicken biriyani taste like fish curry mixed with chicken in it. Wrost biriyani i ever had.  Butter chicken and naan was good.

excerpts: The butter chicken is also one of the best I've had, mostly due to the tenderness of the chicken.
Most chicken curries at other places are dry, so I was surprised that they cooked the chicken so well here!

I also get the paneer tikka masala which is delicious, though I think I might like the butter chicken sauce better than the tikka masala (though they only offer paneer tikka masala, not paneer makhani, afaik).
butter chicken.author: Grace D.
butter chicken.review:
Despite the place being a complete hole-in-the-wall in TL, I find myself coming back (and recently, ordering from UberEats!) because the food is just toooo good! Despite the low food safety score... which didn't scare me away, and it hasn't gotten me sick yet (knock on wood). I love the garlic naan, and I feel like their naan is bigger than what other restaurants give. The butter chicken is also one of the best I've had, mostly due to the tenderness of the chicken. Most chicken curries at other places are dry, so I was surprised that they cooked the chicken so well here! I also get the paneer tikka masala which is delicious, though I think I might like the butter chicken sauce better than the tikka masala (though they only offer paneer tikka masala, not paneer makhani, afaik).

If you can look past its slightly sketch location and the low food safety score, this is an Indian place you cannot skip! Might be my favorite Indian place in the city.

excerpts: I had the butter chicken and plain naan.
Omg!
I've had a lot of butter chicken in my days and this may have been the best.
It's a bit spicy - my lips are still burning.
The bread was amazing.
I had good customer service - not sure what others have experienced.
I'll definitely be back.
butter chicken.author: Jeff P.
butter chicken.review: I had the butter chicken and plain naan. Omg!  I've had a lot of butter chicken in my days and this may have been the best. It's a bit spicy - my lips are still burning. The bread was amazing. I had good customer service - not sure what others have experienced. I'll definitely be back.

excerpts: We tried the naan, butter chicken, and lamb in mild cream curry.
All three were full of flavor, moist, and great texture.
butter chicken.author: Sasquatch M.
butter chicken.review: The best Indian food I've had in San Francisco, and probably in the US. We tried the naan, butter chicken, and lamb in mild cream curry. All three were full of flavor, moist, and great texture.

excerpts: The lamb vindaloo, chicken tikka masala, and butter chicken are absolutely delicious and the best I've ever had!
The chicken tandoori was good too
but I wasn't in love with it like the other dishes.
butter chicken.author: Debbie H.
butter chicken.review:
Love this place!! Absolutely the best Pakistani/Indian food around!! 

The lamb vindaloo, chicken tikka masala, and butter chicken are absolutely delicious and the best I've ever had! The chicken tandoori was good too but I wasn't in love with it like the other dishes. The garlic naan, ohhhh man the garlic naan... It was like love at first sight hahah. 

BYOB kind of place with liquor stores all around

excerpts: We ordered Butter Chicken and Prawn Tikka Masala, and Garlic Naan and Roti to accompany them.
The Butter Chicken of course is thick, creamy and buttery.
The sauce is slightly spicy, enhances the chicken and goes with Naan awesomely.
The chicken is a tiny bit dry but still a lot better than Chutney's.
They're cut into bite-sized chunks of chicken breast.
The Prawn Tikka Masala is cooked in a creamy tomato sauce.
This sauce has awesome consistency - it's less fatty than the butter chicken, there no oily layer on top.
The shrimp was still crisp - tasted very nice and fresh.
The Garlic Naan looks cute and perfectly rounded.
It's topped with garlic and herbs.
This Naan is not too thick and smells nice.
It's not too soft and floppy but not too dey either.
butter chicken.author: Châu B.
butter chicken.review:
This place is pretty good for what it is. The food tasted awesome, it's cooked to order. 

This place is still in the Tenderloin but a block away from the Chutney, Shalimar, etc. bunch. It looks clean and tidy. The tables are spacious. This place is Self Service. You choose your own seat and take the menu, choose what you want and go up to the counter to order. You can help yourself to water from the fridge or free chai tea. Your food will come to you when it's done. And when you're done - you can go to the counter to pay. 

My friend introduced me to this place. We ordered Butter Chicken and Prawn Tikka Masala, and Garlic Naan and Roti to accompany them. 

The food took awhile but they make everything individually to order so the wait isn't a bad thing. The portion may look small but it will fill you up. The Naan will especially help. 

The Butter Chicken of course is thick, creamy and buttery. The sauce is slightly spicy, enhances the chicken and goes with Naan awesomely. The chicken is a tiny bit dry but still a lot better than Chutney's. They're cut into bite-sized chunks of chicken breast. It's $8.99 

The Prawn Tikka Masala is cooked in a creamy tomato sauce. This sauce has awesome consistency - it's less fatty than the butter chicken, there no oily layer on top. The shrimp was still crisp - tasted very nice and fresh. It's really worth the $11.99. 

The Garlic Naan looks cute and perfectly rounded. It's topped with garlic and herbs. This Naan is not too thick and smells nice. It's not too soft and floppy but not too dey either. This was $2.50. 

The Roti is made of whole wheat so it's druer and less fluffy. It's more dry than Naan - but it's healthy. The crisp bread is good to pick up the sauces. I think this was $1.50. 

This place is tidy and bright and the food is flavorful and taste good. The price is a bit higher than Chutney's but the flavor is more authentic and it's really worth it. At least give it a try.

excerpts: Meanwhile, my boyfriend had ordered the butter chicken.
He liked the curry part as he had a couple of spoons of it before trying the chicken
but once he put the chicken in his mouth... let's just say he spit it out, drank an entire can of iced tea, then some water, and that wasn't enough- mouthwash was necessary.
He claimed it was the worst chicken he has ever had.
butter chicken.author: Megha S.
butter chicken.review:
So I'm from NJ and am visiting. Ordered the food with my friendand was hoping it'd be at the very least- decent- since it was on UberEats. When it was delivered we had high hopes, but as soon as we opened the bag- things went down south. 

First, I had ordered the Shahi paneer. Now I have had Indian food at a lot of places (I'm Indian as well), but the container of paneer was literally one fourth full with oil, and it was impossible to separate. The oil was so evident you could see a layer at the bottom, the rims, and the top. We tried to spill it out... but it was quite unsuccessful. At this point, I was hungry so I just tried to eat it without a fuss.

Meanwhile, my boyfriend had ordered the butter chicken. He liked the curry part as he had a couple of spoons of it before trying the chicken but once he put the chicken in his mouth... let's just say he spit it out, drank an entire can of iced tea, then some water, and that wasn't enough- mouthwash was necessary. He claimed it was the worst chicken he has ever had. It basically tasted fake, like cardboard. 

The total order with the two entrees and rice was about $30, and I feel like we should be getting a full refund.

Not to mention, I get that people might love this place but if Yelp has a health warning for it, I really would like to wipe this situation out of my mind. Poor food plus poor sanitation, how much more does it take for a restaurant to be shut down?

excerpts:
Ordered: 
Butter Chicken Masala: 2/5 The chicken was WAY too dry.
It was impossible to break apart with my fork and I could probably chew on a piece for days if I wanted to because it was so overcooked.
The flavor was a lot better than the butter chicken.
butter chicken.author: Courtni W.
butter chicken.review:
Ordered: 
Butter Chicken Masala: 2/5 The chicken was WAY too dry. It was impossible to break apart with my fork and I could probably chew on a piece for days if I wanted to because it was so overcooked. The masala was neither rich nor creamy, it tasted quite bland. 

Chicken Tikka Masala: 3/5 The flavor was a lot better than the butter chicken. Chicken was still very dry. 

Garlic Naan: 2/5 Despite how good it looked (refer to my photos), there was no flavor. I expected the naan to be a mouthful of garlic yumminess but instead received a mouthful of bland carbs instead. 

Service: 1/5 I highly recommend this restaurant to hire someone to bus tables because all the tables around me were filled with dirty dishes. The tub where you usually put your dirty dishes in was already filled to the brim with dirty dishes. Only two people were working and they were both cooking and taking orders. It took a solid 20 minutes for my boyfriend and I to receive our food and took another 5 minutes standing at the counter for one of the employees to give us the check and for us to pay and leave. This restaurant is not run well at all, they definitely need more employees working because it seems like it takes forever for things to get done. 

If you're looking for a quick place to grab a bite to eat, I would not recommend this restaurant but if you're trying to kill time and don't mind an under-averaged plate of Indian food, you could try this place.

excerpts:
Had the garlic naan, chicken cheese naan, chicken tikka masala, butter chicken, and lamb vindaloo.
The butter chicken was the best out of the three.
I prefer the chicken tikka masala better at Chutney, although the meat is really dry there.
The lamb vindaloo was nothing memorable but it wasn't bad.
You couldn't taste the chicken in the chicken cheese naan.
The meal was pretty inexpensive.
butter chicken.author: Heejin L.
butter chicken.review:
3.5
I thought this place maybe slightly better than some of the other places I have been to.  You order first, then sit.

Had the garlic naan, chicken cheese naan, chicken tikka masala, butter chicken, and lamb vindaloo.
The butter chicken was the best out of the three.
I prefer the chicken tikka masala better at Chutney, although the meat is really dry there.
The lamb vindaloo was nothing memorable but it wasn't bad.
You couldn't taste the chicken in the chicken cheese naan.
The meal was pretty inexpensive.

excerpts: My boyfriend ordered the Butter Chicken and I Ordered the chicken biryani.
Both dishes contained a lot of flavor, but the Butter Chicken definitely took the gold.
The sauce was rich and creamy and the chicken was oh so tender.
butter chicken.author: Angela L.
butter chicken.review:
Although located in the sketchy tenderloin district, this place is hands down the best Indian restaurant I've gone to. 

My boyfriend ordered the Butter Chicken and I Ordered the chicken biryani. Both dishes contained a lot of flavor, but the Butter Chicken definitely took the gold. The sauce was rich and creamy and the chicken was oh so tender. The naan was also fluffy and soft, nothing like the chewy ones you get at the Indian express food places. 

The Chicken biryani was a bit dry but the self- served-sauce they provided definitely provided that moistness. The flavor was there, but the texture was a bit off for me. Overall, this is a solid place for Indian food.

excerpts: We got the Chicken Tikka Masala, Butter Chicken Masala and Garlic Naan.
The Butter Chicken Masala was a tad bland.
It wasn't nearly as creamy or rich as most Butter Chicken Masalas and the chicken was extremely dry as well.
The Garlic Naan smelled and looked delicious
Overall, the Butter Chicken and Garlic Naan lacked flavor.
However, the Chicken Tikka Masala was delicious.
They were understaffed leading to very slow service.
Overall, the Butter Chicken and Garlic Naan lacked flavor.
However, the Chicken Tikka Masala was delicious.
They were understaffed leading to very slow service.
butter chicken.author: Ray W.
butter chicken.review:
I came here for lunch with my girlfriend. We got the Chicken Tikka Masala, Butter Chicken Masala and Garlic Naan. 

The Chicken Tikka Masala was great. it was well seasoned and had the perfect taste to it. However, the chicken was extremely dry.

The Butter Chicken Masala was a tad bland. It wasn't nearly as creamy or rich as most Butter Chicken Masalas and the chicken was extremely dry as well.

The Garlic Naan smelled and looked delicious but it wasn't very garlic-y. 

Overall, the Butter Chicken and Garlic Naan lacked flavor. However, the Chicken Tikka Masala was delicious. They were understaffed leading to very slow service. There were only two people working the register and kitchen combined. 

Would definitely come back but only for the Chicken Tikka Masala.

excerpts: Butter Chicken -
butter chicken.author: Katy N.
butter chicken.review:
NOTE to yourself,  do NOT dine here during  a HOT day/night because this place has NO AC!!!!!!!!!!  Only eager to dine here because of that stupid episode from "Check Bay Please" & NOT  looking forward to return here anytime soon! 

One star for their Garlic Naan 

One star for their Lamb Samosa 

Butter Chicken - The sauce was A-OK,  but the highlight of this dish aka Chicken was HARD & inedible; such disappointment! 

Lamb Kabab - Alright. 

Aloo Golbi - Cauliflower with potatoes  - Nothing special & quite  bland.

excerpts: I came with a group of six and we ordered lamb biriyani, bhindi masala (curried okra), butter chicken, tandoori fish, aloo gobi, and lamb vindaloo and shared family style.
We ate ourselves silly and still had tons of leftovers.
butter chicken.author: Kimberly S.
butter chicken.review:
I have a small (okay large) place in my heart for cheap, ethnic, eats and Lahore delivers!

I came with a group of six and we ordered lamb biriyani, bhindi masala (curried okra), butter chicken, tandoori fish, aloo gobi, and lamb vindaloo and shared family style. We ate ourselves silly and still had tons of leftovers. Since we were staying in a hotel, nobody wanted to cart the leftovers home but as a testament to how good the food was, we all regretted our decision approximately one hour later.

This restaurant is not very service oriented which is probably a reason why it is so inexpensive. You place your order from behind the counter and grab your drinks from a little fridge on the side of the restaurant. I did not mind this at all, it made the whole experience all the more cozy and inviting (perhaps due to their BYOB/BYOW policy?!?!).

excerpts: I ordered the $6.50 Butter Chicken, which consisted of Tandoori chicken pieces bathing in a buttery cream sauce (see photo).
Very tender with carrots and spices complementing the flavor.
Jamie went for the $7 Lamb Korma, which was just as tender and succulent though a bit hazardous to spoon since the bowl was filled to the brim with the spicy sauce (see photo).
butter chicken.author: Ed U.
butter chicken.review:
My kindred Yelper Liz S. so inspired me with her knowledgeable review of Lahore Karahi on "Check Please! Bay Area" that it finally motivated Jamie W. and me to try it finally after all these years. We were expecting a madhouse of chaos, but we must have come after Katrina came through since all we saw were piles of dirty dishes all around. We honestly didn't know whether we should wait for the young waiter to clean it all up or just pitch in with some Palmolive and a pair of Playtex gloves from the Walgreen's down O'Farrell. 

We decided to wait and hoped the waiter would wipe down the table. Alas, Jamie got a stain on his beloved Threadless T-shirt due to leftover curry sauce on the rim of the table, and only my Diet Coke came. Note we both ordered Diet Cokes and only mine came. Not Jamie's, mine. Things were not off to a promising start. However, once the food started coming, all was forgiven. We started with the $3 basket of Vegetable Pakora, tasty and surprisingly light veggie fritters that looked like they came from South Carolina, not South Pakistan (see photo). But the exotic spices came through with each bite. 

I ordered the $6.50 Butter Chicken, which consisted of Tandoori chicken pieces bathing in a buttery cream sauce (see photo). Very tender with carrots and spices complementing the flavor. Jamie went for the $7 Lamb Korma, which was just as tender and succulent though a bit hazardous to spoon since the bowl was filled to the brim with the spicy sauce (see photo). We skipped the naan in favor of a plate of Basmati rice to make sure we sop up all the sauces. Genuinely delicious but maybe bring a sponge just in case the waiter doesn't have time to be thorough next time. 

FOOD - 4.5 stars...homemade Pakistani dishes done up right and packed with flavor 
AMBIANCE - 2.5 stars...well... 
SERVICE - 4 stars...the attentive young server was everywhere 
TOTAL - 4 stars...definitely worthy of a return visit...thanks Liz!

excerpts: I can't get enough of their butter chicken & garlic nann!
This place gives me LIFEEEEEE!
butter chicken.author: Ruhjeenuh Z.
butter chicken.review: I LOVE this place!! I always call ahead of time and order by phone. My to go is usually done really fast! By the time I get there it's ready for me to pay! I can't get enough of their butter chicken & garlic nann! This place gives me LIFEEEEEE!

excerpts: Butter chicken was great!
We had dinner on our trip and loved this place.
Pretty relaxed vibe with great food.
butter chicken.author: Daniella W.
butter chicken.review: Butter chicken was great! We had dinner on our trip and loved this place. Pretty relaxed vibe with great food. Others ordered chicken tikka masala, rice with garlic and cheese naan. Loved the cheese naan! Everything was great and will return on our next trip!

excerpts: We ordered Butter Chicken and Lamb Vindaloo for curries.
For the breads, we ordered Roti and Naan.
The Butter Chicken was better than the Lamb Vindaloo.
I like things a little more spicy.
So the Butter Chicken could have been more spicy.
But nevertheless it tasted good.
Lamb Vindaloo was just okay.
The best part was the Naan.
These were the best Naans I have ever had.
Soft, fluffy and non-rubbery.
They had the perfect texture and easy to break with just three fingers.
Unlike most Naans which keep on stretching when you try to break them.
The place is small and cluttered but everyone comes here for the food.
They also had something called BYOD - Bring Your Own Drink going on.
Chilled out laid back!
butter chicken.author: Akshay M.
butter chicken.review:
The food is good. I was with a friend here last night. We ordered Butter Chicken and Lamb Vindaloo for curries. For the breads, we ordered Roti and Naan. The Butter Chicken was better than the Lamb Vindaloo. I like things a little more spicy. So the Butter Chicken could have been more spicy. But nevertheless it tasted good. Lamb Vindaloo was just okay. The best part was the Naan. These were the best Naans I have ever had. Soft, fluffy and non-rubbery. They had the perfect texture and easy to break with just three fingers. Unlike most Naans which keep on stretching when you try to break them. 
The place is small and cluttered but everyone comes here for the food. They also had something called BYOD - Bring Your Own Drink going on. Chilled out laid back!

excerpts: Their garlic naan is wonderful and I can't get enough of their Butter Chicken.
They're doing it the right way here and the staff is super friendly.
No frills here.
Just good food.
butter chicken.author: Steve T.
butter chicken.review: Great food that's relatively cheap and quick. Their garlic naan is wonderful and I can't get enough of their Butter Chicken. They're doing it the right way here and the staff is super friendly. No frills here. Just good food.

excerpts: So far I've had the Butter Chicken, Tikka Masala, Lamb Vindaloo, and Vegetable Korma.
They were all exceptional.
Some of the best indian food I've had in San Francisco.
They took Korma to a whole new level for me.
butter chicken.author: Adam M.
butter chicken.review:
TL;DR - Brilliant food, great prices. Full of flavor, tender meat dishes.

So far I've had the Butter Chicken, Tikka Masala, Lamb Vindaloo, and Vegetable Korma. They were all exceptional. Some of the best indian food I've had in San Francisco. They took Korma to a whole new level for me. Cheese naan was also really good.

You order at the cash register when you walk in, so if your looking for a "nice" restaurant with attentive waiters this really isn't the place for you. I prefer ordering upfront it lets me enjoy my meal in peace and provides me the opportunity to leave when I want.

excerpts: My favorites are the Chicken Karahi, Goat Curry even though the Chicken tandoori and Butter chicken are not bad.
butter chicken.author: Vijay N.
butter chicken.review:
This is by far the best N. Indian cuisine that one would find in SF even though it is Pakistani ( some parts of N.India and Pakistan share the same culture and food habits).

My favorites are the Chicken Karahi, Goat Curry even though the Chicken tandoori and Butter chicken are not bad. The Garlic Naan and Onion Kulcha are my staple orders for bread. Everything is cooked fresh and so will take some time but worth it. The Biryanis are good too here.

The  best part is that in the end, it is not expensive!

excerpts: We ordered a Veggie pakora as an appetizer, a butter chicken and a tandoori chicken for entrees, and garlic naan and basmati rice for sides.
The garlic naan was the best naan I've ever had.
It was so crispy and hot.
You can't fake that freshness.
The entrees were good, but not much better than at other indian restauarnts in the area.
The garlic naan alone was worth the trip.
butter chicken.author: Richard T.
butter chicken.review:
My buddy and I came here for lunch on President's Day.  If I was going to base this review on the service, I would have to give it 2 stars. We ordered a Veggie pakora as an appetizer, a butter chicken and a tandoori chicken for entrees, and garlic naan and basmati rice for sides.  They forgot our pakoras which is when I drafted the review and saved it as 2 stars.  

That's when the food came out.  It was great.  The garlic naan was the best naan I've ever had.  It was so crispy and hot.  You can't fake that freshness.  The entrees were good, but not much better than at other indian restauarnts in the area.  The onion naan was not as good as the garlic one.  

It was a reasonable price for two starving guys.  The garlic naan alone was worth the trip.

excerpts: Between my two friends and I, we ordered the Garlic Naan, Regular Naan, Butter Chicken, Fish Tikka Masala, Tandoori Chicken, and the Saag Paneer.
As a whole, nothing really stood to me as being anything special.
The Fish Tikka Masala was definitely the best of the bunch, as they did a good job with cooking the fish.
Even then though, it didn't strike me as amazing flavor-wise.
Decent, but not great.
And while none of the dishes were bad per se, it's not like
butter chicken.author: Mike L.
butter chicken.review:
One star...yup, haven't given out one of these in a while.  I guess I've been pretty fortunate so far with where I've been (which is something I'm quite appreciative of).  But then, it's not everyday you see a ROACH while you're eating.  Yeaaaaah....game over.  Thanks for playing.

Now, before you write this review off as a one star just because of a roach...well, you're partially right.  Seeing a roach certainly put this one a one star path, but it's not like I found the rest of the experience that fantastic anyways.  Unlike other Yelpers, I didn't find the food that remarkable the first time I was here a year or two ago, and it really wasn't any different this time around.  

Between my two friends and I, we ordered the Garlic Naan, Regular Naan, Butter Chicken, Fish Tikka Masala, Tandoori Chicken, and the Saag Paneer.  As a whole, nothing really stood to me as being anything special.  The Fish Tikka Masala was definitely the best of the bunch, as they did a good job with cooking the fish.  Even then though, it didn't strike me as amazing flavor-wise.  Decent, but not great.  And while none of the dishes were bad per se, it's not like you can't find something just as good (or better) elsewhere in the City or the Bay Area.

Considering the fact that we had to wait almost 40 minutes for our food and that they still forgot our order of Tandoori Chicken, Lahore already wasn't going to be getting anything better than two stars before the roach showed up anyways.  Now, I'm not so naive to think that roaches aren't a problem at other places, including those that I'm actually fond of.  However, there's a BIG difference between suspecting or thinking they might be around, and then actually seeing the damn things on the wall.

If people want to keep coming back because they think the food is still great despite it all, then by all means.  That just means the lines will be shorter somewhere else.  I just know I won't be back, and I wouldn't even give it a second thought.  The only part that I'll still be thinking about is whether or not it was a good or bad thing that we didn't see the roach until towards the end of our meal.  Ugh...disgusting regardless.

excerpts: Excellent food must try Lamb Bhunna and butter chicken, only need to work on ambiance and cleanliness.
butter chicken.author: Faisal K.
butter chicken.review: Excellent food must try Lamb Bhunna and butter chicken, only need to work on ambiance and cleanliness.

excerpts: BUT .... when the food arrived -- tandoori lamb chops, naan, lamb biryani, butter chicken, papad -- it was SO FREAKING INCREDIBLY DELICIOUS that I almost plotzed.
It was like being in some auntie's kitchen and tasting the most delightful symphony of flavors.
The biryani had lots of yummy crispy bits, the lamb chops were huge and searingly hot, the butter chicken buttery!
butter chicken.author: Lisa T.
butter chicken.review:
We were looking for some desi food in the TL and this was the place that popped up closest to where I parked my car. I had not yet consulted Yelp, my friend and I just randomly picked this place.

There are 100 reasons I shouldn't have liked Lahore Karahi. Here are three of them
1) too many white yuppie diners, zero South Asians
2) food took freaking FOREVER
3) one ancient waiter and one busser so service was beyond slow ...

BUT .... when the food arrived -- tandoori lamb chops, naan, lamb biryani, butter chicken, papad -- it was SO FREAKING INCREDIBLY DELICIOUS that I almost plotzed. It was like being in some auntie's kitchen and tasting the most delightful symphony of flavors. The biryani had lots of yummy crispy bits, the lamb chops were huge and searingly hot, the butter chicken buttery!

Our feast came to $28. 
It was really really good food.
Now am beginning to think it wasn't so random after all.

excerpts: We ordered butter chicken, daal masala and garlic naan; and it was all outstanding!
butter chicken.author: Rick J.
butter chicken.review: I'm not exactly sure how anyone couldn't rate this place 5 stars. We ordered butter chicken, daal masala and garlic naan; and it was all outstanding!

excerpts: Best Butter Chicken ever but a bit pricey!
However I come here anyway
butter chicken.author: Anneke B.
butter chicken.review: Best Butter Chicken ever but a bit pricey! However I come here anyway, their garlic naan is great too.
