I asked for a straw...he actually looked around for one when there was a container full sitting in a prominent place next to the drink glasses. Anyone who's been to this place knows how tiny it is...I'd never been there, but still, I knew where the straws were! Near the entrance, somebody was peeling potatoes and onions on a small table. It sure didn't add to the already crappy ambiance.

The food was not so great, either. We ordered vegetable pakoras which were overdone. The butter chicken had a weird consistency and tasted nothing like any butter chicken I've ever had. The chicken karahi was nicely spicy, but all you could taste was dry chicken and green chillies. The garlic naan was ok, but the regular naan was really good. Mango lassi was watered down and they had no ice for our Cokes.

Needless to say, dinner sucked. The kitchen was dirty, the owner kept coming and going indoors and out...he actually met a friend at the front door and played with her dog...eeew! The waiter was incompetent, and I've had better Pakistani food elsewhere. Actually, I wouldn't even call it Pakistani food...that would be an insult to Pakistani food. Guddu needs to learn how to cook!

excerpts: (I'm generally not a fan, but I would get these again); saag ghost; the butter chicken; plain naan and the Afghani naan.
We were served a complimentary ice cream (All of this for $22.00)
If I was standing the saag would have brought me to my knees.
It will restore your faith.
Butter chicken was also divine.
butter chicken.author: She-Ra ..
butter chicken.review:
Thank you to everyone for recommending this place.  (Although my waistline will no doubt wish it remained undiscovered.)  Yes, there is a wait and it is disorganized.  But the food! And the service! The chef is an amazingly friendly person and he does wonderful things in his kitchen.  We had the samosas (I'm generally not a fan, but I would get these again); saag ghost; the butter chicken; plain naan and the Afghani naan.  We were served a complimentary ice cream (All of this for $22.00) If I was standing the saag would have brought me to my knees. It will restore your faith.  Butter chicken was also divine.  The Afghani naan was similar to a cross between panetoni and nann, but it was killer this morning toasted with my coffee.  

The only downside - apart from having to wait - were the feelings of guilt that I was taking advantage of Guddu due to his insanely low pricing for the quality of his food.

excerpts: We ordered an outstanding roti ($1), we ordered naan ($1), we order Butter Chicken and Lamb Vindaloo ($7), and lastly, we ordered the much-hullabalooed Tandoori Fish ($11).
Everything was outstanding.
The Tandoori Fish was perfectly spiced, perfectly cooked.
The Lamb vindaloo was incredibly complex and rich.
And of course, the Butter Chicken was butter chicken - but unlike most places they let the chicken shine, not the sauce.
We ate until you could not possible eat ever again.
I am writing this around lunch-time of the day after
butter chicken.author: Tolga E.
butter chicken.review:
Sometimes, Yelp is dead-on about great places to eat. However, more often then Yelp, your co-worker of the ethnicity in question is even more dead-on. When I saw 4.5 stars on 190 reviews I thought "this is promising". When my co-worker said "The only Indian food that compares is my mom's. I lived in England for 10 years and never had Indian food this good" - then...I drop everything I'm doing and proceed to the restaurant immediately. Simply put, this is best Indian food I've ever had. Some places have been close, but Lahore Karahi is the new standard-bearer. 

LK is in the Tenderloin. So, get your dirty, grimy, SF reality on, and go on a foggy, windy, and freezing summer's evening. The place is BYOB so bring some wine or some beer. When my friend and I arrived, a group of 6 people had already gone through a 6-pack of Fat Tire and were working on a 6-pack of Red Stripe. Two other guys across the room each had one of those large cans of Sapporo to drink with their meal. That alone shows how knowledgeable the patrons here are. They understand that Light lagers, pilsners, and weak ales are the only acceptable beer-forms for Indian (or any other type of equatorial) food.

Now, to the food - My friend and I, seeing that all entrees (other than 3 items) were priced below $7 immediately went into a binge-fest. We ordered an outstanding roti ($1), we ordered naan ($1), we order Butter Chicken and Lamb Vindaloo ($7), and lastly, we ordered the much-hullabalooed Tandoori Fish ($11). Everything was outstanding. The Tandoori Fish was perfectly spiced, perfectly cooked. The Lamb vindaloo was incredibly complex and rich. And of course, the Butter Chicken was butter chicken - but unlike most places they let the chicken shine, not the sauce. We ate until you could not possible eat ever again. I am writing this around lunch-time of the day after and I'm still full.

The owner/chef/waiter greeted us and, at first glance, was slightly eerie. But if you get into your SF cultural acceptance and tolerance mode, you've got no problems with the service. It was timely, efficient, and (somewhat) unintrusive. 

I will be back here many, many times. Oh..and Bourbon and Branch is like 5 steps away. It's an odd to think of these two places, which couldn't be more different, but who both practice their craft with such perfection, both setting up shop in the ghetto a mere block from each other. The joys of San Francisco never cease...

excerpts: Butter chicken:
Creamy sauce, with butter floating on top with super soft chicken pieces.

At lahori: Not creamy at all, 
but rather like a paste of onions and tomatoes.
the texture was so that i could feel the onions and tomatoes in my mouth.
the color which should be bright red or orange is just red.
butter chicken.author: Karthick S.
butter chicken.review:
I figure that if i use yelp, i should also contribute. So from here on you will be seeing more from me. I tend to visit a new restaurant every weekend and i am a big fan of food\cooking myself.

My first ever review and sorry that it has to be a negative one. But here is why:

This is what i feel when i follow a Yelp review:

When it comes to food, there is a difference between good tasting food and ORIGINAL tasting food. 
Yelp reviewers can agree on good tasting food, but not on the later. For example, I have found myself loving certain
Chinese &Mediterranean restaurants which are detested by my Chinese &Mediterranean friends. Reason: I liked how the 
food at these places tasted, but had no exact idea as to how they were supposed to taste. It is like going to a sushi 
place and enjoying a sushi with cooked fish(Might be exaggerating a bit :-) ). 


Lahore Karahi will probably fit the former(In my case not even that). Here are reasons why:

My order:

1)Sheek Kebab
2)Lamb Biryani
3)Garlic Naan
4)Butter Chicken

In this case, me being from that part of the world(Indian& Pakistan) and being an avid food lover, I know how each of the above should taste like, or how each 
of the above taste in the best restaurants, cooked by the best chefs in that part of the world. let me explain how
it should have been cooked and how it should have tasted, and how it actually did.

1) Sheek Kebab: Ground lamb kebabs which when pulled out of the tandoor(grill), should never be overcooked.
When served, the meat is tender and juicy and is still cooking from the heat. at Lahori: burnt on the outside, really
dry meat, overcooked. spices were not bad.

2)Lamb Biryani: usually cooked in a big pot\vessel with alternate layers of 
rice and meat(Slow cooked for a long time and simmered and when served, the layers are mixed and a serving portion is taken out of the big 
pot/vessel). At Lahori: rice and meat mixed together in a frying pan(I saw him do this!).

3) Garlic Naan: Naan usually fluffy and super soft bread with garlic and cilantro pretty much melting on top with the heat of the Naan.
At Lahori: dry bread, garlic not fresh.

4) Butter chicken: Creamy sauce, with butter floating on top with super soft chicken pieces. At lahori: Not creamy at all, 
but rather like a paste of onions and tomatoes. the texture was so that i could feel the onions and tomatoes in my mouth.
the color which should be bright red or orange is just red. can barely taste the fresh butter. 

A lot of you might be thinking if should expect all this in a small restaurant in tenderloin. But as a matter of fact, Every good\well known
street side restaurant in that part of Indian/Pakistan serve the above dishes just as explained above.

Reasons why my 2 stars: The use of spices were pretty decent .But failed in all other aspects (texture, the way it is 
cooked, served, size, taste) . The service was friendly and good.

Also to note, probably a reason why this place gets great reviews, is the service part. The old man serving tends to do a great job
in hyping up the restaurant. I hear him say things like "No one cooks this dish as good as we do" and it seems to be working with the
customers as well. i don't rate restaurants on decor unless it fits that category. The decor in this place seems to be good enough for this
place. 

As it is my first one, i hope you enjoyed it and also be easy on me!

excerpts: Butter chicken was good, but not as good as the eggplant (can't remember if it was the aloo bengan or the bengan bhartiia).
Tasty.
I just wish it was faster.
Also, friend suggested sizzling fish, which I don't think they had the day we were there.
butter chicken.author: Karena Q.
butter chicken.review: Really f-ing long wait for food. Seriously. You need to devote like 2 hours if you're getting food here.  Butter chicken was good, but not as good as the eggplant (can't remember if it was the aloo bengan or the bengan bhartiia). Tasty. I just wish it was faster. Also, friend suggested sizzling fish, which I don't think they had the day we were there.

excerpts: The butter chicken is incredible.
I always bring/send out of towners here when they ask where to go for Indian food and they have never been disappointed.
The hole-in-the-wall ambiance adds to the appeal as does the Bollywood movies playing on the TV.
butter chicken.author: Johanna S.
butter chicken.review: Best Indian food in the City. The butter chicken is incredible. I always bring/send out of towners here when they ask where to go for Indian food and they have never been disappointed. The hole-in-the-wall ambiance adds to the appeal as does the Bollywood movies playing on the TV.

excerpts: I was craving Butter Chicken and was so excited to try it after all the glowing comments.
Unfortunately, I was less than blown away.
The food was pretty good, but just that.
My boyfriend described it as "edible."
The Butter Chicken was very sweet, which was not what I was used to.
I liked that the sauce had little bits of nuts, however.
But, overall, it was a bit flavorless and nothing amazing.
butter chicken.author: Jessica L.
butter chicken.review:
After all the positive reviews of this place, I decided to hit it up last night.  I was craving Butter Chicken and was so excited to try it after all the glowing comments.
Unfortunately, I was less than blown away.  The food was pretty good, but just that.  My boyfriend described it as "edible."  The Butter Chicken was very sweet, which was not what I was used to.  I liked that the sauce had little bits of nuts, however.  But, overall, it was a bit flavorless and nothing amazing.
The garlic naan was my least favorite part of the meal.  I like my naan with crispy bits, but this was all quite soggy and it tasted very sour.  
Lastly, we tried to order samosas and were offered Pakoras instead.  When I asked if we could just have samosas, he evaded acknowledging that they didn't have any.  No samosas?  At an Indian restaurant?  Weird.

excerpts: Bengan Bartha melts in your mouth, Butter chicken blows any Chicken Tikka Masala out of the water, and the onion kulcha is to-die-for...
Seriously cannot stress enough how AMAZING each dish is.
I don't even like lamb
butter chicken.author: metal m.
butter chicken.review:
5 Stars are not enough.

Quite possibly the best meal I've ever had, and I've eaten some amazing food internationally...

Long waits, but well worth it.  Sometimes you have to be patient for near perfection.  Every dish is made fresh and to order.  Bengan Bartha melts in your mouth, Butter chicken blows any Chicken Tikka Masala out of the water, and the onion kulcha is to-die-for...  Seriously cannot stress enough how AMAZING each dish is.  I don't even like lamb and it was pretty good here...

Please tip here because the kitchen is run by the owner, Guddu, 6 days a week.  He makes every dish you eat as well as the Naan and rice... 

My mouth is watering and my almost weekly visit might be early this week!!

excerpts: Bengan Bartha, Butter Chicken, Garlic Naan, Aloo Saag.
butter chicken.author: Heather R.
butter chicken.review:
Lahore Karahi is that "little spot" you bring your new girlfriend or boyfriend to in the city to show off how you, too, know a quaint family- owned joint in the heart of the Tenderloin that only a true San Franciscan would know about. One time, I showed up with a group of friends for dinner. We decided we were to have a feast of epic proportions and after checking out the menu, we ordered whatever sounded good.  The waiter totally indulged us, making great recommendations on the menu and helping set up a SERIOUS spread of INEXPENSIVE food.  

Even though the wait for food can be a little long (I wouldn't recommend Lahore if you're in a rush, but definitely must after seeing a show at the Great American Music Hall) because of the two-man crew that runs the restaurant, you don't mind because you're either a) completely engrossed in the Bollywood movies playing on the tiny monitor in the corner of the restaurant or you're b) enjoying the view of a crack deal outside.    

Thumbs up for: Bengan Bartha, Butter Chicken, Garlic Naan, Aloo Saag.  Enough options for the meat lover AND the humble herbivore.

Pick up beer or wine from one of the liquor stores just outside.  And don't listen to the waiter when he gives you a hard time for refilling your own water.  Enjoy.

excerpts: I'm salivating right now just thinking about those two beautiful words that come together at Lahore Karahi.....Butter Chicken.
I'm usually a Tikka Masala kind of girl, but here, it's all about the Buuuutter Chicken.
butter chicken.author: Kara S.
butter chicken.review:
I'm salivating right now just thinking about those two beautiful words that come together at Lahore Karahi.....Butter Chicken. I'm usually a Tikka Masala kind of girl, but here, it's all about the Buuuutter Chicken. Seriously, get it!

Go down the street and pick up a beer for your dinner and call it a night. A long, delicious, buttery night.

excerpts: I ordered 2 other curries, the Butter Chicken and the Lamb Vanadloo.
Both were good.
butter chicken.author: Paul V.
butter chicken.review:
I *really* *really* *really* wanted to like this place. I like spots like this, that are total whole in the wall, greasy spoon type places.. The food should have been much better tasting. I thought the Chicken Biryani was dry and tasteless. I ordered 2 other curries, the Butter Chicken and the Lamb Vanadloo. Both were good. Nothing to write home about, but good.

I was very hopeful when after placing my order the waiter turned and asked, do you want that mild or spicy? I immediately responded excitedly.. "SPICY." When the food came, everything was  about as spice-less as possible.

I've been in a 3 Star rut of trying new spots lately, I checked the reviews well on this one and had high-hopes. Unfortunately, maybe I got them on a bad day.

The Naan's were smaller than I'm used to but had a much more home made-taste to them. The Onion Naan, actually had a good amount of decent sized chucks of onion cooked in the middle of the bread. Big plus for any Onion Lovers..

No Beer or Wine either..

excerpts: We had a group of 5 and ordered Butter Chicken, which was almost the exact same dish as the chicken tikki masala we ordered!
butter chicken.author: Ann T.
butter chicken.review:
Lahore Karahi...great Indian food! Probably some of the best I've had. Good enough to return?! No way in hell. Maybe if I order to go or something. Looks like Brad L. beat me to the review! Damn that Yelper Elite!!!

We were sat at what the waiter called a "special table" he arranged just for us. Did it come with an invisible cloaking device b/c once he sat us, he forgot about us for 40 minutes. YEAH! 40 minutes. Other tables that were sat AFTER us got their orders taken and their food served before our order was even taken. Come on now! Every time we flagged down our waiter, he averted his eye contact. One person in our party actually went TO the counter to give him our order, and once she was done, his question to her was... (get this!) "Is your order for here or to go?" *Puzzled look* You're kidding right? I can understand the restaurant was packed, but there are only about 8 tables. So what gives?

The mango lassi was definitely the worst I've ever had in my life. Once sip and I tossed it aside.

The only reason this place is getting 2 stars is that the food was excellent. Just the right amount of spice, heat, and meat in each dish. We had a group of 5 and ordered Butter Chicken, which was almost the exact same dish as the chicken tikki masala we ordered! Lamb Vindaloo, Tandoori Fish, Garlic Naan, Vegetable Biryhani, and Eggplant something or other. Out of everything the Eggplant was by far the best! Yummerz!

2 Yummerz stars for this place..and I'm hesitant for even THAT!

excerpts: The Butter Chicken and tandoori fish and bengan bartha is also quite good.
The Saag Ghost was the most tender lamb I ever had, the sauce was a little salty.
Chicken tika masala was delicious albeit a little oily.
butter chicken.author: Jim J.
butter chicken.review: I think the saag paneer and chicken korma is pretty good.  The Butter Chicken and tandoori fish and bengan bartha is also quite good.  The Saag Ghost was the most tender lamb I ever had, the sauce was a little salty.  Chicken tika masala was delicious albeit a little oily.  The garlic naan was freshly baked and tasted very good.  I had the takeout so didn't have to wait.  Just call to make sure your order is ready before going to pick up since the guy told me 15 mins and it turns out to be 1 hour!

excerpts: Everything is super-cheap, and the butter chicken is very tasty.
butter chicken.author: Ellie P.
butter chicken.review:
I guess 210 people already said this place was great. I also think it's great. Everything is super-cheap, and the butter chicken is very tasty. Next time, I'll try the biryani -- looked good.

Wow, this is a really boring review. I'll add that this is a good place to go if you're eating in this neighborhood on a Monday night. Tons of other places were closed. And it's near the Great American Music Hall.

excerpts: and I thought everything about our meal was divine, from the thin-pizza like naan and the sweet butter chicken which meshed well with the beer we brought in.
Hopefully the wait times improve, but overall one of the best Indian/Pakistani places in SF.
butter chicken.author: Anthony K.
butter chicken.review:
More like 4.5, but I'll bump it up to 5 because of the attention that the chef and our waiter gave us, asking if our meals were tasty. All the raving of the buttered chicken was overhyped, but I think the lamb korma was delicious. Also, the cilantro potato naan was pizza-like, and also delicious. Furthermore, our mango lassi's were great.

Update: 8/26/2007

Earlier this year I went back and I thought everything about our meal was divine, from the thin-pizza like naan and the sweet butter chicken which meshed well with the beer we brought in. Hopefully the wait times improve, but overall one of the best Indian/Pakistani places in SF.

excerpts: And the butter chicken.
And the lamb korma.
Skip the appetizers.
butter chicken.author: Pamela D.
butter chicken.review:
The best Indian/Pakistani cuisine in SF, hands down.
Some tips:
Expect an excruciating wait.  
Bring your own beer, and they're happy to keep it cold for you.
Don't get up and help yourself to water - the waiter gets mad.
Order the black daal.  And the butter chicken.  And the lamb korma.  Skip the appetizers.

excerpts: The Butter Chicken and the Chicken Tikka Masala were almost the exact same dish, but delicious none-the-less.
The Tandor Fish was good too, but not so good that I'd want to return, deal with the service and leave smelling like I've been cooking Indian food for an hour.
butter chicken.author: Brad L.
butter chicken.review:
Some of the best Indian food I've had in San Francisco, paired with some of the worst service I've had anywhere. 

It took so long to get our food, two of us actually left the restaurant to buy beer. I bet we waited 40 minutes. In fact, the service was so slow that we sent someone from our table up the counter to order. I'm not sure what the problem was. The place only has 8 tables.

The Butter Chicken and the Chicken Tikka Masala were almost the exact same dish, but delicious none-the-less. The Tandor Fish was good too, but not so good that I'd want to return, deal with the service and leave smelling like I've been cooking Indian food for an hour.

excerpts: Garlic Naan, Butter Chicken.
For when I'm feeling white.
Saag Paneer, Chole are great as well.
butter chicken.author: Srini P.
butter chicken.review:
This is the best North Indian / Pakistani food in the city and is up there for the best in the Bay Area.

Garlic Naan, Butter Chicken.  For when I'm feeling white.  Saag Paneer, Chole are great as well.  I don't get the hype about the Chicken Karahi.  It's not that great (neither are the Tandoori or Biryanis), but there's plenty of other great stuff on the menu.

The place is BYOB, but I don't.  I don't think Guddu the chef really approves of drinking in his place.

excerpts:
grilled tandoori chicken breast
sesame nan
butter chicken

OMG never going to shalimar again !!!
butter chicken.author: Nikola B.
butter chicken.review:
this place is AMAZING 3rd time in one week HIGHLY recommend!!!

grilled tandoori chicken breast
sesame nan
butter chicken

OMG never going to shalimar again !!!

excerpts: I love the chicken tikki masala, the butter chicken, the fish dishes are delicious and sweet.
At the end of every meal Guddhu hooks it up with a sweet, isn't that nice?
On weekend evenings you can catch the bollywood videos.
butter chicken.author: Glu C.
butter chicken.review: It's always a treat coming here, the food is so good! The best mango lassi's, the color is so bright and sprinkled on top are pistachios, gaah, definitely #1 in San Francisco. I love the chicken tikki masala, the butter chicken, the fish dishes are delicious and sweet.  At the end of every meal Guddhu hooks it up with a sweet, isn't that nice? On weekend evenings you can catch the bollywood videos.

excerpts: we tried the butter chicken, chicken biryani, chicken vindaloo and the tandoori chicken.
everything was delicious.
the chicken vindaloo had more cilantro and was less creamy than i have had at other places.
butter chicken.author: Seong P.
butter chicken.review:
had dinner here on a friday night with some fun people.  we tried the butter chicken, chicken biryani, chicken vindaloo and the tandoori chicken.  everything was delicious.  the chicken vindaloo had more cilantro and was less creamy than i have had at other places.  i loved it.

the service was a bit slow and they forgot at least one dish but it was a full house and the bill was low so i let it go.  the conversation was scintillating and i'm pretty sure we gave a newly single guy some questionable, but probably effective, dating advice.  sorry, ladies.

excerpts: Try the butter chicken with sesame naan, or the goat curry with Afghan naan.
Everything is delicious, and perfectly spicy.
The cook is the nicest man on the planet--if I were president he would be the White House Chef.
butter chicken.author: Denny S.
butter chicken.review: The most fantastic food west of Pakistan! Try the butter chicken with sesame naan, or the goat curry with Afghan naan. Everything is delicious, and perfectly spicy. The cook is the nicest man on the planet--if I were president he would be the White House Chef.

excerpts: A couple of other good dishes that i like are the palak paneer, butter chicken, chicken korma and the tandoori fish.
the food is alway fresh and made to order.
an absolute delight to eat here.
the owner/chef is very friendly and makes a spendid meal.
Keep it up!
butter chicken.author: Jon H.
butter chicken.review: This is my favorite indian restaurant.  I try to eat here whenever i'm in town.  the chicken Tikka masala is the absolute best, a must try for any one trying this restaurant.  A couple of other good dishes that i like are the palak paneer, butter chicken, chicken korma and the tandoori fish.  the food is alway fresh and made to order.  an absolute delight to eat here.  the owner/chef is very friendly and makes a spendid meal.  Keep it up!

excerpts:
the setting: saturday lunch.  
the menu: butter chicken (order this...
you will not be sorry), naan (of course), alor matter, and vegetable biryani (2 of us...
we're

BIG eaters)
the outcome: pure happiness and a stuffed tummy.
the owner/chef is amazing...so nice.
the decor, not so,
but hey, i'm here for the food (thus the 1 less star).
can't wait to come back to try the Tandoori Fish.
this is definitely on the rotation.
butter chicken.author: Sonia C.
butter chicken.review:
the setting: saturday lunch.  
the menu: butter chicken (order this...you will not be sorry), naan (of course), alor matter, and vegetable biryani (2 of us...we're BIG eaters)
the outcome: pure happiness and a stuffed tummy.
the owner/chef is amazing...so nice.  the decor, not so, but hey, i'm here for the food (thus the 1 less star).  can't wait to come back to try the Tandoori Fish.  this is definitely on the rotation.

excerpts: We had the palak paneer, the butter chicken and the best dal makhani this side of the Imperial.
The prices were terrific and the atmosphere was about what you would expect.
We loved the Bollywood on tv as we ate and enjoyed our beer purchased from across the street.
I was all prepared to name this my new 'loin favorite.
Despite all this goodness, why the low rating you ask???
Minus one star for each panic filled trip to the bathroom at work the next morning.
I checked the health rating online
and it is a very respectable 82
I am not sure what the deal was, but I am in no hurry to experience it again.
butter chicken.author: Matt T.
butter chicken.review: Terrific tasting Indian.  The service was fast and the guys were very kind and friendly.  We had the palak paneer, the butter chicken and the best dal makhani this side of the Imperial.  The prices were terrific and the atmosphere was about what you would expect.  We loved the Bollywood on tv as we ate and enjoyed our beer purchased from across the street.  I was all prepared to name this my new 'loin favorite.    Despite all this goodness, why the low rating you ask???   Minus one star for each panic filled trip to the bathroom at work the next morning.   I checked the health rating online and it is a very respectable 82.   I am not sure what the deal was, but I am in no hurry to experience it again.

excerpts: We ordered butter chicken, sag paneer, plain nan
and I got a sweet lassi.
The sweet lassi had a very strange sharp sour taste like no other lassi I've ever had before.
I couldn't drink it.
The butter chicken was very bland although no place in SF seems to know how to do butter chicken.
The sag paneer had a sweetish taste that I didn't really like although it was okay otherwise.
butter chicken.author: Kristin B.
butter chicken.review:
Tried this place for lunch today for the first time. The service was very slow even though there was just one other table. The people at the other table got their food and were finished before ours even all arrived. The waiter did give us a free nan I guess as an apology although he never actually explained or apologized for the food taking so long.

We ordered butter chicken, sag paneer, plain nan and I got a sweet lassi. The sweet lassi had a very strange sharp sour taste like no other lassi I've ever had before. I couldn't drink it. The butter chicken was very bland although no place in SF seems to know how to do butter chicken. The sag paneer had a sweetish taste that I didn't really like although it was okay otherwise. The nan was fine.

I would'nt go back. Overall this was one of the most mediocre Indian places I've tried in SF. At least the prices were cheap though.

excerpts: I love the butter chicken and naan bread, could eat it every day if I didn't worry about my cholesterol.
The chef/owner is always smiling and friendly despite a busy atmosphere.
I call in my order to avoid a long wait...though I have waited 10-15 minutes.
All is forgiven after the first bite.
butter chicken.author: Edward L.
butter chicken.review: I'm so glad this place is thriving in a difficult corner of the TL. The food is spicy, cheap and wonderfully fragrant. I love the butter chicken and naan bread, could eat it every day if I didn't worry about my cholesterol. The chef/owner is always smiling and friendly despite a busy atmosphere. I call in my order to avoid a long wait...though I have waited 10-15 minutes. All is forgiven after the first bite.

excerpts: We tried butter chicken (good
but it did not resemble butter chicken at all.
I'd have liked it more if I was not expecting creamy, sinful butter chicken), bengan bartha (okay dish but lacking the smokey eggplant flavor I usually enjoy), tandoori chicken (good but not great.
Much better version could be had in Punjab on Eddy) and naan.
Probably won't return to Lahore Karachi anytime soon when there are so many other Indian/Pakistani restaurants in the neighborhood.
butter chicken.author: Yuko K.
butter chicken.review: This place was just okay for me. Although I did read about its slow service from other posters, it was just painfully sooooooooo sloooow. As for food, I say I had better from other TL establishment. We tried butter chicken (good but it did not resemble butter chicken at all. I'd have liked it more if I was not expecting creamy, sinful butter chicken), bengan bartha (okay dish but lacking the smokey eggplant flavor I usually enjoy), tandoori chicken (good but not great. Much better version could be had in Punjab on Eddy) and naan. Probably won't return to Lahore Karachi anytime soon when there are so many other Indian/Pakistani restaurants in the neighborhood.

excerpts: This place floored me with the best butter chicken I've ever had. . .
butter chicken.author: Valerie D.
butter chicken.review: I am about to have a torrid affair with a restaraunt.  While we've never been exclusive or had "the talk" Raja has been my main squeeze for as long as I have lived here.  . . . until today when my friend introduced me to Lahore Karahi and WHAM - just like that .   This place floored me with the best butter chicken I've ever had. . . garlic naan that was the perfect texture and covered in garlic and saag paneer that was neither too sweet nor too creamy.  The chef was also our waiter and - call me a sucker for a pretty smile - but he knows exactly what to do when some white chick and her lunch pal request in unison "Spicy!!"  We're in the TL so there's nothing fancy here. . . just incredible food served in dishes that look like they're from an actual kitchen.   Perfect.

excerpts: butter chicken is always a must when we go, along with the garlic naan.
the portions are solid and the prices are good.
this place is always worth the wait (when i'm not starving, of course).
butter chicken.author: Meredith K.
butter chicken.review: best indian i've had in sf. sure, there's usually a wait, but the food is made to order and there are only so many tables they can fit in there. i've just learned not to go when i'm too hungry. butter chicken is always a must when we go, along with the garlic naan. the portions are solid and the prices are good. this place is always worth the wait (when i'm not starving, of course).

excerpts:
We ordered Bengan Bartha ($5.50), Butter Chicken ($6.00), and Garlic Naan ($2.00)
Bengan Bartha was good but Butter Chicken was many times better.
Garlic Naan was good too.
butter chicken.author: Oribel ..
butter chicken.review:
We went here and tried Prawn Tikka Masala ($10.95), Fish Tandoori ($10.95), Onion Kulcha ($2.00), Seekh Kabab ($4.00).
The food taste a little different than the Indian restaurants we usually go to such as Chutney or Naan 'n Curry.
Perhaps because Lahore Karahi is Pakistani cuisine(?)
I mean... tandoori in Indian restaurants usually has reddish color but at Lahore Karahi, the tandoori is brown.
The Fish Tandoori and the Seekh Kabab were served on a hot plate. What a nice surprise!
The food are excellent although they are different from what we used to, and the owner is nice and I will definitely come back again in the future.
The service was a little bit slow though. It took about an hour of waiting to get table, to order, and to get the food.
I will definitely upgrade the rating once the service is a little bit faster.
They accept Visa and Master Card.
-----
Despite of the slow service, we decided to come here again only 2 days apart because of its good food.
It took 5 minutes to be seated (great!) but 25 minutes to have the waiter - the guy with the index finger amputated - came and took our order (!!).
He was like in dazed and confused or something!!!

When finally he came and took our order, starting with: "What do you want to order?"
Us: "I want... (point at the menu)..."
He just turned around left before I finished the sentence and talked to another customer that just came without even saying any "excuse me, please", or "would you mind to wait a second?" (if that customer is so important to talk to right away)
Then, he went talking to another customer, then walking around and around, and bringing a couple of plates for another table, then again, walking around and around (yes, we saw all the process because we were just sitting there watching him), then went to another table (that came after us) taking order, then again walking around and around, bringing water jug here and there, before finally coming to our table again without even saying sorry or offering explanation of what happened.
I'm not sure why he did that. I do not mean to insult, but either he was negligent or rude.
Negligent means he did not realize what he did, he lost track, he does not have good memory which table came first, and therefore he was not capable to apologize.
Rude means he meant to do that to ignore us.
I hope it was the first one.

We ordered Bengan Bartha ($5.50), Butter Chicken ($6.00), and Garlic Naan ($2.00)
Bengan Bartha was good but Butter Chicken was many times better.
Garlic Naan was good too.

The food came pretty fast though within 15 minutes.
Now that I understand that Zulfikar "Guddu" Haider is the only guy cooking the dishes, actually we do not mind waiting for the food to be cooked to its excellence but we do mind being IGNORED with that waiter (not Guddu).
Overall was supposed to be 5 stars minus 1 star for the bad service from the waiter.

excerpts: I also had the Butter Chicken which was so flavorful and had a nice portion of protein in it.
butter chicken.author: Samuel J.
butter chicken.review: Unbelievably great !   I knew about Lahore, which is in my neighborhood, but i had never eaten there, due to having so many good options in the TL for food. After reading the reviews for this place on Yelp, i decided to check it out and man, what a smart decision that was.. The Naan was out of this world. I also had the Butter Chicken which was so flavorful and had a nice portion of protein in it. My buddy had the Basmati rice (we were told by the busser that the rice was organic, kudos...) and Aloo Ghobi (extremely delicious, perfectly prepared) The Chai was nothing special, but the busser, owner, price point, and food all get 5 stars from this chef....

excerpts: (pick Butter Chicken if you're not into sweet CTM)
butter chicken.author: Hal C.
butter chicken.review:
To all those who complain about the service here: 

This is a hole in the wall restaurant with 1 waiter serving everything to everybody in a small eating space and all of the dishes are cooked from scratch.  What kind of service can you expect?

Anyway, the food here is probably the best indian you can find in the city and the prices are phenomenally low for what they serve. If you go to a restaurant like Al-Hamra in the Mission, you'll pay 6.99 for Chicken Tikka Masala that has the consistency of a bisque that is as bland as it is runny. If you go to Lahore, you can get yourself a true Chicken Tikka for the same price and it is a thick, flavorful curry that is both spicy and sweet. (pick Butter Chicken if you're not into sweet CTM) 

Stop going to gross Indian places that serve pre-made, watery curries and go here and get the real stuff.

excerpts: so one gets a cozy and raw urban experience that is unlike any other (for better or for worse).The butter chicken is addictive and full of juicy white meat the garlic naan is hot, fresh and delicious.
I don't like my food spicy
and they always honor my request for very mild.
Plus the hospitality is unbeatable; it's like dining at a friend's house, home cooking and all.
butter chicken.author: April H.
butter chicken.review: soooooooo good! every time i eat here i can not believe how tasty everything is. By far the best Indian food i have had in the city. It is in the loin so one gets a cozy and raw urban experience that is unlike any other (for better or for worse).The butter chicken is addictive and full of juicy white meat the garlic naan is hot, fresh and delicious. I don't like my food spicy and they always honor my request for very mild. Plus the hospitality is unbeatable; it's like dining at a friend's house, home cooking and all.

excerpts: We ordered a an Aloo Matter and Butter Chicken as well as various naan and samosas.
The samosas were ok, the naan was fine as well.
The butter chicken was passable but nothing fantastic to warrent the glowing reviews seen here.
The real disappointment for this place came with the Aloo Matter, for some reason it was sweet!!!
I dont think I've ever had a sweet curry before and aloo matter is my staple dish that I've ordered at countless Indian restaurants.
It tasted like someone had spilled a full cup of sugar into it.
butter chicken.author: Anna M.
butter chicken.review:
I was so excited to try this place after reading all the rave reviews here.  I've tried many restaurants in San Fran based off yelp reviews and never been steered wrong. I really wanted to like this place, a fantastic Indian restaurant with in walking distance of my home... what a dream! Sadly, it was not to be. We ordered a an Aloo Matter and Butter Chicken as well as various naan and samosas. The samosas were ok, the naan was fine as well. The butter chicken was passable but nothing fantastic to warrent the glowing reviews seen here. The real disappointment for this place came with the Aloo Matter, for some reason it was sweet!!! I dont think I've ever had a sweet curry before and aloo matter is my staple dish that I've ordered at countless Indian restaurants.  It tasted like someone had spilled a full cup of sugar into it. It was the most disgusting curry I've ever eaten, I couldn't bring myself to eat more then four bites. 

I was so disappointed, finding good Indian in this city is so difficult. =( All the great reviews on this place lead me to wonder if Indian is too subjective of a  cuisine to trust reviews on yelp.

excerpts: We ordered the vegetable pakora, butter chicken, aloo mattar, a couple orders of rice and a garlic naan.
GREAT food.
the green chutney here is absolutely amazing.
When all was said and done, we still were hungry, so I asked the guy for a chicken vindaloo.
He said "right now?
" and I was like "yes, please!"
So the food comes 5 minutes later (the service is ridiculously quick, that's a plus), and it's lamb instead of chicken.
Best vindaloo ever, and it turned out that the lamb was a good contrast
--it was good quality lamb, too.
The presentation is real homey -- the food comes in bowls that look like my cereal bowls at home.
The kitchen area is right there in front of you, so the whole thing is real honest.
You can see what's cooking right there and watch your food being prepared.
Also, there's vintage, poor-quality bollywood on the TV.
major yay. go here.
butter chicken.author: Ethan K.
butter chicken.review: This place is great. We walked here from Powell before the show at Herbst and had a leisurely, great meal. We picked up drinks from the next-door market and the dude supplied us with a bottle opener when he asked. Very courteous service; a Mexican dude is the cook, and they treat him like family. We ordered the vegetable pakora, butter chicken, aloo mattar, a couple orders of rice and a garlic naan. GREAT food. the green chutney here is absolutely amazing. When all was said and done, we still were hungry, so I asked the guy for a chicken vindaloo. He said "right now?" and I was like "yes, please!" So the food comes 5 minutes later (the service is ridiculously quick, that's a plus), and it's lamb instead of chicken. Best vindaloo ever, and it turned out that the lamb was a good contrast--it was good quality lamb, too. The presentation is real homey -- the food comes in bowls that look like my cereal bowls at home. The kitchen area is right there in front of you, so the whole thing is real honest. You can see what's cooking right there and watch your food being prepared. Also, there's vintage, poor-quality bollywood on the TV. major yay. go here.

excerpts: The chicken biriyani taste like fish curry mixed with chicken in it.
Wrost biriyani i ever had.
fish curry.author: Tanver M.
fish curry.review: Placing this eview while sitting in the resturant. This is  We ordered chicken biriyani, butter chicken and naan. The chicken biriyani taste like fish curry mixed with chicken in it. Wrost biriyani i ever had.  Butter chicken and naan was good.

excerpts: We ordered kourma, chicken tandoori, chicken tikka masala, garlic naan, fish curry, and daal.
I would suggest to go there with an empty stomach cause it's a lot of food!
Love it .
fish curry.author: Jennie C.
fish curry.review: Love their food. I've been here a few times and everything is made fresh and consistent. Their Garlic naan is yum. We ordered kourma, chicken tandoori, chicken tikka masala, garlic naan, fish curry, and daal. I would suggest to go there with an empty stomach cause it's a lot of food! Love it .

excerpts: The fish curry, chana sag, and garlic naan were all quite tasty but for some reason my friend got sick (while I didn't).
The only thing she had which
I didn't was the mints and pepsi.
So beware of those I guess?
fish curry.author: Misha T.
fish curry.review: The fish curry, chana sag, and garlic naan were all quite tasty but for some reason my friend got sick (while I didn't). The only thing she had which I didn't was the mints and pepsi. So beware of those I guess?

excerpts: Waited over an hour for fish curry that never came.
What really ticked me off was their dishonesty.

I placed my order and watch everyone who came in after me receive their orders; over half an hour later i decided to ask if my food was ready and the cook proceeded to explain that everyone has to wait 15-20mins for their food.
I decided to be patient and take his words for it.
Another half an hour went by and every other client had left.
I had them cancel my order.
They didn't even have the decency to apologize and muttered something about a misunderstanding.
If they had forgotten my order, it would have been all right if they had pointed that out earlier and apologized.
If my time is going to be disrespected like so, i'm never coming back.
if i had known it was going to take so long, and if they are going to forget my order twice, i would have left earlier and not be so upset.
I get that i have a small physique
but that does not give them the upper hand to be disrespectful towards me.
fish curry.author: Mabel T.
fish curry.review: Waited over an hour for fish curry that never came. What really ticked me off was their dishonesty. I placed my order and watch everyone who came in after me receive their orders; over half an hour later i decided to ask if my food was ready and the cook proceeded to explain that everyone has to wait 15-20mins for their food. I decided to be patient and take his words for it. Another half an hour went by and every other client had left. I had them cancel my order. They didn't even have the decency to apologize and muttered something about a misunderstanding. If they had forgotten my order, it would have been all right if they had pointed that out earlier and apologized. If my time is going to be disrespected like so, i'm never coming back. if i had known it was going to take so long, and if they are going to forget my order twice, i would have left earlier and not be so upset. I get that i have a small physique but that does not give them the upper hand to be disrespectful towards me.

excerpts: Got the garlic naan, lamb vindaloo, and fish curry.
All of the meat was perfectly tender with great flavor.
The spiciness definitely builds.
The flavor was great, but didn't overpower the taste of the meat.
Wanted to try the samosas too, but unfortunately they were sold out.
Maybe another time.
fish curry.author: Tiffany C.
fish curry.review: Honestly I'm not a great judge of indian food.  Got the garlic naan, lamb vindaloo, and fish curry.  All of the meat was perfectly tender with great flavor.  The spiciness definitely builds.  The flavor was great, but didn't overpower the taste of the meat.  Wanted to try the samosas too, but unfortunately they were sold out.  Maybe another time.

excerpts: I've had the well loved fish curry, and really liked it, the the potato/cauliflower aloo gobhi (extra interesting here and absolutely delicious with what can be relatively bland ingredients) and the butter chicken.
fish curry.author: Mike F.
fish curry.review:
I've been here twice now, and if I was just rating the food, I would give it 5 stars, particularly for value for the money but we went last night and the service was just dreadful. We ended up missing the movie we were supposed to go to because the service was so slow.

Let's start with the food. All of the dishes I've had are richly spiced and really nicely put together, especially for $7 or $8. Even old standbys are extra tasty here, and they aren't greasy which can be the downfall of some cheap South Asian restaurants.

I've had the well loved fish curry, and really liked it, the the potato/cauliflower aloo gobhi (extra interesting here and absolutely delicious with what can be relatively bland ingredients) and the butter chicken. All were delicious.

The first visit I made a month or so ago (7/09) the service was quick and efficient. It's a small room and one person should be able to cover it even when busy.

Last night, 9/12/09,  was just dreadful. The one waiter was scattered and couldn't seem to figure out that bringing more than one dish from the kitchen at a time would be more efficient and less annoying to the patrons. He would go to the kitchen, get one thing, and then go back and get another and take it to the same table. Crazy. 

It took 30 minutes for our food to come which seems very long in a restaurant of this sort. People who sat down after us got their food before us, which is always irritating, moreso when you're trying to go to a movie up the street. The waiter was also packaging to go orders, so it's not entirely his fault, but he clearly had no idea what he was doing. 

When the first dish finally came, we reminded him to bring us the bread, rice and mixed pickle we ordered, which he brought ON THREE SEPARATE TRIPS from the kitchen, even though it's either pre-made (pickle) or sitting there waiting to be dished up (bread and rice).

Just crazy. it would make me hesitate to go back, particularly if I was in a hurry, like last night. I'd also say that for a little more money, travelling up the street to Sultan (behind the Hilton on O'Farrell) will get you as good a food and FAR better service.

excerpts: we order so many things for 3 people - half a tandoori chicken, shrimp briyani, saag paneer, fish tikka masala, veg tikka masala, cheese naan and garlic naan.
fish tikka masala.author: Christina L.
fish tikka masala.review:
lahore karahi has been on my list for a while, but since they dont deliver and is in a sketchier part of town, i've been holding off on trying. since the parents are in town though, and were shopping downtown, we decided to stop in because authentic indian food is hard to come by in shanghai...

the restaurant is very minimal and simple - everything is self serve (though they brought us plates and utensils (maybe we looked a bit lost).  we order so many things for 3 people - half a tandoori chicken, shrimp briyani, saag paneer, fish tikka masala, veg tikka masala, cheese naan and garlic naan. haah SUCH FATTIES. 

food came out reasonably fast and all of a sudden our table was full.  the naans were really thin and crispy, and the cheese one was delicious with the tikka sauce.  saag paneer was a bit underwhelming, not as liquidity as i usually like my saag. briyani had good flavors, but not a lot of shrimp.  my mom really enjoyed the tandoori chicken, and here was a good amount of it!  i thought the tikka was flavorful, but....missing SOMETHING.  dinner after tax & tip was $75 - a bargain for all this food (we had a bit of leftovers for my lunch the next day).  i probably wont be coming back given the location...and lack of memorable-ness.

excerpts: Between my two friends and I, we ordered the Garlic Naan, Regular Naan, Butter Chicken, Fish Tikka Masala, Tandoori Chicken, and the Saag Paneer.
As a whole, nothing really stood to me as being anything special.
The Fish Tikka Masala was definitely the best of the bunch, as they did a good job with cooking the fish.
Even then though, it didn't strike me as amazing flavor-wise.
Decent, but not great.
And while none of the dishes were bad per se, it's not like
fish tikka masala.author: Mike L.
fish tikka masala.review:
One star...yup, haven't given out one of these in a while.  I guess I've been pretty fortunate so far with where I've been (which is something I'm quite appreciative of).  But then, it's not everyday you see a ROACH while you're eating.  Yeaaaaah....game over.  Thanks for playing.

Now, before you write this review off as a one star just because of a roach...well, you're partially right.  Seeing a roach certainly put this one a one star path, but it's not like I found the rest of the experience that fantastic anyways.  Unlike other Yelpers, I didn't find the food that remarkable the first time I was here a year or two ago, and it really wasn't any different this time around.  

Between my two friends and I, we ordered the Garlic Naan, Regular Naan, Butter Chicken, Fish Tikka Masala, Tandoori Chicken, and the Saag Paneer.  As a whole, nothing really stood to me as being anything special.  The Fish Tikka Masala was definitely the best of the bunch, as they did a good job with cooking the fish.  Even then though, it didn't strike me as amazing flavor-wise.  Decent, but not great.  And while none of the dishes were bad per se, it's not like you can't find something just as good (or better) elsewhere in the City or the Bay Area.

Considering the fact that we had to wait almost 40 minutes for our food and that they still forgot our order of Tandoori Chicken, Lahore already wasn't going to be getting anything better than two stars before the roach showed up anyways.  Now, I'm not so naive to think that roaches aren't a problem at other places, including those that I'm actually fond of.  However, there's a BIG difference between suspecting or thinking they might be around, and then actually seeing the damn things on the wall.

If people want to keep coming back because they think the food is still great despite it all, then by all means.  That just means the lines will be shorter somewhere else.  I just know I won't be back, and I wouldn't even give it a second thought.  The only part that I'll still be thinking about is whether or not it was a good or bad thing that we didn't see the roach until towards the end of our meal.  Ugh...disgusting regardless.

excerpts: I also recommend the Fish Tikka Masala.
fish tikka masala.author: Jean K.
fish tikka masala.review:
Although Shalimar is still my favorite place for curry, Lahore Kahari is right up there.  While at Shalimar I prefer the vegetarian curries, at Lahore Kahari it's the fish that really shines.  On the recommendation of Yelpers I ordered the Tandoori Fish and Bengan Bartha.  

Here I'll have to digress and give you some tips to ease your time here.  The owner is the cook.  The only cook.  So do yourself a favor and do not come here with a group of 10 people during lunch.  You can imagine how long it took to cook dishes for our table plus the other tables with only 1 cook and 2 burners.  If you do come here hungry, the food comes out in the order of 1) biryani, 2) curry and 3) tandoori.  They were nice and gave us dishes of complimentary pappadams.  Also, if the chai tea runs out, they will make more last, after all the food is finishes and the kitchen is quiet.  I'm not complaining; I want my food.  Just FYI.

The Bengan Bartha was really smooth and smoky.  Not too oily.  I would recommend this.  While I was waiting for my Tandoori Fish I had the opportunity to try the Chicken Biryani (good) and Chicken (korma).  The naan was pretty good but not amazing like I was expecting.  The garlic naan was very garlicky.  At the end of the meal the Tandoori Fish came out.  Wow.  It was totally worth waiting for.  It's unlike any fish dish I've had before.  Fresh (coriander, lime?) and hot (chilies).  I also recommend the Fish Tikka Masala.  Not quite a traditional Tikka Masala sauce but very good.  

I would go back just for the Tandoori Fish.

excerpts: i ordered the lamb samosas, garlic naan, fish tikka masala and mango lassi.
the samosas, naan and lassi were perfect.
the tikka masala sauce was a wee bit too watery and the color is a little too light and not spicy-
it didn't have enough cumin, cayenne pepper, or paprika.
the fish itself was done very well-
fish tikka masala.author: The Hangry Chef O.
fish tikka masala.review:
larhore karahi is a-okay. this little hole in the wall in the heart of the tenderloin does pretty well amongst all the gazillion indian places in the area. the food is good and more importantly, not overpriced. i ordered the lamb samosas, garlic naan, fish tikka masala and mango lassi. the samosas, naan and lassi were perfect. the tikka masala sauce was a wee bit too watery and the color is a little too light and not spicy- it didn't have enough cumin, cayenne pepper, or paprika. the fish itself was done very well- it just falls apart when you put it in your mouth.

so overall 3 stars. why? the place was good but nothing extraordinary. the masala sauce needs a little more spice. they didn't have gulab jamun (crazy! i know) and the staff could definitely crack a smile once in a while.

excerpts: Fish Tikka Masala had a really good amount of fish pieces in it with just the perfect amount of spice.
fish tikka masala.author: Heidi L.
fish tikka masala.review:
Another great hole-in-the-wall find! 

First they gave us papadams on the house and I heart papadams!!

Fish Tikka Masala had a really good amount of fish pieces in it with just the perfect amount of spice. But you can order anything to your spice liking.

Saag Paneer, spinach cooked with cheese and herbs was really rustic tasting because they make the cheese themselves and not at all oily like many of the other Indian/Pakistani restaurants out there.

We also had the plain naan and a garlic naan. Garlic naan was my fave out of these two. Tons of spice and really tasty. They gave us the plain one first and about 10 mins later, the garlic one which was great because who doesn't like "just out of the oven " naan?!

Everything was so good, we ate every last drop and were so full.Can't wait to come back and try their other dishes! One thing, put the fancy clothes away because you'll go home smelling like what you ordered!

excerpts: WOW THE FISH TIKKA MASALA  at Lahore Karahi lets the spiciness sneak up on you rather quickly and unassumingly...
it's a different kind of spice than I'm used to (grew up on jalapenos and wasabi), and it really packed a gastro-intestinal wallop.
My Chinese acupuncturist/herbalist probably would have been upset with me but fortunately for both of us
fish tikka masala.author: Peter L.
fish tikka masala.review:
WOW THE FISH TIKKA MASALA  at Lahore Karahi lets the spiciness sneak up on you rather quickly and unassumingly... it's a different kind of spice than I'm used to (grew up on jalapenos and wasabi), and it really packed a gastro-intestinal wallop.  My Chinese acupuncturist/herbalist probably would have been upset with me but fortunately for both of us I didn't tell her and instead endured the after-effects, left on my own devices.

Spicy, but extremely good, especially with the regular naan (the other naan varieties seem to have a bit too much going on in the flavor department and, to me, detract from the herbal complexity of the tikka masala flavor).

Similar to my experience at Shalimar, at first I wondered if this restaurant was smoking or non-smoking because of the sheer and visible amount of smoke (which I subsequently realized was coming from the cooking apparatus and food, not from a cig).

Advice: Expect your clothing to smell strongly of curry for at least 48 hours after your dining experience here, depending on the ventilation in your residence.

excerpts: I love how you can watch and interact with the owner/chef Guddhu, who suggested the Fish Tikka Masala for next time...
Delicious food + rock bottom prices + friendly service = a new SF favorite!
fish tikka masala.author: Steph P.
fish tikka masala.review:
Ahh yes! An experience to restore my faith in the Yelp hype! From reading some of the reviews, I would have thought that there would be swarms of flies, grimy walls, and greasy table tops. Yeah, it's kinda divey and there are probably people doing crack across the street, but the little restaurant itself isn't THAT bad. Luckily, the Pakistani-Indian food lived up to the rave reviews!

We split the Bengan Bhartha (roasted eggplant w/ onions, tomatoes & cream) and the Saag Paneer (one of my faaaavorites - Spinach w/ fried homemade cheese). Both of the dishes were DAMN GOOD. I think that it's really easy to make mediocre, watery, bland (even w/ all those spices) South Asian food...but this is the real deal. Flavorful, spicy depth, full of creamy texture...I could swim in and drown in this stuff and not care. We also ordered the Aloo Paratha bread, stuffed with potatoes and sprinkled with cilantro, which was very good despite being a bit overcharred. Man, this food made me think, "Hmm, maybe I COULD do the vegetarian thing." And then I started salivating over the Tandoori Chicken of the people sitting across from us. Nevermind!

I love how you can watch and interact with the owner/chef Guddhu, who suggested the Fish Tikka Masala for next time...Delicious food + rock bottom prices + friendly service = a new SF favorite!

excerpts:
The stars of the night were:
- fish tikka masala.
Even better than my usual chicken!
- Palek paneer.
I never really thought much of this plate at other places, but da-YUM this was a must-have here.
fish tikka masala.author: Mari C.
fish tikka masala.review:
...and I thought I was learnéd in the ways of the Pakistani mouth-love.  HA!  This place was dirt cheap, zesty, and encouraged me to drink outside beer.   What more could you ask of a relationship with a Tenderloin restaurant?

I went with about nine other people, all of whom carried with them 40's and 6packs purchased from the liquor stop around the corner.  We had a bit of a wait, but it was mostly because there were so many of us and the place was not huge.  

We ordered about one order of everything, which turned out to be way too much and not enough, all at the same time.  The potato naan was delectable, the sauces were fresh and sassy like a drag queen with a new pair of shoes.  It was pretty much an ideal meal.

The stars of the night were:
- fish tikka masala.  Even better than my usual chicken!
- Palek paneer.  I never really thought much of this plate at other places, but da-YUM this was a must-have here.
- Goat curry was a not-on-the-menu recommendation... makes ya feel special to get it.

Thank you to Tommy H and his wonderful comrades who opened my eyes to the new frontier of gustatory delights.

excerpts: We got fish tikka masala, chicken biryani, tandoori chicken leg,
The fish tikka masala is beyond superb.
Chilean sea bass cooked in a buttery tikka masala sauce that has a great depth of flavors.

Unlike most places where the TM sauce is very smooth and creamy (sometimes almost too creamy), Lahore's version is chunkier, has more texture to it (I think there were nuts in the sauce...or some other crunchy thing) and has a lot more flavor.
fish tikka masala.author: Erika I.
fish tikka masala.review:
My quest to find the best tikka masala among the Tandoorloin's many Indian places brought me to Lahore. Upon entering, we were promptly seated and given our drinks. We got fish tikka masala, chicken biryani, tandoori chicken leg, some garlic naan and basmati rice. 

The fish tikka masala is beyond superb. Chilean sea bass cooked in a buttery tikka masala sauce that has a great depth of flavors. Unlike most places where the TM sauce is very smooth and creamy (sometimes almost too creamy), Lahore's version is chunkier, has more texture to it (I think there were nuts in the sauce...or some other crunchy thing) and has a lot more flavor. Some people prefer their tikka masala smooth and creamy -- I was one of those -- but I'm now a convert for the chunkier and more flavorful sauce that Lahore makes. 

The chicken biryani is also good. We asked for it spicy though, which is a little too spicy for me. I must admit that I have a low tolerance level for anything hot, so I think I downed two cups of water for the small portion of biryani that I tasted. 

The tandoori chicken is yum-o as well. For $3, you get a tandoori chicken thigh/leg on a big plate of grilled veggies. It's moist, delicious and just has the right amount of kick to it.

The garlic naan is goooood. A warning though, they take their garlic seriously here, so if you're a faux or a semi garlic lover, I suggest going for the regular. The garlic and cilantro is just ooozing from the naan and since I love both, I was in naan heaven after having some. 

Oh and of course, forget about parking when you go here. Try walking instead. I know, it's the Tenderloin, but it's a short little walk from Union Square, the muni, bart, so getting here is no problemo at all. 

Just clutch that purse to your chest, have 911 already dialed on your cellphone -- you just need to press the call button -- bring that pepper spray and you're good to go. Just kidding. Seriously, the Tenderloin gets too much bad rap for what it is. You'll be fine.

excerpts: We ordered Butter Chicken and Prawn Tikka Masala, and Garlic Naan and Roti to accompany them.
The Butter Chicken of course is thick, creamy and buttery.
The sauce is slightly spicy, enhances the chicken and goes with Naan awesomely.
The chicken is a tiny bit dry but still a lot better than Chutney's.
They're cut into bite-sized chunks of chicken breast.
The Prawn Tikka Masala is cooked in a creamy tomato sauce.
This sauce has awesome consistency - it's less fatty than the butter chicken, there no oily layer on top.
The shrimp was still crisp - tasted very nice and fresh.
The Garlic Naan looks cute and perfectly rounded.
It's topped with garlic and herbs.
This Naan is not too thick and smells nice.
It's not too soft and floppy but not too dey either.
prawn tikka masala.author: Châu B.
prawn tikka masala.review:
This place is pretty good for what it is. The food tasted awesome, it's cooked to order. 

This place is still in the Tenderloin but a block away from the Chutney, Shalimar, etc. bunch. It looks clean and tidy. The tables are spacious. This place is Self Service. You choose your own seat and take the menu, choose what you want and go up to the counter to order. You can help yourself to water from the fridge or free chai tea. Your food will come to you when it's done. And when you're done - you can go to the counter to pay. 

My friend introduced me to this place. We ordered Butter Chicken and Prawn Tikka Masala, and Garlic Naan and Roti to accompany them. 

The food took awhile but they make everything individually to order so the wait isn't a bad thing. The portion may look small but it will fill you up. The Naan will especially help. 

The Butter Chicken of course is thick, creamy and buttery. The sauce is slightly spicy, enhances the chicken and goes with Naan awesomely. The chicken is a tiny bit dry but still a lot better than Chutney's. They're cut into bite-sized chunks of chicken breast. It's $8.99 

The Prawn Tikka Masala is cooked in a creamy tomato sauce. This sauce has awesome consistency - it's less fatty than the butter chicken, there no oily layer on top. The shrimp was still crisp - tasted very nice and fresh. It's really worth the $11.99. 

The Garlic Naan looks cute and perfectly rounded. It's topped with garlic and herbs. This Naan is not too thick and smells nice. It's not too soft and floppy but not too dey either. This was $2.50. 

The Roti is made of whole wheat so it's druer and less fluffy. It's more dry than Naan - but it's healthy. The crisp bread is good to pick up the sauces. I think this was $1.50. 

This place is tidy and bright and the food is flavorful and taste good. The price is a bit higher than Chutney's but the flavor is more authentic and it's really worth it. At least give it a try.

excerpts: Food is delicious, especially the prawn tikka masala and the chikkar cholay.
Lahori friend says cholay is exactly the way it is in Lahore.
But service is uneven and can be slow, especially on weekends.
There's only one waiter for the entire restaurant, which is just not enough.
The lone waiter often (understandably) forgets some items or doesn't bring an item until much after the rest of the food has arrived.
prawn tikka masala.author: Jemima P.
prawn tikka masala.review:
Where the brown peeps at? Went in tonight with some Lahoris and they were the only brown peeps in the room. I'm Asian, and there were two other Asian chicks, but that was the only "color" in the room. The other tables were filled with hipsters, including one wearing a hiking backpack who had brought his own IPA. 

Food is delicious, especially the prawn tikka masala and the chikkar cholay. Lahori friend says cholay is exactly the way it is in Lahore. But service is uneven and can be slow, especially on weekends. There's only one waiter for the entire restaurant, which is just not enough. The lone waiter often (understandably) forgets some items or doesn't bring an item until much after the rest of the food has arrived. This isn't bad when just a few tables are full, but when the place is hopping, it can detract from the experience and mouth-watering food. 

I'd go here on a slow weekday night, but not on a weekend unless I feel like jousting with the fixie crowd for a table.

excerpts:
We went here and tried Prawn Tikka Masala ($10.95), Fish Tandoori ($10.95), Onion Kulcha ($2.00), Seekh Kabab ($4.00).
The food taste a little different than the Indian restaurants we usually go to such as Chutney or Naan 
'n 
Curry.
Perhaps because Lahore Karahi is Pakistani cuisine(?)
I mean... tandoori in Indian restaurants usually has reddish color but at Lahore Karahi, the tandoori is brown.
The Fish Tandoori and the Seekh Kabab were served on a hot plate. 
What a nice surprise!
The food are excellent although they are different from what we used to, and the owner is nice and I will definitely come back again in the future.
The service was a little bit slow though. 
It took about an hour of waiting to get table, to order, and to get the food.
I will definitely upgrade the rating once the service is a little bit faster.
They accept Visa and Master Card.
-----
Despite of the slow service, we decided to come here again only 2 days apart because of its good food.
It took 5 minutes to be seated (great!) 
but 25 minutes to have the waiter - 
the guy with the index finger amputated - came and took our order (!!).
prawn tikka masala.author: Oribel ..
prawn tikka masala.review:
We went here and tried Prawn Tikka Masala ($10.95), Fish Tandoori ($10.95), Onion Kulcha ($2.00), Seekh Kabab ($4.00).
The food taste a little different than the Indian restaurants we usually go to such as Chutney or Naan 'n Curry.
Perhaps because Lahore Karahi is Pakistani cuisine(?)
I mean... tandoori in Indian restaurants usually has reddish color but at Lahore Karahi, the tandoori is brown.
The Fish Tandoori and the Seekh Kabab were served on a hot plate. What a nice surprise!
The food are excellent although they are different from what we used to, and the owner is nice and I will definitely come back again in the future.
The service was a little bit slow though. It took about an hour of waiting to get table, to order, and to get the food.
I will definitely upgrade the rating once the service is a little bit faster.
They accept Visa and Master Card.
-----
Despite of the slow service, we decided to come here again only 2 days apart because of its good food.
It took 5 minutes to be seated (great!) but 25 minutes to have the waiter - the guy with the index finger amputated - came and took our order (!!).
He was like in dazed and confused or something!!!

When finally he came and took our order, starting with: "What do you want to order?"
Us: "I want... (point at the menu)..."
He just turned around left before I finished the sentence and talked to another customer that just came without even saying any "excuse me, please", or "would you mind to wait a second?" (if that customer is so important to talk to right away)
Then, he went talking to another customer, then walking around and around, and bringing a couple of plates for another table, then again, walking around and around (yes, we saw all the process because we were just sitting there watching him), then went to another table (that came after us) taking order, then again walking around and around, bringing water jug here and there, before finally coming to our table again without even saying sorry or offering explanation of what happened.
I'm not sure why he did that. I do not mean to insult, but either he was negligent or rude.
Negligent means he did not realize what he did, he lost track, he does not have good memory which table came first, and therefore he was not capable to apologize.
Rude means he meant to do that to ignore us.
I hope it was the first one.

We ordered Bengan Bartha ($5.50), Butter Chicken ($6.00), and Garlic Naan ($2.00)
Bengan Bartha was good but Butter Chicken was many times better.
Garlic Naan was good too.

The food came pretty fast though within 15 minutes.
Now that I understand that Zulfikar "Guddu" Haider is the only guy cooking the dishes, actually we do not mind waiting for the food to be cooked to its excellence but we do mind being IGNORED with that waiter (not Guddu).
Overall was supposed to be 5 stars minus 1 star for the bad service from the waiter.

excerpts: The friendliness of the main man/ chef (owner?), who greeted me with a smile and suggested I try the fish vindaloo the next time.
fish vindaloo.author: Ryan W.
fish vindaloo.review:
Dig:
* The 'authentic' (read: low-rent) vibe
* The Indian musicals playing on a constant loop on TV
* The friendliness of the main man/ chef (owner?), who greeted me with a smile and suggested I try the fish vindaloo the next time.
* The taste of the lamb vindaloo & garlic naan I had.

Don't Dig:
* The fact that the chef had a cold and was handling my food.
* That I could see EVERYTHING happening in the kitchen.
* That I had to get up to get my own place setting (silverware, napkin, etc.)
* That the chef pretty much had to do everything himself - incl. take my order, make my meal, and figure out my tab.  Here's an idea: put those 2 latino gentlemen who mill about behind the scenes to work.
* The creepy dude with a bandage on his (recently?) chopped finger who sat by the door and watched me eat.
* I'm pretty sure I saw a roach running across the kitchen counter.

Whatever - the service sucks (he's only one man!) and it has all the ambience of a garage, but this is a cheap Indian/ Pakistani place in the Tenderloin.  What did you expect?  Lahore is flavor country, but I wouldn't bring my parents or any high-maintenance sorts here.

PS ~ Bringing your own refreshments is a GREAT CALL.

excerpts: I also ordered the Prawn Curry, and it wasn't bad.
It was spicy but
not overly so.
prawn curry.author: Xavier G.
prawn curry.review:
I went here on a suggestion from a friend, surprisingly it was only 2 blocks from my house, and I never noticed it. Anyway, it was pretty good for Indian food, which I'm not a huge fan of.

This was probably the only Indian restaurant in the city where the Naan didn't taste burnt, haha. But yeah, I ordered the Garlic naan, and when he brought it to my table, I was intoxicated by the amount of garlic in it. :) Loved it!

I also ordered the Prawn Curry, and it wasn't bad. It was spicy but not overly so. I didn't finish it though, because like I said, not a huge fan of Indian food.

The total was $15 so not too expensive but not too cheap, but now that I think about it, my meal could have fed two people, so then $7.50 isn't a bad deal.

The service itself was kind of 3 starsish...My waiter didn't know how to use the credit card machine so I had to wait until the owner came back. Kind of weird...

**Oh uber uber bonus for having free chai. Luckily my friend told me about it, or I would never had noticed it. It's not on the menu, but you have to go up for self service chai, and I think self service water, bc my waiter never filled my glass back up. But yeah, the chai was pretty tasty, with sugar, without sugar it tasted pretty awful. Not too sure why that is. Maybe it's super healthy? But yeah the main reason this place is 4 stars instead of 3 is for the free chai. :)

excerpts: We had plain and afghani naan, lamb biryani, karahi chicken, prawn curry.
Each dish was brought out separately, and not necessarily in order.
Meaning, the naan arrived with nothing else at first.
I asked the owner/chef and he responded that one must wait because everything is made fresh.
Not exactly the answer I was looking for but ok.
And I wasn't disappointed when he and his assistant (it was a 2-man operation) came with the curries.
prawn curry.author: Cindy W.
prawn curry.review:
I pass this place on the 38 bus every day. And the only reason I had the courage to go (since it was in the tenderloin) was because I had a coupon from the Entertainment book (xmas gift). So I gathered 3 other friends and went. 

Wow - it was really good! We had plain and afghani naan, lamb biryani, karahi chicken, prawn curry. Each dish was brought out separately, and not necessarily in order. Meaning, the naan arrived with nothing else at first. I asked the owner/chef and he responded that one must wait because everything is made fresh. Not exactly the answer I was looking for but ok. And I wasn't disappointed when he and his assistant (it was a 2-man operation) came with the curries. The sauces were flavorful, hot, and fresh. 

If you read my other review, you'll know I'm not a lamb fan, but my 2 other friends devored the biryani. Seems like a good sign. My only disappointment was the Afghani naan. I was thinking it would be more like this other sweet naan I was in search of, but this reminded me more of a fruitcake naan. Same colors and odd taste. But hey, what do I know.

I'd definitely go back, without fear nor coupons (the bill was $40 for FOUR people with a few non alcoholic drinks + tip). Be adventurous and go! Just remember to be patient or else you'll be reprimanded too.
